Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַדְּבָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן בַּמִּדְבָּ֡ר בָּֽעֲרָבָה֩ מ֨וֹל ס֜וּף בֵּֽין־פָּארָ֧ן וּבֵֽין־תֹּ֛פֶל וְלָבָ֥ן וַחֲצֵרֹ֖ת וְדִ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: These are the words that Moses addressed to all Israel on the other side of the Jordan.—Through the wilderness, in the Arabah near Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab,
Transliteration: eleh hadevariym asher diver mosheh el-khׇl-yisherael veever hayareden vamidevar vaaravah mvol suf veyn-faran uveyn-tofel velavan vachatserot vediy zahav

Hebrew: אַחַ֨ד עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ מֵֽחֹרֵ֔ב דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַר־שֵׂעִ֑יר עַ֖ד קָדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵֽעַ׃
Translated: it is eleven days from Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by the Mount Seir route. —
Transliteration: achad ashar yvom mechorev derekhe har-sheiyr ad kadesh varenea

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּאַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה בְּעַשְׁתֵּֽי־עָשָׂ֥ר חֹ֖דֶשׁ בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: It was in the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, that Moses addressed the Israelites in accordance with the instructions that יהוה had given him for them,
Transliteration: vayehiy vearevaiym shanah veashetey-ashar chodesh veechad lachodesh diver mosheh el-veney yisherael khekhol asher tsivah yehovah otvo alehem

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י הַכֹּת֗וֹ אֵ֚ת סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן וְאֵ֗ת ע֚וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֔ן אֲשֶׁר־יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּעַשְׁתָּרֹ֖ת בְּאֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
Translated: after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and King Og of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth [and] Edrei.
Transliteration: acharey hakhotvo et siychon melekhe haemoriy asher yvoshev vecheshevvon veet vog melekhe havashan asher-yvoshev veashetarot veedereiy

Hebrew: בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב הוֹאִ֣יל מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֵּאֵ֛ר אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: On the other side of the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses undertook to expound this Teaching. He said:
Transliteration: veever hayareden veerets mvoav hvoiyl mosheh veer et-hatvorah hazot lemor

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֵ֖ינוּ בְּחֹרֵ֣ב לֵאמֹ֑ר רַב־לָכֶ֥ם שֶׁ֖בֶת בָּהָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Our God יהוה spoke to us at Horeb, saying: You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
Transliteration: yehovah eloheynu diver eleynu vechorev lemor rav-lakhem shevet vahar hazeh

Hebrew: פְּנ֣וּ ׀ וּסְע֣וּ לָכֶ֗ם וּבֹ֨אוּ הַ֥ר הָֽאֱמֹרִי֮ וְאֶל־כׇּל־שְׁכֵנָיו֒ בָּעֲרָבָ֥ה בָהָ֛ר וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֥ה וּבַנֶּ֖גֶב וּבְח֣וֹף הַיָּ֑ם אֶ֤רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ וְהַלְּבָנ֔וֹן עַד־הַנָּהָ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל נְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
Translated: Start out and make your way to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighbors in the Arabah, the hill country, the Shephelah, the Negeb, the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites, and the Lebanon, as far as the Great River, the river Euphrates.
Transliteration: fenu useu lakhem uvou har haemoriy veel-khׇl-shekhenayv vaaravah vahar uvashefelah uvanegev uvechvof hayam erets hakhenaaniy vehalevanvon ad-hanahar hagadol nehar-ferat

Hebrew: רְאֵ֛ה נָתַ֥תִּי לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ בֹּ֚אוּ וּרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבַּ֣ע יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה לַאֲבֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֔ם וּלְזַרְעָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: See, I place the land at your disposal. Go, take possession of the land that יהוה swore to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to assign to them and to their heirs after them.
Transliteration: reeh natatiy lifeneykhem et-haarets vou ureshu et-haarets asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykhem leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov latet lahem ulezaream achareyhem

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר אֲלֵכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל לְבַדִּ֖י שְׂאֵ֥ת אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Thereupon I said to you, “I cannot bear the burden of you by myself.
Transliteration: vaomar alekhem vaet hahiv lemor lo-ukhal levadiy sheet etekhem

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם הִרְבָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְהִנְּכֶ֣ם הַיּ֔וֹם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: Your God יהוה has multiplied you until you are today as numerous as the stars in the sky.—
Transliteration: yehovah eloheykhem hirevah etekhem vehinekhem hayyvom khekhvokhevey hashamayiim larov

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֽוֹתֵכֶ֗ם יֹסֵ֧ף עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם כָּכֶ֖ם אֶ֣לֶף פְּעָמִ֑ים וִיבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶתְכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: May יהוה, the God of your ancestors, increase your numbers a thousandfold, and bless you as promised.—
Transliteration: yehovah elohey avvotekhem yosef aleykhem khakhem elef feamiym viyvarekhe etekhem khaasher diver lakhem

Hebrew: אֵיכָ֥ה אֶשָּׂ֖א לְבַדִּ֑י טׇרְחֲכֶ֥ם וּמַֽשַּׂאֲכֶ֖ם וְרִֽיבְכֶֽם׃
Translated: How can I bear unaided the trouble of you, and the burden, and the bickering!
Transliteration: eykhah esha levadiy tׇrechakhem umashaakhem veriyvekhem

Hebrew: הָב֣וּ לָ֠כֶ֠ם אֲנָשִׁ֨ים חֲכָמִ֧ים וּנְבֹנִ֛ים וִידֻעִ֖ים לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲשִׂימֵ֖ם בְּרָאשֵׁיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Pick from each of your tribes candidates who are wise, discerning, and experienced, and I will appoint them as your heads.”
Transliteration: havu lakhem anashiym chakhamiym unevoniym viyduiym leshiveteykhem vaashiymem verasheykhem

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲנ֖וּ אֹתִ֑י וַתֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ טֽוֹב־הַדָּבָ֥ר אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: You answered me and said, “What you propose to do is good.”
Transliteration: vataanu otiy vatomeru tvov-hadavar asher-divareta laashvot

Hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֞ח אֶת־רָאשֵׁ֣י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֗ם אֲנָשִׁ֤ים חֲכָמִים֙ וִֽידֻעִ֔ים וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אוֹתָ֛ם רָאשִׁ֖ים עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם שָׂרֵ֨י אֲלָפִ֜ים וְשָׂרֵ֣י מֵא֗וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֤י חֲמִשִּׁים֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י עֲשָׂרֹ֔ת וְשֹׁטְרִ֖ים לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: So I took your tribal leaders, wise and experienced men, and appointed them heads over you: chiefs of thousands, chiefs of hundreds, chiefs of fifties, and chiefs of tens, and officials for your tribes.
Transliteration: vaekach et-rashey shiveteykhem anashiym chakhamiym viyduiym vaeten votam rashiym aleykhem sharey alafiym vesharey mevot vesharey chamishiym vesharey asharot veshoteriym leshiveteykhem

Hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּה֙ אֶת־שֹׁ֣פְטֵיכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁמֹ֤עַ בֵּין־אֲחֵיכֶם֙ וּשְׁפַטְתֶּ֣ם צֶ֔דֶק בֵּֽין־אִ֥ישׁ וּבֵין־אָחִ֖יו וּבֵ֥ין גֵּרֽוֹ׃
Translated: I charged your magistrates at that time as follows, “Hear out your fellow Israelites, and decide justly between one party and the other—be it a fellow Israelite or a stranger.
Transliteration: vaatsaveh et-shofeteykhem vaet hahiv lemor shamoa veyn-acheykhem ushefatetem tsedek veyn-iysh uveyn-achiyv uveyn gervo

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַכִּ֨ירוּ פָנִ֜ים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט כַּקָּטֹ֤ן כַּגָּדֹל֙ תִּשְׁמָע֔וּן לֹ֤א תָג֙וּרוּ֙ מִפְּנֵי־אִ֔ישׁ כִּ֥י הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט לֵאלֹהִ֣ים ה֑וּא וְהַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִקְשֶׁ֣ה מִכֶּ֔ם תַּקְרִב֥וּן אֵלַ֖י וּשְׁמַעְתִּֽיו׃
Translated: You shall not be partial in judgment: hear out low and high alike. Fear neither party, for judgment is God’s. And any matter that is too difficult for you, you shall bring to me and I will hear it.”
Transliteration: lo-takhiyru faniym vamishefat khakaton khagadol tishemaun lo taguru mifeney-iysh khiy hamishefat lelohiym hu vehadavar asher yikesheh mikhem takerivun elay ushemaetiyv

Hebrew: וָאֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑וא אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃
Translated: Thus I instructed you, at that time, about the various things that you should do.
Transliteration: vaatsaveh etekhem vaet hahiv et khׇl-hadevariym asher taashun

Hebrew: וַנִּסַּ֣ע מֵחֹרֵ֗ב וַנֵּ֡לֶךְ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַגָּדוֹל֩ וְהַנּוֹרָ֨א הַה֜וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְאִיתֶ֗ם דֶּ֚רֶךְ הַ֣ר הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אֹתָ֑נוּ וַנָּבֹ֕א עַ֖ד קָדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵֽעַ׃
Translated: We set out from Horeb and traveled the great and terrible wilderness that you saw, along the road to the hill country of the Amorites, as our God יהוה had commanded us. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,
Transliteration: vanisa mechorev vanelekhe et khׇl-hamidevar hagadvol vehanvora hahu asher reiytem derekhe har haemoriy khaasher tsivah yehovah eloheynu otanu vanavo ad kadesh varenea

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵכֶ֑ם בָּאתֶם֙ עַד־הַ֣ר הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: I said to you, “You have come to the hill country of the Amorites which our God יהוה is giving to us.
Transliteration: vaomar alekhem vatem ad-har haemoriy asher-yehovah eloheynu noten lanu

Hebrew: רְ֠אֵ֠ה נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ עֲלֵ֣ה רֵ֗שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ אַל־תִּירָ֖א וְאַל־תֵּחָֽת׃
Translated: See, your God יהוה has placed the land at your disposal. Go up, take possession, as יהוה, the God of your fathers, promised you. Fear not and be not dismayed.”
Transliteration: reeh natan yehovah eloheykha lefaneykha et-haarets aleh resh khaasher diver yehovah elohey avoteykha lakhe al-tiyra veal-techat

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרְב֣וּן אֵלַי֮ כֻּלְּכֶם֒ וַתֹּאמְר֗וּ נִשְׁלְחָ֤ה אֲנָשִׁים֙ לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ־לָ֖נוּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְיָשִׁ֤בוּ אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ דָּבָ֔ר אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נַעֲלֶה־בָּ֔הּ וְאֵת֙ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָבֹ֖א אֲלֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Then all of you came to me and said, “Let us send agents ahead to reconnoiter the land for us and bring back word on the route we shall follow and the cities we shall come to.”
Transliteration: vatikerevun elay khulekhem vatomeru nishelechah anashiym lefaneynu veyacheferu-lanu et-haarets veyashivu otanu davar et-haderekhe asher naaleh-vah veet heariym asher navo aleyhen

Hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֥ב בְּעֵינַ֖י הַדָּבָ֑ר וָאֶקַּ֤ח מִכֶּם֙ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֣ר אֲנָשִׁ֔ים אִ֥ישׁ אֶחָ֖ד לַשָּֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: I approved of the plan, and so I selected from among you twelve participants, one representative from each tribe.
Transliteration: vayiytav veeynay hadavar vaekach mikhem sheneym ashar anashiym iysh echad lashavet

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנוּ֙ וַיַּעֲל֣וּ הָהָ֔רָה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכֹּ֑ל וַֽיְרַגְּל֖וּ אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: They made for the hill country, came to the wadi Eshcol, and spied it out.
Transliteration: vayifenu vayaalu haharah vayavou ad-nachal eshekhol vayeragelu otah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֤וּ בְיָדָם֙ מִפְּרִ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיּוֹרִ֖דוּ אֵלֵ֑ינוּ וַיָּשִׁ֨בוּ אֹתָ֤נוּ דָבָר֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ טוֹבָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: They took some of the fruit of the land with them and brought it down to us. And they gave us this report: “It is a good land that our God יהוה is giving to us.”
Transliteration: vayikechu veyadam miferiy haarets vayyvoridu eleynu vayashivu otanu davar vayomeru tvovah haarets asher-yehovah eloheynu noten lanu

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אֲבִיתֶ֖ם לַעֲלֹ֑ת וַתַּמְר֕וּ אֶת־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Yet you refused to go up, and flouted the command of your God יהוה.
Transliteration: velo aviytem laalot vatameru et-fiy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַתֵּרָגְנ֤וּ בְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם֙ וַתֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ בְּשִׂנְאַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֹתָ֔נוּ הוֹצִיאָ֖נוּ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לָתֵ֥ת אֹתָ֛נוּ בְּיַ֥ד הָאֱמֹרִ֖י לְהַשְׁמִידֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: You sulked in your tents and said, “It is out of hatred for us that יהוה brought us out of the land of Egypt, to hand us over to the Amorites to wipe us out.
Transliteration: vateragenu veׇholeykhem vatomeru veshineat yehovah otanu hvotsiyanu meerets mitserayiim latet otanu veyad haemoriy lehashemiydenu

Hebrew: אָנָ֣ה ׀ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ עֹלִ֗ים אַחֵ֩ינוּ֩ הֵמַ֨סּוּ אֶת־לְבָבֵ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר עַ֣ם גָּד֤וֹל וָרָם֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וּבְצוּרֹ֖ת בַּשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְגַם־בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָקִ֖ים רָאִ֥ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: What kind of place are we going to? Our brothers have taken the heart out of us, saying, ‘We saw there a people stronger and taller than we, large cities with walls sky-high, and even Anakites.’”
Transliteration: anah anachenu oliym acheynu hemasu et-levavenu lemor am gadvol varam mimenu ariym gedolot uvetsurot vashamayiim vegam-veney anakiym raiynu sham

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲלֵכֶ֑ם לֹא־תַעַרְצ֥וּן וְלֹא־תִֽירְא֖וּן מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: I said to you, “Have no dread or fear of them.
Transliteration: vaomar alekhem lo-taaretsun velo-tiyreun mehem

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם ה֖וּא יִלָּחֵ֣ם לָכֶ֑ם כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֧ה אִתְּכֶ֛ם בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: None other than your God יהוה, who goes before you, will fight for you, just as [God] did for you in Egypt before your very eyes,
Transliteration: yehovah eloheykhem haholekhe lifeneykhem hu yilachem lakhem khekhol asher ashah itekhem vemitserayiim leeyneykhem

Hebrew: וּבַמִּדְבָּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאִ֔יתָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נְשָׂאֲךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשָּׂא־אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־בְּנ֑וֹ בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲלַכְתֶּ֔ם עַד־בֹּאֲכֶ֖ם עַד־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and in the wilderness, where you saw how your God יהוה carried you, as a householder carries his son, all the way that you traveled until you came to this place.
Transliteration: uvamidevar asher raiyta asher neshaakha yehovah eloheykha khaasher yisha-iysh et-venvo vekhׇl-haderekhe asher halakhetem ad-voakhem ad-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּבַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה אֵֽינְכֶם֙ מַאֲמִינִ֔ם בַּיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Yet for all that, you have no faith in your God יהוה,
Transliteration: uvadavar hazeh eynekhem maamiynim vayhovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: הַהֹלֵ֨ךְ לִפְנֵיכֶ֜ם בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ לָת֥וּר לָכֶ֛ם מָק֖וֹם לַחֲנֹֽתְכֶ֑ם בָּאֵ֣שׁ ׀ לַ֗יְלָה לַרְאֹֽתְכֶם֙ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ וּבֶעָנָ֖ן יוֹמָֽם׃
Translated: who goes before you on your journeys—to scout the place where you are to encamp—in fire by night and in cloud by day, in order to guide you on the route you are to follow.”
Transliteration: haholekhe lifeneykhem vaderekhe latur lakhem makvom lachanotekhem vaesh layelah lareotekhem vaderekhe asher telekhu-vah uveanan yvomam

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־ק֣וֹל דִּבְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיִּקְצֹ֖ף וַיִּשָּׁבַ֥ע לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה heard your loud complaint and, becoming angry, vowed:
Transliteration: vayishema yehovah et-kvol divereykhem vayiketsof vayishava lemor

Hebrew: אִם־יִרְאֶ֥ה אִישׁ֙ בָּאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה הַדּ֥וֹר הָרָ֖ע הַזֶּ֑ה אֵ֚ת הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁבַּ֔עְתִּי לָתֵ֖ת לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Not one of those involved, this evil generation, shall see the good land that I swore to give to your fathers—
Transliteration: im-yireeh iysh vaanashiym haeleh hadvor hara hazeh et haarets hatvovah asher nishevaetiy latet laavoteykhem

Hebrew: זֽוּלָתִ֞י כָּלֵ֤ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּה֙ ה֣וּא יִרְאֶ֔נָּה וְלֽוֹ־אֶתֵּ֧ן אֶת־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דָּֽרַךְ־בָּ֖הּ וּלְבָנָ֑יו יַ֕עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִלֵּ֖א אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: none except Caleb son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him and his descendants will I give the land on which he set foot, because he remained loyal to יהוה.—
Transliteration: zulatiy khalev ven-yefuneh hu yireenah velvo-eten et-haarets asher darakhe-vah ulevanayv yaan asher mile acharey yehovah

Hebrew: גַּם־בִּי֙ הִתְאַנַּ֣ף יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּגְלַלְכֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר גַּם־אַתָּ֖ה לֹא־תָבֹ֥א שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Because of you יהוה was incensed with me too, saying: You shall not enter it either.
Transliteration: gam-viy hiteanaf yehovah vigelalekhem lemor gam-atah lo-tavo sham

Hebrew: יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן־נוּן֙ הָעֹמֵ֣ד לְפָנֶ֔יךָ ה֖וּא יָ֣בֹא שָׁ֑מָּה אֹת֣וֹ חַזֵּ֔ק כִּי־ה֖וּא יַנְחִלֶ֥נָּה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Joshua son of Nun, who attends you, he shall enter it. Imbue him with strength, for he shall allot it to Israel.—
Transliteration: yehvoshua vin-nun haomed lefaneykha hu yavo shamah otvo chazek khiy-hu yanechilenah et-yisherael

Hebrew: וְטַפְּכֶם֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֜ם לָבַ֣ז יִהְיֶ֗ה וּ֠בְנֵיכֶ֠ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יָדְע֤וּ הַיּוֹם֙ ט֣וֹב וָרָ֔ע הֵ֖מָּה יָבֹ֣אוּ שָׁ֑מָּה וְלָהֶ֣ם אֶתְּנֶ֔נָּה וְהֵ֖ם יִירָשֽׁוּהָ׃
Translated: Moreover, your little ones who you said would be carried off, your children who do not yet know good from bad, they shall enter it; to them will I give it and they shall possess it.
Transliteration: vetafekhem asher amaretem lavaz yiheyeh uveneykhem asher lo-yadeu hayyvom tvov vara hemah yavou shamah velahem etenenah vehem yiyrashuha

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֖ם פְּנ֣וּ לָכֶ֑ם וּסְע֥וּ הַמִּדְבָּ֖רָה דֶּ֥רֶךְ יַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated: As for you, turn about and march into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: veatem fenu lakhem useu hamidevarah derekhe yam-suf

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲנ֣וּ ׀ וַתֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלַ֗י חָטָ֘אנוּ֮ לַיהֹוָה֒ אֲנַ֤חְנוּ נַעֲלֶה֙ וְנִלְחַ֔מְנוּ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖נוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַֽתַּחְגְּר֗וּ אִ֚ישׁ אֶת־כְּלֵ֣י מִלְחַמְתּ֔וֹ וַתָּהִ֖ינוּ לַעֲלֹ֥ת הָהָֽרָה׃
Translated: You replied to me, saying, “We stand guilty before יהוה. We will go up now and fight, just as our God יהוה commanded us.” And [the men among] you each girded yourselves with war gear and recklessly started for the hill country.
Transliteration: vataanu vatomeru elay chatanu layhovah anachenu naaleh venilechamenu khekhol asher-tsivanu yehovah eloheynu vatachegeru iysh et-kheley milechametvo vatahiynu laalot haharah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֱמֹ֤ר לָהֶם֙ לֹ֤א תַֽעֲלוּ֙ וְלֹא־תִלָּ֣חֲמ֔וּ כִּ֥י אֵינֶ֖נִּי בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְלֹא֙ תִּנָּ֣גְפ֔וּ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But יהוה said to me, “Warn them: Do not go up and do not fight, since I am not in your midst; else you will be routed by your enemies.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay emor lahem lo taalu velo-tilachamu khiy eyneniy vekirevekhem velo tinagefu lifeney oyeveykhem

Hebrew: וָאֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וְלֹ֣א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֑ם וַתַּמְרוּ֙ אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתָּזִ֖דוּ וַתַּעֲל֥וּ הָהָֽרָה׃
Translated: I spoke to you, but you would not listen; you flouted יהוה’s command and willfully marched into the hill country.
Transliteration: vaadaver aleykhem velo shemaetem vatameru et-fiy yehovah vatazidu vataalu haharah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א הָאֱמֹרִ֜י הַיֹּשֵׁ֨ב בָּהָ֤ר הַהוּא֙ לִקְרַאתְכֶ֔ם וַיִּרְדְּפ֣וּ אֶתְכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ינָה הַדְּבֹרִ֑ים וַֽיַּכְּת֥וּ אֶתְכֶ֛ם בְּשֵׂעִ֖יר עַד־חׇרְמָֽה׃
Translated: Then the Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you like so many bees and chased you, and they crushed you at Hormah in Seir.
Transliteration: vayetse haemoriy hayoshev vahar hahu likeratekhem vayiredefu etekhem khaasher taasheynah hadevoriym vayakhetu etekhem vesheiyr ad-chׇremah

Hebrew: וַתָּשֻׁ֥בוּ וַתִּבְכּ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־שָׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ בְּקֹ֣לְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א הֶאֱזִ֖ין אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Again you wept before יהוה; but יהוה would not heed your cry or give ear to you.
Transliteration: vatashuvu vativekhu lifeney yehovah velo-shama yehovah vekolekhem velo heeziyn aleykhem

Hebrew: וַתֵּשְׁב֥וּ בְקָדֵ֖שׁ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים כַּיָּמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשַׁבְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Thus, after you had remained at Kadesh all that long time,
Transliteration: vateshevu vekadesh yamiym raviym khayamiym asher yeshavetem

Hebrew: וַנֵּ֜פֶן וַנִּסַּ֤ע הַמִּדְבָּ֙רָה֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יַם־ס֔וּף כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַנָּ֥סׇב אֶת־הַר־שֵׂעִ֖יר יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: we marched back into the wilderness by the way of the Sea of Reeds, as יהוה had spoken to me, and skirted the hill country of Seir a long time.
Transliteration: vanefen vanisa hamidevarah derekhe yam-suf khaasher diver yehovah elay vanasׇv et-har-sheiyr yamiym raviym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to me:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: רַב־לָכֶ֕ם סֹ֖ב אֶת־הָהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה פְּנ֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם צָפֹֽנָה׃
Translated: You have been skirting this hill country long enough; now turn north.
Transliteration: rav-lakhem sov et-hahar hazeh fenu lakhem tsafonah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעָם֮ צַ֣ו לֵאמֹר֒ אַתֶּ֣ם עֹֽבְרִ֗ים בִּגְבוּל֙ אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם בְּנֵי־עֵשָׂ֔ו הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּשֵׂעִ֑יר וְיִֽירְא֣וּ מִכֶּ֔ם וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And charge the people as follows: You will be passing through the territory of your kin, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. Though they will be afraid of you, be very careful
Transliteration: veet-haam tsav lemor atem overiym vigevul acheykhem veney-eshav hayosheviym vesheiyr veyiyreu mikhem venishemaretem meod

Hebrew: אַל־תִּתְגָּר֣וּ בָ֔ם כִּ֠י לֹֽא־אֶתֵּ֤ן לָכֶם֙ מֵֽאַרְצָ֔ם עַ֖ד מִדְרַ֣ךְ כַּף־רָ֑גֶל כִּֽי־יְרֻשָּׁ֣ה לְעֵשָׂ֔ו נָתַ֖תִּי אֶת־הַ֥ר שֵׂעִֽיר׃
Translated: not to provoke them. For I will not give you of their land so much as a foot can tread on; I have given the hill country of Seir as a possession to Esau.
Transliteration: al-titegaru vam khiy lo-eten lakhem mearetsam ad miderakhe khaf-ragel khiy-yerushah leeshav natatiy et-har sheiyr

Hebrew: אֹ֣כֶל תִּשְׁבְּר֧וּ מֵֽאִתָּ֛ם בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֑ם וְגַם־מַ֜יִם תִּכְר֧וּ מֵאִתָּ֛ם בַּכֶּ֖סֶף וּשְׁתִיתֶֽם׃
Translated: What food you eat you shall obtain from them for money; even the water you drink you shall procure from them for money.
Transliteration: okhel tisheveru meitam vakhesef vaakhaletem vegam-mayiim tikheru meitam vakhesef ushetiytem

Hebrew: כִּי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בֵּֽרַכְךָ֗ בְּכֹל֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֔ךָ יָדַ֣ע לֶכְתְּךָ֔ אֶת־הַמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַגָּדֹ֖ל הַזֶּ֑ה זֶ֣ה ׀ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א חָסַ֖רְתָּ דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Indeed, your God יהוה has blessed you in all your undertakings. [God] has watched over your wanderings through this great wilderness; your God יהוה has been with you these past forty years: you have lacked nothing.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykha verakhekha vekhol maasheh yadekha yada lekhetekha et-hamidevar hagadol hazeh zeh arevaiym shanah yehovah eloheykha imakhe lo chasareta davar

Hebrew: וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֞ר מֵאֵ֧ת אַחֵ֣ינוּ בְנֵי־עֵשָׂ֗ו הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּשֵׂעִ֔יר מִדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ הָֽעֲרָבָ֔ה מֵאֵילַ֖ת וּמֵעֶצְיֹ֣ן גָּ֑בֶר {ס} וַנֵּ֙פֶן֙ וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֔ר דֶּ֖רֶךְ מִדְבַּ֥ר מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: We then moved on, away from our kin, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, away from the road of the Arabah, away from Elath and Ezion-geber; and we marched on in the direction of the wilderness of Moab.
Transliteration: vanaavor meet acheynu veney-eshav hayosheviym vesheiyr miderekhe haaravah meeylat umeetseyon gaver {s} vanefen vanaavor derekhe midevar mvoav

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אַל־תָּ֙צַר֙ אֶת־מוֹאָ֔ב וְאַל־תִּתְגָּ֥ר בָּ֖ם מִלְחָמָ֑ה כִּ֠י לֹֽא־אֶתֵּ֨ן לְךָ֤ מֵֽאַרְצוֹ֙ יְרֻשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֣י לִבְנֵי־ל֔וֹט נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־עָ֖ר יְרֻשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to me: Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war. For I will not give you any of their land as a possession; I have assigned Ar as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay al-tatsar et-mvoav veal-titegar vam milechamah khiy lo-eten lekha mearetsvo yerushah khiy liveney-lvot natatiy et-ar yerushah

Hebrew: הָאֵמִ֥ים לְפָנִ֖ים יָ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֑הּ עַ֣ם גָּד֥וֹל וְרַ֛ב וָרָ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִֽים׃
Translated: It was formerly inhabited by the Emim, a people great and numerous, and as tall as the Anakites.
Transliteration: haemiym lefaniym yashevu vah am gadvol verav varam khaanakiym

Hebrew: רְפָאִ֛ים יֵחָשְׁב֥וּ אַף־הֵ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִ֑ים וְהַמֹּ֣אָבִ֔ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם אֵמִֽים׃
Translated: Like the Anakites, they are counted as Rephaim; but the Moabites call them Emim.
Transliteration: refaiym eichashevu af-hem khaanakiym vehamoaviym yikereu lahem emiym

Hebrew: וּבְשֵׂעִ֞יר יָשְׁב֣וּ הַחֹרִים֮ לְפָנִים֒ וּבְנֵ֧י עֵשָׂ֣ו יִֽירָשׁ֗וּם וַיַּשְׁמִידוּם֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ תַּחְתָּ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֧ר עָשָׂ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְאֶ֙רֶץ֙ יְרֻשָּׁת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Similarly, Seir was formerly inhabited by the Horites; but the descendants of Esau dispossessed them, wiping them out and settling in their place, just as Israel did in the land they were to possess, which יהוה had given to them.—
Transliteration: uvesheiyr yashevu hachoriym lefaniym uveney eshav yiyrashum vayashemiydum mifeneyhem vayeshevu tachetam khaasher ashah yisherael leerets yerushatvo asher-natan yehovah lahem

Hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה קֻ֛מוּ וְעִבְר֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־נַ֣חַל זָ֑רֶד וַֽנַּעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־נַ֥חַל זָֽרֶד׃
Translated: Up now! Cross the wadi Zered! So we crossed the wadi Zered.
Transliteration: atah kumu veiveru lakhem et-nachal zared vanaavor et-nachal zared

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֣כְנוּ ׀ מִקָּדֵ֣שׁ בַּרְנֵ֗עַ עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־עָבַ֙רְנוּ֙ אֶת־נַ֣חַל זֶ֔רֶד שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה שָׁנָ֑ה עַד־תֹּ֨ם כׇּל־הַדּ֜וֹר אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ מִקֶּ֣רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: The time that we spent in travel from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed the wadi Zered was thirty-eight years, until that whole generation of warriors had perished from the camp, as יהוה had sworn concerning them.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher-halakhenu mikadesh varenea ad asher-avarenu et-nachal zered sheloshiym ushemoneh shanah ad-tom khׇl-hadvor aneshey hamilechamah mikerev hamachaneh khaasher nisheva yehovah lahem

Hebrew: וְגַ֤ם יַד־יְהֹוָה֙ הָ֣יְתָה בָּ֔ם לְהֻמָּ֖ם מִקֶּ֣רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃
Translated: Indeed, the hand of יהוה struck them, to root them out from the camp until they were finished off.
Transliteration: vegam yad-yehovah hayetah vam lehumam mikerev hamachaneh ad tumam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י כַאֲשֶׁר־תַּ֜מּוּ כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֧י הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה לָמ֖וּת מִקֶּ֥רֶב הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When all the warriors among the people had died off,
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-tamu khׇl-aneshey hamilechamah lamut mikerev haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֥י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to me, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah elay lemor

Hebrew: אַתָּ֨ה עֹבֵ֥ר הַיּ֛וֹם אֶת־גְּב֥וּל מוֹאָ֖ב אֶת־עָֽר׃
Translated: You are now passing through the territory of Moab, through Ar.
Transliteration: atah over hayyvom et-gevul mvoav et-ar

Hebrew: וְקָרַבְתָּ֗ מ֚וּל בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן אַל־תְּצֻרֵ֖ם וְאַל־תִּתְגָּ֣ר בָּ֑ם כִּ֣י לֹֽא־אֶ֠תֵּ֠ן מֵאֶ֨רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֤וֹן לְךָ֙ יְרֻשָּׁ֔ה כִּ֥י לִבְנֵי־ל֖וֹט נְתַתִּ֥יהָ יְרֻשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: You will then be close to the Ammonites; do not harass them or start a fight with them. For I will not give any part of the land of the Ammonites to you as a possession; I have assigned it as a possession to the descendants of Lot.—
Transliteration: vekaraveta mul veney amvon al-tetsurem veal-titegar vam khiy lo-eten meerets veney-amvon lekha yerushah khiy liveney-lvot netatiyha yerushah

Hebrew: אֶֽרֶץ־רְפָאִ֥ים תֵּחָשֵׁ֖ב אַף־הִ֑וא רְפָאִ֤ים יָֽשְׁבוּ־בָהּ֙ לְפָנִ֔ים וְהָֽעַמֹּנִ֔ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם זַמְזֻמִּֽים׃
Translated: It, too, is counted as Rephaim country. It was formerly inhabited by Rephaim, whom the Ammonites call Zamzummim,
Transliteration: erets-refaiym techashev af-hiv refaiym yashevu-vah lefaniym vehaamoniym yikereu lahem zamezumiym

Hebrew: עַ֣ם גָּד֥וֹל וְרַ֛ב וָרָ֖ם כָּעֲנָקִ֑ים וַיַּשְׁמִידֵ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּירָשֻׁ֖ם וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתָּֽם׃
Translated: a people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakites. יהוה wiped them out, so that [the Ammonites] dispossessed them and settled in their place,
Transliteration: am gadvol verav varam khaanakiym vayashemiydem yehovah mifeneyhem vayiyrashum vayeshevu tachetam

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֔ו הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּשֵׂעִ֑יר אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִשְׁמִ֤יד אֶת־הַחֹרִי֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּֽירָשֻׁם֙ וַיֵּשְׁב֣וּ תַחְתָּ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: as [God] did for the descendants of Esau who live in Seir, by wiping out the Horites before them, so that they dispossessed them and settled in their place, as is still the case.
Transliteration: khaasher ashah liveney eshav hayosheviym vesheiyr asher hishemiyd et-hachoriy mifeneyhem vayiyrashum vayeshevu tachetam ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְהָֽעַוִּ֛ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים בַּחֲצֵרִ֖ים עַד־עַזָּ֑ה כַּפְתֹּרִים֙ הַיֹּצְאִ֣ים מִכַּפְתֹּ֔ר הִשְׁמִידֻ֖ם וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתָּֽם׃
Translated: So, too, with the Avvim who dwelt in villages in the vicinity of Gaza: the Caphtorim, who came from Crete, wiped them out and settled in their place.—
Transliteration: vehaaviym hayosheviym vachatseriym ad-azah khafetoriym hayotseiym mikhafetor hishemiydum vayeshevu tachetam

Hebrew: ק֣וּמוּ סְּע֗וּ וְעִבְרוּ֮ אֶת־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹן֒ רְאֵ֣ה נָתַ֣תִּי בְ֠יָדְךָ֠ אֶת־סִיחֹ֨ן מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶשְׁבּ֧וֹן הָֽאֱמֹרִ֛י וְאֶת־אַרְצ֖וֹ הָחֵ֣ל רָ֑שׁ וְהִתְגָּ֥ר בּ֖וֹ מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Up! Set out across the wadi Arnon! See, I give into your power Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin the occupation: engage him in battle.
Transliteration: kumu seu veiveru et-nachal arenon reeh natatiy veyadekha et-siychon melekhe-cheshevvon haemoriy veet-aretsvo hachel rash vehitegar vvo milechamah

Hebrew: הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה אָחֵל֙ תֵּ֤ת פַּחְדְּךָ֙ וְיִרְאָ֣תְךָ֔ עַל־פְּנֵי֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁמְעוּן֙ שִׁמְעֲךָ֔ וְרָגְז֥וּ וְחָל֖וּ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: This day I begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples everywhere under heaven, so that they shall tremble and quake because of you whenever they hear you mentioned.
Transliteration: hayyvom hazeh achel tet fachedekha veyireatekha al-feney haamiym tachat khׇl-hashamayiim asher yishemeun shimeakha veragezu vechalu mifaneykha

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכִים֙ מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר קְדֵמ֔וֹת אֶל־סִיח֖וֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן דִּבְרֵ֥י שָׁל֖וֹם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to King Sihon of Heshbon with an offer of peace, as follows,
Transliteration: vaeshelach maleakhiym mimidevar kedemvot el-siychvon melekhe cheshevvon diverey shalvom lemor

Hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָ֣ה בְאַרְצֶ֔ךָ בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ אֵלֵ֑ךְ לֹ֥א אָס֖וּר יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
Translated: “Let me pass through your country. I will keep strictly to the highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left.
Transliteration: eeverah vearetsekha vaderekhe vaderekhe elekhe lo asur yamiyn ushemovl

Hebrew: אֹ֣כֶל בַּכֶּ֤סֶף תַּשְׁבִּרֵ֙נִי֙ וְאָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֛יִם בַּכֶּ֥סֶף תִּתֶּן־לִ֖י וְשָׁתִ֑יתִי רַ֖ק אֶעְבְּרָ֥ה בְרַגְלָֽי׃
Translated: What food I eat you will supply for money, and what water I drink you will furnish for money; just let me pass through —
Transliteration: okhel vakhesef tashevireniy veakhaletiy umayiim vakhesef titen-liy veshatiytiy rak eeverah veragelay

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָֽשׂוּ־לִ֜י בְּנֵ֣י עֵשָׂ֗ו הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּשֵׂעִ֔יר וְהַמּ֣וֹאָבִ֔ים הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בְּעָ֑ר עַ֤ד אֲשֶֽׁר־אֶֽעֱבֹר֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: as the descendants of Esau who dwell in Seir did for me, and the Moabites who dwell in Ar—that I may cross the Jordan into the land that our God יהוה is giving us.”
Transliteration: khaasher ashu-liy veney eshav hayosheviym vesheiyr vehamvoaviym hayosheviym vear ad asher-eevor et-hayareden el-haarets asher-yehovah eloheynu noten lanu

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א אָבָ֗ה סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן הַעֲבִרֵ֖נוּ בּ֑וֹ כִּֽי־הִקְשָׁה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־רוּח֗וֹ וְאִמֵּץ֙ אֶת־לְבָב֔וֹ לְמַ֛עַן תִּתּ֥וֹ בְיָדְךָ֖ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But King Sihon of Heshbon refused to let us pass through, because יהוה had stiffened his will and hardened his heart in order to deliver him into your power—as is now the case.
Transliteration: velo avah siychon melekhe cheshevvon haavirenu vvo khiy-hikeshah yehovah eloheykha et-ruchvo veimets et-levavvo lemaan titvo veyadekha khayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י רְאֵ֗ה הַֽחִלֹּ֙תִי֙ תֵּ֣ת לְפָנֶ֔יךָ אֶת־סִיחֹ֖ן וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ הָחֵ֣ל רָ֔שׁ לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: And יהוה said to me: See, I begin by placing Sihon and his land at your disposal. Begin the occupation; take possession of his land.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay reeh hachilotiy tet lefaneykha et-siychon veet-aretsvo hachel rash lareshet et-aretsvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֩ סִיחֹ֨ן לִקְרָאתֵ֜נוּ ה֧וּא וְכׇל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה יָֽהְצָה׃
Translated: Sihon with all his troops took the field against us at Jahaz,
Transliteration: vayetse siychon likeratenu hu vekhׇl-amvo lamilechamah yahetsah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֛הוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ וַנַּ֥ךְ אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖ו וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and our God יהוה delivered him to us and we defeated him and his sons and all his troops.
Transliteration: vayitenehu yehovah eloheynu lefaneynu vanakhe otvo veet-vanav veet-khׇl-amvo

Hebrew: וַנִּלְכֹּ֤ד אֶת־כׇּל־עָרָיו֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא וַֽנַּחֲרֵם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־עִ֣יר מְתִ֔ם וְהַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַטָּ֑ף לֹ֥א הִשְׁאַ֖רְנוּ שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: At that time we captured all his towns, and we doomed every town—men, women, and children —leaving no survivor.
Transliteration: vanilekhod et-khׇl-arayv vaet hahiv vanacharem et-khׇl-iyr metim vehanashiym vehataf lo hishearenu shariyd

Hebrew: רַ֥ק הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה בָּזַ֣זְנוּ לָ֑נוּ וּשְׁלַ֥ל הֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָכָֽדְנוּ׃
Translated: We retained as booty only the cattle and the spoil of the cities that we captured.
Transliteration: rak havehemah vazazenu lanu ushelal heariym asher lakhadenu

Hebrew: מֵֽעֲרֹעֵ֡ר אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֨חַל אַרְנֹ֜ן וְהָעִ֨יר אֲשֶׁ֤ר בַּנַּ֙חַל֙ וְעַד־הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לֹ֤א הָֽיְתָה֙ קִרְיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂגְבָ֖ה מִמֶּ֑נּוּ אֶת־הַכֹּ֕ל נָתַ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ לְפָנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: From Aroer on the edge of the Arnon valley, including the town in the valley itself, to Gilead, not a city was too mighty for us; our God יהוה delivered everything to us.
Transliteration: mearoer asher al-shefat-nachal arenon vehaiyr asher vanachal vead-hagilead lo hayetah kireyah asher shagevah mimenu et-hakhol natan yehovah eloheynu lefaneynu

Hebrew: רַ֛ק אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֖וֹן לֹ֣א קָרָ֑בְתָּ כׇּל־יַ֞ד נַ֤חַל יַבֹּק֙ וְעָרֵ֣י הָהָ֔ר וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: But you did not encroach upon the land of the Ammonites, all along the wadi Jabbok and the towns of the hill country, just as our God יהוה had commanded.
Transliteration: rak el-erets veney-amvon lo karaveta khׇl-yad nachal yavok vearey hahar vekhol asher-tsivah yehovah eloheynu

Hebrew: וַנֵּ֣פֶן וַנַּ֔עַל דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וַיֵּצֵ֣א עוֹג֩ מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֨ן לִקְרָאתֵ֜נוּ ה֧וּא וְכׇל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
Translated: We made our way up the road toward Bashan, and King Og of Bashan with all his troops took the field against us at Edrei.
Transliteration: vanefen vanaal derekhe havashan vayetse vog melekhe-havashan likeratenu hu vekhׇl-amvo lamilechamah edereiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֣י בְיָדְךָ֞ נָתַ֧תִּי אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ לְסִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּֽוֹן׃
Translated: But יהוה said to me: Do not fear him, for I am delivering him and all his troops and his country into your power, and you will do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay al-tiyra otvo khiy veyadekha natatiy otvo veet-khׇl-amvo veet-aretsvo veashiyta lvo khaasher ashiyta lesiychon melekhe haemoriy asher yvoshev vecheshevvon

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֜ינוּ בְּיָדֵ֗נוּ גַּ֛ם אֶת־ע֥וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֖ן וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֑וֹ וַנַּכֵּ֕הוּ עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: So our God יהוה also delivered into our power King Og of Bashan, with all his troops, and we dealt them such a blow that no survivor was left.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah eloheynu veyadenu gam et-vog melekhe-havashan veet-khׇl-amvo vanakhehu ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lvo shariyd

Hebrew: וַנִּלְכֹּ֤ד אֶת־כׇּל־עָרָיו֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לֹ֤א הָֽיְתָה֙ קִרְיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־לָקַ֖חְנוּ מֵֽאִתָּ֑ם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים עִיר֙ כׇּל־חֶ֣בֶל אַרְגֹּ֔ב מַמְלֶ֥כֶת ע֖וֹג בַּבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: At that time we captured all his towns; there was not a town that we did not take from them: sixty towns, the whole district of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan—
Transliteration: vanilekhod et-khׇl-arayv vaet hahiv lo hayetah kireyah asher lo-lakachenu meitam shishiym iyr khׇl-chevel aregov mamelekhet vog vavashan

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֜לֶּה עָרִ֧ים בְּצֻרֹ֛ת חוֹמָ֥ה גְבֹהָ֖ה דְּלָתַ֣יִם וּבְרִ֑יחַ לְבַ֛ד מֵעָרֵ֥י הַפְּרָזִ֖י הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: all those towns were fortified with high walls, gates, and bars—apart from a great number of unwalled towns.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh ariym vetsurot chvomah gevohah delatayiim uveriycha levad mearey haferaziy hareveh meod

Hebrew: וַנַּחֲרֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔ינוּ לְסִיחֹ֖ן מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן הַחֲרֵם֙ כׇּל־עִ֣יר מְתִ֔ם הַנָּשִׁ֖ים וְהַטָּֽף׃
Translated: We doomed them as we had done in the case of King Sihon of Heshbon; we doomed every town—men, women, and children—
Transliteration: vanacharem votam khaasher ashiynu lesiychon melekhe cheshevvon hacharem khׇl-iyr metim hanashiym vehataf

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָ֛ה וּשְׁלַ֥ל הֶעָרִ֖ים בַּזּ֥וֹנוּ לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: and retained as booty all the cattle and the spoil of the towns.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-havehemah ushelal heariym vazvonu lanu

Hebrew: וַנִּקַּ֞ח בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִוא֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ מִיַּ֗ד שְׁנֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִנַּ֥חַל אַרְנֹ֖ן עַד־הַ֥ר חֶרְמֽוֹן׃
Translated: Thus we seized, at that time, from the two Amorite kings, the country beyond the Jordan, from the wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon—
Transliteration: vanikach vaet hahiv et-haarets miyad sheney malekhey haemoriy asher veever hayareden minachal arenon ad-har cheremvon

Hebrew: צִידֹנִ֛ים יִקְרְא֥וּ לְחֶרְמ֖וֹן שִׂרְיֹ֑ן וְהָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י יִקְרְאוּ־ל֖וֹ שְׂנִֽיר׃
Translated: Sidonians called Hermon Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir—
Transliteration: tsiydoniym yikereu lecheremvon shireyon vehaemoriy yikereu-lvo sheniyr

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ עָרֵ֣י הַמִּישֹׁ֗ר וְכׇל־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְכׇל־הַבָּשָׁ֔ן עַד־סַלְכָ֖ה וְאֶדְרֶ֑עִי עָרֵ֛י מַמְלֶ֥כֶת ע֖וֹג בַּבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: all the towns of the Tableland and the whole of Gilead and Bashan as far as Salcah and Edrei, the towns of Og’s kingdom in Bashan.
Transliteration: khol arey hamiyshor vekhׇl-hagilead vekhׇl-havashan ad-salekhah veedereiy arey mamelekhet vog vavashan

Hebrew: כִּ֣י רַק־ע֞וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֗ן נִשְׁאַר֮ מִיֶּ֣תֶר הָרְפָאִים֒ הִנֵּ֤ה עַרְשׂוֹ֙ עֶ֣רֶשׂ בַּרְזֶ֔ל הֲלֹ֣ה הִ֔וא בְּרַבַּ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן תֵּ֧שַׁע אַמּ֣וֹת אׇרְכָּ֗הּ וְאַרְבַּ֥ע אַמּ֛וֹת רׇחְבָּ֖הּ בְּאַמַּת־אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Only King Og of Bashan was left of the remaining Rephaim. His bedstead, an iron bedstead, is now in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it is nine cubits long and four cubits wide, by the standard cubit!
Transliteration: khiy rak-vog melekhe havashan nishear miyeter harefaiym hineh areshvo eresh varezel haloh hiv veravat veney amvon tesha amvot ׇrekhah veareva amvot rׇchevah veamat-iysh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את יָרַ֖שְׁנוּ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑וא מֵעֲרֹעֵ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־עַל־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹ֗ן וַחֲצִ֤י הַֽר־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְעָרָ֔יו נָתַ֕תִּי לָרֽאוּבֵנִ֖י וְלַגָּדִֽי׃
Translated: And this is the land which we apportioned at that time: The part from Aroer along the wadi Arnon, with part of the hill country of Gilead and its towns, I assigned to the Reubenites and the Gadites.
Transliteration: veet-haarets hazot yarashenu vaet hahiv mearoer asher-al-nachal arenon vachatsiy har-hagilead vearayv natatiy laruveniy velagadiy

Hebrew: וְיֶ֨תֶר הַגִּלְעָ֤ד וְכׇל־הַבָּשָׁן֙ מַמְלֶ֣כֶת ע֔וֹג נָתַ֕תִּי לַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כֹּ֣ל חֶ֤בֶל הָֽאַרְגֹּב֙ לְכׇל־הַבָּשָׁ֔ן הַה֥וּא יִקָּרֵ֖א אֶ֥רֶץ רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: The rest of Gilead, and all of Bashan under Og’s rule—the whole Argob district, all that part of Bashan which is called Rephaim country—I assigned to the half-tribe of Manasseh.
Transliteration: veyeter hagilead vekhׇl-havashan mamelekhet vog natatiy lachatsiy shevet hamenasheh khol chevel haaregov lekhׇl-havashan hahu yikare erets refaiym

Hebrew: יָאִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה לָקַח֙ אֶת־כׇּל־חֶ֣בֶל אַרְגֹּ֔ב עַד־גְּב֥וּל הַגְּשׁוּרִ֖י וְהַמַּֽעֲכָתִ֑י וַיִּקְרָא֩ אֹתָ֨ם עַל־שְׁמ֤וֹ אֶת־הַבָּשָׁן֙ חַוֺּ֣ת יָאִ֔יר עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Jair son of Manasseh received the whole Argob district (that is, Bashan) as far as the boundary of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and named it after himself: Havvoth-jair —as is still the case.
Transliteration: yaiyr ven-menasheh lakach et-khׇl-chevel aregov ad-gevul hageshuriy vehamaakhatiy vayikera otam al-shemvo et-havashan chavot yaiyr ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּלְמָכִ֖יר נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: To Machir I assigned Gilead.
Transliteration: ulemakhiyr natatiy et-hagilead

Hebrew: וְלָראוּבֵנִ֨י וְלַגָּדִ֜י נָתַ֤תִּי מִן־הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְעַד־נַ֣חַל אַרְנֹ֔ן תּ֥וֹךְ הַנַּ֖חַל וּגְבֻ֑ל וְעַד֙ יַבֹּ֣ק הַנַּ֔חַל גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: And to the Reubenites and the Gadites I assigned the part from Gilead down to the wadi Arnon, the middle of the wadi being the boundary, and up to the wadi Jabbok, the boundary of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: velaruveniy velagadiy natatiy min-hagilead vead-nachal arenon tvokhe hanachal ugevul vead yavok hanachal gevul veney amvon

Hebrew: וְהָֽעֲרָבָ֖ה וְהַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן וּגְבֻ֑ל מִכִּנֶּ֗רֶת וְעַ֨ד יָ֤ם הָֽעֲרָבָה֙ יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לַח תַּ֛חַת אַשְׁדֹּ֥ת הַפִּסְגָּ֖ה מִזְרָֽחָה׃
Translated: [We also seized] the Arabah, from the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, to the edge of the Jordan, and from Chinnereth down to the sea of the Arabah, the Dead Sea.
Transliteration: vehaaravah vehayareden ugevul mikhineret vead yam haaravah yam hamelach tachat ashedot hafisegah mizerachah

Hebrew: וָאֲצַ֣ו אֶתְכֶ֔ם בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם נָתַ֨ן לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־הָאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ חֲלוּצִ֣ים תַּֽעַבְר֗וּ לִפְנֵ֛י אֲחֵיכֶ֥ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כׇּל־בְּנֵי־חָֽיִל׃
Translated: At that time I charged you [men of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh], saying, “Your God יהוה has given you this country to possess. You must go as shock-troops, warriors all, at the head of your Israelite kin.
Transliteration: vaatsav etekhem vaet hahiv lemor yehovah eloheykhem natan lakhem et-haarets hazot lerishetah chalutsiym taaveru lifeney acheykhem veney-yisherael khׇl-veney-chayiil

Hebrew: רַ֠ק נְשֵׁיכֶ֣ם וְטַפְּכֶם֮ וּמִקְנֵכֶם֒ יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־מִקְנֶ֥ה רַ֖ב לָכֶ֑ם יֵֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּעָ֣רֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Only your wives, children, and livestock—I know that you have much livestock—shall be left in the towns I have assigned to you,
Transliteration: rak nesheykhem vetafekhem umikenekhem yadaetiy khiy-mikeneh rav lakhem eishevu veareykhem asher natatiy lakhem

Hebrew: עַ֠ד אֲשֶׁר־יָנִ֨יחַ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> לַֽאֲחֵיכֶם֮ כָּכֶם֒ וְיָרְשׁ֣וּ גַם־הֵ֔ם אֶת־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם נֹתֵ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְשַׁבְתֶּ֗ם אִ֚ישׁ לִֽירֻשָּׁת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: until יהוה has granted your kin a haven such as you have, and they too have taken possession of the land that your God יהוה is assigning them, beyond the Jordan. Then you may return each to the homestead that I have assigned to him.”
Transliteration: ad asher-yaniycha yehovah <small></small> laacheykhem khakhem veyareshu gam-hem et-haarets asher yehovah eloheykhem noten lahem veever hayareden veshavetem iysh liyrushatvo asher natatiy lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יְהוֹשׁ֣וּעַ צִוֵּ֔יתִי בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹ֑ר עֵינֶ֣יךָ הָרֹאֹ֗ת אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶם֙ לִשְׁנֵי֙ הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה כֵּֽן־יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְכׇל־הַמַּמְלָכ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹבֵ֥ר שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: I also charged Joshua at that time, saying, “You have seen with your own eyes all that your God יהוה has done to these two kings; so shall יהוה do to all the kingdoms into which you shall cross over.
Transliteration: veet-yehvoshua tsiveytiy vaet hahiv lemor eyneykha haroot et khׇl-asher ashah yehovah eloheykhem lisheney hamelakhiym haeleh khen-yaasheh yehovah lekhׇl-hamamelakhvot asher atah over shamah

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּֽירָא֑וּם כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֖וּא הַנִּלְחָ֥ם לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not fear them, for it is your God יהוה who will battle for you.”
Transliteration: lo tiyraum khiy yehovah eloheykhem hu hanilecham lakhem {s}

Hebrew: וָאֶתְחַנַּ֖ן אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖וא לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: I pleaded with יהוה at that time, saying,
Transliteration: vaetechanan el-yehovah vaet hahiv lemor

Hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אַתָּ֤ה הַֽחִלּ֙וֹתָ֙ לְהַרְא֣וֹת אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶ֨ת־גׇּדְלְךָ֔ וְאֶת־יָדְךָ֖ הַחֲזָקָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִי־אֵל֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם וּבָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה כְמַעֲשֶׂ֖יךָ וְכִגְבוּרֹתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “O Lord יהוה, You who let Your servant see the first works of Your greatness and Your mighty hand, You whose powerful deeds no god in heaven or on earth can equal!
Transliteration: adonay yehovih atah hachilvota leharevot et-avedekha et-gׇdelekha veet-yadekha hachazakah asher miy-el vashamayiim uvaarets asher-yaasheh khemaasheykha vekhigevurotekha

Hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָה־נָּ֗א וְאֶרְאֶה֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן הָהָ֥ר הַטּ֛וֹב הַזֶּ֖ה וְהַלְּבָנֹֽן׃
Translated: Let me, I pray, cross over and see the good land on the other side of the Jordan, that good hill country, and the Lebanon.”
Transliteration: eeverah-na veereeh et-haarets hatvovah asher veever hayareden hahar hatvov hazeh vehalevanon

Hebrew: וַיִּתְעַבֵּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֥ה בִּי֙ לְמַ֣עַנְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א שָׁמַ֖ע אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֵלַי֙ רַב־לָ֔ךְ אַל־תּ֗וֹסֶף דַּבֵּ֥ר אֵלַ֛י ע֖וֹד בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But יהוה was wrathful with me on your account and would not listen to me. יהוה said to me, “Enough! Never speak to Me of this matter again!
Transliteration: vayiteaver yehovah viy lemaanekhem velo shama elay vayomer yehovah elay rav-lakhe al-tvosef daver elay vod vadavar hazeh

Hebrew: עֲלֵ֣ה ׀ רֹ֣אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֗ה וְשָׂ֥א עֵינֶ֛יךָ יָ֧מָּה וְצָפֹ֛נָה וְתֵימָ֥נָה וּמִזְרָ֖חָה וּרְאֵ֣ה בְעֵינֶ֑יךָ כִּי־לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֥ן הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Go up to the summit of Pisgah and gaze about, to the west, the north, the south, and the east. Look at it well, for you shall not go across yonder Jordan.
Transliteration: aleh rosh hafisegah vesha eyneykha yamah vetsafonah veteymanah umizerachah ureeh veeyneykha khiy-lo taavor et-hayareden hazeh

Hebrew: וְצַ֥ו אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וְחַזְּקֵ֣הוּ וְאַמְּצֵ֑הוּ כִּי־ה֣וּא יַעֲבֹ֗ר לִפְנֵי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהוּא֙ יַנְחִ֣יל אוֹתָ֔ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: Give Joshua his instructions, and imbue him with strength and courage, for he shall go across at the head of this people, and he shall allot to them the land that you may only see.”
Transliteration: vetsav et-yehvoshua vechazekehu veametsehu khiy-hu yaavor lifeney haam hazeh vehu yanechiyl votam et-haarets asher tireeh

Hebrew: וַנֵּ֣שֶׁב בַּגָּ֔יְא מ֖וּל בֵּ֥ית פְּעֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated: Meanwhile we stayed on in the valley near Beth-peor.
Transliteration: vaneshev vagaye mul veyt fevor {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שְׁמַ֤ע אֶל־הַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְאֶל־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָֽנֹכִ֛י מְלַמֵּ֥ד אֶתְכֶ֖ם לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לְמַ֣עַן תִּֽחְי֗וּ וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: And now, O Israel, give heed to the laws and rules that I am instructing you to observe, so that you may live to enter and occupy the land that יהוה, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
Transliteration: veatah yisherael shema el-hachukiym veel-hamishefatiym asher anokhiy melamed etekhem laashvot lemaan ticheyu uvatem viyrishetem et-haarets asher yehovah elohey avoteykhem noten lakhem

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹסִ֗פוּ עַל־הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תִגְרְע֖וּ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ לִשְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not add anything to what I command you or take anything away from it, but keep the commandments of your God יהוה that I enjoin upon you.
Transliteration: lo tosifu al-hadavar asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem velo tigereu mimenu lishemor et-mitsevot yehovah eloheykhem asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem

Hebrew: עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ הָֽרֹא֔וֹת אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר כִּ֣י כׇל־הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הָלַךְ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י בַֽעַל־פְּע֔וֹר הִשְׁמִיד֛וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: You saw with your own eyes what יהוה did in the matter of Baal-peor, that your God יהוה wiped out from among you every person who followed Baal-peor;
Transliteration: eyneykhem harovot et asher-ashah yehovah vevaal fevor khiy khׇl-haiysh asher halakhe acharey vaal-fevor hishemiydvo yehovah eloheykha mikirevekha

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ הַדְּבֵקִ֔ים בַּיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם חַיִּ֥ים כֻּלְּכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: while you, who held fast to your God יהוה, are all alive today.
Transliteration: veatem hadevekiym vayhovah eloheykhem chayiym khulekhem hayyvom

Hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה ׀ לִמַּ֣דְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֗ם חֻקִּים֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוַּ֖נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת כֵּ֔ן בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם בָּאִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: See, I have imparted to you laws and rules, as my God יהוה has commanded me, for you to abide by in the land that you are about to enter and occupy.
Transliteration: reeh limadetiy etekhem chukiym umishefatiym khaasher tsivaniy yehovah elohay laashvot khen vekerev haarets asher atem vaiym shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֮ וַעֲשִׂיתֶם֒ כִּ֣י הִ֤וא חׇכְמַתְכֶם֙ וּבִ֣ינַתְכֶ֔ם לְעֵינֵ֖י הָעַמִּ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשְׁמְע֗וּן אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַחֻקִּ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאָמְר֗וּ רַ֚ק עַם־חָכָ֣ם וְנָב֔וֹן הַגּ֥וֹי הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Observe them faithfully, for that will be proof of your wisdom and discernment to other peoples, who on hearing of all these laws will say, “Surely, that great nation is a wise and discerning people.”
Transliteration: ushemaretem vaashiytem khiy hiv chׇkhematekhem uviynatekhem leeyney haamiym asher yishemeun et khׇl-hachukiym haeleh veameru rak am-chakham venavvon hagvoy hagadvol hazeh

Hebrew: כִּ֚י מִי־ג֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־ל֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים קְרֹבִ֣ים אֵלָ֑יו כַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ בְּכׇל־קׇרְאֵ֖נוּ אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: For what great nation is there that has a god so close at hand as is our God יהוה whenever we call?
Transliteration: khiy miy-gvoy gadvol asher-lvo Elohim keroviym elayv khayhovah eloheynu vekhׇl-kׇreenu elayv

Hebrew: וּמִי֙ גּ֣וֹי גָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ חֻקִּ֥ים וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֖ים צַדִּיקִ֑ם כְּכֹל֙ הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Or what great nation has laws and rules as perfect as all this Teaching that I set before you this day?
Transliteration: umiy gvoy gadvol asher-lvo chukiym umishefatiym tsadiykim khekhol hatvorah hazot asher anokhiy noten lifeneykhem hayyvom

Hebrew: רַ֡ק הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֩ וּשְׁמֹ֨ר נַפְשְׁךָ֜ מְאֹ֗ד פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֨ח אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־רָא֣וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וּפֶן־יָס֙וּרוּ֙ מִלְּבָ֣בְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּ֑יךָ וְהוֹדַעְתָּ֥ם לְבָנֶ֖יךָ וְלִבְנֵ֥י בָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But take utmost care and watch yourselves scrupulously, so that you do not forget the things that you saw with your own eyes and so that they do not fade from your mind as long as you live. And make them known to your children and to your children’s children:
Transliteration: rak hishamer lekha ushemor nafeshekha meod fen-tishekhach et-hadevariym asher-rau eyneykha ufen-yasuru milevavekha khol yemey chayeykha vehvodaetam levaneykha veliveney vaneykha

Hebrew: י֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָמַ֜דְתָּ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ בְּחֹרֵב֒ בֶּאֱמֹ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י הַקְהֶל־לִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאַשְׁמִעֵ֖ם אֶת־דְּבָרָ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִלְמְד֜וּן לְיִרְאָ֣ה אֹתִ֗י כׇּל־הַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֤ם חַיִּים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וְאֶת־בְּנֵיהֶ֖ם יְלַמֵּדֽוּן׃
Translated: The day you stood before your God יהוה at Horeb, when יהוה said to me, “Gather the people to Me that I may let them hear My words, in order that they may learn to revere Me as long as they live on earth, and may so teach their children.”
Transliteration: yvom asher amadeta lifeney yehovah eloheykha vechorev veemor yehovah elay hakehel-liy et-haam veashemiem et-devaray asher yilemedun leyireah otiy khׇl-hayamiym asher hem chayiym al-haadamah veet-veneyhem yelamedun

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרְב֥וּן וַתַּֽעַמְד֖וּן תַּ֣חַת הָהָ֑ר וְהָהָ֞ר בֹּעֵ֤ר בָּאֵשׁ֙ עַד־לֵ֣ב הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם חֹ֖שֶׁךְ עָנָ֥ן וַעֲרָפֶֽל׃
Translated: You came forward and stood at the foot of the mountain. The mountain was ablaze with flames to the very skies, dark with densest clouds.
Transliteration: vatikerevun vataamedun tachat hahar vehahar voer vaesh ad-lev hashamayiim choshekhe anan vaarafel

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָאֵ֑שׁ ק֤וֹל דְּבָרִים֙ אַתֶּ֣ם שֹׁמְעִ֔ים וּתְמוּנָ֛ה אֵינְכֶ֥ם רֹאִ֖ים זוּלָתִ֥י קֽוֹל׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to you out of the fire; you heard the sound of words but perceived no shape—nothing but a voice.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah aleykhem mitvokhe haesh kvol devariym atem shomeiym utemunah eynekhem roiym zulatiy kvol

Hebrew: וַיַּגֵּ֨ד לָכֶ֜ם אֶת־בְּרִית֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת עֲשֶׂ֖רֶת הַדְּבָרִ֑ים וַֽיִּכְתְּבֵ֔ם עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י לֻח֥וֹת אֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: [God] declared to you the covenant that you were commanded to observe, the Ten Commandments, inscribing them on two tablets of stone.
Transliteration: vayaged lakhem et-veriytvo asher tsivah etekhem laashvot asheret hadevariym vayikhetevem al-sheney luchvot avaniym

Hebrew: וְאֹתִ֞י צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לְלַמֵּ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֔ם חֻקִּ֖ים וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֑ים לַעֲשֹׂתְכֶ֣ם אֹתָ֔ם בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: At the same time יהוה commanded me to impart to you laws and rules for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy.
Transliteration: veotiy tsivah yehovah vaet hahiv lelamed etekhem chukiym umishefatiym laashotekhem otam vaarets asher atem overiym shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּ֥ם מְאֹ֖ד לְנַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֣י לֹ֤א רְאִיתֶם֙ כׇּל־תְּמוּנָ֔ה בְּי֗וֹם דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֲלֵיכֶ֛ם בְּחֹרֵ֖ב מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: For your own sake, therefore, be most careful—since you saw no shape when יהוה spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire—
Transliteration: venishemaretem meod lenafeshoteykhem khiy lo reiytem khׇl-temunah veyvom diver yehovah aleykhem vechorev mitvokhe haesh

Hebrew: פֶּ֨ן־תַּשְׁחִת֔וּן וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם פֶּ֖סֶל תְּמוּנַ֣ת כׇּל־סָ֑מֶל תַּבְנִ֥ית זָכָ֖ר א֥וֹ נְקֵבָֽה׃
Translated: not to act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness whatever: the form of a man or a woman,
Transliteration: fen-tashechitun vaashiytem lakhem fesel temunat khׇl-samel taveniyt zakhar vo nekevah

Hebrew: תַּבְנִ֕ית כׇּל־בְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאָ֑רֶץ תַּבְנִית֙ כׇּל־צִפּ֣וֹר כָּנָ֔ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּע֖וּף בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: the form of any beast on earth, the form of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
Transliteration: taveniyt khׇl-vehemah asher vaarets taveniyt khׇl-tsifvor khanaf asher tauf vashamayiim

Hebrew: תַּבְנִ֕ית כׇּל־רֹמֵ֖שׂ בָּאֲדָמָ֑ה תַּבְנִ֛ית כׇּל־דָּגָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־בַּמַּ֖יִם מִתַּ֥חַת לָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: the form of anything that creeps on the ground, the form of any fish that is in the waters below the earth.—
Transliteration: taveniyt khׇl-romesh vaadamah taveniyt khׇl-dagah asher-vamayiim mitachat laarets

Hebrew: וּפֶן־תִּשָּׂ֨א עֵינֶ֜יךָ הַשָּׁמַ֗יְמָה וְֽ֠רָאִ֠יתָ אֶת־הַשֶּׁ֨מֶשׁ וְאֶת־הַיָּרֵ֜חַ וְאֶת־הַכּֽוֹכָבִ֗ים כֹּ֚ל צְבָ֣א הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְנִדַּחְתָּ֛ וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם וַעֲבַדְתָּ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָלַ֜ק יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֹתָ֔ם לְכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים תַּ֖חַת כׇּל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: And when you look up to the sky and behold the sun and the moon and the stars, the whole heavenly host, you must not be lured into bowing down to them or serving them. These your God יהוה allotted to other peoples everywhere under heaven;
Transliteration: ufen-tisha eyneykha hashamayemah veraiyta et-hashemesh veet-hayarecha veet-hakhvokhaviym khol tseva hashamayiim venidacheta vehishetachaviyta lahem vaavadetam asher chalak yehovah eloheykha otam lekhol haamiym tachat khׇl-hashamayiim

Hebrew: וְאֶתְכֶם֙ לָקַ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיּוֹצִ֥א אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִכּ֥וּר הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם לִהְי֥וֹת ל֛וֹ לְעַ֥ם נַחֲלָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: but you יהוה took and brought out of Egypt, that iron blast furnace, to be God’s very own people, as is now the case.
Transliteration: veetekhem lakach yehovah vayyvotsi etekhem mikhur havarezel mimitserayiim liheyvot lvo leam nachalah khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֥ה הִתְאַנַּף־בִּ֖י עַל־דִּבְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֗ע לְבִלְתִּ֤י עׇבְרִי֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וּלְבִלְתִּי־בֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated: Now יהוה was angry with me on your account and swore that I should not cross the Jordan and enter the good land that your God יהוה is assigning you as a heritage.
Transliteration: vayhovah hiteanaf-viy al-divereykhem vayishava leviletiy ׇveriy et-hayareden uleviletiy-vo el-haarets hatvovah asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֥י מֵת֙ בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֵינֶ֥נִּי עֹבֵ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְאַתֶּם֙ עֹֽבְרִ֔ים וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֕ם אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: For I must die in this land; I shall not cross the Jordan. But you will cross and take possession of that good land.
Transliteration: khiy anokhiy met vaarets hazot eyneniy over et-hayareden veatem overiym viyrishetem et-haarets hatvovah hazot

Hebrew: הִשָּׁמְר֣וּ לָכֶ֗ם פֶּֽן־תִּשְׁכְּחוּ֙ אֶת־בְּרִ֤ית יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖ת עִמָּכֶ֑ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם לָכֶ֥ם פֶּ֙סֶל֙ תְּמ֣וּנַת כֹּ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Take care, then, not to forget the covenant that your God יהוה concluded with you, and not to make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, against which your God יהוה has enjoined you.
Transliteration: hishameru lakhem fen-tishekhechu et-veriyt yehovah eloheykhem asher kharat imakhem vaashiytem lakhem fesel temunat khol asher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֵ֥שׁ אֹכְלָ֖ה ה֑וּא אֵ֖ל קַנָּֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: For your God יהוה is a consuming fire, an impassioned God.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykha esh okhelah hu el kana {f}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תוֹלִ֤יד בָּנִים֙ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים וְנוֹשַׁנְתֶּ֖ם בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְהִשְׁחַתֶּ֗ם וַעֲשִׂ֤יתֶם פֶּ֙סֶל֙ תְּמ֣וּנַת כֹּ֔ל וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֥ם הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָה־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
Translated: When you have begotten children and children’s children and are long established in the land, should you act wickedly and make for yourselves a sculptured image in any likeness, causing your God יהוה displeasure and vexation,
Transliteration: khiy-tvoliyd vaniym uveney vaniym venvoshanetem vaarets vehishechatem vaashiytem fesel temunat khol vaashiytem hara veeyney yehovah-eloheykha lehakheiysvo

Hebrew: הַעִידֹ֩תִי֩ בָכֶ֨ם הַיּ֜וֹם אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ כִּֽי־אָבֹ֣ד תֹּאבֵדוּן֮ מַהֵר֒ מֵעַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ לֹֽא־תַאֲרִיכֻ֤ן יָמִים֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֥י הִשָּׁמֵ֖ד תִּשָּׁמֵדֽוּן׃
Translated: I call heaven and earth this day to witness against you that you shall soon perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess; you shall not long endure in it, but shall be utterly wiped out.
Transliteration: haiydotiy vakhem hayyvom et-hashamayiim veet-haarets khiy-avod tovedun maher meal haarets asher atem overiym et-hayareden shamah lerishetah lo-taariykhun yamiym aleyha khiy hishamed tishamedun

Hebrew: וְהֵפִ֧יץ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּעַמִּ֑ים וְנִשְׁאַרְתֶּם֙ מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר בַּגּוֹיִ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְנַהֵ֧ג יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: יהוה will scatter you among the peoples, and only a scant few of you shall be left among the nations to which יהוה will drive you.
Transliteration: vehefiyts yehovah etekhem vaamiym venishearetem metey misefar vagvoyim asher yenaheg yehovah etekhem shamah

Hebrew: וַעֲבַדְתֶּם־שָׁ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֔ים מַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָ֑ם עֵ֣ץ וָאֶ֔בֶן אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִרְאוּן֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמְע֔וּן וְלֹ֥א יֹֽאכְל֖וּן וְלֹ֥א יְרִיחֻֽן׃
Translated: There you will serve gods of wood and stone, made by human hands, that cannot see or hear or eat or smell.
Transliteration: vaavadetem-sham Elohim maasheh yedey adam ets vaeven asher lo-yireun velo yishemeun velo yokhelun velo yeriychun

Hebrew: וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּ֥ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּמָצָ֑אתָ כִּ֣י תִדְרְשֶׁ֔נּוּ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: But if you search there, you will find your God יהוה, if only you seek with all your heart and soul—
Transliteration: uvikashetem misham et-yehovah eloheykha umatsata khiy tidereshenu vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha

Hebrew: בַּצַּ֣ר לְךָ֔ וּמְצָא֕וּךָ כֹּ֖ל הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה בְּאַחֲרִית֙ הַיָּמִ֔ים וְשַׁבְתָּ֙ עַד־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated: when you are in distress because all these things have befallen you and, in the end, return to and obey your God יהוה.
Transliteration: vatsar lekha umetsaukha khol hadevariym haeleh veachariyt hayamiym veshaveta ad-yehovah eloheykha veshamaeta vekolvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֵ֤ל רַחוּם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א יַשְׁחִיתֶ֑ךָ וְלֹ֤א יִשְׁכַּח֙ אֶת־בְּרִ֣ית אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: For your God יהוה is a compassionate God, who will not fail you nor let you perish; [God] will not forget the covenant made on oath with your fathers.
Transliteration: khiy el rachum yehovah eloheykha lo yarefekha velo yashechiytekha velo yishekhach et-veriyt avoteykha asher nisheva lahem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שְׁאַל־נָא֩ לְיָמִ֨ים רִֽאשֹׁנִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־הָי֣וּ לְפָנֶ֗יךָ לְמִן־הַיּוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁר֩ בָּרָ֨א אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> אָדָם֙ עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּלְמִקְצֵ֥ה הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם הֲנִֽהְיָ֗ה כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַגָּדוֹל֙ הַזֶּ֔ה א֖וֹ הֲנִשְׁמַ֥ע כָּמֹֽהוּ׃
Translated: You have but to inquire about bygone ages that came before you, ever since God created humankind on earth, from one end of heaven to the other: has anything as grand as this ever happened, or has its like ever been known?
Transliteration: khiy sheal-na leyamiym rishoniym asher-hayu lefaneykha lemin-hayyvom asher vara Elohim <small></small> adam al-haarets ulemiketseh hashamayiim vead-ketseh hashamayiim haniheyah khadavar hagadvol hazeh vo hanishema khamohu

Hebrew: הֲשָׁ֣מַֽע עָם֩ ק֨וֹל אֱלֹהִ֜ים מְדַבֵּ֧ר מִתּוֹךְ־הָאֵ֛שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֥עְתָּ אַתָּ֖ה וַיֶּֽחִי׃
Translated: Has any people heard the voice of a god speaking out of a fire, as you have, and survived?
Transliteration: hashama am kvol Elohim medaver mitvokhe-haesh khaasher-shamaeta atah vayechiy

Hebrew: א֣וֹ ׀ הֲנִסָּ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֗ים לָ֠ב֠וֹא לָקַ֨חַת ל֣וֹ גוֹי֮ מִקֶּ֣רֶב גּוֹי֒ בְּמַסֹּת֩ בְּאֹתֹ֨ת וּבְמוֹפְתִ֜ים וּבְמִלְחָמָ֗ה וּבְיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְמוֹרָאִ֖ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Or has any deity ventured to go and take one nation from the midst of another by prodigious acts, by signs and portents, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and awesome power, as your God יהוה did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
Transliteration: vo hanisah Elohim lavvo lakachat lvo gvoy mikerev gvoy vemasot veotot uvemvofetiym uvemilechamah uveyad chazakah uvizervoa netuyah uvemvoraiym gedoliym khekhol asher-ashah lakhem yehovah eloheykhem vemitserayiim leeyneykha

Hebrew: אַתָּה֙ הׇרְאֵ֣תָ לָדַ֔עַת כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֣וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים אֵ֥ין ע֖וֹד מִלְּבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: It has been clearly demonstrated to you that יהוה alone is God; there is none else.
Transliteration: atah hׇreeta ladaat khiy yehovah hu haElohim eyn vod milevadvo

Hebrew: מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם הִשְׁמִֽיעֲךָ֥ אֶת־קֹל֖וֹ לְיַסְּרֶ֑ךָּ וְעַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ הֶרְאֲךָ֙ אֶת־אִשּׁ֣וֹ הַגְּדוֹלָ֔ה וּדְבָרָ֥יו שָׁמַ֖עְתָּ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: From the heavens [God] let you hear the divine voice to discipline you; on earth [God] let you see the great divine fire; and from amidst that fire you heard God’s words.
Transliteration: min-hashamayiim hishemiyakha et-kolvo leyaserekha veal-haarets hereakha et-ishvo hagedvolah udevarayv shamaeta mitvokhe haesh

Hebrew: וְתַ֗חַת כִּ֤י אָהַב֙ אֶת־אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ וַיִּבְחַ֥ר בְּזַרְע֖וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וַיּוֹצִֽאֲךָ֧ בְּפָנָ֛יו בְּכֹח֥וֹ הַגָּדֹ֖ל מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And having loved your ancestors, [God] chose their heirs after them; [God] personally —in great, divine might—led you out of Egypt,
Transliteration: vetachat khiy ahav et-avoteykha vayivechar vezarevo acharayv vayyvotsiakha vefanayv vekhochvo hagadol mimitserayiim

Hebrew: לְהוֹרִ֗ישׁ גּוֹיִ֛ם גְּדֹלִ֧ים וַעֲצֻמִ֛ים מִמְּךָ֖ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ לַהֲבִֽיאֲךָ֗ לָֽתֶת־לְךָ֧ אֶת־אַרְצָ֛ם נַחֲלָ֖ה כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: to drive from your path nations greater and more populous than you, to take you into their land and assign it to you as a heritage, as is still the case.
Transliteration: lehvoriysh gvoyim gedoliym vaatsumiym mimekha mifaneykha lahaviyakha latet-lekha et-aretsam nachalah khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם וַהֲשֵׁבֹתָ֮ אֶל־לְבָבֶ֒ךָ֒ כִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם מִמַּ֔עַל וְעַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ מִתָּ֑חַת אֵ֖ין עֽוֹד׃
Translated: Know therefore this day and keep in mind that יהוה alone is God in heaven above and on earth below; there is no other.
Transliteration: veyadaeta hayyvom vahashevota el-levavekha khiy yehovah hu haElohimm vashamayiim mimaal veal-haarets mitachat eyn vod

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֞ אֶת־חֻקָּ֣יו וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֲשֶׁר֙ יִיטַ֣ב לְךָ֔ וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ וּלְמַ֨עַן תַּאֲרִ֤יךְ יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Observe God’s laws and commandments, which I enjoin upon you this day, that it may go well with you and your children after you, and that you may long remain in the land that your God יהוה is assigning to you for all time.
Transliteration: veshamareta et-chukayv veet-mitsevotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom asher yiytav lekha ulevaneykha achareykha ulemaan taariykhe yamiym al-haadamah asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יַבְדִּ֤יל מֹשֶׁה֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ עָרִ֔ים בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִזְרְחָ֖ה שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: Then Moses set aside three cities on the east side of the Jordan
Transliteration: az yavediyl mosheh shalosh ariym veever hayareden mizerechah shamesh

Hebrew: לָנֻ֨ס שָׁ֜מָּה רוֹצֵ֗חַ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִרְצַ֤ח אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּבְלִי־דַ֔עַת וְה֛וּא לֹא־שֹׂנֵ֥א ל֖וֹ מִתְּמֹ֣ל שִׁלְשֹׁ֑ם וְנָ֗ס אֶל־אַחַ֛ת מִן־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖ל וָחָֽי׃
Translated: to which [a man] who has killed someone could escape, one who unwittingly slew another without having been an enemy in the past; he could flee to one of these cities and live:
Transliteration: lanus shamah rvotsecha asher yiretsach et-reehu viveliy-daat vehu lo-shone lvo mitemol shileshom venas el-achat min-heariym hael vachay

Hebrew: אֶת־בֶּ֧צֶר בַּמִּדְבָּ֛ר בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַמִּישֹׁ֖ר לָרֽאוּבֵנִ֑י וְאֶת־רָאמֹ֤ת בַּגִּלְעָד֙ לַגָּדִ֔י וְאֶת־גּוֹלָ֥ן בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן לַֽמְנַשִּֽׁי׃
Translated: Bezer, in the wilderness in the Tableland, belonging to the Reubenites; Ramoth, in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; and Golan, in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.
Transliteration: et-vetser vamidevar veerets hamiyshor laruveniy veet-ramot vagilead lagadiy veet-gvolan vavashan lamenashiy

Hebrew: וְזֹ֖את הַתּוֹרָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: This is the Teaching that Moses set before the Israelites:
Transliteration: vezot hatvorah asher-sham mosheh lifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה הָֽעֵדֹ֔ת וְהַֽחֻקִּ֖ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: these are the decrees, laws, and rules that Moses addressed to the people of Israel, after they had left Egypt,
Transliteration: eleh haedot vehachukiym vehamishefatiym asher diver mosheh el-veney yisherael vetsetam mimitserayiim

Hebrew: בְּעֵ֨בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֜ן בַּגַּ֗יְא מ֚וּל בֵּ֣ית פְּע֔וֹר בְּאֶ֗רֶץ סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֤ה מֹשֶׁה֙ וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: beyond the Jordan, in the valley at Beth-peor, in the land of King Sihon of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, whom Moses and the Israelites defeated after they had left Egypt.
Transliteration: veever hayareden vagaye mul veyt fevor veerets siychon melekhe haemoriy asher yvoshev vecheshevvon asher hikhah mosheh uveney yisherael vetsetam mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְשׁ֨וּ אֶת־אַרְצ֜וֹ וְאֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ ׀ ע֣וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֗ן שְׁנֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן מִזְרַ֖ח שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: They had taken possession of his country and that of King Og of Bashan—the two kings of the Amorites—which were on the east side of the Jordan
Transliteration: vayiyreshu et-aretsvo veet-erets vog melekhe-havashan sheney malekhey haemoriy asher veever hayareden mizerach shamesh

Hebrew: מֵעֲרֹעֵ֞ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֧חַל אַרְנֹ֛ן וְעַד־הַ֥ר שִׂיאֹ֖ן ה֥וּא חֶרְמֽוֹן׃
Translated: from Aroer on the banks of the wadi Arnon, as far as Mount Sion, that is, Hermon;
Transliteration: mearoer asher al-shefat-nachal arenon vead-har shiyon hu cheremvon

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָ֨עֲרָבָ֜ה עֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה וְעַ֖ד יָ֣ם הָעֲרָבָ֑ה תַּ֖חַת אַשְׁדֹּ֥ת הַפִּסְגָּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: also the whole Arabah on the east side of the Jordan, as far as the Sea of the Arabah, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haaravah ever hayareden mizerachah vead yam haaravah tachat ashedot hafisegah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם שְׁמַ֤ע יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י דֹּבֵ֥ר בְּאׇזְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם וּלְמַדְתֶּ֣ם אֹתָ֔ם וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֖ם לַעֲשֹׂתָֽם׃
Translated: Moses summoned all the Israelites and said to them: Hear, O Israel, the laws and rules that I proclaim to you this day! Study them and observe them faithfully!
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh el-khׇl-yisherael vayomer alehem shema yisherael et-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym asher anokhiy dover veׇzeneykhem hayyvom ulemadetem otam ushemaretem laashotam

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ כָּרַ֥ת עִמָּ֛נוּ בְּרִ֖ית בְּחֹרֵֽב׃
Translated: Our God יהוה made a covenant with us at Horeb.
Transliteration: yehovah eloheynu kharat imanu veriyt vechorev

Hebrew: לֹ֣א אֶת־אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ כָּרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֑את כִּ֣י אִתָּ֔נוּ אֲנַ֨חְנוּ אֵ֥לֶּה פֹ֛ה הַיּ֖וֹם כֻּלָּ֥נוּ חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: It was not with our ancestors that יהוה made this covenant, but with us, the living, every one of us who is here today.
Transliteration: lo et-avoteynu kharat yehovah et-haveriyt hazot khiy itanu anachenu eleh foh hayyvom khulanu chayiym

Hebrew: פָּנִ֣ים ׀ בְּפָנִ֗ים דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה עִמָּכֶ֛ם בָּהָ֖ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Face to face יהוה spoke to you on the mountain out of the fire—
Transliteration: faniym vefaniym diver yehovah imakhem vahar mitvokhe haesh

Hebrew: אָ֠נֹכִ֠י עֹמֵ֨ד בֵּין־יְהֹוָ֤ה וּבֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔וא לְהַגִּ֥יד לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י יְרֵאתֶם֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָאֵ֔שׁ וְלֹֽא־עֲלִיתֶ֥ם בָּהָ֖ר לֵאמֹֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: I stood between יהוה and you at that time to convey יהוה’s words to you, for you were afraid of the fire and did not go up the mountain—saying:
Transliteration: anokhiy omed veyn-yehovah uveyneykhem vaet hahiv lehagiyd lakhem et-devar yehovah khiy yeretem mifeney haesh velo-aliytem vahar lemor {s}

Hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֖י֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצֵאתִ֛יךָ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣֥ית עֲבָדִ֑͏ֽים׃
Translated: I יהוה am your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt, the house of bondage:
Transliteration: anokhiy yehovah eloheykha asher hvotsetiykha meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadi͏ym

Hebrew: לֹ֣א־יִהְיֶ֥͏ֽה־לְךָ֛֩ אֱלֹהִ֥֨ים אֲחֵרִ֖֜ים עַל־פָּנָֽ͏ַ֗י׃
Translated: You shall have no other gods beside Me.
Transliteration: lo-yiheye͏h-lekha Elohimm acheriym al-fana͏ay

Hebrew: לֹֽ֣א־תַעֲשֶֽׂ֨ה־לְךָ֥֣ פֶ֣֙סֶל֙ ׀ כׇּל־תְּמוּנָ֔֡ה אֲשֶׁ֤֣ר בַּשָּׁמַ֣֙יִם֙ ׀ מִמַּ֔֡עַל וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר֩ בָּאָ֖֨רֶץ מִתָּ֑͏ַ֜חַת וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּמַּ֖֣יִם ׀ מִתַּ֥֣חַת לָאָֽ֗רֶץ׃
Translated: You shall not make for yourself a sculptured image, any likeness of what is in the heavens above, or on the earth below, or in the waters below the earth.
Transliteration: lo-taasheh-lekha fesel khׇl-temunah asher vashamayiyim mimaal vaasher vaarets mita͏achat vaasher vamayiyim mitachat laarets

Hebrew: לֹא־תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥֣ה לָהֶ֖ם֮ וְלֹ֣א תׇעׇבְדֵ֑ם֒ כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֞י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣ל קַנָּ֔א פֹּ֠קֵ֠ד עֲוֺ֨ן אָב֧וֹת עַל־בָּנִ֛ים וְעַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֥ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִ֖ים לְשֹׂנְאָֽ֑י׃
Translated: You shall not bow down to them or serve them. For I your God יהוה am an impassioned God, visiting the guilt of the parents upon the children, upon the third and upon the fourth generations of those who reject Me,
Transliteration: lo-tishetachaveh lahem velo tׇׇvedem khiy anokhiy yehovah eloheykha el kana foked avon avvot al-vaniym veal-shileshiym veal-riveiym leshoneay

Hebrew: וְעֹ֥֤שֶׂה חֶ֖֙סֶד֙ לַֽאֲלָפִ֑֔ים לְאֹהֲבַ֖י וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י (מצותו) [מִצְוֺתָֽי]׃ {ס}
Translated: but showing kindness to the thousandth generation of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
Transliteration: veosheh chesed laalafiym leohavay uleshomerey (mtsvtv) [mitsevotay] {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִשָּׂ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַשָּׁ֑וְא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יְנַקֶּה֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ לַשָּֽׁוְא׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not swear falsely by the name of your God יהוה; for יהוה will not clear one who swears falsely by God’s name.
Transliteration: lo tisha et-shem-yehovah eloheykha lashave khiy lo yenakeh yehovah et asher-yisha et-shemvo lashave {s}

Translated: Observe the sabbath day and keep it holy, as your God יהוה has commanded you.
Transliteration: shamvor et-yvom hashavat lekadeshvo khaasher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha

Translated: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym taavod veashiyta khׇֿl-melakhetekha

Hebrew: וְי֨וֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔֜י שַׁבָּ֖֣ת ׀ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑֗יךָ לֹ֣א תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה כׇל־מְלָאכָ֡ה אַתָּ֣ה וּבִנְךָֽ־וּבִתֶּ֣ךָ וְעַבְדְּךָֽ־וַ֠אֲמָתֶ֠ךָ וְשׁוֹרְךָ֨ וַחֲמֹֽרְךָ֜ וְכׇל־בְּהֶמְתֶּ֗ךָ וְגֵֽרְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ לְמַ֗עַן יָנ֛וּחַ עַבְדְּךָ֥ וַאֲמָתְךָ֖ כָּמֽ֑וֹךָ׃
Translated: but the seventh day is a sabbath of your God יהוה; you shall not do any work—you, your son or your daughter, your male or female slave, your ox or your ass, or any of your cattle, or the stranger in your settlements, so that your male and female slave may rest as you do.
Transliteration: veyvom hasheviyiy shavat layhovah eloheykha lo taasheh khׇl-melakhah atah uvinekha-uvitekha veavedekha-vaamatekha veshvorekha vachamorekha vekhׇl-vehemetekha vegerekha asher visheareykha lemaan yanucha avedekha vaamatekha khamvokha

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֗֞ כִּ֣י־עֶ֤֥בֶד הָיִ֣֙יתָ֙ ׀ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔֗יִם וַיֹּצִ֨אֲךָ֜֩ יְהֹוָ֤֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֤֙יךָ֙ מִשָּׁ֔ם֙ בְּיָ֥֤ד חֲזָקָ֖ה֙ וּבִזְרֹ֣עַ נְטוּיָ֑֔ה עַל־כֵּ֗ן צִוְּךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת אֶת־י֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: Remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and your God יהוה freed you from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm; therefore your God יהוה has commanded you to observe the sabbath day.
Transliteration: vezakhareta khiy-eved hayiyta veerets mitserayiyim vayotsiakha yehovah eloheykha misham veyad chazakah uvizeroa netuyah al-khen tsivekha yehovah eloheykha laashvot et-yvom hashavat {s}

Hebrew: כַּבֵּ֤ד אֶת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ וְאֶת־אִמֶּ֔ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן ׀ יַאֲרִיכֻ֣ן יָמֶ֗יךָ וּלְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Honor your father and your mother, as your God יהוה has commanded you, that you may long endure, and that you may fare well, in the land that your God יהוה is assigning to you.
Transliteration: khaved et-aviykha veet-imekha khaasher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha lemaan yaariykhun yameykha ulemaan yiytav lakhe al haadamah asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥֖א תִּֿרְצָ֖͏ֽח׃ {ס} וְלֹ֣֖א תִּֿנְאָ֑͏ֽף׃ {ס} וְלֹ֣֖א תִּֿגְנֹֽ֔ב׃ {ס} וְלֹֽא־תַעֲנֶ֥ה בְרֵֽעֲךָ֖ עֵ֥ד שָֽׁוְא׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not murder. You shall not commit adultery. You shall not steal. You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
Transliteration: lo tֿiretsa͏ch {s} velo tֿinea͏f {s} velo tֿigenov {s} velo-taaneh vereakha ed shave {s}

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תַחְמֹ֖ד אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֶ֑ךָ {ס} וְלֹ֨א תִתְאַוֶּ֜ה בֵּ֣ית רֵעֶ֗ךָ שָׂדֵ֜הוּ וְעַבְדּ֤וֹ וַאֲמָתוֹ֙ שׁוֹר֣וֹ וַחֲמֹר֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְרֵעֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: You [men] shall not covet your neighbor’s wife. Likewise, none of you shall crave your neighbor’s house, or field, or male or female slave, or ox, or ass, or anything that is your neighbor’s.
Transliteration: velo tachemod eshet reekha {s} velo titeaveh veyt reekha shadehu veavedvo vaamatvo shvorvo vachamorvo vekhol asher lereekha {s}

Hebrew: אֶֽת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֡לֶּה דִּבֶּר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶל־כׇּל־קְהַלְכֶ֜ם בָּהָ֗ר מִתּ֤וֹךְ הָאֵשׁ֙ הֶֽעָנָ֣ן וְהָֽעֲרָפֶ֔ל ק֥וֹל גָּד֖וֹל וְלֹ֣א יָסָ֑ף וַֽיִּכְתְּבֵ֗ם עַל־שְׁנֵי֙ לֻחֹ֣ת אֲבָנִ֔ים וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: יהוה spoke those words—those and no more—to your whole congregation at the mountain, with a mighty voice out of the fire and the dense clouds. [God] inscribed them on two tablets of stone and gave them to me.
Transliteration: et-hadevariym haeleh diver yehovah el-khׇl-kehalekhem vahar mitvokhe haesh heanan vehaarafel kvol gadvol velo yasaf vayikhetevem al-sheney luchot avaniym vayitenem elay

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כְּשׇׁמְעֲכֶ֤ם אֶת־הַקּוֹל֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וְהָהָ֖ר בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֑שׁ וַתִּקְרְב֣וּן אֵלַ֔י כׇּל־רָאשֵׁ֥י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֖ם וְזִקְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: When you heard the voice out of the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, you came up to me, all your tribal heads and elders,
Transliteration: vayehiy kheshׇmeakhem et-hakvol mitvokhe hachoshekhe vehahar voer vaesh vatikerevun elay khׇl-rashey shiveteykhem vezikeneykhem

Hebrew: וַתֹּאמְר֗וּ הֵ֣ן הֶרְאָ֜נוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־כְּבֹד֣וֹ וְאֶת־גׇּדְל֔וֹ וְאֶת־קֹל֥וֹ שָׁמַ֖עְנוּ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָאֵ֑שׁ הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ רָאִ֔ינוּ כִּֽי־יְדַבֵּ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָֽאָדָ֖ם וָחָֽי׃
Translated: and said, “Our God יהוה has just shown us a majestic Presence, and we have heard God’s voice out of the fire; we have seen this day that humankind may live though addressed by God.
Transliteration: vatomeru hen hereanu yehovah eloheynu et-khevodvo veet-gׇdelvo veet-kolvo shamaenu mitvokhe haesh hayyvom hazeh raiynu khiy-yedaver Elohim et-haadam vachay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ לָ֣מָּה נָמ֔וּת כִּ֣י תֹֽאכְלֵ֔נוּ הָאֵ֥שׁ הַגְּדֹלָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את אִם־יֹסְפִ֣ים ׀ אֲנַ֗חְנוּ לִ֠שְׁמֹ֠עַ אֶת־ק֨וֹל יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ ע֖וֹד וָמָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: Let us not die, then, for this fearsome fire will consume us; if we hear the voice of our God יהוה any longer, we shall die.
Transliteration: veatah lamah namut khiy tokhelenu haesh hagedolah hazot im-yosefiym anachenu lishemoa et-kvol yehovah eloheynu vod vamatenu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מִ֣י כׇל־בָּשָׂ֡ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁמַ֣ע קוֹל֩ אֱלֹהִ֨ים חַיִּ֜ים מְדַבֵּ֧ר מִתּוֹךְ־הָאֵ֛שׁ כָּמֹ֖נוּ וַיֶּֽחִי׃
Translated: For what mortal ever heard the voice of the living God speak out of the fire, as we did, and lived?
Transliteration: khiy miy khׇl-vashar asher shama kvol Elohim chayiym medaver mitvokhe-haesh khamonu vayechiy

Hebrew: קְרַ֤ב אַתָּה֙ וּֽשְׁמָ֔ע אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְאַ֣תְּ ׀ תְּדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֵ֗ינוּ אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְדַבֵּ֜ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵ֛ינוּ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְשָׁמַ֥עְנוּ וְעָשִֽׂינוּ׃
Translated: You go closer and hear all that our God יהוה says, and then you tell us everything that our God יהוה tells you, and we will willingly do it.”
Transliteration: kerav atah ushema et khׇl-asher yomar yehovah eloheynu veate tedaver eleynu et khׇl-asher yedaver yehovah eloheynu eleykha veshamaenu veashiynu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל דִּבְרֵיכֶ֔ם בְּדַבֶּרְכֶ֖ם אֵלָ֑י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י שָׁ֠מַ֠עְתִּי אֶת־ק֨וֹל דִּבְרֵ֜י הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבְּר֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ הֵיטִ֖יבוּ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated: יהוה heard the plea that you made to me, and יהוה said to me, “I have heard the plea that this people made to you; they did well to speak thus.
Transliteration: vayishema yehovah et-kvol divereykhem vedaverekhem elay vayomer yehovah elay shamaetiy et-kvol diverey haam hazeh asher diveru eleykha heytiyvu khׇl-asher diveru
