Hebrew: מִֽי־יִתֵּ֡ן וְהָיָה֩ לְבָבָ֨ם זֶ֜ה לָהֶ֗ם לְיִרְאָ֥ה אֹתִ֛י וְלִשְׁמֹ֥ר אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתַ֖י כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים לְמַ֨עַן יִיטַ֥ב לָהֶ֛ם וְלִבְנֵיהֶ֖ם לְעֹלָֽם׃
Translated: May they always be of such mind, to revere Me and follow all My commandments, that it may go well with them and with their children forever!
Transliteration: miy-yiten vehayah levavam zeh lahem leyireah otiy velishemor et-khׇl-mitsevotay khׇl-hayamiym lemaan yiytav lahem veliveneyhem leolam

Hebrew: לֵ֖ךְ אֱמֹ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם שׁ֥וּבוּ לָכֶ֖ם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Go, say to them, ‘Return to your tents.’
Transliteration: lekhe emor lahem shuvu lakhem leׇholeykhem

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה פֹּה֮ עֲמֹ֣ד עִמָּדִי֒ וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה אֵלֶ֗יךָ אֵ֧ת כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֛ה וְהַחֻקִּ֥ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר תְּלַמְּדֵ֑ם וְעָשׂ֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: But you remain here with Me, and I will give you the whole Instruction—the laws and the rules—that you shall impart to them, for them to observe in the land that I am giving them to possess.”
Transliteration: veatah foh amod imadiy vaadaverah eleykha et khׇl-hamitsevah vehachukiym vehamishefatiym asher telamedem veashu vaarets asher anokhiy noten lahem lerishetah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם אֶתְכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תָסֻ֖רוּ יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאל׃
Translated: Be careful, then, to do as your God יהוה has commanded you. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left:
Transliteration: ushemaretem laashvot khaasher tsivah yehovah eloheykhem etekhem lo tasuru yamiyn ushemol

Hebrew: בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֜ה יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם אֶתְכֶ֖ם תֵּלֵ֑כוּ לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽחְיוּן֙ וְט֣וֹב לָכֶ֔ם וְהַאֲרַכְתֶּ֣ם יָמִ֔ים בָּאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּֽירָשֽׁוּן׃
Translated: follow only the path that your God יהוה has enjoined upon you, so that you may thrive and that it may go well with you, and that you may long endure in the land you are to possess.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haderekhe asher tsivah yehovah eloheykhem etekhem telekhu lemaan ticheyun vetvov lakhem vehaarakhetem yamiym vaarets asher tiyrashun

Hebrew: וְזֹ֣את הַמִּצְוָ֗ה הַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם לְלַמֵּ֣ד אֶתְכֶ֑ם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And this is the Instruction—the laws and the rules—that your God יהוה has commanded [me] to impart to you, to be observed in the land that you are about to cross into and occupy,
Transliteration: vezot hamitsevah hachukiym vehamishefatiym asher tsivah yehovah eloheykhem lelamed etekhem laashvot vaarets asher atem overiym shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן תִּירָ֜א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ לִ֠שְׁמֹ֠ר אֶת־כׇּל־חֻקֹּתָ֣יו וּמִצְוֺתָיו֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוֶּ֒ךָ֒ אַתָּה֙ וּבִנְךָ֣ וּבֶן־בִּנְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּ֑יךָ וּלְמַ֖עַן יַאֲרִכֻ֥ן יָמֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: so that you, your children, and your children’s children may revere your God יהוה and follow, as long as you live, all the divine laws and commandments that I enjoin upon you, to the end that you may long endure.
Transliteration: lemaan tiyra et-yehovah eloheykha lishemor et-khׇl-chukotayv umitsevotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha atah uvinekha uven-vinekha khol yemey chayeykha ulemaan yaarikhun yameykha

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר֙ יִיטַ֣ב לְךָ֔ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְבּ֖וּן מְאֹ֑ד כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י אֲבֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: Obey, O Israel, willingly and faithfully, that it may go well with you and that you may increase greatly [in] a land flowing with milk and honey, as יהוה, the God of your ancestors, spoke to you.
Transliteration: veshamaeta yisherael veshamareta laashvot asher yiytav lekha vaasher tirevun meod khaasher diver yehovah elohey avoteykha lakhe erets zavat chalav udevash {f}

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֖<big>ע</big> יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> אֶחָֽ<big>ד</big>׃
Translated: Hear, O Israel! יהוה is our God, יהוה alone.
Transliteration: shema<big></big> yisherael yehovah eloheynu yehovah <small></small> echa<big>d</big>

Hebrew: וְאָ֣הַבְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֥ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־מְאֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You shall love your God יהוה with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
Transliteration: veahaveta et yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha uvekhׇl-meodekha

Hebrew: וְהָי֞וּ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם עַל־לְבָבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Take to heart these instructions with which I charge you this day.
Transliteration: vehayu hadevariym haeleh asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom al-levavekha

Hebrew: וְשִׁנַּנְתָּ֣ם לְבָנֶ֔יךָ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֖ בָּ֑ם בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֤ בְּבֵיתֶ֙ךָ֙ וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ֣ בַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וּֽבְשׇׁכְבְּךָ֖ וּבְקוּמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Impress them upon your children. Recite them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up.
Transliteration: veshinanetam levaneykha vedivareta vam veshivetekha veveytekha uvelekhetekha vaderekhe uveshׇkhevekha uvekumekha

Hebrew: וּקְשַׁרְתָּ֥ם לְא֖וֹת עַל־יָדֶ֑ךָ וְהָי֥וּ לְטֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֥ין עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a symbol on your forehead;
Transliteration: ukesharetam levot al-yadekha vehayu letotafot veyn eyneykha

Hebrew: וּכְתַבְתָּ֛ם עַל־מְזֻז֥וֹת בֵּיתֶ֖ךָ וּבִשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates.
Transliteration: ukhetavetam al-mezuzvot veytekha uvisheareykha {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כִּ֥י יְבִיאֲךָ֣ ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֜רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם לְיִצְחָ֥ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לָ֣תֶת לָ֑ךְ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וְטֹבֹ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־בָנִֽיתָ׃
Translated: When your God יהוה brings you into the land that was sworn to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to be assigned to you—great and flourishing cities that you did not build,
Transliteration: vehayah khiy yeviyakha yehovah eloheykha el-haarets asher nisheva laavoteykha leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov latet lakhe ariym gedolot vetovot asher lo-vaniyta

Hebrew: וּבָ֨תִּ֜ים מְלֵאִ֣ים כׇּל־טוּב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־מִלֵּ֒אתָ֒ וּבֹרֹ֤ת חֲצוּבִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־חָצַ֔בְתָּ כְּרָמִ֥ים וְזֵיתִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־נָטָ֑עְתָּ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: houses full of all good things that you did not fill, hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant—and you eat your fill,
Transliteration: uvatiym meleiym khׇl-tuv asher lo-mileta uvorot chatsuviym asher lo-chatsaveta kheramiym vezeytiym asher lo-nataeta veakhaleta veshavaeta

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הוֹצִֽיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: take heed that you do not forget יהוה who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage.
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-tishekhach et-yehovah asher hvotsiyakha meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadiym

Hebrew: אֶת־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ תִּירָ֖א וְאֹת֣וֹ תַעֲבֹ֑ד וּבִשְׁמ֖וֹ תִּשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
Translated: Revere only your God יהוה and worship [God] alone, and swear only by God’s name.
Transliteration: et-yehovah eloheykha tiyra veotvo taavod uvishemvo tishavea

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תֵֽלְכ֔וּן אַחֲרֵ֖י אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים מֵאֱלֹהֵי֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר סְבִיבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not follow other gods, any gods of the peoples about you—
Transliteration: lo telekhun acharey Elohim acheriym meelohey haamiym asher seviyvvoteykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֵ֥ל קַנָּ֛א יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בְּקִרְבֶּ֑ךָ פֶּן־יֶ֠חֱרֶ֠ה אַף־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּ֔ךְ וְהִשְׁמִ֣ידְךָ֔ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: for your God יהוה in your midst is an impassioned God—lest the anger of your God יהוה blaze forth against you, wiping you off the face of the earth.
Transliteration: khiy el kana yehovah eloheykha vekirevekha fen-yechereh af-yehovah eloheykha vakhe vehishemiydekha meal feney haadamah {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תְנַסּ֔וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִסִּיתֶ֖ם בַּמַּסָּֽה׃
Translated: Do not try your God יהוה, as you did at Massah.
Transliteration: lo tenasu et-yehovah eloheykhem khaasher nisiytem vamasah

Hebrew: שָׁמ֣וֹר תִּשְׁמְר֔וּן אֶת־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְעֵדֹתָ֥יו וְחֻקָּ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Be sure to keep the commandments, decrees, and laws that your God יהוה has enjoined upon you.
Transliteration: shamvor tishemerun et-mitsevot yehovah eloheykhem veedotayv vechukayv asher tsivakhe

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֛יתָ הַיָּשָׁ֥ר וְהַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וּבָ֗אתָ וְיָֽרַשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Do what is right and good in the sight of יהוה, that it may go well with you and that you may be able to possess the good land that your God יהוה promised on oath to your fathers,
Transliteration: veashiyta hayashar vehatvov veeyney yehovah lemaan yiytav lakhe uvata veyarasheta et-haarets hatovah asher-nisheva yehovah laavoteykha

Hebrew: לַהֲדֹ֥ף אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and that all your enemies may be driven out before you, as יהוה has spoken.
Transliteration: lahadof et-khׇl-oyeveykha mifaneykha khaasher diver yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָלְךָ֥ בִנְךָ֛ מָחָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר מָ֣ה הָעֵדֹ֗ת וְהַֽחֻקִּים֙ וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: When, in time to come, your children ask you, “What mean the decrees, laws, and rules that our God יהוה has enjoined upon you?”
Transliteration: khiy-yishealekha vinekha machar lemor mah haedot vehachukiym vehamishefatiym asher tsivah yehovah eloheynu etekhem

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לְבִנְךָ֔ עֲבָדִ֛ים הָיִ֥ינוּ לְפַרְעֹ֖ה בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַיֹּצִיאֵ֧נוּ יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: you shall say to your children, “We were slaves to Pharaoh in Egypt and יהוה freed us from Egypt with a mighty hand.
Transliteration: veamareta levinekha avadiym hayiynu lefareoh vemitserayiim vayotsiyenu yehovah mimitserayiim veyad chazakah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֡ה אוֹתֹ֣ת וּ֠מֹפְתִ֠ים גְּדֹלִ֨ים וְרָעִ֧ים <small>׀</small> בְּמִצְרַ֛יִם בְּפַרְעֹ֥ה וּבְכׇל־בֵּית֖וֹ לְעֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: יהוה wrought before our eyes marvelous and destructive signs and portents in Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his household;
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah votot umofetiym gedoliym veraiym <small></small> vemitserayiim vefareoh uvekhׇl-veytvo leeyneynu

Hebrew: וְאוֹתָ֖נוּ הוֹצִ֣יא מִשָּׁ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ הָבִ֣יא אֹתָ֔נוּ לָ֤תֶת לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: and us [God] freed from there, in order to take us and give us the land promised on oath to our fathers.
Transliteration: vevotanu hvotsiy misham lemaan haviy otanu latet lanu et-haarets asher nisheva laavoteynu

Hebrew: וַיְצַוֵּ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֗ה לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַחֻקִּ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה לְיִרְאָ֖ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ לְט֥וֹב לָ֙נוּ֙ כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֔ים לְחַיֹּתֵ֖נוּ כְּהַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Then יהוה commanded us to observe all these laws, to revere our God יהוה, for our lasting good and for our survival, as is now the case.
Transliteration: vayetsavenu yehovah laashvot et-khׇl-hachukiym haeleh leyireah et-yehovah eloheynu letvov lanu khׇl-hayamiym lechayotenu khehayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּצְדָקָ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑נוּ כִּֽי־נִשְׁמֹ֨ר לַעֲשׂ֜וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֗את לִפְנֵ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: It will be therefore to our merit before our God יהוה to observe faithfully this whole Instruction, as [God] has commanded us.”
Transliteration: utsedakah tiheyeh-lanu khiy-nishemor laashvot et-khׇl-hamitsevah hazot lifeney yehovah eloheynu khaasher tsivanu {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יְבִֽיאֲךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְנָשַׁ֣ל גּֽוֹיִם־רַבִּ֣ים <small>׀</small> מִפָּנֶ֡יךָ הַֽחִתִּי֩ וְהַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֨י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֜י וְהַכְּנַעֲנִ֣י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֗י וְהַֽחִוִּי֙ וְהַיְבוּסִ֔י שִׁבְעָ֣ה גוֹיִ֔ם רַבִּ֥ים וַעֲצוּמִ֖ים מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated: When your God יהוה brings you to the land that you are about to enter and possess, and [God] dislodges many nations before you—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations much larger than you—
Transliteration: khiy yeviyakha yehovah eloheykha el-haarets asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah venashal gvoyim-raviym <small></small> mifaneykha hachitiy vehagiregashiy vehaemoriy vehakhenaaniy vehaferiziy vehachiviy vehayevusiy shiveah gvoyim raviym vaatsumiym mimekha

Hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֞ם יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ לְפָנֶ֖יךָ וְהִכִּיתָ֑ם הַחֲרֵ֤ם תַּחֲרִים֙ אֹתָ֔ם לֹא־תִכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם בְּרִ֖ית וְלֹ֥א תְחׇנֵּֽם׃
Translated: and your God יהוה delivers them to you and you defeat them, you must doom them to destruction: grant them no terms and give them no quarter.
Transliteration: unetanam yehovah eloheykha lefaneykha vehikhiytam hacharem tachariym otam lo-tikherot lahem veriyt velo techׇnem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תִתְחַתֵּ֖ן בָּ֑ם בִּתְּךָ֙ לֹא־תִתֵּ֣ן לִבְנ֔וֹ וּבִתּ֖וֹ לֹא־תִקַּ֥ח לִבְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You shall not intermarry with them: do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.
Transliteration: velo titechaten vam vitekha lo-titen livenvo uvitvo lo-tikach livenekha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָסִ֤יר אֶת־בִּנְךָ֙ מֵֽאַחֲרַ֔י וְעָבְד֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וְחָרָ֤ה אַף־יְהֹוָה֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וְהִשְׁמִידְךָ֖ מַהֵֽר׃
Translated: For they will turn your children away from Me to worship other gods, and יהוה’s anger will blaze forth against you, promptly wiping you out.
Transliteration: khiy-yasiyr et-vinekha meacharay veavedu Elohim acheriym vecharah af-yehovah vakhem vehishemiydekha maher

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אִם־כֹּ֤ה תַעֲשׂוּ֙ לָהֶ֔ם מִזְבְּחֹתֵיהֶ֣ם תִּתֹּ֔צוּ וּמַצֵּבֹתָ֖ם תְּשַׁבֵּ֑רוּ וַאֲשֵֽׁירֵהֶם֙ תְּגַדֵּע֔וּן וּפְסִילֵיהֶ֖ם תִּשְׂרְפ֥וּן בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Instead, this is what you shall do to them: you shall tear down their altars, smash their pillars, cut down their sacred posts, and consign their images to the fire.
Transliteration: khiy-im-khoh taashu lahem mizevechoteyhem titotsu umatsevotam teshaveru vaasheyrehem tegadeun ufesiyleyhem tisherefun vaesh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּךָ֞ בָּחַ֣ר ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ לִהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: For you are a people consecrated to your God יהוה: of all the peoples on earth your God יהוה chose you to be God’s treasured people.
Transliteration: khiy am kadvosh atah layhovah eloheykha vekha vachar yehovah eloheykha liheyvot lvo leam segulah mikhol haamiym asher al-feney haadamah

Hebrew: לֹ֣א מֵֽרֻבְּכֶ֞ם מִכׇּל־הָֽעַמִּ֗ים חָשַׁ֧ק יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּכֶ֖ם וַיִּבְחַ֣ר בָּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֥ם הַמְעַ֖ט מִכׇּל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated: It is not because you are the most numerous of peoples that יהוה grew attached to you and chose you—indeed, you are the smallest of peoples;
Transliteration: lo meruvekhem mikhׇl-haamiym chashak yehovah vakhem vayivechar vakhem khiy-atem hameat mikhׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: כִּי֩ מֵאַהֲבַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶתְכֶ֗ם וּמִשׇּׁמְר֤וֹ אֶת־הַשְּׁבֻעָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּע֙ לַאֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם הוֹצִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם בְּיָ֣ד חֲזָקָ֑ה וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים מִיַּ֖ד פַּרְעֹ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: but it was because יהוה favored you and kept the oath made to your fathers that יהוה freed you with a mighty hand and rescued you from the house of bondage, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
Transliteration: khiy meahavat yehovah etekhem umishׇmervo et-hashevuah asher nisheva laavoteykhem hvotsiy yehovah etekhem veyad chazakah vayifedekha miveyt avadiym miyad fareoh melekhe-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְיָ֣דַעְתָּ֔ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ ה֣וּא הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים הָאֵל֙ הַֽנֶּאֱמָ֔ן שֹׁמֵ֧ר הַבְּרִ֣ית וְהַחֶ֗סֶד לְאֹהֲבָ֛יו וּלְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י מִצְוֺתָ֖ו לְאֶ֥לֶף דּֽוֹר׃
Translated: Know, therefore, that only your God יהוה is God, the steadfast God who keeps the divine covenant faithfully to the thousandth generation of those who love [God] and keep the divine commandments,
Transliteration: veyadaeta khiy-yehovah eloheykha hu haElohimm hael haneeman shomer haveriyt vehachesed leohavayv uleshomerey mitsevotav leelef dvor

Hebrew: וּמְשַׁלֵּ֧ם לְשֹׂנְאָ֛יו אֶל־פָּנָ֖יו לְהַאֲבִיד֑וֹ לֹ֤א יְאַחֵר֙ לְשֹׂ֣נְא֔וֹ אֶל־פָּנָ֖יו יְשַׁלֶּם־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: but who instantly requites with destruction those who reject [God]—never slow with those who reject, but requiting them instantly.
Transliteration: umeshalem leshoneayv el-fanayv lehaaviydvo lo yeacher leshonevo el-fanayv yeshalem-lvo

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַמִּצְוָ֜ה וְאֶת־הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם לַעֲשׂוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Therefore, observe faithfully the Instruction—the laws and the rules—with which I charge you today.
Transliteration: veshamareta et-hamitsevah veet-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom laashvotam {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ עֵ֣קֶב תִּשְׁמְע֗וּן אֵ֤ת הַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֥ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְשָׁמַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ לְךָ֗ אֶֽת־הַבְּרִית֙ וְאֶת־הַחֶ֔סֶד אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And if you do obey these rules and observe them carefully, your God יהוה will maintain faithfully for you the covenant made on oath with your fathers:
Transliteration: vehayah ekev tishemeun et hamishefatiym haeleh ushemaretem vaashiytem otam veshamar yehovah eloheykha lekha et-haveriyt veet-hachesed asher nisheva laavoteykha

Hebrew: וַאֲהֵ֣בְךָ֔ וּבֵרַכְךָ֖ וְהִרְבֶּ֑ךָ וּבֵרַ֣ךְ פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֣ וּפְרִֽי־אַ֠דְמָתֶ֠ךָ דְּגָ֨נְךָ֜ וְתִירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֗ךָ שְׁגַר־אֲלָפֶ֙יךָ֙ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת צֹאנֶ֔ךָ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָ֥תֶת לָֽךְ׃
Translated: [God] will favor you and bless you and multiply you—blessing your issue from the womb and your produce from the soil, your new grain and wine and oil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock, in the land sworn to your fathers to be assigned to you.
Transliteration: vaahevekha uverakhekha vehirevekha uverakhe feriy-vitenekha uferiy-adematekha deganekha vetiyroshekha veyitseharekha shegar-alafeykha veasheterot tsonekha al haadamah asher-nisheva laavoteykha latet lakhe

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ תִּֽהְיֶ֖ה מִכׇּל־הָעַמִּ֑ים לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְךָ֛ עָקָ֥ר וַֽעֲקָרָ֖ה וּבִבְהֶמְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: You shall be blessed above all other peoples: there shall be no sterile male or female among you or among your livestock.
Transliteration: varukhe tiheyeh mikhׇl-haamiym lo-yiheyeh vekha akar vaakarah uvivehemetekha

Hebrew: וְהֵסִ֧יר יְהֹוָ֛ה מִמְּךָ֖ כׇּל־חֹ֑לִי וְכׇל־מַדְוֵי֩ מִצְרַ֨יִם הָרָעִ֜ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדַ֗עְתָּ לֹ֤א יְשִׂימָם֙ בָּ֔ךְ וּנְתָנָ֖ם בְּכׇל־שֹׂנְאֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: יהוה will ward off from you all sickness; [God] will not bring upon you any of the dreadful diseases of Egypt, about which you know, but will inflict them upon all your enemies.
Transliteration: vehesiyr yehovah mimekha khׇl-choliy vekhׇl-madevey mitserayiim haraiym asher yadaeta lo yeshiymam vakhe unetanam vekhׇl-shoneeykha

Hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ אֶת־כׇּל־הָֽעַמִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֖ עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְלֹ֤א תַעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־מוֹקֵ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall destroy all the peoples that your God יהוה delivers to you, showing them no pity. And you shall not worship their gods, for that would be a snare to you.
Transliteration: veakhaleta et-khׇl-haamiym asher yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe lo-tachvos eynekha aleyhem velo taavod et-eloheyhem khiy-mvokesh hu lakhe {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תֹאמַר֙ בִּלְבָ֣בְךָ֔ רַבִּ֛ים הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֵיכָ֥ה אוּכַ֖ל לְהוֹרִישָֽׁם׃
Translated: Should you say to yourselves, “These nations are more numerous than we; how can we dispossess them?”
Transliteration: khiy tomar vilevavekha raviym hagvoyim haeleh mimeniy eykhah ukhal lehvoriysham

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א מֵהֶ֑ם זָכֹ֣ר תִּזְכֹּ֗ר אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְפַרְעֹ֖ה וּלְכׇל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You need have no fear of them. You have but to bear in mind what your God יהוה did to Pharaoh and all the Egyptians:
Transliteration: lo tiyra mehem zakhor tizekhor et asher-ashah yehovah eloheykha lefareoh ulekhׇl-mitserayiim

Hebrew: הַמַּסֹּ֨ת הַגְּדֹלֹ֜ת אֲשֶׁר־רָא֣וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וְהָאֹתֹ֤ת וְהַמֹּֽפְתִים֙ וְהַיָּ֤ד הַחֲזָקָה֙ וְהַזְּרֹ֣עַ הַנְּטוּיָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹצִֽאֲךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כֵּֽן־יַעֲשֶׂ֞ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְכׇל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה יָרֵ֖א מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: the wondrous acts that you saw with your own eyes, the signs and the portents, the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm by which your God יהוה liberated you. Thus will your God יהוה do to all the peoples you now fear.
Transliteration: hamasot hagedolot asher-rau eyneykha vehaotot vehamofetiym vehayad hachazakah vehazeroa hanetuyah asher hvotsiakha yehovah eloheykha khen-yaasheh yehovah eloheykha lekhׇl-haamiym asher-atah yare mifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְגַם֙ אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֔ה יְשַׁלַּ֛ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בָּ֑ם עַד־אֲבֹ֗ד הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֛ים וְהַנִּסְתָּרִ֖ים מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Your God יהוה will also send a plague against them, until those who are left in hiding perish before you.
Transliteration: vegam et-hatsireah yeshalach yehovah eloheykha vam ad-avod hanisheariym vehanisetariym mifaneykha

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תַעֲרֹ֖ץ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּקִרְבֶּ֔ךָ אֵ֥ל גָּד֖וֹל וְנוֹרָֽא׃
Translated: Do not stand in dread of them, for your God יהוה is in your midst, a great and awesome God.
Transliteration: lo taarots mifeneyhem khiy-yehovah eloheykha vekirevekha el gadvol venvora

Hebrew: וְנָשַׁל֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֛ל מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ מְעַ֣ט מְעָ֑ט לֹ֤א תוּכַל֙ כַּלֹּתָ֣ם מַהֵ֔ר פֶּן־תִּרְבֶּ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Your God יהוה will dislodge those peoples before you little by little; you will not be able to put an end to them at once, else the wild beasts would multiply to your hurt.
Transliteration: venashal yehovah eloheykha et-hagvoyim hael mifaneykha meat meat lo tukhal khalotam maher fen-tireveh aleykha chayat hashadeh

Hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֛ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְהָמָם֙ מְהוּמָ֣ה גְדֹלָ֔ה עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽם׃
Translated: Your God יהוה will deliver them up to you, throwing them into utter panic until they are wiped out.
Transliteration: unetanam yehovah eloheykha lefaneykha vehamam mehumah gedolah ad hishamedam

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֤ן מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ בְּיָדֶ֔ךָ וְהַאֲבַדְתָּ֣ אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לֹֽא־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב אִישׁ֙ בְּפָנֶ֔יךָ עַ֥ד הִשְׁמִֽדְךָ֖ אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: [God] will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall obliterate their name from under the heavens; no one shall stand up to you, until you have wiped them out.
Transliteration: venatan malekheyhem veyadekha vehaavadeta et-shemam mitachat hashamayiim lo-yiteyatsev iysh vefaneykha ad hishemidekha otam

Hebrew: פְּסִילֵ֥י אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֖ם תִּשְׂרְפ֣וּן בָּאֵ֑שׁ לֹֽא־תַחְמֹד֩ כֶּ֨סֶף וְזָהָ֤ב עֲלֵיהֶם֙ וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ לָ֔ךְ פֶּ֚ן תִּוָּקֵ֣שׁ בּ֔וֹ כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃
Translated: You shall consign the images of their gods to the fire; you shall not covet the silver and gold on them and keep it for yourselves, lest you be ensnared thereby; for that is abhorrent to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: fesiyley eloheyhem tisherefun vaesh lo-tachemod khesef vezahav aleyhem velakacheta lakhe fen tivakesh vvo khiy tvoavat yehovah eloheykha hu

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תָבִ֤יא תֽוֹעֵבָה֙ אֶל־בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ חֵ֖רֶם כָּמֹ֑הוּ שַׁקֵּ֧ץ ׀ תְּשַׁקְּצֶ֛נּוּ וְתַעֵ֥ב ׀ תְּֽתַעֲבֶ֖נּוּ כִּי־חֵ֥רֶם הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: You must not bring an abhorrent thing into your house, or you will be proscribed like it; you must reject it as abominable and abhorrent, for it is proscribed.
Transliteration: velo-taviy tvoevah el-veytekha vehayiyta cherem khamohu shakets teshaketsenu vetaev tetaavenu khiy-cherem hu {f}

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם תִּשְׁמְר֣וּן לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לְמַ֨עַן תִּֽחְי֜וּן וּרְבִיתֶ֗ם וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall faithfully observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, that you may thrive and increase and be able to possess the land that יהוה promised on oath to your fathers.
Transliteration: khׇl-hamitsevah asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom tishemerun laashvot lemaan ticheyun ureviytem uvatem viyrishetem et-haarets asher-nisheva yehovah laavoteykhem

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֣ אֶת־כׇּל־הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹלִֽיכְךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ זֶ֛ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְמַ֨עַן עַנֹּֽתְךָ֜ לְנַסֹּֽתְךָ֗ לָדַ֜עַת אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֧ר בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֛ הֲתִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתָ֖ו אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: Remember the long way that your God יהוה has made you travel in the wilderness these past forty years, in order to test you by hardships to learn what was in your hearts: whether you would keep the divine commandments or not.
Transliteration: vezakhareta et-khׇl-haderekhe asher hvoliykhekha yehovah eloheykha zeh arevaiym shanah vamidevar lemaan anotekha lenasotekha ladaat et-asher vilevavekha hatishemor mitsevotav im-lo

Hebrew: וַֽיְעַנְּךָ֮ וַיַּרְעִבֶ֒ךָ֒ וַיַּאֲכִֽלְךָ֤ אֶת־הַמָּן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדַ֔עְתָּ וְלֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּן אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן הוֹדִֽיעֲךָ֗ כִּ֠י לֹ֣א עַל־הַלֶּ֤חֶם לְבַדּוֹ֙ יִחְיֶ֣ה הָֽאָדָ֔ם כִּ֛י עַל־כׇּל־מוֹצָ֥א פִֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה יִחְיֶ֥ה הָאָדָֽם׃
Translated: [God] subjected you to the hardship of hunger and then gave you manna to eat, which neither you nor your ancestors had ever known, in order to teach you that a human being does not live on bread alone, but that one may live on anything that יהוה decrees.
Transliteration: vayeanekha vayareivekha vayaakhilekha et-haman asher lo-yadaeta velo yadeun avoteykha lemaan hvodiyakha khiy lo al-halechem levadvo yicheyeh haadam khiy al-khׇl-mvotsa fiy-yehovah yicheyeh haadam

Hebrew: שִׂמְלָ֨תְךָ֜ לֹ֤א בָֽלְתָה֙ מֵֽעָלֶ֔יךָ וְרַגְלְךָ֖ לֹ֣א בָצֵ֑קָה זֶ֖ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: The clothes upon you did not wear out, nor did your feet swell these forty years.
Transliteration: shimelatekha lo valetah mealeykha veragelekha lo vatsekah zeh arevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֖ עִם־לְבָבֶ֑ךָ כִּ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יְיַסֵּ֥ר אִישׁ֙ אֶת־בְּנ֔וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מְיַסְּרֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: Bear in mind that your God יהוה disciplines you just as a householder disciplines his son.
Transliteration: veyadaeta im-levavekha khiy khaasher yeyaser iysh et-venvo yehovah eloheykha meyaserekha

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣מַרְתָּ֔ אֶת־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לָלֶ֥כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֖יו וּלְיִרְאָ֥ה אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Therefore keep the commandments of your God יהוה: walk in God’s ways and show reverence.
Transliteration: veshamareta et-mitsevot yehovah eloheykha lalekhet viderakhayv uleyireah otvo

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מְבִֽיאֲךָ֖ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ טוֹבָ֑ה אֶ֚רֶץ נַ֣חֲלֵי מָ֔יִם עֲיָנֹת֙ וּתְהֹמֹ֔ת יֹצְאִ֥ים בַּבִּקְעָ֖ה וּבָהָֽר׃
Translated: For your God יהוה is bringing you into a good land, a land with streams and springs and fountains issuing from plain and hill;
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykha meviyakha el-erets tvovah erets nachaley mayiim ayanot utehomot yotseiym vavikeah uvahar

Hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ חִטָּה֙ וּשְׂעֹרָ֔ה וְגֶ֥פֶן וּתְאֵנָ֖ה וְרִמּ֑וֹן אֶֽרֶץ־זֵ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶן וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: a land of wheat and barley, of vines, figs, and pomegranates, a land of olive trees and honey;
Transliteration: erets chitah usheorah vegefen uteenah verimvon erets-zeyt shemen udevash

Hebrew: אֶ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹ֤א בְמִסְכֵּנֻת֙ תֹּֽאכַל־בָּ֣הּ לֶ֔חֶם לֹֽא־תֶחְסַ֥ר כֹּ֖ל בָּ֑הּ אֶ֚רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲבָנֶ֣יהָ בַרְזֶ֔ל וּמֵהֲרָרֶ֖יהָ תַּחְצֹ֥ב נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: a land where you may eat food without stint, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.
Transliteration: erets asher lo vemisekhenut tokhal-vah lechem lo-techesar khol vah erets asher avaneyha varezel umeharareyha tachetsov nechoshet

Hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָ֑עְתָּ וּבֵֽרַכְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: When you have eaten your fill, give thanks to your God יהוה for the good land given to you.
Transliteration: veakhaleta veshavaeta uverakheta et-yehovah eloheykha al-haarets hatovah asher natan-lakhe

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּן־תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לְבִלְתִּ֨י שְׁמֹ֤ר מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֣יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Take care lest you forget your God יהוה and fail to keep the divine commandments, rules, and laws which I enjoin upon you today.
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-tishekhach et-yehovah eloheykha leviletiy shemor mitsevotayv umishefatayv vechukotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom

Hebrew: פֶּן־תֹּאכַ֖ל וְשָׂבָ֑עְתָּ וּבָתִּ֥ים טֹבִ֛ים תִּבְנֶ֖ה וְיָשָֽׁבְתָּ׃
Translated: When you have eaten your fill, and have built fine houses to live in,
Transliteration: fen-tokhal veshavaeta uvatiym toviym tiveneh veyashaveta

Hebrew: וּבְקָֽרְךָ֤ וְצֹֽאנְךָ֙ יִרְבְּיֻ֔ן וְכֶ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב יִרְבֶּה־לָּ֑ךְ וְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֖ יִרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: and your herds and flocks have multiplied, and your silver and gold have increased, and everything you own has prospered,
Transliteration: uvekarekha vetsonekha yireveyun vekhesef vezahav yireveh-lakhe vekhol asher-lekha yireveh

Hebrew: וְרָ֖ם לְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְשָֽׁכַחְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַמּוֹצִיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: beware lest your heart grow haughty and you forget your God יהוה —who freed you from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage;
Transliteration: veram levavekha veshakhacheta et-yehovah eloheykha hamvotsiyakha meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadiym

Hebrew: הַמּוֹלִ֨יכְךָ֜ בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּדֹ֣ל וְהַנּוֹרָ֗א נָחָ֤שׁ ׀ שָׂרָף֙ וְעַקְרָ֔ב וְצִמָּא֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֵֽין־מָ֑יִם הַמּוֹצִ֤יא לְךָ֙ מַ֔יִם מִצּ֖וּר הַֽחַלָּמִֽישׁ׃
Translated: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness with its seraph serpents and scorpions, a parched land with no water in it, who brought forth water for you from the flinty rock;
Transliteration: hamvoliykhekha vamidevar hagadol vehanvora nachash sharaf veakerav vetsimavon asher eyn-mayiim hamvotsiy lekha mayiim mitsur hachalamiysh

Hebrew: הַמַּאֲכִ֨לְךָ֥ מָן֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדְע֖וּן אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֣עַן עַנֹּֽתְךָ֗ וּלְמַ֙עַן֙ נַסֹּתֶ֔ךָ לְהֵיטִֽבְךָ֖ בְּאַחֲרִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your ancestors had never known, in order to test you by hardships only to benefit you in the end—
Transliteration: hamaakhilekha man vamidevar asher lo-yadeun avoteykha lemaan anotekha ulemaan nasotekha leheytivekha veachariytekha

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ כֹּחִי֙ וְעֹ֣צֶם יָדִ֔י עָ֥שָׂה לִ֖י אֶת־הַחַ֥יִל הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and you say to yourselves, “My own power and the might of my own hand have won this wealth for me.”
Transliteration: veamareta vilevavekha khochiy veotsem yadiy ashah liy et-hachayiil hazeh

Hebrew: וְזָֽכַרְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כִּ֣י ה֗וּא הַנֹּתֵ֥ן לְךָ֛ כֹּ֖חַ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת חָ֑יִל לְמַ֨עַן הָקִ֧ים אֶת־בְּרִית֛וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Remember that it is your God יהוה who gives you the power to get wealth, in fulfillment of the covenant made on oath with your fathers, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vezakhareta et-yehovah eloheykha khiy hu hanoten lekha khocha laashvot chayiil lemaan hakiym et-veriytvo asher-nisheva laavoteykha khayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁכֹ֤חַ תִּשְׁכַּח֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֗ אַחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַעֲבַדְתָּ֖ם וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִ֣יתָ לָהֶ֑ם הַעִדֹ֤תִי בָכֶם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּ֥י אָבֹ֖ד תֹּאבֵדֽוּן׃
Translated: If you do forget your God יהוה and follow other gods to serve them or bow down to them, I warn you this day that you shall certainly perish;
Transliteration: vehayah im-shakhocha tishekhach et-yehovah eloheykha vehalakheta acharey Elohim acheriym vaavadetam vehishetachaviyta lahem haidotiy vakhem hayyvom khiy avod tovedun

Hebrew: כַּגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ מַאֲבִ֣יד מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם כֵּ֖ן תֹּאבֵד֑וּן עֵ֚קֶב לֹ֣א תִשְׁמְע֔וּן בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: like the nations that יהוה will cause to perish before you, so shall you perish—because you did not heed your God יהוה.
Transliteration: khagvoyim asher yehovah maaviyd mifeneykhem khen tovedun ekev lo tishemeun vekvol yehovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אַתָּ֨ה עֹבֵ֤ר הַיּוֹם֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָבֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת גּוֹיִ֔ם גְּדֹלִ֥ים וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים מִמֶּ֑ךָּ עָרִ֛ים גְּדֹלֹ֥ת וּבְצֻרֹ֖ת בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross the Jordan to go in and dispossess nations greater and more populous than you: great cities with walls sky-high;
Transliteration: shema yisherael atah over hayyvom et-hayareden lavo lareshet gvoyim gedoliym vaatsumiym mimekha ariym gedolot uvetsurot vashamayiim

Hebrew: עַֽם־גָּד֥וֹל וָרָ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י עֲנָקִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ וְאַתָּ֣ה שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ מִ֣י יִתְיַצֵּ֔ב לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָֽק׃
Translated: a people great and tall, the Anakites, of whom you have knowledge; for you have heard it said, “Who can stand up to the children of Anak?”
Transliteration: am-gadvol varam veney anakiym asher atah yadaeta veatah shamaeta miy yiteyatsev lifeney veney anak

Hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם כִּי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ הֽוּא־הָעֹבֵ֤ר לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵ֣שׁ אֹֽכְלָ֔ה ה֧וּא יַשְׁמִידֵ֛ם וְה֥וּא יַכְנִיעֵ֖ם לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וְהֽוֹרַשְׁתָּ֤ם וְהַֽאֲבַדְתָּם֙ מַהֵ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Know then this day that none other than your God יהוה is crossing at your head, a devouring fire; it is [God] who will wipe them out—subduing them before you, that you may quickly dispossess and destroy them, as יהוה promised you.
Transliteration: veyadaeta hayyvom khiy yehovah eloheykha hu-haover lefaneykha esh okhelah hu yashemiydem vehu yakheniyem lefaneykha vehvorashetam vehaavadetam maher khaasher diver yehovah lakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַ֣ר בִּלְבָבְךָ֗ בַּהֲדֹ֣ף יְהֹוָה֩ אֱלֹהֶ֨יךָ אֹתָ֥ם <small>׀</small> מִלְּפָנֶ֘יךָ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בְּצִדְקָתִי֙ הֱבִיאַ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֔ה לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את וּבְרִשְׁעַת֙ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֔לֶּה יְהֹוָ֖ה מוֹרִישָׁ֥ם מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And when your God יהוה has thrust them from your path, say not to yourselves, “יהוה has enabled us to possess this land because of our virtues”; it is rather because of the wickedness of those nations that יהוה is dispossessing them before you.
Transliteration: al-tomar vilevavekha vahadof yehovah eloheykha otam <small></small> milefaneykha lemor vetsidekatiy heviyaniy yehovah lareshet et-haarets hazot uverisheat hagvoyim haeleh yehovah mvoriysham mifaneykha

Hebrew: לֹ֣א בְצִדְקָתְךָ֗ וּבְיֹ֙שֶׁר֙ לְבָ֣בְךָ֔ אַתָּ֥ה בָ֖א לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־אַרְצָ֑ם כִּ֞י בְּרִשְׁעַ֣ת ׀ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ מוֹרִישָׁ֣ם מִפָּנֶ֔יךָ וּלְמַ֜עַן הָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ לַאֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: It is not because of your virtues and your rectitude that you will be able to possess their country; but it is because of their wickedness that your God יהוה is dispossessing those nations before you, and in order to fulfill the oath that יהוה made to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Transliteration: lo vetsidekatekha uveyosher levavekha atah va lareshet et-aretsam khiy verisheat hagvoyim haeleh yehovah eloheykha mvoriysham mifaneykha ulemaan hakiym et-hadavar asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykha leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov

Hebrew: וְיָדַעְתָּ֗ כִּ֠י לֹ֤א בְצִדְקָֽתְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֠לֹהֶ֠יךָ נֹתֵ֨ן לְךָ֜ אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֛ה הַזֹּ֖את לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: Know, then, that it is not for any virtue of yours that your God יהוה is giving you this good land to possess; for you are a stiffnecked people.
Transliteration: veyadaeta khiy lo vetsidekatekha yehovah eloheykha noten lekha et-haarets hatvovah hazot lerishetah khiy am-kesheh-oref atah

Hebrew: זְכֹר֙ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֔ח אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־הִקְצַ֛פְתָּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לְמִן־הַיּ֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֣אתָ ׀ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם עַד־בֹּֽאֲכֶם֙ עַד־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה מַמְרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם עִם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Remember, never forget, how you provoked your God יהוה to anger in the wilderness: from the day that you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have continued defiant toward יהוה.
Transliteration: zekhor al-tishekhach et asher-hiketsafeta et-yehovah eloheykha vamidevar lemin-hayyvom asher-yatsata meerets mitserayiim ad-voakhem ad-hamakvom hazeh mameriym heyiytem im-yehovah

Hebrew: וּבְחֹרֵ֥ב הִקְצַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּתְאַנַּ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּכֶ֖ם לְהַשְׁמִ֥יד אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: At Horeb you so provoked יהוה that יהוה was angry enough with you to have destroyed you.
Transliteration: uvechorev hiketsafetem et-yehovah vayiteanaf yehovah vakhem lehashemiyd etekhem

Hebrew: בַּעֲלֹתִ֣י הָהָ֗רָה לָקַ֜חַת לוּחֹ֤ת הָֽאֲבָנִים֙ לוּחֹ֣ת הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּכֶ֑ם וָאֵשֵׁ֣ב בָּהָ֗ר אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֥א שָׁתִֽיתִי׃
Translated: I had ascended the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant that יהוה had made with you, and I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, eating no bread and drinking no water.
Transliteration: vaalotiy haharah lakachat luchot haavaniym luchot haveriyt asher-kharat yehovah imakhem vaeshev vahar arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah lechem lo akhaletiy umayiim lo shatiytiy

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֶת־שְׁנֵי֙ לוּחֹ֣ת הָֽאֲבָנִ֔ים כְּתֻבִ֖ים בְּאֶצְבַּ֣ע אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַעֲלֵיהֶ֗ם כְּֽכׇל־הַדְּבָרִ֡ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה עִמָּכֶ֥ם בָּהָ֛ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵ֖שׁ בְּי֥וֹם הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: And יהוה gave me the two tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God, with the exact words that יהוה had addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah elay et-sheney luchot haavaniym khetuviym veetseva Elohim vaaleyhem khekhׇl-hadevariym asher diver yehovah imakhem vahar mitvokhe haesh veyvom hakahal

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקֵּץ֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י אֶת־שְׁנֵ֛י לֻחֹ֥ת הָאֲבָנִ֖ים לֻח֥וֹת הַבְּרִֽית׃
Translated: At the end of those forty days and forty nights, יהוה gave me the two tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah natan yehovah elay et-sheney luchot haavaniym luchvot haveriyt

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י ק֣וּם רֵ֤ד מַהֵר֙ מִזֶּ֔ה כִּ֚י שִׁחֵ֣ת עַמְּךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹצֵ֖אתָ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם סָ֣רוּ מַהֵ֗ר מִן־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתִ֔ם עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם מַסֵּכָֽה׃
Translated: And יהוה said to me, “Hurry, go down from here at once, for the people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted wickedly; they have been quick to stray from the path that I enjoined upon them; they have made themselves a molten image.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay kum red maher mizeh khiy shichet amekha asher hvotseta mimitserayiim saru maher min-haderekhe asher tsiviytim ashu lahem masekhah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלַ֣י לֵאמֹ֑ר רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה עַם־קְשֵׁה־עֹ֖רֶף הֽוּא׃
Translated: יהוה further said to me, “I see that this is a stiffnecked people.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay lemor raiytiy et-haam hazeh vehineh am-kesheh-oref hu

Hebrew: הֶ֤רֶף מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ וְאַשְׁמִידֵ֔ם וְאֶמְחֶ֣ה אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֽוֹתְךָ֔ לְגוֹי־עָצ֥וּם וָרָ֖ב מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Let Me alone and I will destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven, and I will make you a nation far more numerous than they.”
Transliteration: heref mimeniy veashemiydem veemecheh et-shemam mitachat hashamayiim veeesheh votekha legvoy-atsum varav mimenu

Hebrew: וָאֵ֗פֶן וָֽאֵרֵד֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וְהָהָ֖ר בֹּעֵ֣ר בָּאֵ֑שׁ וּשְׁנֵי֙ לוּחֹ֣ת הַבְּרִ֔ית עַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֥י יָדָֽי׃
Translated: I started down the mountain, a mountain ablaze with fire, the two Tablets of the Covenant in my two hands.
Transliteration: vaefen vaered min-hahar vehahar voer vaesh usheney luchot haveriyt al shetey yaday

Hebrew: וָאֵ֗רֶא וְהִנֵּ֤ה חֲטָאתֶם֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם עֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם לָכֶ֔ם עֵ֖גֶל מַסֵּכָ֑ה סַרְתֶּ֣ם מַהֵ֔ר מִן־הַדֶּ֕רֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I saw how you had sinned against your God יהוה: you had made yourselves a molten calf; you had been quick to stray from the path that יהוה had enjoined upon you.
Transliteration: vaere vehineh chatatem layhovah eloheykhem ashiytem lakhem egel masekhah saretem maher min-haderekhe asher-tsivah yehovah etekhem

Hebrew: וָאֶתְפֹּשׂ֙ בִּשְׁנֵ֣י הַלֻּחֹ֔ת וָֽאַשְׁלִכֵ֔ם מֵעַ֖ל שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדָ֑י וָאֲשַׁבְּרֵ֖ם לְעֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Thereupon I gripped the two tablets and flung them away with both my hands, smashing them before your eyes.
Transliteration: vaetefosh visheney haluchot vaashelikhem meal shetey yaday vaashaverem leeyneykhem

Hebrew: וָֽאֶתְנַפַּל֩ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה כָּרִאשֹׁנָ֗ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְאַרְבָּעִ֣ים לַ֔יְלָה לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אָכַ֔לְתִּי וּמַ֖יִם לֹ֣א שָׁתִ֑יתִי עַ֤ל כׇּל־חַטַּאתְכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חֲטָאתֶ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַכְעִיסֽוֹ׃
Translated: I threw myself down before יהוה —eating no bread and drinking no water forty days and forty nights, as before—because of the great wrong you had committed, doing what displeased and vexed יהוה.
Transliteration: vaetenafal lifeney yehovah kharishonah arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah lechem lo akhaletiy umayiim lo shatiytiy al khׇl-chatatekhem asher chatatem laashvot hara veeyney yehovah lehakheiysvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יָגֹ֗רְתִּי מִפְּנֵ֤י הָאַף֙ וְהַ֣חֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָצַ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם לְהַשְׁמִ֣יד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י גַּ֖ם בַּפַּ֥עַם הַהִֽוא׃
Translated: For I was in dread of the fierce anger against you which moved יהוה to wipe you out. And that time, too, יהוה gave heed to me.—
Transliteration: khiy yagoretiy mifeney haaf vehachemah asher katsaf yehovah aleykhem lehashemiyd etekhem vayishema yehovah elay gam vafaam hahiv

Hebrew: וּֽבְאַהֲרֹ֗ן הִתְאַנַּ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה מְאֹ֖ד לְהַשְׁמִיד֑וֹ וָֽאֶתְפַּלֵּ֛ל גַּם־בְּעַ֥ד אַהֲרֹ֖ן בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽוא׃
Translated: Moreover, יהוה was angry enough with Aaron to have destroyed him; so I also interceded for Aaron at that time.—
Transliteration: uveaharon hiteanaf yehovah meod lehashemiydvo vaetefalel gam-vead aharon vaet hahiv

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־חַטַּאתְכֶ֞ם אֲשֶׁר־עֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם אֶת־הָעֵ֗גֶל לָקַ֘חְתִּי֮ וָאֶשְׂרֹ֣ף אֹת֣וֹ <small>׀</small> בָּאֵשׁ֒ וָאֶכֹּ֨ת אֹת֤וֹ טָחוֹן֙ הֵיטֵ֔ב עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־דַּ֖ק לְעָפָ֑ר וָֽאַשְׁלִךְ֙ אֶת־עֲפָר֔וֹ אֶל־הַנַּ֖חַל הַיֹּרֵ֥ד מִן־הָהָֽר׃
Translated: As for that sinful thing you had made, the calf, I took it and put it to the fire; I broke it to bits and ground it thoroughly until it was fine as dust, and I threw its dust into the brook that comes down from the mountain.
Transliteration: veet-chatatekhem asher-ashiytem et-haegel lakachetiy vaesherof otvo <small></small> vaesh vaekhot otvo tachvon heytev ad asher-dak leafar vaashelikhe et-afarvo el-hanachal hayored min-hahar

Hebrew: וּבְתַבְעֵרָה֙ וּבְמַסָּ֔ה וּבְקִבְרֹ֖ת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה מַקְצִפִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Again you provoked יהוה at Taberah, and at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.
Transliteration: uvetaveerah uvemasah uvekiverot hataavah maketsifiym heyiytem et-yehovah

Hebrew: וּבִשְׁלֹ֨חַ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶתְכֶ֗ם מִקָּדֵ֤שׁ בַּרְנֵ֙עַ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר עֲלוּ֙ וּרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לָכֶ֑ם וַתַּמְר֗וּ אֶת־פִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֤א הֶֽאֱמַנְתֶּם֙ ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א שְׁמַעְתֶּ֖ם בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when יהוה sent you on from Kadesh-barnea, saying, “Go up and take possession of the land that I am giving you,” you flouted the command of your God יהוה —whom you did not put your trust in nor obey.
Transliteration: uvishelocha yehovah etekhem mikadesh varenea lemor alu ureshu et-haarets asher natatiy lakhem vatameru et-fiy yehovah eloheykhem velo heemanetem lvo velo shemaetem vekolvo

Hebrew: מַמְרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם עִם־יְהֹוָ֑ה מִיּ֖וֹם דַּעְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: As long as I have known you, you have been defiant toward יהוה.
Transliteration: mameriym heyiytem im-yehovah miyyvom daetiy etekhem

Hebrew: וָֽאֶתְנַפַּ֞ל לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֣ת אַרְבָּעִ֥ים הַיּ֛וֹם וְאֶת־אַרְבָּעִ֥ים הַלַּ֖יְלָה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִתְנַפָּ֑לְתִּי כִּֽי־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לְהַשְׁמִ֥יד אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: When I lay prostrate before יהוה those forty days and forty nights, because יהוה was determined to destroy you,
Transliteration: vaetenafal lifeney yehovah et arevaiym hayyvom veet-arevaiym halayelah asher hitenafaletiy khiy-amar yehovah lehashemiyd etekhem

Hebrew: וָאֶתְפַּלֵּ֣ל אֶל־יְהֹוָה֮ וָאֹמַר֒ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֤ת עַמְּךָ֙ וְנַחֲלָ֣תְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּדִ֖יתָ בְּגׇדְלֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתָ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם בְּיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: I prayed to יהוה and said, “O Lord יהוה, do not annihilate Your very own people, whom You redeemed in Your majesty and whom You freed from Egypt with a mighty hand.
Transliteration: vaetefalel el-yehovah vaomar adonay yehovih al-tashechet amekha venachalatekha asher fadiyta vegׇdelekha asher-hvotseta mimitserayiim veyad chazakah

Hebrew: זְכֹר֙ לַעֲבָדֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב אַל־תֵּ֗פֶן אֶל־קְשִׁי֙ הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְאֶל־רִשְׁע֖וֹ וְאֶל־חַטָּאתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Give thought to Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and pay no heed to the stubbornness of this people, its wickedness, and its sinfulness.
Transliteration: zekhor laavadeykha leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov al-tefen el-keshiy haam hazeh veel-rishevo veel-chatatvo

Hebrew: פֶּן־יֹאמְר֗וּ הָאָ֘רֶץ֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹצֵאתָ֣נוּ מִשָּׁם֒ מִבְּלִי֙ יְכֹ֣לֶת יְהֹוָ֔ה לַהֲבִיאָ֕ם אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וּמִשִּׂנְאָת֣וֹ אוֹתָ֔ם הוֹצִיאָ֖ם לַהֲמִתָ֥ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Else the country from which You freed us will say, ‘It was because יהוה was powerless to bring them into the land promised to them, and because of having rejected them, that [their god] brought them out to have them die in the wilderness.’
Transliteration: fen-yomeru haarets asher hvotsetanu misham miveliy yekholet yehovah lahaviyam el-haarets asher-diver lahem umishineatvo votam hvotsiyam lahamitam vamidevar

Hebrew: וְהֵ֥ם עַמְּךָ֖ וְנַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר הוֹצֵ֙אתָ֙ בְּכֹחֲךָ֣ הַגָּדֹ֔ל וּבִֽזְרֹעֲךָ֖ הַנְּטוּיָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Yet they are Your very own people, whom You freed with Your great might and Your outstretched arm.”
Transliteration: vehem amekha venachalatekha asher hvotseta vekhochakha hagadol uvizeroakha hanetuyah {f}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֨ת הַהִ֜וא אָמַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֵלַ֗י פְּסׇל־לְךָ֞ שְׁנֵֽי־לוּחֹ֤ת אֲבָנִים֙ כָּרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים וַעֲלֵ֥ה אֵלַ֖י הָהָ֑רָה וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ לְּךָ֖ אֲר֥וֹן עֵֽץ׃
Translated: Thereupon יהוה said to me, “Carve out two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to Me on the mountain; and make an ark of wood.
Transliteration: vaet hahiv amar yehovah elay fesׇl-lekha sheney-luchot avaniym kharishoniym vaaleh elay haharah veashiyta lekha arvon ets

Hebrew: וְאֶכְתֹּב֙ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֛וּ עַל־הַלֻּחֹ֥ת הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר שִׁבַּ֑רְתָּ וְשַׂמְתָּ֖ם בָּאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: I will inscribe on the tablets the commandments that were on the first tablets that you smashed, and you shall deposit them in the ark.”
Transliteration: veekhetov al-haluchot et-hadevariym asher hayu al-haluchot harishoniym asher shivareta veshametam vaarvon

Hebrew: וָאַ֤עַשׂ אֲרוֹן֙ עֲצֵ֣י שִׁטִּ֔ים וָאֶפְסֹ֛ל שְׁנֵי־לֻחֹ֥ת אֲבָנִ֖ים כָּרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וָאַ֣עַל הָהָ֔רָה וּשְׁנֵ֥י הַלֻּחֹ֖ת בְּיָדִֽי׃
Translated: I made an ark of acacia wood and carved out two tablets of stone like the first; I took the two tablets with me and went up the mountain.
Transliteration: vaaash arvon atsey shitiym vaefesol sheney-luchot avaniym kharishoniym vaaal haharah usheney haluchot veyadiy

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב עַֽל־הַלֻּחֹ֜ת כַּמִּכְתָּ֣ב הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן אֵ֚ת עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֲלֵיכֶ֥ם בָּהָ֛ר מִתּ֥וֹךְ הָאֵ֖שׁ בְּי֣וֹם הַקָּהָ֑ל וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: After inscribing on the tablets the same text as on the first—the Ten Commandments that יהוה addressed to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the Assembly— יהוה gave them to me.
Transliteration: vayikhetov al-haluchot khamikhetav harishvon et asheret hadevariym asher diver yehovah aleykhem vahar mitvokhe haesh veyvom hakahal vayitenem yehovah elay

Hebrew: וָאֵ֗פֶן וָֽאֵרֵד֙ מִן־הָהָ֔ר וָֽאָשִׂם֙ אֶת־הַלֻּחֹ֔ת בָּאָר֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑יתִי וַיִּ֣הְיוּ שָׁ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוַּ֖נִי יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then I left and went down from the mountain, and I deposited the tablets in the ark that I had made, where they still are, as יהוה had commanded me.
Transliteration: vaefen vaered min-hahar vaashim et-haluchot vaarvon asher ashiytiy vayiheyu sham khaasher tsivaniy yehovah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נָ֥סְע֛וּ מִבְּאֵרֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־יַעֲקָ֖ן מוֹסֵרָ֑ה שָׁ֣ם מֵ֤ת אַהֲרֹן֙ וַיִּקָּבֵ֣ר שָׁ֔ם וַיְכַהֵ֛ן אֶלְעָזָ֥ר בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: From Beeroth-bene-jaakan the Israelites marched to Moserah. Aaron died there and was buried there; and his son Eleazar became priest in his stead.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael naseu miveerot veney-yaakan mvoserah sham met aharon vayikaver sham vayekhahen eleazar venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: מִשָּׁ֥ם נָסְע֖וּ הַגֻּדְגֹּ֑דָה וּמִן־הַגֻּדְגֹּ֣דָה יׇטְבָ֔תָה אֶ֖רֶץ נַ֥חֲלֵי מָֽיִם׃
Translated: From there they marched to Gudgod, and from Gudgod to Jotbath, a region of running brooks.
Transliteration: misham naseu hagudegodah umin-hagudegodah yׇtevatah erets nachaley mayiim

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗וא הִבְדִּ֤יל יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט הַלֵּוִ֔י לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֑ה לַעֲמֹד֩ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה לְשָֽׁרְתוֹ֙ וּלְבָרֵ֣ךְ בִּשְׁמ֔וֹ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: At that time יהוה set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the Ark of יהוה’s Covenant, to stand in attendance upon יהוה, and to bless in God’s name, as is still the case.
Transliteration: vaet hahiv hivediyl yehovah et-shevet haleviy lashet et-arvon veriyt-yehovah laamod lifeney yehovah lesharetvo ulevarekhe vishemvo ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֞ן לֹֽא־הָיָ֧ה לְלֵוִ֛י חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִם־אֶחָ֑יו יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: That is why Levi has received no hereditary portion along with its kin: יהוה is its portion, as your God יהוה spoke concerning it.
Transliteration: al-khen lo-hayah leleviy chelek venachalah im-echayv yehovah hu nachalatvo khaasher diver yehovah eloheykha lvo

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֞י עָמַ֣דְתִּי בָהָ֗ר כַּיָּמִים֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים אַרְבָּעִ֣ים י֔וֹם וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים לָ֑יְלָה וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י גַּ֚ם בַּפַּ֣עַם הַהִ֔וא לֹא־אָבָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה הַשְׁחִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: I had stayed on the mountain, as I did the first time, forty days and forty nights; and יהוה heeded me once again: יהוה agreed not to destroy you.
Transliteration: veanokhiy amadetiy vahar khayamiym harishoniym arevaiym yvom vearevaiym layelah vayishema yehovah elay gam vafaam hahiv lo-avah yehovah hashechiytekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֵלַ֔י ק֛וּם לֵ֥ךְ לְמַסַּ֖ע לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וְיָבֹ֙אוּ֙ וְיִֽירְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And יהוה said to me, “Up, resume the march at the head of the people, that they may go in and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay kum lekhe lemasa lifeney haam veyavou veyiyreshu et-haarets asher-nishevaetiy laavotam latet lahem {f}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מָ֚ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ שֹׁאֵ֖ל מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ כִּ֣י אִם־לְ֠יִרְאָ֠ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ לָלֶ֤כֶת בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָיו֙ וּלְאַהֲבָ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ וְלַֽעֲבֹד֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: And now, O Israel, what does your God יהוה demand of you? Only this: to revere your God יהוה, to walk only in divine paths, to love and to serve your God יהוה with all your heart and soul,
Transliteration: veatah yisherael mah yehovah eloheykha shoel meimakhe khiy im-leyiireah et-yehovah eloheykha lalekhet vekhׇl-derakhayv uleahavah otvo velaavod et-yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha

Hebrew: לִשְׁמֹ֞ר אֶת־מִצְוֺ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לְט֖וֹב לָֽךְ׃
Translated: keeping יהוה’s commandments and laws, which I enjoin upon you today, for your good.
Transliteration: lishemor et-mitsevot yehovah veet-chukotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom letvov lakhe

Hebrew: הֵ֚ן לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּשְׁמֵ֣י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם הָאָ֖רֶץ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Mark, the heavens to their uttermost reaches belong to your God יהוה, the earth and all that is on it!
Transliteration: hen layhovah eloheykha hashamayiim ushemey hashamayiim haarets vekhׇl-asher-vah

Hebrew: רַ֧ק בַּאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ חָשַׁ֥ק יְהֹוָ֖ה לְאַהֲבָ֣ה אוֹתָ֑ם וַיִּבְחַ֞ר בְּזַרְעָ֣ם אַחֲרֵיהֶ֗ם בָּכֶ֛ם מִכׇּל־הָעַמִּ֖ים כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Yet it was to your ancestors that יהוה was drawn out of love for them, so that you, their lineal descendants, were chosen from among all peoples—as is now the case.
Transliteration: rak vaavoteykha chashak yehovah leahavah votam vayivechar vezaream achareyhem vakhem mikhׇl-haamiym khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּמַלְתֶּ֕ם אֵ֖ת עׇרְלַ֣ת לְבַבְכֶ֑ם וְעׇ֨רְפְּכֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תַקְשׁ֖וּ עֽוֹד׃
Translated: Cut away, therefore, the thickening about your hearts and stiffen your necks no more.
Transliteration: umaletem et ׇrelat levavekhem veׇrefekhem lo takeshu vod

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֚וּא אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַאֲדֹנֵ֖י הָאֲדֹנִ֑ים הָאֵ֨ל הַגָּדֹ֤ל הַגִּבֹּר֙ וְהַנּוֹרָ֔א אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹא־יִשָּׂ֣א פָנִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יִקַּ֖ח שֹֽׁחַד׃
Translated: For your God יהוה is God supreme and Lord supreme, the great, the mighty, and the awesome God, who shows no favor and takes no bribe,
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykhem hu elohey haElohimm vaadoney haadoniym hael hagadol hagivor vehanvora asher lo-yisha faniym velo yikach shochad

Hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט יָת֖וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֑ה וְאֹהֵ֣ב גֵּ֔ר לָ֥תֶת ל֖וֹ לֶ֥חֶם וְשִׂמְלָֽה׃
Translated: but upholds the cause of the fatherless and the widow, and befriends the stranger, providing food and clothing.—
Transliteration: osheh mishefat yatvom vealemanah veohev ger latet lvo lechem veshimelah

Hebrew: וַאֲהַבְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הַגֵּ֑ר כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You too must befriend the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: vaahavetem et-hager khiy-geriym heyiytem veerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: אֶת־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ תִּירָ֖א אֹת֣וֹ תַעֲבֹ֑ד וּב֣וֹ תִדְבָּ֔ק וּבִשְׁמ֖וֹ תִּשָּׁבֵֽעַ׃
Translated: You must revere יהוה: only your God shall you worship, to [God] shall you hold fast, and by God’s name shall you swear.
Transliteration: et-yehovah eloheykha tiyra otvo taavod uvvo tidevak uvishemvo tishavea

Hebrew: ה֥וּא תְהִלָּתְךָ֖ וְה֣וּא אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֣ה אִתְּךָ֗ אֶת־הַגְּדֹלֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַנּֽוֹרָאֹת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָא֖וּ עֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: [ יהוה ] is your glory and your God, who wrought for you those marvelous, awesome deeds that you saw with your own eyes.
Transliteration: hu tehilatekha vehu eloheykha asher-ashah itekha et-hagedolot veet-hanvoraot haeleh asher rau eyneykha

Hebrew: בְּשִׁבְעִ֣ים נֶ֔פֶשׁ יָרְד֥וּ אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ מִצְרָ֑יְמָה וְעַתָּ֗ה שָֽׂמְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: Your ancestors went down to Egypt seventy persons; and now your God יהוה has made you as numerous as the stars of heaven.
Transliteration: veshiveiym nefesh yaredu avoteykha mitserayemah veatah shamekha yehovah eloheykha khekhvokhevey hashamayiim larov

Hebrew: וְאָ֣הַבְתָּ֔ אֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ מִשְׁמַרְתּ֗וֹ וְחֻקֹּתָ֧יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֛יו וּמִצְוֺתָ֖יו כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: Love, therefore, your God יהוה, and always keep God’s charge, God’s laws, God’s rules, and God’s commandments.
Transliteration: veahaveta et yehovah eloheykha veshamareta mishemaretvo vechukotayv umishefatayv umitsevotayv khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וִֽידַעְתֶּם֮ הַיּוֹם֒ כִּ֣י ׀ לֹ֣א אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יָדְעוּ֙ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־רָא֔וּ אֶת־מוּסַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם אֶת־גׇּדְל֕וֹ אֶת־יָדוֹ֙ הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּזְרֹע֖וֹ הַנְּטוּיָֽה׃
Translated: Take thought this day that it was not your children, who neither experienced nor witnessed the lesson of your God יהוה —God’s majesty, mighty hand, and outstretched arm;
Transliteration: viydaetem hayyvom khiy lo et-veneykhem asher lo-yadeu vaasher lo-rau et-musar yehovah eloheykhem et-gׇdelvo et-yadvo hachazakah uzerovo hanetuyah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֹֽתֹתָיו֙ וְאֶֽת־מַעֲשָׂ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה מֶֽלֶךְ־מִצְרַ֖יִם וּלְכׇל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: the signs and the deeds that [God] performed in Egypt against Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;
Transliteration: veet-ototayv veet-maashayv asher ashah vetvokhe mitserayiim lefareoh melekhe-mitserayiim ulekhׇl-aretsvo

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂה֩ לְחֵ֨יל מִצְרַ֜יִם לְסוּסָ֣יו וּלְרִכְבּ֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵצִ֜יף אֶת־מֵ֤י יַם־סוּף֙ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֔ם בְּרׇדְפָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיכֶ֑ם וַיְאַבְּדֵ֣ם יְהֹוָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: what [God] did to Egypt’s army, its horses and chariots; how יהוה rolled back upon them the waters of the Sea of Reeds when they were pursuing you, thus destroying them once and for all;
Transliteration: vaasher ashah lecheyl mitserayiim lesusayv ulerikhevvo asher hetsiyf et-mey yam-suf al-feneyhem verׇdefam achareykhem vayeavedem yehovah ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַד־בֹּאֲכֶ֖ם עַד־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: what [God] did for you in the wilderness before you arrived in this place;
Transliteration: vaasher ashah lakhem vamidevar ad-voakhem ad-hamakvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה לְדָתָ֣ן וְלַאֲבִירָ֗ם בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָב֮ בֶּן־רְאוּבֵן֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּצְתָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ וַתִּבְלָעֵ֥ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַיְקוּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם בְּקֶ֖רֶב כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and what [God] did to Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab son of Reuben, when the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them, along with their households, their tents, and every living thing in their train, from amidst all Israel—
Transliteration: vaasher ashah ledatan velaaviyram veney eliyav ven-reuven asher fatsetah haarets et-fiyha vativelaem veet-vateyhem veet-ׇholeyhem veet khׇl-hayekum asher verageleyhem vekerev khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֤י עֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ הָֽרֹאֹ֔ת אֶת־כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה הַגָּדֹ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: but that it was you who saw with your own eyes all the marvelous deeds that יהוה performed.
Transliteration: khiy eyneykhem haroot et-khׇl-maasheh yehovah hagadol asher ashah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לְמַ֣עַן תֶּחֶזְק֗וּ וּבָאתֶם֙ וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Keep, therefore, all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you today, so that you may have the strength to enter and take possession of the land that you are about to cross into and possess,
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-khׇl-hamitsevah asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom lemaan techezeku uvatem viyrishetem et-haarets asher atem overiym shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: וּלְמַ֨עַן תַּאֲרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֧ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶ֛ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם וּלְזַרְעָ֑ם אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: and that you may long endure upon the soil that יהוה swore to your fathers to assign to them and to their heirs, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Transliteration: ulemaan taariykhu yamiym al-haadamah asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykhem latet lahem ulezaream erets zavat chalav udevash {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה בָא־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ לֹ֣א כְאֶ֤רֶץ מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ הִ֔וא אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְצָאתֶ֖ם מִשָּׁ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּזְרַע֙ אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֔ וְהִשְׁקִ֥יתָ בְרַגְלְךָ֖ כְּגַ֥ן הַיָּרָֽק׃
Translated: For the land that you are about to enter and possess is not like the land of Egypt from which you have come. There the grain you sowed had to be watered by your own labors, like a vegetable garden;
Transliteration: khiy haarets asher atah va-shamah lerishetah lo kheerets mitserayiim hiv asher yetsatem misham asher tizera et-zareakha vehishekiyta veragelekha khegan hayarak

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֥ים שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ אֶ֥רֶץ הָרִ֖ים וּבְקָעֹ֑ת לִמְטַ֥ר הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם תִּשְׁתֶּה־מָּֽיִם׃
Translated: but the land you are about to cross into and possess, a land of hills and valleys, soaks up its water from the rains of heaven.
Transliteration: vehaarets asher atem overiym shamah lerishetah erets hariym uvekaot limetar hashamayiim tisheteh-mayiim

Hebrew: אֶ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ דֹּרֵ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑הּ תָּמִ֗יד עֵינֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בָּ֔הּ מֵֽרֵשִׁית֙ הַשָּׁנָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד אַחֲרִ֥ית שָׁנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: It is a land which your God יהוה looks after, on which your God יהוה always keeps an eye, from year’s beginning to year’s end.
Transliteration: erets asher-yehovah eloheykha doresh otah tamiyd eyney yehovah eloheykha vah mereshiyt hashanah vead achariyt shanah {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁמֹ֤עַ תִּשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מִצְוֺתַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ וּלְעׇבְד֔וֹ בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: If, then, you obey the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, loving your God יהוה and serving [God] with all your heart and soul,
Transliteration: vehayah im-shamoa tishemeu el-mitsevotay asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom leahavah et-yehovah eloheykhem uleׇvedvo vekhׇl-levavekhem uvekhׇl-nafeshekhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֧י מְטַֽר־אַרְצְכֶ֛ם בְּעִתּ֖וֹ יוֹרֶ֣ה וּמַלְק֑וֹשׁ וְאָסַפְתָּ֣ דְגָנֶ֔ךָ וְתִירֹֽשְׁךָ֖ וְיִצְהָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: I will grant the rain for your land in season, the early rain and the late. You shall gather in your new grain and wine and oil—
Transliteration: venatatiy metar-aretsekhem veitvo yvoreh umalekvosh veasafeta deganekha vetiyroshekha veyitseharekha

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֛י עֵ֥שֶׂב בְּשָׂדְךָ֖ לִבְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ וְאָכַלְתָּ֖ וְשָׂבָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: I will also provide grass in the fields for your cattle—and thus you shall eat your fill.
Transliteration: venatatiy eshev veshadekha livehemetekha veakhaleta veshavaeta

Hebrew: הִשָּֽׁמְר֣וּ לָכֶ֔ם פֶּ֥ן יִפְתֶּ֖ה לְבַבְכֶ֑ם וְסַרְתֶּ֗ם וַעֲבַדְתֶּם֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: Take care not to be lured away to serve other gods and bow to them.
Transliteration: hishameru lakhem fen yifeteh levavekhem vesaretem vaavadetem Elohim acheriym vehishetachaviytem lahem

Hebrew: וְחָרָ֨ה אַף־יְהֹוָ֜ה בָּכֶ֗ם וְעָצַ֤ר אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֣ה מָטָ֔ר וְהָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה לֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן אֶת־יְבוּלָ֑הּ וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֣ם מְהֵרָ֗ה מֵעַל֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטֹּבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: For יהוה’s anger will flare up against you, shutting up the skies so that there will be no rain and the ground will not yield its produce; and you will soon perish from the good land that יהוה is assigning to you.
Transliteration: vecharah af-yehovah vakhem veatsar et-hashamayiim velo-yiheyeh matar vehaadamah lo titen et-yevulah vaavadetem meherah meal haarets hatovah asher yehovah noten lakhem

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתֶּם֙ אֶת־דְּבָרַ֣י אֵ֔לֶּה עַל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וְעַֽל־נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם וּקְשַׁרְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֤ם לְאוֹת֙ עַל־יֶדְכֶ֔ם וְהָי֥וּ לְטוֹטָפֹ֖ת בֵּ֥ין עֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Therefore impress these My words upon your very heart: bind them as a sign on your hand and let them serve as a symbol on your forehead,
Transliteration: veshametem et-devaray eleh al-levavekhem veal-nafeshekhem ukesharetem otam levot al-yedekhem vehayu letvotafot veyn eyneykhem

Hebrew: וְלִמַּדְתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֛ם אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֖ם לְדַבֵּ֣ר בָּ֑ם בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֤ בְּבֵיתֶ֙ךָ֙ וּבְלֶכְתְּךָ֣ בַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וּֽבְשׇׁכְבְּךָ֖ וּבְקוּמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and teach them to your children—reciting them when you stay at home and when you are away, when you lie down and when you get up;
Transliteration: velimadetem otam et-veneykhem ledaver vam veshivetekha veveytekha uvelekhetekha vaderekhe uveshׇkhevekha uvekumekha

Hebrew: וּכְתַבְתָּ֛ם עַל־מְזוּז֥וֹת בֵּיתֶ֖ךָ וּבִשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: and inscribe them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates—
Transliteration: ukhetavetam al-mezuzvot veytekha uvisheareykha

Hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן יִרְבּ֤וּ יְמֵיכֶם֙ וִימֵ֣י בְנֵיכֶ֔ם עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם כִּימֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: to the end that you and your children may endure, in the land that יהוה swore to your fathers to assign to them, as long as there is a heaven over the earth.
Transliteration: lemaan yirevu yemeykhem viymey veneykhem al haadamah asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykhem latet lahem khiymey hashamayiim al-haarets {s}

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אִם־שָׁמֹ֨ר תִּשְׁמְר֜וּן אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֗את אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם לַעֲשֹׂתָ֑הּ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם לָלֶ֥כֶת בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֖יו וּלְדׇבְקָה־בֽוֹ׃
Translated: If, then, you faithfully keep all this Instruction that I command you, loving your God יהוה, walking in all God’s ways, and holding fast to [God],
Transliteration: khiy im-shamor tishemerun et-khׇl-hamitsevah hazot asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem laashotah leahavah et-yehovah eloheykhem lalekhet vekhׇl-derakhayv uledׇvekah-vvo

Hebrew: וְהוֹרִ֧ישׁ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִלִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם גּוֹיִ֔ם גְּדֹלִ֥ים וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים מִכֶּֽם׃
Translated: יהוה will dislodge before you all these nations: you will dispossess nations greater and more numerous than you.
Transliteration: vehvoriysh yehovah et-khׇl-hagvoyim haeleh milifeneykhem viyrishetem gvoyim gedoliym vaatsumiym mikhem

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּדְרֹ֧ךְ כַּֽף־רַגְלְכֶ֛ם בּ֖וֹ לָכֶ֣ם יִהְיֶ֑ה מִן־הַמִּדְבָּ֨ר וְהַלְּבָנ֜וֹן מִן־הַנָּהָ֣ר נְהַר־פְּרָ֗ת וְעַד֙ הַיָּ֣ם הָאַֽחֲר֔וֹן יִהְיֶ֖ה גְּבֻלְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Every spot on which your foot treads shall be yours; your territory shall extend from the wilderness to the Lebanon and from the River—the Euphrates—to the Western Sea.
Transliteration: khׇl-hamakvom asher tiderokhe khaf-ragelekhem vvo lakhem yiheyeh min-hamidevar vehalevanvon min-hanahar nehar-ferat vead hayam haacharvon yiheyeh gevulekhem

Hebrew: לֹא־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב אִ֖ישׁ בִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם פַּחְדְּכֶ֨ם וּמוֹרַֽאֲכֶ֜ם יִתֵּ֣ן ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם עַל־פְּנֵ֤י כׇל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּדְרְכוּ־בָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: No one shall stand up to you: your God יהוה will put the dread and the fear of you over the whole land in which you set foot, as promised.
Transliteration: lo-yiteyatsev iysh vifeneykhem fachedekhem umvoraakhem yiten yehovah eloheykhem al-feney khׇl-haarets asher tiderekhu-vah khaasher diver lakhem {s}

Hebrew: רְאֵ֗ה אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם בְּרָכָ֖ה וּקְלָלָֽה׃
Translated: See, this day I set before you blessing and curse:
Transliteration: reeh anokhiy noten lifeneykhem hayyvom verakhah ukelalah

Hebrew: אֶֽת־הַבְּרָכָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְע֗וּ אֶל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: blessing, if you obey the commandments of your God יהוה that I enjoin upon you this day;
Transliteration: et-haverakhah asher tishemeu el-mitsevot yehovah eloheykhem asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom

Hebrew: וְהַקְּלָלָ֗ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמְעוּ֙ אֶל־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וְסַרְתֶּ֣ם מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם לָלֶ֗כֶת אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְדַעְתֶּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: and curse, if you do not obey the commandments of your God יהוה, but turn away from the path that I enjoin upon you this day and follow other gods, whom you have not experienced.
Transliteration: vehakelalah im-lo tishemeu el-mitsevot yehovah eloheykhem vesaretem min-haderekhe asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom lalekhet acharey Elohim acheriym asher lo-yedaetem {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּ֤י יְבִֽיאֲךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֶת־הַבְּרָכָה֙ עַל־הַ֣ר גְּרִזִ֔ים וְאֶת־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה עַל־הַ֥ר עֵיבָֽל׃
Translated: When your God יהוה brings you into the land that you are about to enter and possess, you shall pronounce the blessing at Mount Gerizim and the curse at Mount Ebal.—
Transliteration: vehayah khiy yeviyakha yehovah eloheykha el-haarets asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah venatatah et-haverakhah al-har geriziym veet-hakelalah al-har eyval

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־הֵ֜מָּה בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן אַֽחֲרֵי֙ דֶּ֚רֶךְ מְב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ בְּאֶ֙רֶץ֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּעֲרָבָ֑ה מ֚וּל הַגִּלְגָּ֔ל אֵ֖צֶל אֵלוֹנֵ֥י מֹרֶֽה׃
Translated: Both are on the other side of the Jordan, beyond the west road that is in the land of the Canaanites who dwell in the Arabah—near Gilgal, by the terebinths of Moreh.
Transliteration: halo-hemah veever hayareden acharey derekhe mevvo hashemesh veerets hakhenaaniy hayoshev vaaravah mul hagilegal etsel elvoney moreh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אַתֶּם֙ עֹבְרִ֣ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָבֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֹתָ֖הּ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that your God יהוה is assigning to you. When you have occupied it and are settled in it,
Transliteration: khiy atem overiym et-hayareden lavo lareshet et-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykhem noten lakhem viyrishetem otah viyshavetem-vah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַֽחֻקִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: take care to observe all the laws and rules that I have set before you this day.
Transliteration: ushemaretem laashvot et khׇl-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym asher anokhiy noten lifeneykhem hayyvom

Hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּשְׁמְר֣וּן לַעֲשׂוֹת֒ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֧י אֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּ֑הּ כׇּ֨ל־הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם חַיִּ֖ים עַל־הָאֲדָמָֽה׃
Translated: These are the laws and rules that you must carefully observe in the land that יהוה, God of your ancestors, is giving you to possess, as long as you live on earth.
Transliteration: eleh hachukiym vehamishefatiym asher tishemerun laashvot vaarets asher natan yehovah elohey avoteykha lekha lerishetah khׇl-hayamiym asher-atem chayiym al-haadamah

Hebrew: אַבֵּ֣ד תְּ֠אַבְּד֠וּן אֶֽת־כׇּל־הַמְּקֹמ֞וֹת אֲשֶׁ֧ר עָֽבְדוּ־שָׁ֣ם הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֛ם יֹרְשִׁ֥ים אֹתָ֖ם אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם עַל־הֶהָרִ֤ים הָֽרָמִים֙ וְעַל־הַגְּבָע֔וֹת וְתַ֖חַת כׇּל־עֵ֥ץ רַעֲנָֽן׃
Translated: You must destroy all the sites at which the nations you are to dispossess worshiped their gods, whether on lofty mountains and on hills or under any luxuriant tree.
Transliteration: aved teavedun et-khׇl-hamekomvot asher avedu-sham hagvoyim asher atem yoreshiym otam et-eloheyhem al-hehariym haramiym veal-hagevavot vetachat khׇl-ets raanan

Hebrew: וְנִתַּצְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־מִזְבְּחֹתָ֗ם וְשִׁבַּרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־מַצֵּ֣בֹתָ֔ם וַאֲשֵֽׁרֵיהֶם֙ תִּשְׂרְפ֣וּן בָּאֵ֔שׁ וּפְסִילֵ֥י אֱלֹֽהֵיהֶ֖ם תְּגַדֵּע֑וּן וְאִבַּדְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־שְׁמָ֔ם מִן־הַמָּק֖וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: Tear down their altars, smash their pillars, put their sacred posts to the fire, and cut down the images of their gods, obliterating their name from that site.
Transliteration: venitatsetem et-mizevechotam veshivaretem et-matsevotam vaashereyhem tisherefun vaesh ufesiyley eloheyhem tegadeun veivadetem et-shemam min-hamakvom hahu

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשׂ֣וּן כֵּ֔ן לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not worship your God יהוה in like manner,
Transliteration: lo-taashun khen layhovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֠י אִֽם־אֶל־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ מִכׇּל־שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֔ם לָשׂ֥וּם אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם לְשִׁכְנ֥וֹ תִדְרְשׁ֖וּ וּבָ֥אתָ שָּֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: but look only to the site that your God יהוה will choose amidst all your tribes as God’s habitation, to establish the divine name there. There you are to go,
Transliteration: khiy im-el-hamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah eloheykhem mikhׇl-shiveteykhem lashum et-shemvo sham leshikhenvo tidereshu uvata shamah

Hebrew: וַהֲבֵאתֶ֣ם שָׁ֗מָּה עֹלֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וְזִבְחֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵת֙ מַעְשְׂרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת תְּרוּמַ֣ת יֶדְכֶ֑ם וְנִדְרֵיכֶם֙ וְנִדְבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקַרְכֶ֖ם וְצֹאנְכֶֽם׃
Translated: and there you are to bring your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, your votive and freewill offerings, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks.
Transliteration: vahavetem shamah oloteykhem vezivecheykhem veet maesheroteykhem veet terumat yedekhem venidereykhem venidevoteykhem uvekhorot vekarekhem vetsonekhem

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּם־שָׁ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם בְּכֹל֙ מִשְׁלַ֣ח יֶדְכֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֖ם וּבָתֵּיכֶ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בֵּֽרַכְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Together with your households, you shall feast there before your God יהוה, happy in all the undertakings in which your God יהוה has blessed you.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem-sham lifeney yehovah eloheykhem ushemachetem vekhol mishelach yedekhem atem uvateykhem asher verakhekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּן כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנַ֧חְנוּ עֹשִׂ֛ים פֹּ֖ה הַיּ֑וֹם אִ֖ישׁ כׇּל־הַיָּשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: You shall not act at all as we now act here, each of us as we please,
Transliteration: lo taashun khekhol asher anachenu oshiym foh hayyvom iysh khׇl-hayashar veeynayv

Hebrew: כִּ֥י לֹא־בָאתֶ֖ם עַד־עָ֑תָּה אֶל־הַמְּנוּחָה֙ וְאֶל־הַֽנַּחֲלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
Translated: because you have not yet come to the allotted haven that your God יהוה is giving you.
Transliteration: khiy lo-vatem ad-atah el-hamenuchah veel-hanachalah asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe

Hebrew: וַעֲבַרְתֶּם֮ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֣ם בָּאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מַנְחִ֣יל אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְהֵנִ֨יחַ לָכֶ֧ם מִכׇּל־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֛ם מִסָּבִ֖יב וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בֶּֽטַח׃
Translated: When you cross the Jordan and settle in the land that your God יהוה is allotting to you, and [God] grants you safety from all your enemies around you and you live in security,
Transliteration: vaavaretem et-hayareden viyshavetem vaarets asher-yehovah eloheykhem manechiyl etekhem veheniycha lakhem mikhׇl-oyeveykhem misaviyv viyshavetem-vetach

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֥ם בּוֹ֙ לְשַׁכֵּ֤ן שְׁמוֹ֙ שָׁ֔ם שָׁ֣מָּה תָבִ֔יאוּ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֑ם עוֹלֹתֵיכֶ֣ם וְזִבְחֵיכֶ֗ם מַעְשְׂרֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וּתְרֻמַ֣ת יֶדְכֶ֔ם וְכֹל֙ מִבְחַ֣ר נִדְרֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּדְּר֖וּ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: then you must bring everything that I command you to the site where your God יהוה will choose to establish the divine name: your burnt offerings and other sacrifices, your tithes and contributions, and all the choice votive offerings that you vow to יהוה.
Transliteration: vehayah hamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah eloheykhem vvo leshakhen shemvo sham shamah taviyu et khׇl-asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem voloteykhem vezivecheykhem maesheroteykhem uterumat yedekhem vekhol mivechar nidereykhem asher tideru layhovah

Hebrew: וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵי֮ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֒ אַתֶּ֗ם וּבְנֵיכֶם֙ וּבְנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַבְדֵיכֶ֖ם וְאַמְהֹתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהַלֵּוִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּשַֽׁעֲרֵיכֶ֔ם כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין ל֛וֹ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: And you shall rejoice before your God יהוה with your sons and daughters and with your male and female slaves, along with the [family of the] Levite in your settlements, for he has no territorial allotment among you.
Transliteration: ushemachetem lifeney yehovah eloheykhem atem uveneykhem uvenoteykhem veavedeykhem veamehoteykhem vehaleviy asher veshaareykhem khiy eyn lvo chelek venachalah itekhem

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּֽן־תַּעֲלֶ֖ה עֹלֹתֶ֑יךָ בְּכׇל־מָק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: Take care not to sacrifice your burnt offerings in any place you like,
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-taaleh oloteykha vekhׇl-makvom asher tireeh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־בַּמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁבָטֶ֔יךָ שָׁ֖ם תַּעֲלֶ֣ה עֹלֹתֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁ֣ם תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated: but only in the place that יהוה will choose in one of your tribal territories. There you shall sacrifice your burnt offerings and there you shall observe all that I enjoin upon you.
Transliteration: khiy im-vamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah veachad shevateykha sham taaleh oloteykha vesham taasheh khol asher anokhiy metsavekha

Hebrew: רַק֩ בְּכׇל־אַוַּ֨ת נַפְשְׁךָ֜ תִּזְבַּ֣ח ׀ וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ בָשָׂ֗ר כְּבִרְכַּ֨ת יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לְךָ֖ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ הַטָּמֵ֤א וְהַטָּהוֹר֙ יֹאכְלֶ֔נּוּ כַּצְּבִ֖י וְכָאַיָּֽל׃
Translated: But whenever you desire, you may slaughter and eat meat in any of your settlements, according to the blessing that your God יהוה has granted you. The impure and the pure alike may partake of it, as of the gazelle and the deer.
Transliteration: rak vekhׇl-avat nafeshekha tizevach veakhaleta vashar khevirekhat yehovah eloheykha asher natan-lekha vekhׇl-sheareykha hatame vehatahvor yokhelenu khatseviy vekhaayal

Hebrew: רַ֥ק הַדָּ֖ם לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: But you must not partake of the blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
Transliteration: rak hadam lo tokhelu al-haarets tishefekhenu khamayiim

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תוּכַ֞ל לֶאֱכֹ֣ל בִּשְׁעָרֶ֗יךָ מַעְשַׂ֤ר דְּגָֽנְךָ֙ וְתִירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֔ךָ וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקָרְךָ֖ וְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ וְכׇל־נְדָרֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּדֹּ֔ר וְנִדְבֹתֶ֖יךָ וּתְרוּמַ֥ת יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You may not partake in your settlements of the tithes of your new grain or wine or oil, or of the firstlings of your herds and flocks, or of any of the votive offerings that you vow, or of your freewill offerings, or of your contributions.
Transliteration: lo-tukhal leekhol visheareykha maeshar deganekha vetiyroshekha veyitseharekha uvekhorot vekarekha vetsonekha vekhׇl-nedareykha asher tidor venidevoteykha uterumat yadekha

Hebrew: כִּ֡י אִם־לִפְנֵי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ תֹּאכְלֶ֗נּוּ בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִבְחַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ בּוֹ֒ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֤ וּבִתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְהַלֵּוִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֗ לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: These you must consume before your God יהוה in the place that your God יהוה will choose—you and your sons and your daughters, your male and female slaves, and the [family of the] Levite in your settlements—happy before your God יהוה in all your undertakings.
Transliteration: khiy im-lifeney yehovah eloheykha tokhelenu vamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha vvo atah uvinekha uvitekha veavedekha vaamatekha vehaleviy asher visheareykha veshamacheta lifeney yehovah eloheykha vekhol mishelach yadekha

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֔ פֶּֽן־תַּעֲזֹ֖ב אֶת־הַלֵּוִ֑י כׇּל־יָמֶ֖יךָ עַל־אַדְמָתֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Be sure not to neglect the [family of the] Levite as long as you live in your land.
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-taazov et-haleviy khׇl-yameykha al-adematekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַרְחִיב֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֥יךָ אֶֽת־גְּבֻלְךָ֮ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֶּר־לָךְ֒ וְאָמַרְתָּ֙ אֹכְלָ֣ה בָשָׂ֔ר כִּֽי־תְאַוֶּ֥ה נַפְשְׁךָ֖ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל בָּשָׂ֑ר בְּכׇל־אַוַּ֥ת נַפְשְׁךָ֖ תֹּאכַ֥ל בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: When יהוה enlarges your territory, as promised, and you say, “I shall eat some meat,” for you have the urge to eat meat, you may eat meat whenever you wish.
Transliteration: khiy-yarechiyv yehovah eloheykha et-gevulekha khaasher diver-lakhe veamareta okhelah vashar khiy-teaveh nafeshekha leekhol vashar vekhׇl-avat nafeshekha tokhal vashar
