Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִרְחַ֨ק מִמְּךָ֜ הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִבְחַ֜ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֘יךָ֮ לָשׂ֣וּם שְׁמ֣וֹ שָׁם֒ וְזָבַחְתָּ֞ מִבְּקָרְךָ֣ וּמִצֹּֽאנְךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ לְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוִּיתִ֑ךָ וְאָֽכַלְתָּ֙ בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל אַוַּ֥ת נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: If the place where יהוה has chosen to establish the divine name is too far from you, you may slaughter any of the cattle or sheep that יהוה gives you, as I have instructed you; and you may eat to your heart’s content in your settlements.
Transliteration: khiy-yirechak mimekha hamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha lashum shemvo sham vezavacheta mivekarekha umitsonekha asher natan yehovah lekha khaasher tsiviytikha veakhaleta visheareykha vekhol avat nafeshekha

Hebrew: אַ֗ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵאָכֵ֤ל אֶֽת־הַצְּבִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אַיָּ֔ל כֵּ֖ן תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ הַטָּמֵא֙ וְהַטָּה֔וֹר יַחְדָּ֖ו יֹאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Eat it, however, as the gazelle and the deer are eaten: the impure may eat it together with the pure.
Transliteration: akhe khaasher eiakhel et-hatseviy veet-haayal khen tokhelenu hatame vehatahvor yachedav yokhelenu

Hebrew: רַ֣ק חֲזַ֗ק לְבִלְתִּי֙ אֲכֹ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם כִּ֥י הַדָּ֖ם ה֣וּא הַנָּ֑פֶשׁ וְלֹא־תֹאכַ֥ל הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ עִם־הַבָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: But make sure that you do not partake of the blood; for the blood is the life, and you must not consume the life with the flesh.
Transliteration: rak chazak leviletiy akhol hadam khiy hadam hu hanafesh velo-tokhal hanefesh im-havashar

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: You must not partake of it; you must pour it out on the ground like water:
Transliteration: lo tokhelenu al-haarets tishefekhenu khamayiim

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ לְמַ֨עַן יִיטַ֤ב לְךָ֙ וּלְבָנֶ֣יךָ אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: you must not partake of it, in order that it may go well with you and with your descendants to come, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of יהוה.
Transliteration: lo tokhelenu lemaan yiytav lekha ulevaneykha achareykha khiy-taasheh hayashar veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: רַ֧ק קׇֽדָשֶׁ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֖ וּנְדָרֶ֑יךָ תִּשָּׂ֣א וּבָ֔אתָ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But such sacred and votive donations as you may have shall be taken by you to the site that יהוה will choose.
Transliteration: rak kׇdasheykha asher-yiheyu lekha unedareykha tisha uvata el-hamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ עֹלֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַבָּשָׂ֣ר וְהַדָּ֔ם עַל־מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְדַם־זְבָחֶ֗יךָ יִשָּׁפֵךְ֙ עַל־מִזְבַּח֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהַבָּשָׂ֖ר תֹּאכֵֽל׃
Translated: You shall offer your burnt offerings, both the flesh and the blood, on the altar of your God יהוה; and of your other sacrifices, the blood shall be poured out on the altar of your God יהוה, and you shall eat the flesh.
Transliteration: veashiyta oloteykha havashar vehadam al-mizevach yehovah eloheykha vedam-zevacheykha yishafekhe al-mizevach yehovah eloheykha vehavashar tokhel

Hebrew: שְׁמֹ֣ר וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֗ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י מְצַוֶּ֑ךָּ לְמַ֩עַן֩ יִיטַ֨ב לְךָ֜ וּלְבָנֶ֤יךָ אַחֲרֶ֙יךָ֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם כִּ֤י תַעֲשֶׂה֙ הַטּ֣וֹב וְהַיָּשָׁ֔ר בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Be careful to heed all these commandments that I enjoin upon you; thus it will go well with you and with your descendants after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of your God יהוה.
Transliteration: shemor veshamaeta et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh asher anokhiy metsavekha lemaan yiytav lekha ulevaneykha achareykha ad-volam khiy taasheh hatvov vehayashar veeyney yehovah eloheykha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַכְרִית֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֛מָּה לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אוֹתָ֖ם מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וְיָרַשְׁתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֖ בְּאַרְצָֽם׃
Translated: When your God יהוה has cut down before you the nations that you are about to enter and dispossess, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their land,
Transliteration: khiy-yakheriyt yehovah eloheykha et-hagvoyim asher atah va-shamah lareshet votam mifaneykha veyarasheta otam veyashaveta vearetsam

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֗ פֶּן־תִּנָּקֵשׁ֙ אַחֲרֵיהֶ֔ם אַחֲרֵ֖י הִשָּׁמְדָ֣ם מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וּפֶן־תִּדְרֹ֨שׁ לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר אֵיכָ֨ה יַעַבְד֜וּ הַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֶת־אֱלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶעֱשֶׂה־כֵּ֖ן גַּם־אָֽנִי׃
Translated: beware of being lured into their ways after they have been wiped out before you! Do not inquire about their gods, saying, “How did those nations worship their gods? I too will follow those practices.”
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-tinakesh achareyhem acharey hishamedam mifaneykha ufen-tiderosh leloheyhem lemor eykhah yaavedu hagvoyim haeleh et-eloheyhem veeesheh-khen gam-aniy

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה כֵ֔ן לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּי֩ כׇל־תּוֹעֲבַ֨ת יְהֹוָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׂנֵ֗א עָשׂוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֣י גַ֤ם אֶת־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־בְּנֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם יִשְׂרְפ֥וּ בָאֵ֖שׁ לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not act thus toward your God יהוה, for they perform for their gods every abhorrent act that יהוה detests; they even offer up their sons and daughters in fire to their gods.
Transliteration: lo-taasheh khen layhovah eloheykha khiy khׇl-tvoavat yehovah asher shane ashu leloheyhem khiy gam et-veneyhem veet-venoteyhem yisherefu vaesh leloheyhem

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֹת֥וֹ תִשְׁמְר֖וּ לַעֲשׂ֑וֹת לֹא־תֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֔יו וְלֹ֥א תִגְרַ֖ע מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Be careful to observe only that which I enjoin upon you: neither add to it nor take away from it.
Transliteration: et khׇl-hadavar asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem otvo tishemeru laashvot lo-tosef alayv velo tigera mimenu {f}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָק֤וּם בְּקִרְבְּךָ֙ נָבִ֔יא א֖וֹ חֹלֵ֣ם חֲל֑וֹם וְנָתַ֥ן אֵלֶ֛יךָ א֖וֹת א֥וֹ מוֹפֵֽת׃
Translated: If there appears among you a prophet or a dream-diviner, who gives you a sign or a portent,
Transliteration: khiy-yakum vekirevekha naviy vo cholem chalvom venatan eleykha vot vo mvofet

Hebrew: וּבָ֤א הָאוֹת֙ וְהַמּוֹפֵ֔ת אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵֽלְכָ֞ה אַחֲרֵ֨י אֱלֹהִ֧ים אֲחֵרִ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יְדַעְתָּ֖ם וְנׇֽעׇבְדֵֽם׃
Translated: saying, “Let us follow and worship another god”—whom you have not experienced —even if the sign or portent named to you comes true,
Transliteration: uva havot vehamvofet asher-diver eleykha lemor nelekhah acharey Elohim acheriym asher lo-yedaetam venׇׇvedem

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תִשְׁמַ֗ע אֶל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַנָּבִ֣יא הַה֔וּא א֛וֹ אֶל־חוֹלֵ֥ם הַחֲל֖וֹם הַה֑וּא כִּ֣י מְנַסֶּ֞ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם לָדַ֗עַת הֲיִשְׁכֶ֤ם אֹֽהֲבִים֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: do not heed the words of that prophet or that dream-diviner. For your God יהוה is testing you to see whether you really love your God יהוה with all your heart and soul.
Transliteration: lo tishema el-diverey hanaviy hahu vo el-chvolem hachalvom hahu khiy menaseh yehovah eloheykhem etekhem ladaat hayishekhem ohaviym et-yehovah eloheykhem vekhׇl-levavekhem uvekhׇl-nafeshekhem

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם תֵּלֵ֖כוּ וְאֹת֣וֹ תִירָ֑אוּ וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתָ֤יו תִּשְׁמֹ֙רוּ֙ וּבְקֹל֣וֹ תִשְׁמָ֔עוּ וְאֹת֥וֹ תַעֲבֹ֖דוּ וּב֥וֹ תִדְבָּקֽוּן׃
Translated: It is your God יהוה alone whom you should follow, whom you should revere, whose commandments you should observe, whose orders you should heed, whom you should worship, and to whom you should hold fast.
Transliteration: acharey yehovah eloheykhem telekhu veotvo tiyrau veet-mitsevotayv tishemoru uvekolvo tishemau veotvo taavodu uvvo tidevakun

Hebrew: וְהַנָּבִ֣יא הַה֡וּא א֣וֹ חֹלֵם֩ הַחֲל֨וֹם הַה֜וּא יוּמָ֗ת כִּ֣י דִבֶּר־סָ֠רָ֠ה עַל־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֜ם הַמּוֹצִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֣ם ׀ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם וְהַפֹּֽדְךָ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֔ים לְהַדִּֽיחֲךָ֙ מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֧ר צִוְּךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּ֑הּ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: As for that prophet or dream-diviner, such a one shall be put to death for having urged disloyalty to your God יהוה —who freed you from the land of Egypt and who redeemed you from the house of bondage—to make you stray from the path that your God יהוה commanded you to follow. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
Transliteration: vehanaviy hahu vo cholem hachalvom hahu yumat khiy diver-sarah al-yehovah eloheykhem hamvotsiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim vehafodekha miveyt avadiym lehadiychakha min-haderekhe asher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha lalekhet vah uviareta hara mikirevekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יְסִֽיתְךָ֡ אָחִ֣יךָ בֶן־אִ֠מֶּ֠ךָ אֽוֹ־בִנְךָ֨ אֽוֹ־בִתְּךָ֜ א֣וֹ ׀ אֵ֣שֶׁת חֵיקֶ֗ךָ א֧וֹ רֵֽעֲךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר כְּנַפְשְׁךָ֖ בַּסֵּ֣תֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵֽלְכָ֗ה וְנַֽעַבְדָה֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתָּ אַתָּ֖ה וַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: If your brother, your own mother’s son, or your son or daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your closest friend entices you in secret, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced —
Transliteration: khiy yesiytekha achiykha ven-imekha vo-vinekha vo-vitekha vo eshet cheykekha vo reakha asher khenafeshekha vaseter lemor nelekhah venaavedah Elohim acheriym asher lo yadaeta atah vaavoteykha

Hebrew: מֵאֱלֹהֵ֣י הָֽעַמִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם הַקְּרֹבִ֣ים אֵלֶ֔יךָ א֖וֹ הָרְחֹקִ֣ים מִמֶּ֑ךָּ מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: from among the gods of the peoples around you, either near to you or distant, anywhere from one end of the earth to the other:
Transliteration: meelohey haamiym asher seviyvoteykhem hakeroviym eleykha vo harechokiym mimekha miketseh haarets vead-ketseh haarets

Hebrew: לֹא־תֹאבֶ֣ה ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁמַ֖ע אֵלָ֑יו וְלֹא־תָח֤וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְלֹֽא־תַחְמֹ֥ל וְלֹֽא־תְכַסֶּ֖ה עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: do not assent or give heed to any of them. Show no pity or compassion, and do not cover up the matter;
Transliteration: lo-toveh lvo velo tishema elayv velo-tachvos eynekha alayv velo-tachemol velo-tekhaseh alayv

Hebrew: כִּ֤י הָרֹג֙ תַּֽהַרְגֶ֔נּוּ יָ֥דְךָ֛ תִּֽהְיֶה־בּ֥וֹ בָרִֽאשׁוֹנָ֖ה לַהֲמִית֑וֹ וְיַ֥ד כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם בָּאַחֲרֹנָֽה׃
Translated: but take that person’s life. Let your hand be the first to put that person to death, followed by the hand of the rest of the people.
Transliteration: khiy harog taharegenu yadekha tiheyeh-vvo varishvonah lahamiytvo veyad khׇl-haam vaacharonah

Hebrew: וּסְקַלְתּ֥וֹ בָאֲבָנִ֖ים וָמֵ֑ת כִּ֣י בִקֵּ֗שׁ לְהַדִּֽיחֲךָ֙ מֵעַל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ הַמּוֹצִיאֲךָ֛ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֥ית עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: Stone that person to death for having sought to make you stray from your God יהוה, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
Transliteration: usekaletvo vaavaniym vamet khiy vikesh lehadiychakha meal yehovah eloheykha hamvotsiyakha meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadiym

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִשְׁמְע֖וּ וְיִֽרָא֑וּן וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֣פוּ לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת כַּדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus all Israel will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not be done again in your midst.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael yishemeu veyiraun velo-yvosifu laashvot khadavar hara hazeh vekirevekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִשְׁמַ֞ע בְּאַחַ֣ת עָרֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֛ לָשֶׁ֥בֶת שָׁ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: If you hear it said, of one of the towns that your God יהוה is giving you to dwell in,
Transliteration: khiy-tishema veachat areykha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha lashevet sham lemor

Hebrew: יָצְא֞וּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־בְלִיַּ֙עַל֙ מִקִּרְבֶּ֔ךָ וַיַּדִּ֛יחוּ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י עִירָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר נֵלְכָ֗ה וְנַעַבְדָ֛ה אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יְדַעְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: that some scoundrels from among you have gone and subverted the inhabitants of their town, saying, “Come let us worship other gods”—whom you have not experienced—
Transliteration: yatseu anashiym veney-veliyaal mikirevekha vayadiychu et-yoshevey iyram lemor nelekhah venaavedah Elohim acheriym asher lo-yedaetem

Hebrew: וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֧ וְחָקַרְתָּ֛ וְשָׁאַלְתָּ֖ הֵיטֵ֑ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֱמֶת֙ נָכ֣וֹן הַדָּבָ֔ר נֶעֶשְׂתָ֛ה הַתּוֹעֵבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: you shall investigate and inquire and interrogate thoroughly. If it is true, the fact is established—that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in your midst—
Transliteration: vedarasheta vechakareta veshaaleta heytev vehineh emet nakhvon hadavar neeshetah hatvoevah hazot vekirevekha

Hebrew: הַכֵּ֣ה תַכֶּ֗ה אֶת־יֹ֥שְׁבֵ֛י הָעִ֥יר הַהִ֖וא לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב הַחֲרֵ֨ם אֹתָ֧הּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֛הּ וְאֶת־בְּהֶמְתָּ֖הּ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: put the inhabitants of that town to the sword and put its cattle to the sword. Doom it and all that is in it to destruction:
Transliteration: hakheh takheh et-yoshevey haiyr hahiv lefiy-charev hacharem otah veet-khׇl-asher-vah veet-vehemetah lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וְאֶת־כׇּל־שְׁלָלָ֗הּ תִּקְבֹּץ֮ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ רְחֹבָהּ֒ וְשָׂרַפְתָּ֨ בָאֵ֜שׁ אֶת־הָעִ֤יר וְאֶת־כׇּל־שְׁלָלָהּ֙ כָּלִ֔יל לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהָיְתָה֙ תֵּ֣ל עוֹלָ֔ם לֹ֥א תִבָּנֶ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
Translated: gather all its spoil into the open square, and burn the town and all its spoil as a holocaust to your God יהוה. And it shall remain an everlasting ruin, never to be rebuilt.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-shelalah tikevots el-tvokhe rechovah vesharafeta vaesh et-haiyr veet-khׇl-shelalah khaliyl layhovah eloheykha vehayetah tel volam lo tivaneh vod

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יִדְבַּ֧ק בְּיָדְךָ֛ מְא֖וּמָה מִן־הַחֵ֑רֶם לְמַ֩עַן֩ יָשׁ֨וּב יְהֹוָ֜ה מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֗וֹ וְנָֽתַן־לְךָ֤ רַחֲמִים֙ וְרִֽחַמְךָ֣ וְהִרְבֶּ֔ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Let nothing that has been doomed stick to your hand, in order that יהוה may turn from a blazing anger and show you compassion, and in compassion increase you as promised on oath to your fathers—
Transliteration: velo-yidevak veyadekha meumah min-hacherem lemaan yashuv yehovah mecharvon afvo venatan-lekha rachamiym verichamekha vehirevekha khaasher nisheva laavoteykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֗ע בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹר֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ הַיָּשָׁ֔ר בְּעֵינֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: for you will be heeding your God יהוה, obeying all the divine commandments that I enjoin upon you this day, doing what is right in the sight of your God יהוה.
Transliteration: khiy tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor et-khׇl-mitsevotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom laashvot hayashar veeyney yehovah eloheykha {s}

Hebrew: בָּנִ֣ים אַתֶּ֔ם לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם לֹ֣א תִתְגֹּֽדְד֗וּ וְלֹֽא־תָשִׂ֧ימוּ קׇרְחָ֛ה בֵּ֥ין עֵינֵיכֶ֖ם לָמֵֽת׃
Translated: You are children of your God יהוה. You shall not gash yourselves or shave the front of your heads because of the dead.
Transliteration: vaniym atem layhovah eloheykhem lo titegodedu velo-tashiymu kׇrechah veyn eyneykhem lamet

Hebrew: כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וּבְךָ֞ בָּחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לִֽהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: For you are a people consecrated to your God יהוה: your God יהוה chose you from among all other peoples on earth to be a treasured people.
Transliteration: khiy am kadvosh atah layhovah eloheykha uvekha vachar yehovah liheyvot lvo leam segulah mikhol haamiym asher al-feney haadamah {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תֹאכַ֖ל כׇּל־תּוֹעֵבָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not eat anything abhorrent.
Transliteration: lo tokhal khׇl-tvoevah

Hebrew: זֹ֥את הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאכֵ֑לוּ שׁ֕וֹר שֵׂ֥ה כְשָׂבִ֖ים וְשֵׂ֥ה עִזִּֽים׃
Translated: These are the animals that you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat;
Transliteration: zot havehemah asher tokhelu shvor sheh kheshaviym vesheh iziym

Hebrew: אַיָּ֥ל וּצְבִ֖י וְיַחְמ֑וּר וְאַקּ֥וֹ וְדִישֹׁ֖ן וּתְא֥וֹ וָזָֽמֶר׃
Translated: the deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, the mountain sheep,
Transliteration: ayal utseviy veyachemur veakvo vediyshon utevo vazamer

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֞ה מַפְרֶ֣סֶת פַּרְסָ֗ה וְשֹׁסַ֤עַת שֶׁ֙סַע֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י פְרָס֔וֹת מַעֲלַ֥ת גֵּרָ֖ה בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה אֹתָ֖הּ תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: and any other animal that has true hoofs which are cleft in two and brings up the cud—such you may eat.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-vehemah mafereset faresah veshosaat shesa shetey ferasvot maalat gerah vavehemah otah tokhelu

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶת־זֶ֞ה לֹ֤א תֹֽאכְלוּ֙ מִמַּֽעֲלֵ֣י הַגֵּרָ֔ה וּמִמַּפְרִיסֵ֥י הַפַּרְסָ֖ה הַשְּׁסוּעָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֠גָּמָ֠ל וְאֶת־הָאַרְנֶ֨בֶת וְאֶת־הַשָּׁפָ֜ן כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֧ה גֵרָ֣ה הֵ֗מָּה וּפַרְסָה֙ לֹ֣א הִפְרִ֔יסוּ טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: But the following, which do bring up the cud or have true hoofs which are cleft through, you may not eat: the camel, the hare, and the daman—for although they bring up the cud, they have no true hoofs—they are impure for you;
Transliteration: akhe et-zeh lo tokhelu mimaaley hagerah umimaferiysey hafaresah hashesuah et-hagamal veet-haarenevet veet-hashafan khiy-maaleh gerah hemah ufaresah lo hiferiysu temeiym hem lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠חֲזִ֠יר כִּֽי־מַפְרִ֨יס פַּרְסָ֥ה הוּא֙ וְלֹ֣א גֵרָ֔ה טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶ֑ם מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וּבְנִבְלָתָ֖ם לֹ֥א תִגָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: also the swine—for although it has true hoofs, it does not bring up the cud—is impure for you. You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses.
Transliteration: veet-hachaziyr khiy-maferiys faresah hu velo gerah tame hu lakhem mivesharam lo tokhelu uvenivelatam lo tigau {s}

Hebrew: אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם כֹּ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: These you may eat of all that live in water: you may eat anything that has fins and scales.
Transliteration: et-zeh tokhelu mikhol asher vamayiim khol asher-lvo senafiyr vekashekeshet tokhelu

Hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר אֵֽין־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But you may not eat anything that has no fins and scales: it is impure for you.
Transliteration: vekhol asher eyn-lvo senafiyr vekashekeshet lo tokhelu tame hu lakhem {s}

Hebrew: כׇּל־צִפּ֥וֹר טְהֹרָ֖ה תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: You may eat any pure bird.
Transliteration: khׇl-tsifvor tehorah tokhelu

Hebrew: וְזֶ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־תֹאכְל֖וּ מֵהֶ֑ם הַנֶּ֥שֶׁר וְהַפֶּ֖רֶס וְהָֽעׇזְנִיָּֽה׃
Translated: The following you may not eat: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;
Transliteration: vezeh asher lo-tokhelu mehem hanesher vehaferes vehaׇzeniyah

Hebrew: וְהָרָאָה֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אַיָּ֔ה וְהַדַּיָּ֖ה לְמִינָֽהּ׃
Translated: the kite, the falcon, and the buzzard of any variety;
Transliteration: veharaah veet-haayah vehadayah lemiynah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־עֹרֵ֖ב לְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated: every variety of raven;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-orev lemiynvo

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ בַּ֣ת הַֽיַּעֲנָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַתַּחְמָ֖ס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑חַף וְאֶת־הַנֵּ֖ץ לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of any variety;
Transliteration: veet vat hayaanah veet-hatachemas veet-hashachaf veet-hanets lemiynehu

Hebrew: אֶת־הַכּ֥וֹס וְאֶת־הַיַּנְשׁ֖וּף וְהַתִּנְשָֽׁמֶת׃
Translated: the little owl, the great owl, and the white owl;
Transliteration: et-hakhvos veet-hayaneshuf vehatineshamet

Hebrew: וְהַקָּאָ֥ת וְאֶֽת־הָרָחָ֖מָה וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָֽךְ׃
Translated: the pelican, the bustard, and the cormorant;
Transliteration: vehakaat veet-harachamah veet-hashalakhe

Hebrew: וְהַ֣חֲסִידָ֔ה וְהָאֲנָפָ֖ה לְמִינָ֑הּ וְהַדּוּכִיפַ֖ת וְהָעֲטַלֵּֽף׃
Translated: the stork, any variety of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
Transliteration: vehachasiydah vehaanafah lemiynah vehadukhiyfat vehaatalef

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶ֑ם לֹ֖א יֵאָכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: All winged swarming things are impure for you: they may not be eaten.
Transliteration: vekhol sherets havof tame hu lakhem lo eiakhelu

Hebrew: כׇּל־ע֥וֹף טָה֖וֹר תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: You may eat only pure winged creatures.
Transliteration: khׇl-vof tahvor tokhelu

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תֹאכְל֣וּ כׇל־נְ֠בֵלָ֠ה לַגֵּ֨ר אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׁעָרֶ֜יךָ תִּתְּנֶ֣נָּה וַאֲכָלָ֗הּ א֤וֹ מָכֹר֙ לְנׇכְרִ֔י כִּ֣י עַ֤ם קָדוֹשׁ֙ אַתָּ֔ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹֽא־תְבַשֵּׁ֥ל גְּדִ֖י בַּחֲלֵ֥ב אִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall not eat anything that has died a natural death; give it to the stranger in your community to eat, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a people consecrated to your God יהוה. You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.
Transliteration: lo tokhelu khׇl-nevelah lager asher-visheareykha titenenah vaakhalah vo makhor lenׇkheriy khiy am kadvosh atah layhovah eloheykha lo-tevashel gediy vachalev imvo {f}

Hebrew: עַשֵּׂ֣ר תְּעַשֵּׂ֔ר אֵ֖ת כׇּל־תְּבוּאַ֣ת זַרְעֶ֑ךָ הַיֹּצֵ֥א הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה שָׁנָ֥ה שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: You shall set aside every year a tenth part of all the yield of your sowing that is brought from the field.
Transliteration: asher teasher et khׇl-tevuat zareekha hayotse hashadeh shanah shanah

Hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֞ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בַּמָּק֣וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַר֮ לְשַׁכֵּ֣ן שְׁמ֣וֹ שָׁם֒ מַעְשַׂ֤ר דְּגָֽנְךָ֙ תִּירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֔ךָ וּבְכֹרֹ֥ת בְּקָרְךָ֖ וְצֹאנֶ֑ךָ לְמַ֣עַן תִּלְמַ֗ד לְיִרְאָ֛ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: You shall consume the tithes of your new grain and wine and oil, and the firstlings of your herds and flocks, in the presence of your God יהוה, in the place where [God] will choose to establish the divine name, so that you may learn to revere your God יהוה forever.
Transliteration: veakhaleta lifeney yehovah eloheykha vamakvom asher-yivechar leshakhen shemvo sham maeshar deganekha tiyroshekha veyitseharekha uvekhorot vekarekha vetsonekha lemaan tilemad leyireah et-yehovah eloheykha khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִרְבֶּ֨ה מִמְּךָ֜ הַדֶּ֗רֶךְ כִּ֣י לֹ֣א תוּכַל֮ שְׂאֵתוֹ֒ כִּֽי־יִרְחַ֤ק מִמְּךָ֙ הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לָשׂ֥וּם שְׁמ֖וֹ שָׁ֑ם כִּ֥י יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Should the distance be too great for you, should you be unable to transport them, because the place where your God יהוה has chosen to establish the divine name is far from you and because your God יהוה has blessed you,
Transliteration: vekhiy-yireveh mimekha haderekhe khiy lo tukhal sheetvo khiy-yirechak mimekha hamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha lashum shemvo sham khiy yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֖ה בַּכָּ֑סֶף וְצַרְתָּ֤ הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ בְּיָ֣דְךָ֔ וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: you may convert them into money. Wrap up the money and take it with you to the place that your God יהוה has chosen,
Transliteration: venatatah vakhasef vetsareta hakhesef veyadekha vehalakheta el-hamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha vvo

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה הַכֶּ֡סֶף בְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁר־תְּאַוֶּ֨ה נַפְשְׁךָ֜ בַּבָּקָ֣ר וּבַצֹּ֗אן וּבַיַּ֙יִן֙ וּבַשֵּׁכָ֔ר וּבְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּֽשְׁאָלְךָ֖ נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וְאָכַ֣לְתָּ שָּׁ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֖ אַתָּ֥ה וּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: and spend the money on anything you want—cattle, sheep, wine, or other intoxicant, or anything you may desire. And you shall feast there, in the presence of your God יהוה, and rejoice with your household.
Transliteration: venatatah hakhesef vekhol asher-teaveh nafeshekha vavakar uvatson uvayayiin uvashekhar uvekhol asher tishealekha nafeshekha veakhaleta sham lifeney yehovah eloheykha veshamacheta atah uveytekha

Hebrew: וְהַלֵּוִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־בִּשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תַֽעַזְבֶ֑נּוּ כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין ל֛וֹ חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: But do not neglect the [family of the] Levite in your community, for he has no hereditary portion as you have.
Transliteration: vehaleviy asher-visheareykha lo taazevenu khiy eyn lvo chelek venachalah imakhe {s}

Hebrew: מִקְצֵ֣ה ׀ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים תּוֹצִיא֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מַעְשַׂר֙ תְּבוּאָ֣תְךָ֔ בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִ֑וא וְהִנַּחְתָּ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Every third year you shall bring out the full tithe of your yield of that year, but leave it within your settlements.
Transliteration: miketseh shalosh shaniym tvotsiy et-khׇl-maeshar tevuatekha vashanah hahiv vehinacheta visheareykha

Hebrew: וּבָ֣א הַלֵּוִ֡י כִּ֣י אֵֽין־לוֹ֩ חֵ֨לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֜ה עִמָּ֗ךְ וְ֠הַגֵּ֠ר וְהַיָּת֤וֹם וְהָֽאַלְמָנָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ וְאָכְל֖וּ וְשָׂבֵ֑עוּ לְמַ֤עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the [family of the] Levite, who has no hereditary portion as you have, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your settlements shall come and eat their fill, so that your God יהוה may bless you in all the enterprises you undertake.
Transliteration: uva haleviy khiy eyn-lvo chelek venachalah imakhe vehager vehayatvom vehaalemanah asher visheareykha veakhelu veshaveu lemaan yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-maasheh yadekha asher taasheh {s}

Hebrew: מִקֵּ֥ץ שֶֽׁבַע־שָׁנִ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה שְׁמִטָּֽה׃
Translated: Every seventh year you shall practice remission of debts.
Transliteration: mikets sheva-shaniym taasheh shemitah

Hebrew: וְזֶה֮ דְּבַ֣ר הַשְּׁמִטָּה֒ שָׁמ֗וֹט כׇּל־בַּ֙עַל֙ מַשֵּׁ֣ה יָד֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַשֶּׁ֖ה בְּרֵעֵ֑הוּ לֹֽא־יִגֹּ֤שׂ אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ וְאֶת־אָחִ֔יו כִּֽי־קָרָ֥א שְׁמִטָּ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: This shall be the nature of the remission: all creditors shall remit the due that they claim from their fellow [Israelites]; they shall not dun their fellow [Israelites] or kin, for the remission proclaimed is of יהוה.
Transliteration: vezeh devar hashemitah shamvot khׇl-vaal masheh yadvo asher yasheh vereehu lo-yigosh et-reehu veet-achiyv khiy-kara shemitah layhovah

Hebrew: אֶת־הַנׇּכְרִ֖י תִּגֹּ֑שׂ וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ אֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ תַּשְׁמֵ֥ט יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You may dun the foreigner; but you must remit whatever is due you from your kin.
Transliteration: et-hanׇkheriy tigosh vaasher yiheyeh lekha et-achiykha tashemet yadekha

Hebrew: אֶ֕פֶס כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־בְּךָ֖ אֶבְי֑וֹן כִּֽי־בָרֵ֤ךְ יְבָֽרֶכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹֽתֵן־לְךָ֥ נַחֲלָ֖ה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: There shall be no needy among you—since your God יהוה will bless you in the land that your God יהוה is giving you as a hereditary portion—
Transliteration: efes khiy lo yiheyeh-vekha eveyvon khiy-varekhe yevarekhekha yehovah vaarets asher yehovah eloheykha noten-lekha nachalah lerishetah

Hebrew: רַ֚ק אִם־שָׁמ֣וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: if only you heed your God יהוה and take care to keep all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.
Transliteration: rak im-shamvoa tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor laashvot et-khׇl-hamitsevah hazot asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בֵּֽרַכְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְהַֽעֲבַטְתָּ֞ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֗ים וְאַתָּה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲבֹ֔ט וּמָֽשַׁלְתָּ֙ בְּגוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וּבְךָ֖ לֹ֥א יִמְשֹֽׁלוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: For your God יהוה will bless you as promised: you will extend loans to many nations, but require none yourself; you will dominate many nations, but they will not dominate you.
Transliteration: khiy-yehovah eloheykha verakhekha khaasher diver-lakhe vehaavateta gvoyim raviym veatah lo taavot umashaleta vegvoyim raviym uvekha lo yimesholu {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶה֩ בְךָ֨ אֶבְי֜וֹן מֵאַחַ֤ד אַחֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּאַ֨רְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ לֹ֧א תְאַמֵּ֣ץ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֗ וְלֹ֤א תִקְפֹּץ֙ אֶת־יָ֣דְךָ֔ מֵאָחִ֖יךָ הָאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
Translated: If, however, there is a needy person among you, one of your kin in any of your settlements in the land that your God יהוה is giving you, do not harden your heart and shut your hand against your needy kin.
Transliteration: khiy-yiheyeh vekha eveyvon meachad acheykha veachad sheareykha vearetsekha asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe lo teamets et-levavekha velo tikefots et-yadekha meachiykha haeveyvon

Hebrew: כִּֽי־פָתֹ֧חַ תִּפְתַּ֛ח אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ ל֑וֹ וְהַעֲבֵט֙ תַּעֲבִיטֶ֔נּוּ דֵּ֚י מַחְסֹר֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֶחְסַ֖ר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Rather, you must open your hand and lend whatever is sufficient to meet the need.
Transliteration: khiy-fatocha tifetach et-yadekha lvo vehaavet taaviytenu dey machesorvo asher yechesar lvo

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֣מֶר לְךָ֡ פֶּן־יִהְיֶ֣ה דָבָר֩ עִם־לְבָבְךָ֨ בְלִיַּ֜עַל לֵאמֹ֗ר קָֽרְבָ֣ה שְׁנַֽת־הַשֶּׁ֘בַע֮ שְׁנַ֣ת הַשְּׁמִטָּה֒ וְרָעָ֣ה עֵֽינְךָ֗ בְּאָחִ֙יךָ֙ הָֽאֶבְי֔וֹן וְלֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן ל֑וֹ וְקָרָ֤א עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
Translated: Beware lest you harbor the base thought, “The seventh year, the year of remission, is approaching,” so that you are mean and give nothing to your needy kin—who will cry out to יהוה against you, and you will incur guilt.
Transliteration: hishamer lekha fen-yiheyeh davar im-levavekha veliyaal lemor karevah shenat-hasheva shenat hashemitah veraah eynekha veachiykha haeveyvon velo titen lvo vekara aleykha el-yehovah vehayah vekha chete

Hebrew: נָת֤וֹן תִּתֵּן֙ ל֔וֹ וְלֹא־יֵרַ֥ע לְבָבְךָ֖ בְּתִתְּךָ֣ ל֑וֹ כִּ֞י בִּגְלַ֣ל ׀ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇֽל־מַעֲשֶׂ֔ךָ וּבְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Give readily and have no regrets when you do so, for in return your God יהוה will bless you in all your efforts and in all your undertakings.
Transliteration: natvon titen lvo velo-eira levavekha vetitekha lvo khiy vigelal hadavar hazeh yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-maashekha uvekhol mishelach yadekha

Hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹא־יֶחְדַּ֥ל אֶבְי֖וֹן מִקֶּ֣רֶב הָאָ֑רֶץ עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר פָּ֠תֹ֠חַ תִּפְתַּ֨ח אֶת־יָדְךָ֜ לְאָחִ֧יךָ לַעֲנִיֶּ֛ךָ וּלְאֶבְיֹנְךָ֖ בְּאַרְצֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: For there will never cease to be needy ones in your land, which is why I command you: open your hand to the poor and needy kin in your land.
Transliteration: khiy lo-yechedal eveyvon mikerev haarets al-khen anokhiy metsavekha lemor fatocha tifetach et-yadekha leachiykha laaniyekha uleeveyonekha vearetsekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּכֵ֨ר לְךָ֜ אָחִ֣יךָ הָֽעִבְרִ֗י א֚וֹ הָֽעִבְרִיָּ֔ה וַעֲבָֽדְךָ֖ שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וּבַשָּׁנָה֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ת תְּשַׁלְּחֶ֥נּוּ חׇפְשִׁ֖י מֵעִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: If a fellow Hebrew man—or woman—is sold to you, he shall serve you six years, and in the seventh year you shall set him free.
Transliteration: khiy-yimakher lekha achiykha haiveriy vo haiveriyah vaavadekha shesh shaniym uvashanah hasheviyit teshalechenu chׇfeshiy meimakhe

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תְשַׁלְּחֶ֥נּוּ חׇפְשִׁ֖י מֵֽעִמָּ֑ךְ לֹ֥א תְשַׁלְּחֶ֖נּוּ רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated: When you set him free, do not let him go empty-handed:
Transliteration: vekhiy-teshalechenu chׇfeshiy meimakhe lo teshalechenu reykam

Hebrew: הַעֲנֵ֤יק תַּעֲנִיק֙ ל֔וֹ מִצֹּ֣אנְךָ֔ וּמִֽגׇּרְנְךָ֖ וּמִיִּקְבֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֧ר בֵּרַכְךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ תִּתֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Furnish him out of the flock, threshing floor, and vat, with which your God יהוה has blessed you.
Transliteration: haaneyk taaniyk lvo mitsonekha umigׇrenekha umiyikevekha asher verakhekha yehovah eloheykha titen-lvo

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֗ כִּ֣י עֶ֤בֶד הָיִ֙יתָ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Bear in mind that you were slaves in the land of Egypt and your God יהוה redeemed you; therefore I enjoin this commandment upon you today.
Transliteration: vezakhareta khiy eved hayiyta veerets mitserayiim vayifedekha yehovah eloheykha al-khen anokhiy metsavekha et-hadavar hazeh hayyvom

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־יֹאמַ֣ר אֵלֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א אֵצֵ֖א מֵעִמָּ֑ךְ כִּ֤י אֲהֵֽבְךָ֙ וְאֶת־בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ כִּי־ט֥וֹב ל֖וֹ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: But should he say to you, “I do not want to leave you”—for he loves you and your household and is happy with you—
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yomar eleykha lo etse meimakhe khiy ahevekha veet-veytekha khiy-tvov lvo imakhe

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ אֶת־הַמַּרְצֵ֗עַ וְנָתַתָּ֤ה בְאׇזְנוֹ֙ וּבַדֶּ֔לֶת וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ עֶ֣בֶד עוֹלָ֑ם וְאַ֥ף לַאֲמָתְךָ֖ תַּעֲשֶׂה־כֵּֽן׃
Translated: you shall take an awl and put it through his ear into the door, and he shall become your slave in perpetuity. Do the same with your female slave.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-hamaretsea venatatah veׇzenvo uvadelet vehayah lekha eved volam veaf laamatekha taasheh-khen

Hebrew: לֹא־יִקְשֶׁ֣ה בְעֵינֶ֗ךָ בְּשַׁלֵּֽחֲךָ֨ אֹת֤וֹ חׇפְשִׁי֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ כִּ֗י מִשְׁנֶה֙ שְׂכַ֣ר שָׂכִ֔יר עֲבָֽדְךָ֖ שֵׁ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֑ים וּבֵֽרַכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: When you do set either one free, do not feel aggrieved; for in the six years you have been given double the service of a hired worker. Moreover, your God יהוה will bless you in all you do.
Transliteration: lo-yikesheh veeynekha veshalechakha otvo chׇfeshiy meimakhe khiy misheneh shekhar shakhiyr avadekha shesh shaniym uverakhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol asher taasheh {f}

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַבְּכ֡וֹר אֲשֶׁר֩ יִוָּלֵ֨ד בִּבְקָרְךָ֤ וּבְצֹֽאנְךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר תַּקְדִּ֖ישׁ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ לֹ֤א תַעֲבֹד֙ בִּבְכֹ֣ר שׁוֹרֶ֔ךָ וְלֹ֥א תָגֹ֖ז בְּכ֥וֹר צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You shall consecrate to your God יהוה all male firstlings that are born in your herd and in your flock: you must not work your firstling ox or shear your firstling sheep.
Transliteration: khׇl-havekhvor asher yivaled vivekarekha uvetsonekha hazakhar takediysh layhovah eloheykha lo taavod vivekhor shvorekha velo tagoz vekhvor tsonekha

Hebrew: לִפְנֵי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֤יךָ תֹאכְלֶ֙נּוּ֙ שָׁנָ֣ה בְשָׁנָ֔ה בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אַתָּ֖ה וּבֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You and your household shall eat it annually before your God יהוה in the place that יהוה will choose.
Transliteration: lifeney yehovah eloheykha tokhelenu shanah veshanah vamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah atah uveytekha

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֨ה ב֜וֹ מ֗וּם פִּסֵּ֙חַ֙ א֣וֹ עִוֵּ֔ר כֹּ֖ל מ֣וּם רָ֑ע לֹ֣א תִזְבָּחֶ֔נּוּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But if it has a defect, lameness or blindness, any serious defect, you shall not sacrifice it to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yiheyeh vvo mum fisecha vo iver khol mum ra lo tizevachenu layhovah eloheykha

Hebrew: בִּשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ הַטָּמֵ֤א וְהַטָּהוֹר֙ יַחְדָּ֔ו כַּצְּבִ֖י וְכָאַיָּֽל׃
Translated: Eat it in your settlements, the impure among you no less than the pure, just like the gazelle and the deer.
Transliteration: visheareykha tokhelenu hatame vehatahvor yachedav khatseviy vekhaayal

Hebrew: רַ֥ק אֶת־דָּמ֖וֹ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑ל עַל־הָאָ֥רֶץ תִּשְׁפְּכֶ֖נּוּ כַּמָּֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: Only you must not partake of its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground like water.
Transliteration: rak et-damvo lo tokhel al-haarets tishefekhenu khamayiim {f}

Hebrew: שָׁמוֹר֙ אֶת־חֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאָבִ֔יב וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ פֶּ֔סַח לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֞י בְּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽאָבִ֗יב הוֹצִ֨יאֲךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: Observe the month of Abib and offer a passover sacrifice to your God יהוה, for it was in the month of Abib, at night, that your God יהוה freed you from Egypt.
Transliteration: shamvor et-chodesh haaviyv veashiyta fesach layhovah eloheykha khiy vechodesh haaviyv hvotsiyakha yehovah eloheykha mimitserayiim layelah

Hebrew: וְזָבַ֥חְתָּ פֶּ֛סַח לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ צֹ֣אן וּבָקָ֑ר בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: You shall slaughter the passover sacrifice for your God יהוה, from the flock and the herd, in the place where יהוה will choose to establish the divine name.
Transliteration: vezavacheta fesach layhovah eloheykha tson uvakar vamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah leshakhen shemvo sham

Hebrew: לֹא־תֹאכַ֤ל עָלָיו֙ חָמֵ֔ץ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֛ים תֹּֽאכַל־עָלָ֥יו מַצּ֖וֹת לֶ֣חֶם עֹ֑נִי כִּ֣י בְחִפָּז֗וֹן יָצָ֙אתָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לְמַ֣עַן תִּזְכֹּ֗ר אֶת־י֤וֹם צֵֽאתְךָ֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall not eat anything leavened with it; for seven days thereafter you shall eat unleavened bread, bread of distress—for you departed from the land of Egypt hurriedly—so that you may remember the day of your departure from the land of Egypt as long as you live.
Transliteration: lo-tokhal alayv chamets shiveat yamiym tokhal-alayv matsvot lechem oniy khiy vechifazvon yatsata meerets mitserayiim lemaan tizekhor et-yvom tsetekha meerets mitserayiim khol yemey chayeykha

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יֵרָאֶ֨ה לְךָ֥ שְׂאֹ֛ר בְּכׇל־גְּבֻלְךָ֖ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְלֹא־יָלִ֣ין מִן־הַבָּשָׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּזְבַּ֥ח בָּעֶ֛רֶב בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: For seven days no leaven shall be found with you in all your territory, and none of the flesh of what you slaughter on the evening of the first day shall be left until morning.
Transliteration: velo-eiraeh lekha sheor vekhׇl-gevulekha shiveat yamiym velo-yaliyn min-havashar asher tizevach vaerev vayyvom harishvon lavoker

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לִזְבֹּ֣חַ אֶת־הַפָּ֑סַח בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
Translated: You are not permitted to slaughter the passover sacrifice in any of the settlements that your God יהוה is giving you;
Transliteration: lo tukhal lizevocha et-hafasach veachad sheareykha asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe

Hebrew: כִּ֠י אִֽם־אֶל־הַמָּק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְשַׁכֵּ֣ן שְׁמ֔וֹ שָׁ֛ם תִּזְבַּ֥ח אֶת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בָּעָ֑רֶב כְּב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ מוֹעֵ֖ד צֵֽאתְךָ֥ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: but at the place where your God יהוה will choose to establish the divine name, there alone shall you slaughter the passover sacrifice, in the evening, at sundown, the time of day when you departed from Egypt.
Transliteration: khiy im-el-hamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah eloheykha leshakhen shemvo sham tizevach et-hafesach vaarev khevvo hashemesh mvoed tsetekha mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וּבִשַּׁלְתָּ֙ וְאָ֣כַלְתָּ֔ בַּמָּק֕וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּ֑וֹ וּפָנִ֣יתָ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ לְאֹהָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall cook and eat it at the place that your God יהוה will choose; and in the morning you may start back on your journey home.
Transliteration: uvishaleta veakhaleta vamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha vvo ufaniyta vavoker vehalakheta leohaleykha

Hebrew: שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים תֹּאכַ֣ל מַצּ֑וֹת וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י עֲצֶ֙רֶת֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה מְלָאכָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: After eating unleavened bread six days, you shall hold a solemn gathering for your God יהוה on the seventh day: you shall do no work.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym tokhal matsvot uvayyvom hasheviyiy atseret layhovah eloheykha lo taasheh melakhah {s}

Hebrew: שִׁבְעָ֥ה שָׁבֻעֹ֖ת תִּסְפׇּר־לָ֑ךְ מֵהָחֵ֤ל חֶרְמֵשׁ֙ בַּקָּמָ֔ה תָּחֵ֣ל לִסְפֹּ֔ר שִׁבְעָ֖ה שָׁבֻעֽוֹת׃
Translated: You shall count off seven weeks; start to count the seven weeks when the sickle is first put to the standing grain.
Transliteration: shiveah shavuot tisefׇr-lakhe mehachel cheremesh vakamah tachel lisefor shiveah shavuvot

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֜יתָ חַ֤ג שָׁבֻעוֹת֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מִסַּ֛ת נִדְבַ֥ת יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֵּ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יְבָרֶכְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then you shall observe the Feast of Weeks for your God יהוה, offering your freewill contribution according as your God יהוה has blessed you.
Transliteration: veashiyta chag shavuvot layhovah eloheykha misat nidevat yadekha asher titen khaasher yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֞ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֣ וּבִתֶּ֘ךָ֮ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶ֒ךָ֒ וְהַלֵּוִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ וְהַגֵּ֛ר וְהַיָּת֥וֹם וְהָאַלְמָנָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבֶּ֑ךָ בַּמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: You shall rejoice before your God יהוה with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the [family of the] Levite in your communities, and the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your midst, at the place where your God יהוה will choose to establish the divine name.
Transliteration: veshamacheta lifeney yehovah eloheykha atah uvinekha uvitekha veavedekha vaamatekha vehaleviy asher visheareykha vehager vehayatvom vehaalemanah asher vekirevekha vamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha leshakhen shemvo sham

Hebrew: וְזָ֣כַרְתָּ֔ כִּי־עֶ֥בֶד הָיִ֖יתָ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ וְעָשִׂ֔יתָ אֶת־הַֽחֻקִּ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ {פ}
Translated: Bear in mind that you were slaves in Egypt, and take care to obey these laws.
Transliteration: vezakhareta khiy-eved hayiyta vemitserayiim veshamareta veashiyta et-hachukiym haeleh {f}

Hebrew: חַ֧ג הַסֻּכֹּ֛ת תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בְּאׇ֨סְפְּךָ֔ מִֽגׇּרְנְךָ֖ וּמִיִּקְבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: After the ingathering from your threshing floor and your vat, you shall hold the Feast of Booths for seven days.
Transliteration: chag hasukhot taasheh lekha shiveat yamiym veׇsefekha migׇrenekha umiyikevekha

Hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֖ בְּחַגֶּ֑ךָ אַתָּ֨ה וּבִנְךָ֤ וּבִתֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וַאֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וְהַלֵּוִ֗י וְהַגֵּ֛ר וְהַיָּת֥וֹם וְהָאַלְמָנָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall rejoice in your festival, with your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the [family of the] Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow in your communities.
Transliteration: veshamacheta vechagekha atah uvinekha uvitekha veavedekha vaamatekha vehaleviy vehager vehayatvom vehaalemanah asher visheareykha

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֗ים תָּחֹג֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֣י יְבָרֶכְךָ֞ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בְּכֹ֤ל תְּבוּאָֽתְךָ֙ וּבְכֹל֙ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֔יךָ וְהָיִ֖יתָ אַ֥ךְ שָׂמֵֽחַ׃
Translated: You shall hold a festival for your God יהוה seven days, in the place that יהוה will choose; for your God יהוה will bless all your crops and all your undertakings, and you shall have nothing but joy.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym tachog layhovah eloheykha vamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah khiy yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol tevuatekha uvekhol maasheh yadeykha vehayiyta akhe shamecha

Hebrew: שָׁל֣וֹשׁ פְּעָמִ֣ים ׀ בַּשָּׁנָ֡ה יֵרָאֶ֨ה כׇל־זְכוּרְךָ֜ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בַּמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִבְחָ֔ר בְּחַ֧ג הַמַּצּ֛וֹת וּבְחַ֥ג הַשָּׁבֻע֖וֹת וּבְחַ֣ג הַסֻּכּ֑וֹת וְלֹ֧א יֵרָאֶ֛ה אֶת־פְּנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated: Three times a year—on the Feast of Unleavened Bread, on the Feast of Weeks, and on the Feast of Booths—all your males shall appear before your God יהוה in the place that [God] will choose. They shall not appear before יהוה empty-handed,
Transliteration: shalvosh feamiym vashanah eiraeh khׇl-zekhurekha et-feney yehovah eloheykha vamakvom asher yivechar vechag hamatsvot uvechag hashavuvot uvechag hasukhvot velo eiraeh et-feney yehovah reykam

Hebrew: אִ֖ישׁ כְּמַתְּנַ֣ת יָד֑וֹ כְּבִרְכַּ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָֽתַן־לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: but each with his own gift, according to the blessing that your God יהוה has bestowed upon you.
Transliteration: iysh khematenat yadvo khevirekhat yehovah eloheykha asher natan-lakhe {s}

Hebrew: שֹׁפְטִ֣ים וְשֹֽׁטְרִ֗ים תִּֽתֶּן־לְךָ֙ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לִשְׁבָטֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁפְט֥וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם מִשְׁפַּט־צֶֽדֶק׃
Translated: You shall appoint magistrates and officials for your tribes, in all the settlements that your God יהוה is giving you, and they shall govern the people with due justice.
Transliteration: shofetiym veshoteriym titen-lekha vekhׇl-sheareykha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha lishevateykha veshafetu et-haam mishefat-tsedek

Hebrew: לֹא־תַטֶּ֣ה מִשְׁפָּ֔ט לֹ֥א תַכִּ֖יר פָּנִ֑ים וְלֹא־תִקַּ֣ח שֹׁ֔חַד כִּ֣י הַשֹּׁ֗חַד יְעַוֵּר֙ עֵינֵ֣י חֲכָמִ֔ים וִֽיסַלֵּ֖ף דִּבְרֵ֥י צַדִּיקִֽם׃
Translated: You shall not judge unfairly: you shall show no partiality; you shall not take bribes, for bribes blind the eyes of the discerning and upset the plea of the just.
Transliteration: lo-tateh mishefat lo takhiyr faniym velo-tikach shochad khiy hashochad yeaver eyney chakhamiym viysalef diverey tsadiykim

Hebrew: צֶ֥דֶק צֶ֖דֶק תִּרְדֹּ֑ף לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽחְיֶה֙ וְיָרַשְׁתָּ֣ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Justice, justice shall you pursue, that you may thrive and occupy the land that your God יהוה is giving you.
Transliteration: tsedek tsedek tiredof lemaan ticheyeh veyarasheta et-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִטַּ֥ע לְךָ֛ אֲשֵׁרָ֖ה כׇּל־עֵ֑ץ אֵ֗צֶל מִזְבַּ֛ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: You shall not set up a sacred post—any kind of pole beside the altar of your God יהוה that you may make—
Transliteration: lo-tita lekha asherah khׇl-ets etsel mizevach yehovah eloheykha asher taasheh-lakhe

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תָקִ֥ים לְךָ֖ מַצֵּבָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׂנֵ֖א יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: or erect a stone pillar; for such your God יהוה detests.
Transliteration: velo-takiym lekha matsevah asher shane yehovah eloheykha {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תִזְבַּח֩ לַיהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ שׁ֣וֹר וָשֶׂ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בוֹ֙ מ֔וּם כֹּ֖ל דָּבָ֣ר רָ֑ע כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not sacrifice to your God יהוה an ox or a sheep that has any defect of a serious kind, for that is abhorrent to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-tizevach layhovah eloheykha shvor vasheh asher yiheyeh vvo mum khol davar ra khiy tvoavat yehovah eloheykha hu {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּצֵ֤א בְקִרְבְּךָ֙ בְּאַחַ֣ד שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ אִ֣ישׁ אוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה אֶת־הָרַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָה־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לַעֲבֹ֥ר בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If there is found among you, in one of the settlements that your God יהוה is giving you, a man or woman who has affronted your God יהוה and transgressed the Covenant—
Transliteration: khiy-yimatse vekirevekha veachad sheareykha asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe iysh vo-ishah asher yaasheh et-hara veeyney yehovah-eloheykha laavor veriytvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיַּעֲבֹד֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לָהֶ֑ם וְלַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ ׀ א֣וֹ לַיָּרֵ֗חַ א֛וֹ לְכׇל־צְבָ֥א הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־צִוִּֽיתִי׃
Translated: turning to the worship of other gods and bowing down to them, to the sun or the moon or any of the heavenly host, something I never commanded—
Transliteration: vayelekhe vayaavod Elohim acheriym vayishetachu lahem velashemesh vo layarecha vo lekhׇl-tseva hashamayiim asher lo-tsiviytiy

Hebrew: וְהֻֽגַּד־לְךָ֖ וְשָׁמָ֑עְתָּ וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֣ הֵיטֵ֔ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֱמֶת֙ נָכ֣וֹן הַדָּבָ֔ר נֶעֶשְׂתָ֛ה הַתּוֹעֵבָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and you have been informed or have learned of it, then you shall make a thorough inquiry. If it is true, the fact is established, that abhorrent thing was perpetrated in Israel,
Transliteration: vehugad-lekha veshamaeta vedarasheta heytev vehineh emet nakhvon hadavar neeshetah hatvoevah hazot veyisherael

Hebrew: וְהֽוֹצֵאתָ֣ אֶת־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֡וּא אוֹ֩ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֨ה הַהִ֜וא אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָ֠שׂ֠וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֨ר הָרָ֤ע הַזֶּה֙ אֶל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ אֶת־הָאִ֕ישׁ א֖וֹ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וּסְקַלְתָּ֥ם בָּאֲבָנִ֖ים וָמֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: you shall take the man or the woman who did that wicked thing out to the public place, and you shall stone that man or woman to death.—
Transliteration: vehvotseta et-haiysh hahu vo et-haishah hahiv asher ashu et-hadavar hara hazeh el-sheareykha et-haiysh vo et-haishah usekaletam vaavaniym vametu

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ שְׁנַ֣יִם עֵדִ֗ים א֛וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה עֵדִ֖ים יוּמַ֣ת הַמֵּ֑ת לֹ֣א יוּמַ֔ת עַל־פִּ֖י עֵ֥ד אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: A person shall be put to death only on the testimony of two or more witnesses; no one shall be put to death on the testimony of a single witness.—
Transliteration: al-fiy shenayiim ediym vo sheloshah ediym yumat hamet lo yumat al-fiy ed echad

Hebrew: יַ֣ד הָעֵדִ֞ים תִּֽהְיֶה־בּ֤וֹ בָרִאשֹׁנָה֙ לַהֲמִית֔וֹ וְיַ֥ד כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם בָּאַחֲרֹנָ֑ה וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: Let the hands of the witnesses be the first to put [the condemned] to death, followed by the hands of the rest of the people. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
Transliteration: yad haediym tiheyeh-vvo varishonah lahamiytvo veyad khׇl-haam vaacharonah uviareta hara mikirevekha {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יִפָּלֵא֩ מִמְּךָ֨ דָבָ֜ר לַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט בֵּֽין־דָּ֨ם <small>׀</small> לְדָ֜ם בֵּֽין־דִּ֣ין לְדִ֗ין וּבֵ֥ין נֶ֙גַע֙ לָנֶ֔גַע דִּבְרֵ֥י רִיבֹ֖ת בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ וְקַמְתָּ֣ וְעָלִ֔יתָ אֶ֨ל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If a case is too baffling for you to decide, be it a controversy over homicide, civil law, or assault—matters of dispute in your courts—you shall promptly repair to the place that your God יהוה will have chosen,
Transliteration: khiy yifale mimekha davar lamishefat veyn-dam <small></small> ledam veyn-diyn lediyn uveyn nega lanega diverey riyvot visheareykha vekameta vealiyta el-hamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha vvo

Hebrew: וּבָאתָ֗ אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִים֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְאֶ֨ל־הַשֹּׁפֵ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֑ם וְדָרַשְׁתָּ֙ וְהִגִּ֣ידוּ לְךָ֔ אֵ֖ת דְּבַ֥ר הַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: and appear before the levitical priests, or the magistrate in charge at the time, and present your problem. When they have announced to you the verdict in the case,
Transliteration: uvata el-hakhohaniym haleviyim veel-hashofet asher yiheyeh vayamiym hahem vedarasheta vehigiydu lekha et devar hamishefat

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֗יתָ עַל־פִּ֤י הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַגִּ֣ידֽוּ לְךָ֔ מִן־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִבְחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֣ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹרֽוּךָ׃
Translated: you shall carry out the verdict that is announced to you from that place that יהוה chose, observing scrupulously all their instructions to you.
Transliteration: veashiyta al-fiy hadavar asher yagiydu lekha min-hamakvom hahu asher yivechar yehovah veshamareta laashvot khekhol asher yvorukha

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֨י הַתּוֹרָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יוֹר֗וּךָ וְעַל־הַמִּשְׁפָּ֛ט אֲשֶׁר־יֹאמְר֥וּ לְךָ֖ תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה לֹ֣א תָס֗וּר מִן־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־יַגִּ֥ידֽוּ לְךָ֖ יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאל׃
Translated: You shall act in accordance with the instructions given you and the ruling handed down to you; you must not deviate from the verdict that they announce to you either to the right or to the left.
Transliteration: al-fiy hatvorah asher yvorukha veal-hamishefat asher-yomeru lekha taasheh lo tasur min-hadavar asher-yagiydu lekha yamiyn ushemol

Hebrew: וְהָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה בְזָד֗וֹן לְבִלְתִּ֨י שְׁמֹ֤עַ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵן֙ הָעֹמֵ֞ד לְשָׁ֤רֶת שָׁם֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ א֖וֹ אֶל־הַשֹּׁפֵ֑ט וּמֵת֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Should either party [to the dispute] act presumptuously and disregard the priest charged with serving there your God יהוה, or the magistrate, that party shall die. Thus you will sweep out evil from Israel:
Transliteration: vehaiysh asher-yaasheh vezadvon leviletiy shemoa el-hakhohen haomed lesharet sham et-yehovah eloheykha vo el-hashofet umet haiysh hahu uviareta hara miyisherael

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם יִשְׁמְע֣וּ וְיִרָ֑אוּ וְלֹ֥א יְזִיד֖וּן עֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated: all the people will hear and be afraid and will not act presumptuously again.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haam yishemeu veyirau velo yeziydun vod {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣א אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֔ךְ וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֖הּ וְיָשַׁ֣בְתָּה בָּ֑הּ וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ אָשִׂ֤ימָה עָלַי֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ כְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סְבִיבֹתָֽי׃
Translated: If, after you have entered the land that your God יהוה has assigned to you, and taken possession of it and settled in it, you decide, “I will set a king over me, as do all the nations about me,”
Transliteration: khiy-tavo el-haarets asher yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe viyrishetah veyashavetah vah veamareta ashiymah alay melekhe khekhׇl-hagvoyim asher seviyvotay

Hebrew: שׂ֣וֹם תָּשִׂ֤ים עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בּ֑וֹ מִקֶּ֣רֶב אַחֶ֗יךָ תָּשִׂ֤ים עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ מֶ֔לֶךְ לֹ֣א תוּכַ֗ל לָתֵ֤ת עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אִ֣ישׁ נׇכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־אָחִ֖יךָ הֽוּא׃
Translated: you shall be free to set a king over yourself, one chosen by your God יהוה. Be sure to set as king over yourself one of your own people; you must not set a foreigner over you, one who is not your kin.
Transliteration: shvom tashiym aleykha melekhe asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha vvo mikerev acheykha tashiym aleykha melekhe lo tukhal latet aleykha iysh nׇkheriy asher lo-achiykha hu

Hebrew: רַק֮ לֹא־יַרְבֶּה־לּ֣וֹ סוּסִים֒ וְלֹֽא־יָשִׁ֤יב אֶת־הָעָם֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה לְמַ֖עַן הַרְבּ֣וֹת ס֑וּס וַֽיהֹוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר לָכֶ֔ם לֹ֣א תֹסִפ֗וּן לָשׁ֛וּב בַּדֶּ֥רֶךְ הַזֶּ֖ה עֽוֹד׃
Translated: Moreover, he shall not keep many horses or send people back to Egypt to add to his horses, since יהוה has warned you, “You must not go back that way again.”
Transliteration: rak lo-yareveh-lvo susiym velo-yashiyv et-haam mitserayemah lemaan harevvot sus vayhovah amar lakhem lo tosifun lashuv vaderekhe hazeh vod

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יַרְבֶּה־לּוֹ֙ נָשִׁ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָס֖וּר לְבָב֑וֹ וְכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב לֹ֥א יַרְבֶּה־לּ֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: And he shall not have many wives, lest his heart go astray; nor shall he amass silver and gold to excess.
Transliteration: velo yareveh-lvo nashiym velo yasur levavvo vekhesef vezahav lo yareveh-lvo meod

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה כְשִׁבְתּ֔וֹ עַ֖ל כִּסֵּ֣א מַמְלַכְתּ֑וֹ וְכָ֨תַב ל֜וֹ אֶת־מִשְׁנֵ֨ה הַתּוֹרָ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ עַל־סֵ֔פֶר מִלִּפְנֵ֖י הַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: When he is seated on his royal throne, he shall have a copy of this Teaching written for him on a scroll by the levitical priests.
Transliteration: vehayah kheshivetvo al khise mamelakhetvo vekhatav lvo et-misheneh hatvorah hazot al-sefer milifeney hakhohaniym haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֣ה עִמּ֔וֹ וְקָ֥רָא ב֖וֹ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑יו לְמַ֣עַן יִלְמַ֗ד לְיִרְאָה֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔יו לִ֠שְׁמֹ֠ר אֶֽת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֞י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את וְאֶת־הַחֻקִּ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לַעֲשֹׂתָֽם׃
Translated: Let it remain with him and let him read in it all his life, so that he may learn to revere his God יהוה, to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching as well as these laws.
Transliteration: vehayetah imvo vekara vvo khׇl-yemey chayayv lemaan yilemad leyireah et-yehovah elohayv lishemor et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot veet-hachukiym haeleh laashotam

Hebrew: לְבִלְתִּ֤י רוּם־לְבָבוֹ֙ מֵֽאֶחָ֔יו וּלְבִלְתִּ֛י ס֥וּר מִן־הַמִּצְוָ֖ה יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לְמַ֩עַן֩ יַאֲרִ֨יךְ יָמִ֧ים עַל־מַמְלַכְתּ֛וֹ ה֥וּא וּבָנָ֖יו בְּקֶ֥רֶב יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus he will not act haughtily toward his fellows or deviate from the Instruction to the right or to the left, to the end that he and his descendants may reign long in the midst of Israel.
Transliteration: leviletiy rum-levavvo meechayv uleviletiy sur min-hamitsevah yamiyn ushemovl lemaan yaariykhe yamiym al-mamelakhetvo hu uvanayv vekerev yisherael {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִ֠הְיֶ֠ה לַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם כׇּל־שֵׁ֧בֶט לֵוִ֛י חֵ֥לֶק וְנַחֲלָ֖ה עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִשֵּׁ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה וְנַחֲלָת֖וֹ יֹאכֵלֽוּן׃
Translated: The levitical priests, the whole tribe of Levi, shall have no territorial portion with Israel. They shall live only off יהוה’s offerings by fire as their portion,
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh lakhohaniym haleviyim khׇl-shevet leviy chelek venachalah im-yisherael ishey yehovah venachalatvo yokhelun

Hebrew: וְנַחֲלָ֥ה לֹא־יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ בְּקֶ֣רֶב אֶחָ֑יו יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: and shall have no portion among their brother tribes: יהוה is their portion, as promised.
Transliteration: venachalah lo-yiheyeh-lvo vekerev echayv yehovah hu nachalatvo khaasher diver-lvo {s}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֡ה יִהְיֶה֩ מִשְׁפַּ֨ט הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים מֵאֵ֣ת הָעָ֗ם מֵאֵ֛ת זֹבְחֵ֥י הַזֶּ֖בַח אִם־שׁ֣וֹר אִם־שֶׂ֑ה וְנָתַן֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן הַזְּרֹ֥עַ וְהַלְּחָיַ֖יִם וְהַקֵּבָֽה׃
Translated: This then shall be the priests’ due from the people: Everyone who offers a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep, must give the shoulder, the cheeks, and the stomach to the priest.
Transliteration: vezeh yiheyeh mishefat hakhohaniym meet haam meet zovechey hazevach im-shvor im-sheh venatan lakhohen hazeroa vehalechayayiim vehakevah

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁ֨ית דְּגָֽנְךָ֜ תִּירֹשְׁךָ֣ וְיִצְהָרֶ֗ךָ וְרֵאשִׁ֛ית גֵּ֥ז צֹאנְךָ֖ תִּתֶּן־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall also give him the first fruits of your new grain and wine and oil, and the first shearing of your sheep.
Transliteration: reshiyt deganekha tiyroshekha veyitseharekha vereshiyt gez tsonekha titen-lvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ב֗וֹ בָּחַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִכׇּל־שְׁבָטֶ֑יךָ לַעֲמֹ֨ד לְשָׁרֵ֧ת בְּשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֛ה ה֥וּא וּבָנָ֖יו כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: For your God יהוה has chosen him and his descendants, out of all your tribes, to be in attendance for service in the name of יהוה for all time.
Transliteration: khiy vvo vachar yehovah eloheykha mikhׇl-shevateykha laamod lesharet veshem-yehovah hu uvanayv khׇl-hayamiym {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָבֹ֨א הַלֵּוִ֜י מֵאַחַ֤ד שְׁעָרֶ֙יךָ֙ מִכׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־ה֖וּא גָּ֣ר שָׁ֑ם וּבָא֙ בְּכׇל־אַוַּ֣ת נַפְשׁ֔וֹ אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: If a Levite would go, from any of the settlements throughout Israel where he has been residing, to the place that יהוה has chosen, he may do so whenever he pleases.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yavo haleviy meachad sheareykha mikhׇl-yisherael asher-hu gar sham uva vekhׇl-avat nafeshvo el-hamakvom asher-yivechar yehovah

Hebrew: וְשֵׁרֵ֕ת בְּשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו כְּכׇל־אֶחָיו֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם הָעֹמְדִ֥ים שָׁ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He may serve in the name of his God יהוה like all his fellow Levites who are there in attendance before יהוה.
Transliteration: vesheret veshem yehovah elohayv khekhׇl-echayv haleviyim haomediym sham lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: חֵ֥לֶק כְּחֵ֖לֶק יֹאכֵ֑לוּ לְבַ֥ד מִמְכָּרָ֖יו עַל־הָאָבֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: They shall receive equal shares of the dues, without regard to personal gifts or patrimonies.
Transliteration: chelek khechelek yokhelu levad mimekharayv al-haavvot {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ בָּ֣א אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ לֹֽא־תִלְמַ֣ד לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּתוֹעֲבֹ֖ת הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָהֵֽם׃
Translated: When you enter the land that your God יהוה is giving you, you shall not learn to imitate the abhorrent practices of those nations.
Transliteration: khiy atah va el-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe lo-tilemad laashvot khetvoavot hagvoyim hahem

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִמָּצֵ֣א בְךָ֔ מַעֲבִ֥יר בְּנֽוֹ־וּבִתּ֖וֹ בָּאֵ֑שׁ קֹסֵ֣ם קְסָמִ֔ים מְעוֹנֵ֥ן וּמְנַחֵ֖שׁ וּמְכַשֵּֽׁף׃
Translated: Let no one be found among you who consigns a son or daughter to the fire, or who is an augur, a soothsayer, a diviner, a sorcerer,
Transliteration: lo-yimatse vekha maaviyr venvo-uvitvo vaesh kosem kesamiym mevonen umenachesh umekhashef

Hebrew: וְחֹבֵ֖ר חָ֑בֶר וְשֹׁאֵ֥ל אוֹב֙ וְיִדְּעֹנִ֔י וְדֹרֵ֖שׁ אֶל־הַמֵּתִֽים׃
Translated: one who casts spells, or one who consults ghosts or familiar spirits, or one who inquires of the dead.
Transliteration: vechover chaver veshoel vov veyideoniy vedoresh el-hametiym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תוֹעֲבַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה כׇּל־עֹ֣שֵׂה אֵ֑לֶּה וּבִגְלַל֙ הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔לֶּה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ מוֹרִ֥ישׁ אוֹתָ֖ם מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: For anyone who does such things is abhorrent to יהוה, and it is because of these abhorrent things that your God יהוה is dispossessing them before you.
Transliteration: khiy-tvoavat yehovah khׇl-osheh eleh uvigelal hatvoevot haeleh yehovah eloheykha mvoriysh votam mifaneykha

Hebrew: תָּמִ֣ים תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה עִ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You must be wholehearted with your God יהוה.
Transliteration: tamiym tiheyeh im yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ יוֹרֵ֣שׁ אוֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מְעֹנְנִ֥ים וְאֶל־קֹסְמִ֖ים יִשְׁמָ֑עוּ וְאַתָּ֕ה לֹ֣א כֵ֔ן נָ֥תַן לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Those nations that you are about to dispossess do indeed resort to soothsayers and augurs; to you, however, your God יהוה has not assigned the like.
Transliteration: khiy hagvoyim haeleh asher atah yvoresh votam el-meoneniym veel-kosemiym yishemau veatah lo khen natan lekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: נָבִ֨יא מִקִּרְבְּךָ֤ מֵאַחֶ֙יךָ֙ כָּמֹ֔נִי יָקִ֥ים לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ אֵלָ֖יו תִּשְׁמָעֽוּן׃
Translated: From among your own people, your God יהוה will raise up for you a prophet like myself; that is whom you shall heed.
Transliteration: naviy mikirevekha meacheykha khamoniy yakiym lekha yehovah eloheykha elayv tishemaun

Hebrew: כְּכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁאַ֜לְתָּ מֵעִ֨ם יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּחֹרֵ֔ב בְּי֥וֹם הַקָּהָ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר לֹ֣א אֹסֵ֗ף לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ אֶת־קוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י וְאֶת־הָאֵ֨שׁ הַגְּדֹלָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את לֹֽא־אֶרְאֶ֥ה ע֖וֹד וְלֹ֥א אָמֽוּת׃
Translated: This is just what you asked of your God יהוה at Horeb, on the day of the Assembly, saying, “Let me not hear the voice of my God יהוה any longer or see this wondrous fire any more, lest I die.”
Transliteration: khekhol asher-shaaleta meim yehovah eloheykha vechorev veyvom hakahal lemor lo osef lishemoa et-kvol yehovah elohay veet-haesh hagedolah hazot lo-ereeh vod velo amut

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י הֵיטִ֖יבוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽרוּ׃
Translated: Whereupon יהוה said to me, “They have done well in speaking thus.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay heytiyvu asher diveru

Hebrew: נָבִ֨יא אָקִ֥ים לָהֶ֛ם מִקֶּ֥רֶב אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם כָּמ֑וֹךָ וְנָתַתִּ֤י דְבָרַי֙ בְּפִ֔יו וְדִבֶּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲצַוֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: I will raise up for them from among their own people a prophet like yourself, in whose mouth I will put My words and who will speak to them all that I command;
Transliteration: naviy akiym lahem mikerev acheyhem khamvokha venatatiy devaray vefiyv vediver aleyhem et khׇl-asher atsavenu

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־יִשְׁמַע֙ אֶל־דְּבָרַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְדַבֵּ֖ר בִּשְׁמִ֑י אָנֹכִ֖י אֶדְרֹ֥שׁ מֵעִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and anybody who fails to heed the words [the prophet] speaks in My name, I Myself will call to account.
Transliteration: vehayah haiysh asher lo-yishema el-devaray asher yedaver vishemiy anokhiy ederosh meimvo

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ הַנָּבִ֡יא אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָזִיד֩ לְדַבֵּ֨ר דָּבָ֜ר בִּשְׁמִ֗י אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־צִוִּיתִיו֙ לְדַבֵּ֔ר וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יְדַבֵּ֔ר בְּשֵׁ֖ם אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֑ים וּמֵ֖ת הַנָּבִ֥יא הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: But any prophet who presumes to speak in My name an oracle that I did not command to be uttered, or who speaks in the name of other gods—that prophet shall die.”
Transliteration: akhe hanaviy asher yaziyd ledaver davar vishemiy et asher lo-tsiviytiyv ledaver vaasher yedaver veshem Elohim acheriym umet hanaviy hahu

Hebrew: וְכִ֥י תֹאמַ֖ר בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ אֵיכָה֙ נֵדַ֣ע אֶת־הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־דִבְּר֖וֹ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And should you ask yourselves, “How can we know that the oracle was not spoken by יהוה?”—
Transliteration: vekhiy tomar vilevavekha eykhah neda et-hadavar asher lo-divervo yehovah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר֩ יְדַבֵּ֨ר הַנָּבִ֜יא בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֗ה וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה הַדָּבָר֙ וְלֹ֣א יָבֹ֔א ה֣וּא הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־דִבְּר֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּזָדוֹן֙ דִּבְּר֣וֹ הַנָּבִ֔יא לֹ֥א תָג֖וּר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: if the prophet speaks in the name of יהוה and the oracle does not come true, that oracle was not spoken by יהוה; the prophet has uttered it presumptuously: do not stand in dread of that person.
Transliteration: asher yedaver hanaviy veshem yehovah velo-yiheyeh hadavar velo yavo hu hadavar asher lo-divervo yehovah vezadvon divervo hanaviy lo tagur mimenu {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יַכְרִ֞ית יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ אֶת־אַרְצָ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֕ם וְיָשַׁבְתָּ֥ בְעָרֵיהֶ֖ם וּבְבָתֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When your God יהוה has cut down the nations whose land your God יהוה is assigning to you, and you have dispossessed them and settled in their towns and homes,
Transliteration: khiy-yakheriyt yehovah eloheykha et-hagvoyim asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha et-aretsam viyrishetam veyashaveta veareyhem uvevateyhem

Hebrew: שָׁל֥וֹשׁ עָרִ֖ים תַּבְדִּ֣יל לָ֑ךְ בְּת֣וֹךְ אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: you shall set aside three cities in the land that your God יהוה is giving you to possess.
Transliteration: shalvosh ariym tavediyl lakhe vetvokhe aretsekha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha lerishetah

Hebrew: תָּכִ֣ין לְךָ֮ הַדֶּ֒רֶךְ֒ וְשִׁלַּשְׁתָּ֙ אֶת־גְּב֣וּל אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַנְחִֽילְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהָיָ֕ה לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה כׇּל־רֹצֵֽחַ׃
Translated: You shall survey the distances, and divide into three parts the territory of the country that your God יהוה has allotted to you, so that any [man] who has killed someone may have a place to flee to.—
Transliteration: takhiyn lekha haderekhe veshilasheta et-gevul aretsekha asher yanechiylekha yehovah eloheykha vehayah lanus shamah khׇl-rotsecha

Hebrew: וְזֶה֙ דְּבַ֣ר הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־יָנ֥וּס שָׁ֖מָּה וָחָ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַכֶּ֤ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ בִּבְלִי־דַ֔עַת וְה֛וּא לֹא־שֹׂנֵ֥א ל֖וֹ מִתְּמֹ֥ל שִׁלְשֹֽׁם׃
Translated: Now this is the case of the killer who may flee there and live: one who has slain another unwittingly, without having been an enemy in the past.
Transliteration: vezeh devar harotsecha asher-yanus shamah vachay asher yakheh et-reehu viveliy-daat vehu lo-shone lvo mitemol shileshom

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁר֩ יָבֹ֨א אֶת־רֵעֵ֥הוּ בַיַּ֘עַר֮ לַחְטֹ֣ב עֵצִים֒ וְנִדְּחָ֨ה יָד֤וֹ בַגַּרְזֶן֙ לִכְרֹ֣ת הָעֵ֔ץ וְנָשַׁ֤ל הַבַּרְזֶל֙ מִן־הָעֵ֔ץ וּמָצָ֥א אֶת־רֵעֵ֖הוּ וָמֵ֑ת ה֗וּא יָנ֛וּס אֶל־אַחַ֥ת הֶעָרִים־הָאֵ֖לֶּה וָחָֽי׃
Translated: For instance, a man goes with another fellow into a grove to cut wood; as his hand swings the ax to cut down a tree, the ax-head flies off the handle and strikes the other so that he dies. That man shall flee to one of these cities and live.—
Transliteration: vaasher yavo et-reehu vayaar lachetov etsiym venidechah yadvo vagarezen likherot haets venashal havarezel min-haets umatsa et-reehu vamet hu yanus el-achat heariym-haeleh vachay

Hebrew: פֶּן־יִרְדֹּף֩ גֹּאֵ֨ל הַדָּ֜ם אַחֲרֵ֣י הָרֹצֵ֗חַ כִּי־יֵחַם֮ לְבָבוֹ֒ וְהִשִּׂיג֛וֹ כִּֽי־יִרְבֶּ֥ה הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ וְהִכָּ֣הוּ נָ֑פֶשׁ וְלוֹ֙ אֵ֣ין מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֔וֶת כִּ֠י לֹ֣א שֹׂנֵ֥א ה֛וּא ל֖וֹ מִתְּמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
Translated: Otherwise, when the distance is great, the blood-avenger, pursuing the killer in hot anger, may overtake him and strike him down; yet he did not incur the death penalty, since he had never been the other’s enemy.
Transliteration: fen-yiredof goel hadam acharey harotsecha khiy-eicham levavvo vehishiygvo khiy-yireveh haderekhe vehikhahu nafesh velvo eyn mishefat-mavet khiy lo shone hu lvo mitemvol shileshvom

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֛ן אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁלֹ֥שׁ עָרִ֖ים תַּבְדִּ֥יל לָֽךְ׃
Translated: That is why I command you: set aside three cities.
Transliteration: al-khen anokhiy metsavekha lemor shalosh ariym tavediyl lakhe

Hebrew: וְאִם־יַרְחִ֞יב יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־גְּבֻ֣לְךָ֔ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְנָ֤תַן לְךָ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר לָתֵ֥ת לַאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And when your God יהוה enlarges your territory, as was sworn to your fathers, and gives you all the land that was promised to be given to your fathers—
Transliteration: veim-yarechiyv yehovah eloheykha et-gevulekha khaasher nisheva laavoteykha venatan lekha et-khׇl-haarets asher diver latet laavoteykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִשְׁמֹר֩ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֨ה הַזֹּ֜את לַעֲשֹׂתָ֗הּ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוְּךָ֮ הַיּוֹם֒ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ וְלָלֶ֥כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֖יו כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֑ים וְיָסַפְתָּ֨ לְךָ֥ עוֹד֙ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ עָרִ֔ים עַ֖ל הַשָּׁלֹ֥שׁ הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: if you faithfully observe all this Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day, to love your God יהוה and to walk in God’s ways at all times—then you shall add three more towns to those three.
Transliteration: khiy-tishemor et-khׇl-hamitsevah hazot laashotah asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom leahavah et-yehovah eloheykha velalekhet viderakhayv khׇl-hayamiym veyasafeta lekha vod shalosh ariym al hashalosh haeleh

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יִשָּׁפֵךְ֙ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֔י בְּקֶ֣רֶב אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה וְהָיָ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ דָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus blood of the innocent will not be shed, bringing bloodguilt upon you in the land that your God יהוה is allotting to you.
Transliteration: velo yishafekhe dam nakiy vekerev aretsekha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah vehayah aleykha damiym {f}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה אִישׁ֙ שֹׂנֵ֣א לְרֵעֵ֔הוּ וְאָ֤רַב לוֹ֙ וְקָ֣ם עָלָ֔יו וְהִכָּ֥הוּ נֶ֖פֶשׁ וָמֵ֑ת וְנָ֕ס אֶל־אַחַ֖ת הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽל׃
Translated: If, however, a man who is the enemy of another lies in wait and sets upon [the victim] and strikes a fatal blow and then flees to one of these towns,
Transliteration: vekhiy-yiheyeh iysh shone lereehu vearav lvo vekam alayv vehikhahu nefesh vamet venas el-achat heariym hael

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁלְחוּ֙ זִקְנֵ֣י עִיר֔וֹ וְלָקְח֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ מִשָּׁ֑ם וְנָתְנ֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ בְּיַ֛ד גֹּאֵ֥ל הַדָּ֖ם וָמֵֽת׃
Translated: the elders of his town shall have him brought back from there and shall hand him over to the blood-avenger to be put to death;
Transliteration: veshalechu zikeney iyrvo velakechu otvo misham venatenu otvo veyad goel hadam vamet

Hebrew: לֹא־תָח֥וֹס עֵֽינְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֧ דַֽם־הַנָּקִ֛י מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְט֥וֹב לָֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: you must show him no pity. Thus you will purge Israel of the blood of the innocent, and it will go well with you.
Transliteration: lo-tachvos eynekha alayv uviareta dam-hanakiy miyisherael vetvov lakhe {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֤א תַסִּיג֙ גְּב֣וּל רֵֽעֲךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר גָּבְל֖וּ רִאשֹׁנִ֑ים בְּנַחֲלָֽתְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּנְחַ֔ל בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not move your neighbor’s landmarks, set up by previous generations, in the property that will be allotted to you in the land that your God יהוה is giving you to possess.
Transliteration: lo tasiyg gevul reakha asher gavelu rishoniym venachalatekha asher tinechal vaarets asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha lerishetah {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָקוּם֩ עֵ֨ד אֶחָ֜ד בְּאִ֗ישׁ לְכׇל־עָוֺן֙ וּלְכׇל־חַטָּ֔את בְּכׇל־חֵ֖טְא אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֶֽחֱטָ֑א עַל־פִּ֣י ׀ שְׁנֵ֣י עֵדִ֗ים א֛וֹ עַל־פִּ֥י שְׁלֹשָֽׁה־עֵדִ֖ים יָק֥וּם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: A single witness may not validate against an [accused] party any guilt or blame for any offense that may be committed; a case can be valid only on the testimony of two witnesses or more.
Transliteration: lo-yakum ed echad veiysh lekhׇl-avon ulekhׇl-chatat vekhׇl-chete asher yecheta al-fiy sheney ediym vo al-fiy sheloshah-ediym yakum davar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָק֥וּם עֵד־חָמָ֖ס בְּאִ֑ישׁ לַעֲנ֥וֹת בּ֖וֹ סָרָֽה׃
Translated: If someone appears against another party to testify maliciously and gives incriminating yet false testimony,
Transliteration: khiy-yakum ed-chamas veiysh laanvot vvo sarah

Hebrew: וְעָמְד֧וּ שְׁנֵֽי־הָאֲנָשִׁ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־לָהֶ֥ם הָרִ֖יב לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לִפְנֵ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ וְהַשֹּׁ֣פְטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְי֖וּ בַּיָּמִ֥ים הָהֵֽם׃
Translated: the two parties to the dispute shall appear before יהוה, before the priests or magistrates in authority at the time,
Transliteration: veamedu sheney-haanashiym asher-lahem hariyv lifeney yehovah lifeney hakhohaniym vehashofetiym asher yiheyu vayamiym hahem

Hebrew: וְדָרְשׁ֥וּ הַשֹּׁפְטִ֖ים הֵיטֵ֑ב וְהִנֵּ֤ה עֵֽד־שֶׁ֙קֶר֙ הָעֵ֔ד שֶׁ֖קֶר עָנָ֥ה בְאָחִֽיו׃
Translated: and the magistrates shall make a thorough investigation. If the one who testified is a false witness, having testified falsely against a fellow Israelite,
Transliteration: vedareshu hashofetiym heytev vehineh ed-sheker haed sheker anah veachiyv

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂ֣יתֶם ל֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר זָמַ֖ם לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לְאָחִ֑יו וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: you shall do to the one as the one schemed to do to the other. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst;
Transliteration: vaashiytem lvo khaasher zamam laashvot leachiyv uviareta hara mikirevekha

Hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֖ים יִשְׁמְע֣וּ וְיִרָ֑אוּ וְלֹֽא־יֹסִ֨פוּ לַעֲשׂ֜וֹת ע֗וֹד כַּדָּבָ֥ר הָרָ֛ע הַזֶּ֖ה בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: others will hear and be afraid, and such evil things will not again be done in your midst.
Transliteration: vehanisheariym yishemeu veyirau velo-yosifu laashvot vod khadavar hara hazeh vekirevekha

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א תָח֖וֹס עֵינֶ֑ךָ נֶ֣פֶשׁ בְּנֶ֗פֶשׁ עַ֤יִן בְּעַ֙יִן֙ שֵׁ֣ן בְּשֵׁ֔ן יָ֥ד בְּיָ֖ד רֶ֥גֶל בְּרָֽגֶל׃ {ס}
Translated: Nor must you show pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
Transliteration: velo tachvos eynekha nefesh venefesh ayiin veayiin shen veshen yad veyad regel veragel {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֨א לַמִּלְחָמָ֜ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֗ךָ וְֽרָאִ֜יתָ ס֤וּס וָרֶ֙כֶב֙ עַ֚ם רַ֣ב מִמְּךָ֔ לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א מֵהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ הַמַּֽעַלְךָ֖ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: When you [an Israelite warrior] take the field against your enemies, and see horses and chariots—forces larger than yours—have no fear of them, for your God יהוה, who brought you from the land of Egypt, is with you.
Transliteration: khiy-tetse lamilechamah al-oyevekha veraiyta sus varekhev am rav mimekha lo tiyra mehem khiy-yehovah eloheykha imakhe hamaalekha meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה כְּקָֽרׇבְכֶ֖ם אֶל־הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְנִגַּ֥שׁ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְדִבֶּ֥ר אֶל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Before you join battle, the priest shall come forward and address the troops.
Transliteration: vehayah khekarׇvekhem el-hamilechamah venigash hakhohen vediver el-haam

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֤ר אֲלֵהֶם֙ שְׁמַ֣ע יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתֶּ֨ם קְרֵבִ֥ים הַיּ֛וֹם לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם אַל־יֵרַ֣ךְ לְבַבְכֶ֗ם אַל־תִּֽירְא֧וּ וְאַֽל־תַּחְפְּז֛וּ וְאַל־תַּֽעַרְצ֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: He shall say to them, “Hear, O Israel! You are about to join battle with your enemy. Let not your courage falter. Do not be in fear, or in panic, or in dread of them.
Transliteration: veamar alehem shema yisherael atem kereviym hayyvom lamilechamah al-oyeveykhem al-eirakhe levavekhem al-tiyreu veal-tachefezu veal-taaretsu mifeneyhem

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עִמָּכֶ֑ם לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם עִם־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֖ם לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: For it is your God יהוה who marches with you to do battle for you against your enemy, to bring you victory.”
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykhem haholekhe imakhem lehilachem lakhem im-oyeveykhem lehvoshiya etekhem

Hebrew: וְדִבְּר֣וּ הַשֹּֽׁטְרִים֮ אֶל־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹר֒ מִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנָ֤ה בַֽיִת־חָדָשׁ֙ וְלֹ֣א חֲנָכ֔וֹ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יַחְנְכֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Then the officials shall address the troops, as follows: “Is there anyone who has built a new house but has not dedicated it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another dedicate it.
Transliteration: vediveru hashoteriym el-haam lemor miy-haiysh asher vanah vayiit-chadash velo chanakhvo eilekhe veyashov leveytvo fen-yamut vamilechamah veiysh acher yachenekhenu

Hebrew: וּמִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־נָטַ֥ע כֶּ֙רֶם֙ וְלֹ֣א חִלְּל֔וֹ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יְחַלְּלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Is there anyone who has planted a vineyard but has never harvested it? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another harvest it.
Transliteration: umiy-haiysh asher-nata kherem velo chilelvo eilekhe veyashov leveytvo fen-yamut vamilechamah veiysh acher yechalelenu

Hebrew: וּמִֽי־הָאִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־אֵרַ֤שׂ אִשָּׁה֙ וְלֹ֣א לְקָחָ֔הּ יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ פֶּן־יָמוּת֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאִ֥ישׁ אַחֵ֖ר יִקָּחֶֽנָּה׃
Translated: Is there anyone who has paid the bride-price for a wife, but who has not yet taken her [into his household]? Let him go back to his home, lest he die in battle and another take her [into his household as his wife].”
Transliteration: umiy-haiysh asher-erash ishah velo lekachah eilekhe veyashov leveytvo fen-yamut vamilechamah veiysh acher yikachenah

Hebrew: וְיָסְפ֣וּ הַשֹּׁטְרִים֮ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־הָעָם֒ וְאָמְר֗וּ מִי־הָאִ֤ישׁ הַיָּרֵא֙ וְרַ֣ךְ הַלֵּבָ֔ב יֵלֵ֖ךְ וְיָשֹׁ֣ב לְבֵית֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יִמַּ֛ס אֶת־לְבַ֥ב אֶחָ֖יו כִּלְבָבֽוֹ׃
Translated: The officials shall go on addressing the troops and say, “Is there anyone afraid and disheartened? Let him go back to his home, lest the courage of his comrades flag like his.”
Transliteration: veyasefu hashoteriym ledaver el-haam veameru miy-haiysh hayare verakhe halevav eilekhe veyashov leveytvo velo yimas et-levav echayv khilevavvo

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה כְּכַלֹּ֥ת הַשֹּׁטְרִ֖ים לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־הָעָ֑ם וּפָ֥קְד֛וּ שָׂרֵ֥י צְבָא֖וֹת בְּרֹ֥אשׁ הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When the officials have finished addressing the troops, army commanders shall assume command of the troops.
Transliteration: vehayah khekhalot hashoteriym ledaver el-haam ufakedu sharey tsevavot verosh haam {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִקְרַ֣ב אֶל־עִ֔יר לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם עָלֶ֑יהָ וְקָרָ֥אתָ אֵלֶ֖יהָ לְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: When you approach a town to attack it, you shall offer it terms of peace.
Transliteration: khiy-tikerav el-iyr lehilachem aleyha vekarata eleyha leshalvom

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אִם־שָׁל֣וֹם תַּֽעַנְךָ֔ וּפָתְחָ֖ה לָ֑ךְ וְהָיָ֞ה כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַנִּמְצָא־בָ֗הּ יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֛ לָמַ֖ס וַעֲבָדֽוּךָ׃
Translated: If it responds peaceably and lets you in, all the people present there shall serve you at forced labor.
Transliteration: vehayah im-shalvom taanekha ufatechah lakhe vehayah khׇl-haam hanimetsa-vah yiheyu lekha lamas vaavadukha

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א תַשְׁלִים֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ וְעָשְׂתָ֥ה עִמְּךָ֖ מִלְחָמָ֑ה וְצַרְתָּ֖ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: If it does not surrender to you, but would join battle with you, you shall lay siege to it;
Transliteration: veim-lo tasheliym imakhe veashetah imekha milechamah vetsareta aleyha

Hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֛הּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְהִכִּיתָ֥ אֶת־כׇּל־זְכוּרָ֖הּ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: and when your God יהוה delivers it into your hand, you shall put all its males to the sword.
Transliteration: unetanah yehovah eloheykha veyadekha vehikhiyta et-khׇl-zekhurah lefiy-charev

Hebrew: רַ֣ק הַ֠נָּשִׁ֠ים וְהַטַּ֨ף וְהַבְּהֵמָ֜ה וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בָעִ֛יר כׇּל־שְׁלָלָ֖הּ תָּבֹ֣ז לָ֑ךְ וְאָֽכַלְתָּ֙ אֶת־שְׁלַ֣ל אֹיְבֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: You may, however, take as your booty the women, the children, the livestock, and everything in the town—all its spoil—and enjoy the use of the spoil of your enemy, which your God יהוה gives you.
Transliteration: rak hanashiym vehataf vehavehemah vekhol asher yiheyeh vaiyr khׇl-shelalah tavoz lakhe veakhaleta et-shelal oyeveykha asher natan yehovah eloheykha lakhe

Hebrew: כֵּ֤ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ לְכׇל־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים הָרְחֹקֹ֥ת מִמְּךָ֖ מְאֹ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מֵעָרֵ֥י הַגּֽוֹיִם־הָאֵ֖לֶּה הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: Thus you shall deal with all towns that lie very far from you, towns that do not belong to nations hereabout.
Transliteration: khen taasheh lekhׇl-heariym harechokot mimekha meod asher lo-mearey hagvoyim-haeleh henah

Hebrew: רַ֗ק מֵעָרֵ֤י הָֽעַמִּים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה לֹ֥א תְחַיֶּ֖ה כׇּל־נְשָׁמָֽה׃
Translated: In the towns of the latter peoples, however, which your God יהוה is giving you as a heritage, you shall not let a soul remain alive.
Transliteration: rak mearey haamiym haeleh asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah lo techayeh khׇl-neshamah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הַחֲרֵ֣ם תַּחֲרִימֵ֗ם הַחִתִּ֤י וְהָאֱמֹרִי֙ הַכְּנַעֲנִ֣י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוְּךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: No, you must proscribe them—the Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites—as your God יהוה has commanded you,
Transliteration: khiy-hacharem tachariymem hachitiy vehaemoriy hakhenaaniy vehaferiziy hachiviy vehayevusiy khaasher tsivekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יְלַמְּד֤וּ אֶתְכֶם֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּכֹל֙ תּֽוֹעֲבֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשׂ֖וּ לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶ֑ם וַחֲטָאתֶ֖ם לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: lest they lead you into doing all the abhorrent things that they have done for their gods and you stand guilty before your God יהוה.
Transliteration: lemaan asher lo-yelamedu etekhem laashvot khekhol tvoavotam asher ashu leloheyhem vachatatem layhovah eloheykhem {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תָצ֣וּר אֶל־עִיר֩ יָמִ֨ים רַבִּ֜ים לְֽהִלָּחֵ֧ם עָלֶ֣יהָ לְתׇפְשָׂ֗הּ לֹֽא־תַשְׁחִ֤ית אֶת־עֵצָהּ֙ לִנְדֹּ֤חַ עָלָיו֙ גַּרְזֶ֔ן כִּ֚י מִמֶּ֣נּוּ תֹאכֵ֔ל וְאֹת֖וֹ לֹ֣א תִכְרֹ֑ת כִּ֤י הָֽאָדָם֙ עֵ֣ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לָבֹ֥א מִפָּנֶ֖יךָ בַּמָּצֽוֹר׃
