Translated: When in your war against a city you have to besiege it a long time in order to capture it, you must not destroy its trees, wielding the ax against them. You may eat of them, but you must not cut them down. Are trees of the field human to withdraw before you into the besieged city?
Transliteration: khiy-tatsur el-iyr yamiym raviym lehilachem aleyha letׇfeshah lo-tashechiyt et-etsah linedocha alayv garezen khiy mimenu tokhel veotvo lo tikherot khiy haadam ets hashadeh lavo mifaneykha vamatsvor

Hebrew: רַ֞ק עֵ֣ץ אֲשֶׁר־תֵּדַ֗ע כִּֽי־לֹא־עֵ֤ץ מַאֲכָל֙ ה֔וּא אֹת֥וֹ תַשְׁחִ֖ית וְכָרָ֑תָּ וּבָנִ֣יתָ מָצ֗וֹר עַל־הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁר־הִ֨וא עֹשָׂ֧ה עִמְּךָ֛ מִלְחָמָ֖ה עַ֥ד רִדְתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Only trees that you know do not yield food may be destroyed; you may cut them down for constructing siegeworks against the city that is waging war on you, until it has been reduced.
Transliteration: rak ets asher-teda khiy-lo-ets maakhal hu otvo tashechiyt vekharata uvaniyta matsvor al-haiyr asher-hiv oshah imekha milechamah ad ridetah {f}

Hebrew: כִּי־יִמָּצֵ֣א חָלָ֗ל בָּאֲדָמָה֙ אֲשֶׁר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ נֹתֵ֤ן לְךָ֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ נֹפֵ֖ל בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה לֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖ע מִ֥י הִכָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: If, in the land that your God יהוה is assigning you to possess, someone slain is found lying in the open, the identity of the slayer not being known,
Transliteration: khiy-yimatse chalal vaadamah asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha lerishetah nofel vashadeh lo nvoda miy hikhahu

Hebrew: וְיָצְא֥וּ זְקֵנֶ֖יךָ וְשֹׁפְטֶ֑יךָ וּמָדְדוּ֙ אֶל־הֶ֣עָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר סְבִיבֹ֥ת הֶחָלָֽל׃
Translated: your elders and magistrates shall go out and measure the distances from the corpse to the nearby towns.
Transliteration: veyatseu zekeneykha veshofeteykha umadedu el-heariym asher seviyvot hechalal

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה הָעִ֔יר הַקְּרֹבָ֖ה אֶל־הֶחָלָ֑ל וְלָֽקְח֡וּ זִקְנֵי֩ הָעִ֨יר הַהִ֜וא עֶגְלַ֣ת בָּקָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־עֻבַּד֙ בָּ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־מָשְׁכָ֖ה בְּעֹֽל׃
Translated: The elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall then take a heifer which has never been worked, which has never pulled in a yoke;
Transliteration: vehayah haiyr hakerovah el-hechalal velakechu zikeney haiyr hahiv egelat vakar asher lo-uvad vah asher lo-mashekhah veol

Hebrew: וְהוֹרִ֡דוּ זִקְנֵי֩ הָעִ֨יר הַהִ֤וא אֶת־הָֽעֶגְלָה֙ אֶל־נַ֣חַל אֵיתָ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יֵעָבֵ֥ד בּ֖וֹ וְלֹ֣א יִזָּרֵ֑עַ וְעָֽרְפוּ־שָׁ֥ם אֶת־הָעֶגְלָ֖ה בַּנָּֽחַל׃
Translated: and the elders of that town shall bring the heifer down to an everflowing wadi, which is not tilled or sown. There, in the wadi, they shall break the heifer’s neck.
Transliteration: vehvoridu zikeney haiyr hahiv et-haegelah el-nachal eytan asher lo-eiaved vvo velo yizarea vearefu-sham et-haegelah vanachal

Hebrew: וְנִגְּשׁ֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִים֮ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִי֒ כִּ֣י בָ֗ם בָּחַ֞ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֖ךְ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעַל־פִּיהֶ֥ם יִהְיֶ֖ה כׇּל־רִ֥יב וְכׇל־נָֽגַע׃
Translated: The priests, sons of Levi, shall come forward; for your God יהוה has chosen them for divine service and to pronounce blessing in the name of יהוה, and every lawsuit and case of assault is subject to their ruling.
Transliteration: venigeshu hakhohaniym veney leviy khiy vam vachar yehovah eloheykha lesharetvo ulevarekhe veshem yehovah veal-fiyhem yiheyeh khׇl-riyv vekhׇl-naga

Hebrew: וְכֹ֗ל זִקְנֵי֙ הָעִ֣יר הַהִ֔וא הַקְּרֹבִ֖ים אֶל־הֶחָלָ֑ל יִרְחֲצוּ֙ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַל־הָעֶגְלָ֖ה הָעֲרוּפָ֥ה בַנָּֽחַל׃
Translated: Then all the elders of the town nearest to the corpse shall wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the wadi.
Transliteration: vekhol zikeney haiyr hahiv hakeroviym el-hechalal yirechatsu et-yedeyhem al-haegelah haarufah vanachal

Hebrew: וְעָנ֖וּ וְאָמְר֑וּ יָדֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֤א (שפכה) [שָֽׁפְכוּ֙] אֶת־הַדָּ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה וְעֵינֵ֖ינוּ לֹ֥א רָאֽוּ׃
Translated: And they shall make this declaration: “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.
Transliteration: veanu veameru yadeynu lo (shfkhh) [shafekhu] et-hadam hazeh veeyneynu lo rau

Hebrew: כַּפֵּר֩ לְעַמְּךָ֨ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־פָּדִ֙יתָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאַל־תִּתֵּן֙ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֔י בְּקֶ֖רֶב עַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְנִכַּפֵּ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם הַדָּֽם׃
Translated: Absolve, יהוה, Your people Israel whom You redeemed, and do not let guilt for the blood of the innocent remain among Your people Israel.” And they will be absolved of bloodguilt.
Transliteration: khafer leamekha yisherael asher-fadiyta yehovah veal-titen dam nakiy vekerev amekha yisherael venikhafer lahem hadam

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּבַעֵ֛ר הַדָּ֥ם הַנָּקִ֖י מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַיָּשָׁ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus you will remove from your midst guilt for the blood of the innocent, for you will be doing what is right in the sight of יהוה.
Transliteration: veatah tevaer hadam hanakiy mikirevekha khiy-taasheh hayashar veeyney yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וּנְתָנ֞וֹ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ בְּיָדֶ֖ךָ וְשָׁבִ֥יתָ שִׁבְיֽוֹ׃
Translated: When you [an Israelite warrior] take the field against your enemies, and your God יהוה delivers them into your power and you take some of them captive,
Transliteration: khiy-tetse lamilechamah al-oyeveykha unetanvo yehovah eloheykha veyadekha veshaviyta shiveyvo

Hebrew: וְרָאִ֙יתָ֙ בַּשִּׁבְיָ֔ה אֵ֖שֶׁת יְפַת־תֹּ֑אַר וְחָשַׁקְתָּ֣ בָ֔הּ וְלָקַחְתָּ֥ לְךָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: and you see among the captives a beautiful woman and you desire her and would take her [into your household] as your wife,
Transliteration: veraiyta vashiveyah eshet yefat-toar vechashaketa vah velakacheta lekha leishah

Hebrew: וַהֲבֵאתָ֖הּ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְגִלְּחָה֙ אֶת־רֹאשָׁ֔הּ וְעָשְׂתָ֖ה אֶת־צִפׇּרְנֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: you shall bring her into your household, and she shall trim her hair, pare her nails,
Transliteration: vahavetah el-tvokhe veytekha vegilechah et-roshah veashetah et-tsifׇreneyha

Hebrew: וְהֵסִ֩ירָה֩ אֶת־שִׂמְלַ֨ת שִׁבְיָ֜הּ מֵעָלֶ֗יהָ וְיָֽשְׁבָה֙ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ וּבָ֥כְתָ֛ה אֶת־אָבִ֥יהָ וְאֶת־אִמָּ֖הּ יֶ֣רַח יָמִ֑ים וְאַ֨חַר כֵּ֜ן תָּב֤וֹא אֵלֶ֙יהָ֙ וּבְעַלְתָּ֔הּ וְהָיְתָ֥ה לְךָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: and discard her captive’s garb. She shall spend a month’s time in your household lamenting her father and mother; after that you may come to her and thus become her husband, and she shall be your wife.
Transliteration: vehesiyrah et-shimelat shiveyah mealeyha veyashevah veveytekha uvakhetah et-aviyha veet-imah yerach yamiym veachar khen tavvo eleyha uvealetah vehayetah lekha leishah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־לֹ֧א חָפַ֣צְתָּ בָּ֗הּ וְשִׁלַּחְתָּהּ֙ לְנַפְשָׁ֔הּ וּמָכֹ֥ר לֹא־תִמְכְּרֶ֖נָּה בַּכָּ֑סֶף לֹא־תִתְעַמֵּ֣ר בָּ֔הּ תַּ֖חַת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִנִּיתָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then, should you no longer want her, you must release her outright. You must not sell her for money: since you had your will of her, you must not enslave her.
Transliteration: vehayah im-lo chafatseta vah veshilachetah lenafeshah umakhor lo-timekherenah vakhasef lo-titeamer vah tachat asher iniytah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִהְיֶ֨יןָ לְאִ֜ישׁ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֗ים הָאַחַ֤ת אֲהוּבָה֙ וְהָאַחַ֣ת שְׂנוּאָ֔ה וְיָֽלְדוּ־ל֣וֹ בָנִ֔ים הָאֲהוּבָ֖ה וְהַשְּׂנוּאָ֑ה וְהָיָ֛ה הַבֵּ֥ן הַבְּכֹ֖ר לַשְּׂנִיאָֽה׃
Translated: If a householder has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him sons, but the first-born is the son of the unloved one—
Transliteration: khiy-tiheyeyna leiysh shetey nashiym haachat ahuvah vehaachat shenuah veyaledu-lvo vaniym haahuvah vehashenuah vehayah haven havekhor lasheniyah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בְּיוֹם֙ הַנְחִיל֣וֹ אֶת־בָּנָ֔יו אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֖ה ל֑וֹ לֹ֣א יוּכַ֗ל לְבַכֵּר֙ אֶת־בֶּן־הָ֣אֲהוּבָ֔ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י בֶן־הַשְּׂנוּאָ֖ה הַבְּכֹֽר׃
Translated: when he wills his property to his sons, he may not treat as first-born the son of the loved one in disregard of the son of the unloved one who is older.
Transliteration: vehayah veyvom hanechiylvo et-vanayv et asher-yiheyeh lvo lo yukhal levakher et-ven-haahuvah al-feney ven-hashenuah havekhor

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־הַבְּכֹ֨ר בֶּן־הַשְּׂנוּאָ֜ה יַכִּ֗יר לָ֤תֶת לוֹ֙ פִּ֣י שְׁנַ֔יִם בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יִמָּצֵ֖א ל֑וֹ כִּי־הוּא֙ רֵאשִׁ֣ית אֹנ֔וֹ ל֖וֹ מִשְׁפַּ֥ט הַבְּכֹרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Instead, he must accept the first-born, the son of the unloved one, and allot to him a double portion of all he possesses; since he is the first fruit of his vigor, the birthright is his due.
Transliteration: khiy et-havekhor ven-hashenuah yakhiyr latet lvo fiy shenayiim vekhol asher-yimatse lvo khiy-hu reshiyt onvo lvo mishefat havekhorah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִ֗ישׁ בֵּ֚ן סוֹרֵ֣ר וּמוֹרֶ֔ה אֵינֶ֣נּוּ שֹׁמֵ֔עַ בְּק֥וֹל אָבִ֖יו וּבְק֣וֹל אִמּ֑וֹ וְיִסְּר֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א יִשְׁמַ֖ע אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: If a householder has a wayward and defiant son, who does not heed his father or mother and does not obey them even after they discipline him,
Transliteration: khiy-yiheyeh leiysh ven svorer umvoreh eynenu shomea vekvol aviyv uvekvol imvo veyiseru otvo velo yishema aleyhem

Hebrew: וְתָ֥פְשׂוּ ב֖וֹ אָבִ֣יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ וְהוֹצִ֧יאוּ אֹת֛וֹ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֥י עִיר֖וֹ וְאֶל־שַׁ֥עַר מְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: his father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him out to the elders of his town at the public place of his community.
Transliteration: vetafeshu vvo aviyv veimvo vehvotsiyu otvo el-zikeney iyrvo veel-shaar mekomvo

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֞וּ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י עִיר֗וֹ בְּנֵ֤נוּ זֶה֙ סוֹרֵ֣ר וּמֹרֶ֔ה אֵינֶ֥נּוּ שֹׁמֵ֖עַ בְּקֹלֵ֑נוּ זוֹלֵ֖ל וְסֹבֵֽא׃
Translated: They shall say to the elders of his town, “This son of ours is disloyal and defiant; he does not heed us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
Transliteration: veameru el-zikeney iyrvo venenu zeh svorer umoreh eynenu shomea vekolenu zvolel vesove

Hebrew: וּ֠רְגָמֻ֠הוּ כׇּל־אַנְשֵׁ֨י עִיר֤וֹ בָֽאֲבָנִים֙ וָמֵ֔ת וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּ֑ךָ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִשְׁמְע֥וּ וְיִרָֽאוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Thereupon his town’s council shall stone him to death. Thus you will sweep out evil from your midst: all Israel will hear and be afraid.
Transliteration: uregamuhu khׇl-aneshey iyrvo vaavaniym vamet uviareta hara mikirevekha vekhׇl-yisherael yishemeu veyirau {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֣ה בְאִ֗ישׁ חֵ֛טְא מִשְׁפַּט־מָ֖וֶת וְהוּמָ֑ת וְתָלִ֥יתָ אֹת֖וֹ עַל־עֵֽץ׃
Translated: If any party is guilty of a capital offense and is put to death, and you impale the body on a stake,
Transliteration: vekhiy-yiheyeh veiysh chete mishefat-mavet vehumat vetaliyta otvo al-ets

Hebrew: לֹא־תָלִ֨ין נִבְלָת֜וֹ עַל־הָעֵ֗ץ כִּֽי־קָב֤וֹר תִּקְבְּרֶ֙נּוּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא כִּֽי־קִלְלַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים תָּל֑וּי וְלֹ֤א תְטַמֵּא֙ אֶת־אַדְמָ֣תְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: you must not let the corpse remain on the stake overnight, but must bury it the same day. For an impaled body is an affront to God: you shall not defile the land that your God יהוה is giving you to possess.
Transliteration: lo-taliyn nivelatvo al-haets khiy-kavvor tikeverenu vayyvom hahu khiy-kilelat Elohim taluy velo tetame et-adematekha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִרְאֶה֩ אֶת־שׁ֨וֹר אָחִ֜יךָ א֤וֹ אֶת־שֵׂיוֹ֙ נִדָּחִ֔ים וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם הָשֵׁ֥ב תְּשִׁיבֵ֖ם לְאָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: If you see your fellow Israelite’s ox or sheep gone astray, do not ignore it; you must take it back to your peer.
Transliteration: lo-tireeh et-shvor achiykha vo et-sheyvo nidachiym vehitealameta mehem hashev teshiyvem leachiykha

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א קָר֥וֹב אָחִ֛יךָ אֵלֶ֖יךָ וְלֹ֣א יְדַעְתּ֑וֹ וַאֲסַפְתּוֹ֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ בֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְהָיָ֣ה עִמְּךָ֗ עַ֣ד דְּרֹ֤שׁ אָחִ֙יךָ֙ אֹת֔וֹ וַהֲשֵׁבֹת֖וֹ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: If your fellow Israelite does not live near you or you do not know who [the owner] is, you shall bring it home and it shall remain with you until your peer claims it; then you shall give it back.
Transliteration: veim-lo karvov achiykha eleykha velo yedaetvo vaasafetvo el-tvokhe veytekha vehayah imekha ad derosh achiykha otvo vahashevotvo lvo

Hebrew: וְכֵ֧ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה לַחֲמֹר֗וֹ וְכֵ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂה֮ לְשִׂמְלָתוֹ֒ וְכֵ֣ן תַּעֲשֶׂ֗ה לְכׇל־אֲבֵדַ֥ת אָחִ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאבַ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נּוּ וּמְצָאתָ֑הּ לֹ֥א תוּכַ֖ל לְהִתְעַלֵּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall do the same with that person’s ass; you shall do the same with that person’s garment; and so too shall you do with anything that your fellow Israelite loses and you find: you must not remain indifferent.
Transliteration: vekhen taasheh lachamorvo vekhen taasheh leshimelatvo vekhen taasheh lekhׇl-avedat achiykha asher-tovad mimenu umetsatah lo tukhal lehitealem {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תִרְאֶה֩ אֶת־חֲמ֨וֹר אָחִ֜יךָ א֤וֹ שׁוֹרוֹ֙ נֹפְלִ֣ים בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְהִתְעַלַּמְתָּ֖ מֵהֶ֑ם הָקֵ֥ם תָּקִ֖ים עִמּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: If you see your fellow Israelite’s ass or ox fallen on the road, do not ignore it; you must raise it together.
Transliteration: lo-tireeh et-chamvor achiykha vo shvorvo nofeliym vaderekhe vehitealameta mehem hakem takiym imvo {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֤ה כְלִי־גֶ֙בֶר֙ עַל־אִשָּׁ֔ה וְלֹא־יִלְבַּ֥שׁ גֶּ֖בֶר שִׂמְלַ֣ת אִשָּׁ֑ה כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כׇּל־עֹ֥שֵׂה אֵֽלֶּה׃ {פ}
Translated: A woman must not put on man’s apparel, nor shall a man wear woman’s clothing; for whoever does these things is abhorrent to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh kheliy-gever al-ishah velo-yilevash gever shimelat ishah khiy tvoavat yehovah eloheykha khׇl-osheh eleh {f}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יִקָּרֵ֣א קַן־צִפּ֣וֹר ׀ לְפָנֶ֡יךָ בַּדֶּ֜רֶךְ בְּכׇל־עֵ֣ץ ׀ א֣וֹ עַל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֶפְרֹחִים֙ א֣וֹ בֵיצִ֔ים וְהָאֵ֤ם רֹבֶ֙צֶת֙ עַל־הָֽאֶפְרֹחִ֔ים א֖וֹ עַל־הַבֵּיצִ֑ים לֹא־תִקַּ֥ח הָאֵ֖ם עַל־הַבָּנִֽים׃
Translated: If, along the road, you chance upon a bird’s nest, in any tree or on the ground, with fledglings or eggs and the mother sitting over the fledglings or on the eggs, do not take the mother together with her young.
Transliteration: khiy yikare kan-tsifvor lefaneykha vaderekhe vekhׇl-ets vo al-haarets eferochiym vo veytsiym vehaem rovetset al-haeferochiym vo al-haveytsiym lo-tikach haem al-havaniym

Hebrew: שַׁלֵּ֤חַ תְּשַׁלַּח֙ אֶת־הָאֵ֔ם וְאֶת־הַבָּנִ֖ים תִּֽקַּֽח־לָ֑ךְ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יִ֣יטַב לָ֔ךְ וְהַאֲרַכְתָּ֖ יָמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Let the mother go, and take only the young, in order that you may fare well and have a long life.
Transliteration: shalecha teshalach et-haem veet-havaniym tikach-lakhe lemaan yiytav lakhe vehaarakheta yamiym {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תִבְנֶה֙ בַּ֣יִת חָדָ֔שׁ וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מַעֲקֶ֖ה לְגַגֶּ֑ךָ וְלֹֽא־תָשִׂ֤ים דָּמִים֙ בְּבֵיתֶ֔ךָ כִּֽי־יִפֹּ֥ל הַנֹּפֵ֖ל מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: When you build a new house, you shall make a parapet for your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if anyone should fall from it.
Transliteration: khiy tiveneh vayiit chadash veashiyta maakeh legagekha velo-tashiym damiym veveytekha khiy-yifol hanofel mimenu

Hebrew: לֹא־תִזְרַ֥ע כַּרְמְךָ֖ כִּלְאָ֑יִם פֶּן־תִּקְדַּ֗שׁ הַֽמְלֵאָ֤ה הַזֶּ֙רַע֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּזְרָ֔ע וּתְבוּאַ֖ת הַכָּֽרֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not sow your vineyard with a second kind of seed, else the crop—from the seed you have sown—and the yield of the vineyard may not be used.
Transliteration: lo-tizera kharemekha khileayiim fen-tikedash hameleah hazera asher tizera utevuat hakharem {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַחֲרֹ֥שׁ בְּשׁוֹר־וּבַחֲמֹ֖ר יַחְדָּֽו׃
Translated: You shall not plow with an ox and an ass together.
Transliteration: lo-tacharosh veshvor-uvachamor yachedav

Hebrew: לֹ֤א תִלְבַּשׁ֙ שַֽׁעַטְנֵ֔ז צֶ֥מֶר וּפִשְׁתִּ֖ים יַחְדָּֽו׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not wear cloth combining wool and linen.
Transliteration: lo tilevash shaatenez tsemer ufishetiym yachedav {s}

Hebrew: גְּדִלִ֖ים תַּעֲשֶׂה־לָּ֑ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֛ע כַּנְפ֥וֹת כְּסוּתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּכַסֶּה־בָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall make tassels on the four corners of the garment with which you cover yourself.
Transliteration: gediliym taasheh-lakhe al-areva khanefvot khesutekha asher tekhaseh-vah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֖ישׁ אִשָּׁ֑ה וּבָ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ וּשְׂנֵאָֽהּ׃
Translated: A householder takes a woman [as his wife] and cohabits with her. Then he takes an aversion to her
Transliteration: khiy-yikach iysh ishah uva eleyha usheneah

Hebrew: וְשָׂ֥ם לָהּ֙ עֲלִילֹ֣ת דְּבָרִ֔ים וְהוֹצִ֥א עָלֶ֖יהָ שֵׁ֣ם רָ֑ע וְאָמַ֗ר אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֤ה הַזֹּאת֙ לָקַ֔חְתִּי וָאֶקְרַ֣ב אֵלֶ֔יהָ וְלֹא־מָצָ֥אתִי לָ֖הּ בְּתוּלִֽים׃
Translated: and makes up charges against her and defames her, saying, “This is the party I took [to wife]; but when I approached her, I found that she was not a virgin.”
Transliteration: vesham lah aliylot devariym vehvotsi aleyha shem ra veamar et-haishah hazot lakachetiy vaekerav eleyha velo-matsatiy lah vetuliym

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֛ח אֲבִ֥י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ וְאִמָּ֑הּ וְהוֹצִ֜יאוּ אֶת־בְּתוּלֵ֧י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֛ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֥י הָעִ֖יר הַשָּֽׁעְרָה׃
Translated: In such a case, the girl’s father and mother shall produce the evidence of the girl’s virginity before the elders of the town at the gate.
Transliteration: velakach aviy hanaara veimah vehvotsiyu et-vetuley hanaara el-zikeney haiyr hashaerah

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֛ר אֲבִ֥י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֑ים אֶת־בִּתִּ֗י נָתַ֜תִּי לָאִ֥ישׁ הַזֶּ֛ה לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וַיִּשְׂנָאֶֽהָ׃
Translated: And the girl’s father shall say to the elders, “To this party I gave my own daughter to wife, but he has taken an aversion to her;
Transliteration: veamar aviy hanaara el-hazekeniym et-vitiy natatiy laiysh hazeh leishah vayishenaeha

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה־ה֡וּא שָׂם֩ עֲלִילֹ֨ת דְּבָרִ֜ים לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹֽא־מָצָ֤אתִי לְבִתְּךָ֙ בְּתוּלִ֔ים וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּתוּלֵ֣י בִתִּ֑י וּפָֽרְשׂוּ֙ הַשִּׂמְלָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י זִקְנֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: so he has made up charges, saying, ‘I did not find your daughter a virgin.’ But here is the evidence of my daughter’s virginity!” And they shall spread out the cloth before the elders of the town.
Transliteration: vehineh-hu sham aliylot devariym lemor lo-matsatiy levitekha vetuliym veeleh vetuley vitiy ufareshu hashimelah lifeney zikeney haiyr

Hebrew: וְלָ֥קְח֛וּ זִקְנֵ֥י הָֽעִיר־הַהִ֖וא אֶת־הָאִ֑ישׁ וְיִסְּר֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The elders of that town shall then take that party and flog him,
Transliteration: velakechu zikeney haiyr-hahiv et-haiysh veyiseru otvo

Hebrew: וְעָנְשׁ֨וּ אֹת֜וֹ מֵ֣אָה כֶ֗סֶף וְנָתְנוּ֙ לַאֲבִ֣י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה כִּ֤י הוֹצִיא֙ שֵׁ֣ם רָ֔ע עַ֖ל בְּתוּלַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֽוֹ־תִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֔ה לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל לְשַׁלְּחָ֖הּ כׇּל־יָמָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: and they shall fine him a hundred [shekels of] silver and give it to the girl’s father; for [that householder] has defamed a virgin in Israel. Moreover, she shall remain his wife; he shall never have the right to divorce her.
Transliteration: veaneshu otvo meah khesef venatenu laaviy hanaarah khiy hvotsiy shem ra al vetulat yisherael velvo-tiheyeh leishah lo-yukhal leshalechah khׇl-yamayv {s}

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֱמֶ֣ת הָיָ֔ה הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה לֹא־נִמְצְא֥וּ בְתוּלִ֖ים לַֽנַּעֲרָֽ׃
Translated: But if the charge proves true, the girl was found not to have been a virgin,
Transliteration: veim-emet hayah hadavar hazeh lo-nimetseu vetuliym lanaara

Hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֨יאוּ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֜ אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח בֵּית־אָבִ֗יהָ וּסְקָל֩וּהָ֩ אַנְשֵׁ֨י עִירָ֤הּ בָּאֲבָנִים֙ וָמֵ֔תָה כִּֽי־עָשְׂתָ֤ה נְבָלָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִזְנ֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יהָ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: then the girl shall be brought out to the entrance of her father’s house, and her town’s council shall stone her to death; for she did a shameful thing in Israel, committing fornication while under her father’s authority. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.
Transliteration: vehvotsiyu et-hanaara el-fetach veyt-aviyha usekaluha aneshey iyrah vaavaniym vametah khiy-ashetah nevalah veyisherael lizenvot veyt aviyha uviareta hara mikirevekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמָּצֵ֨א אִ֜ישׁ שֹׁכֵ֣ב ׀ עִם־אִשָּׁ֣ה בְעֻֽלַת־בַּ֗עַל וּמֵ֙תוּ֙ גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם הָאִ֛ישׁ הַשֹּׁכֵ֥ב עִם־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וְהָאִשָּׁ֑ה וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both of them—the man and the woman with whom he lay—shall die. Thus you will sweep away evil from Israel.
Transliteration: khiy-yimatse iysh shokhev im-ishah veulat-vaal umetu gam-sheneyhem haiysh hashokhev im-haishah vehaishah uviareta hara miyisherael {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יִהְיֶה֙ נַעֲרָ֣ בְתוּלָ֔ה מְאֹרָשָׂ֖ה לְאִ֑ישׁ וּמְצָאָ֥הּ אִ֛ישׁ בָּעִ֖יר וְשָׁכַ֥ב עִמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: In the case of a virgin who is engaged to someone —if another man comes upon her in town and lies with her,
Transliteration: khiy yiheyeh naara vetulah meorashah leiysh umetsaah iysh vaiyr veshakhav imah

Hebrew: וְהוֹצֵאתֶ֨ם אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶ֜ם אֶל־שַׁ֣עַר ׀ הָעִ֣יר הַהִ֗וא וּסְקַלְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֥ם בָּאֲבָנִים֮ וָמֵ֒תוּ֒ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֗ עַל־דְּבַר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־צָעֲקָ֣ה בָעִ֔יר וְאֶ֨ת־הָאִ֔ישׁ עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אֲשֶׁר־עִנָּ֖ה אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: you shall take the two of them out to the gate of that town and stone them to death: the girl because she did not cry for help in the town, and the man because he violated his neighbor’s wife. Thus you will sweep away evil from your midst.
Transliteration: vehvotsetem et-sheneyhem el-shaar haiyr hahiv usekaletem otam vaavaniym vametu et-hanaara al-devar asher lo-tsaakah vaiyr veet-haiysh al-devar asher-inah et-eshet reehu uviareta hara mikirevekha {s}

Hebrew: וְֽאִם־בַּשָּׂדֶ֞ה יִמְצָ֣א הָאִ֗ישׁ אֶת־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֙ הַמְאֹ֣רָשָׂ֔ה וְהֶחֱזִֽיק־בָּ֥הּ הָאִ֖ישׁ וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ וּמֵ֗ת הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁכַ֥ב עִמָּ֖הּ לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But if the man comes upon the engaged girl in the open country, and the man lies with her by force, only the party who lay with her shall die,
Transliteration: veim-vashadeh yimetsa haiysh et-hanaara hameorashah vehecheziyk-vah haiysh veshakhav imah umet haiysh asher-shakhav imah levadvo

Hebrew: וְלַֽנַּעֲרָ֙ לֹא־תַעֲשֶׂ֣ה דָבָ֔ר אֵ֥ין לַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ חֵ֣טְא מָ֑וֶת כִּ֡י כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ יָק֨וּם אִ֤ישׁ עַל־רֵעֵ֙הוּ֙ וּרְצָח֣וֹ נֶ֔פֶשׁ כֵּ֖ן הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: but you shall do nothing to the girl. The girl did not incur the death penalty, for this case is like that of one party attacking and murdering another.
Transliteration: velanaara lo-taasheh davar eyn lanaara chete mavet khiy khaasher yakum iysh al-reehu uretsachvo nefesh khen hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: כִּ֥י בַשָּׂדֶ֖ה מְצָאָ֑הּ צָעֲקָ֗ה הַֽנַּעֲרָ֙ הַמְאֹ֣רָשָׂ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין מוֹשִׁ֖יעַ לָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: He came upon her in the open; though the engaged girl cried for help, there was no one to save her.
Transliteration: khiy vashadeh metsaah tsaakah hanaara hameorashah veeyn mvoshiya lah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִמְצָ֣א אִ֗ישׁ נַעֲרָ֤ בְתוּלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־אֹרָ֔שָׂה וּתְפָשָׂ֖הּ וְשָׁכַ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ וְנִמְצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: If a man comes upon a virgin who is not engaged and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,
Transliteration: khiy-yimetsa iysh naara vetulah asher lo-orashah utefashah veshakhav imah venimetsau

Hebrew: וְ֠נָתַ֠ן הָאִ֨ישׁ הַשֹּׁכֵ֥ב עִמָּ֛הּ לַאֲבִ֥י הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים כָּ֑סֶף וְלֽוֹ־תִהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֗ה תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִנָּ֔הּ לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל שַׁלְּחָ֖הּ כׇּל־יָמָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: the party who lay with her shall pay the girl’s father fifty [shekels of] silver, and she shall be his wife. Because he has violated her, he can never have the right to divorce her.
Transliteration: venatan haiysh hashokhev imah laaviy hanaara chamishiym khasef velvo-tiheyeh leishah tachat asher inah lo-yukhal shalechah khׇl-yamayv {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֖ישׁ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יְגַלֶּ֖ה כְּנַ֥ף אָבִֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: No householder shall take his father’s former wife [as his own wife], so as to remove his father’s garment.
Transliteration: lo-yikach iysh et-eshet aviyv velo yegaleh khenaf aviyv {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָבֹ֧א פְצֽוּעַ־דַּכָּ֛א וּכְר֥וּת שׇׁפְכָ֖ה בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: No man whose testes are crushed or whose member is cut off shall be admitted into the congregation of יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-yavo fetsua-dakha ukherut shׇfekhah vikehal yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־יָבֹ֥א מַמְזֵ֖ר בִּקְהַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה גַּ֚ם דּ֣וֹר עֲשִׂירִ֔י לֹא־יָ֥בֹא ל֖וֹ בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: No one misbegotten shall be admitted into the congregation of יהוה; no descendant of such, even in the tenth generation, shall be admitted into the congregation of יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-yavo mamezer vikehal yehovah gam dvor ashiyriy lo-yavo lvo vikehal yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָבֹ֧א עַמּוֹנִ֛י וּמוֹאָבִ֖י בִּקְהַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה גַּ֚ם דּ֣וֹר עֲשִׂירִ֔י לֹא־יָבֹ֥א לָהֶ֛ם בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהֹוָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: No Ammonite or Moabite shall be admitted into the congregation of יהוה; no descendants of such, even in the tenth generation, shall ever be admitted into the congregation of יהוה,
Transliteration: lo-yavo amvoniy umvoaviy vikehal yehovah gam dvor ashiyriy lo-yavo lahem vikehal yehovah ad-volam

Hebrew: עַל־דְּבַ֞ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־קִדְּמ֤וּ אֶתְכֶם֙ בַּלֶּ֣חֶם וּבַמַּ֔יִם בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֣ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַאֲשֶׁר֩ שָׂכַ֨ר עָלֶ֜יךָ אֶת־בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֗וֹר מִפְּת֛וֹר אֲרַ֥ם נַהֲרַ֖יִם לְקַֽלְלֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey after you left Egypt, and because they hired Balaam son of Beor, from Pethor of Aram-naharaim, to curse you.—
Transliteration: al-devar asher lo-kidemu etekhem valechem uvamayiim vaderekhe vetsetekhem mimitserayiim vaasher shakhar aleykha et-vileam ven-vevor mifetvor aram naharayiim lekalelekha

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־אָבָ֞ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיַּהֲפֹךְ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֧יךָ לְּךָ֛ אֶת־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה לִבְרָכָ֑ה כִּ֥י אֲהֵֽבְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But your God יהוה refused to heed Balaam; instead, your God יהוה turned the curse into a blessing for you, for your God יהוה loves you.—
Transliteration: velo-avah yehovah eloheykha lishemoa el-vileam vayahafokhe yehovah eloheykha lekha et-hakelalah liverakhah khiy ahevekha yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: לֹא־תִדְרֹ֥שׁ שְׁלֹמָ֖ם וְטֹבָתָ֑ם כׇּל־יָמֶ֖יךָ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall never concern yourself with their welfare or benefit as long as you live.
Transliteration: lo-tiderosh shelomam vetovatam khׇl-yameykha levolam {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תְתַעֵ֣ב אֲדֹמִ֔י כִּ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ ה֑וּא לֹא־תְתַעֵ֣ב מִצְרִ֔י כִּי־גֵ֖ר הָיִ֥יתָ בְאַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall not abhor an Edomite, for such is your kin. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a stranger in that land.
Transliteration: lo-tetaev adomiy khiy achiykha hu lo-tetaev mitseriy khiy-ger hayiyta vearetsvo

Hebrew: בָּנִ֛ים אֲשֶׁר־יִוָּלְד֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם דּ֣וֹר שְׁלִישִׁ֑י יָבֹ֥א לָהֶ֖ם בִּקְהַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Children born to them may be admitted into the congregation of יהוה in the third generation.
Transliteration: vaniym asher-yivaledu lahem dvor sheliyshiy yavo lahem vikehal yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א מַחֲנֶ֖ה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וְנִ֨שְׁמַרְתָּ֔ מִכֹּ֖ל דָּבָ֥ר רָֽע׃
Translated: When you [men] go out as a troop against your enemies, be on your guard against anything untoward.
Transliteration: khiy-tetse machaneh al-oyeveykha venishemareta mikhol davar ra

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בְךָ֙ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה טָה֖וֹר מִקְּרֵה־לָ֑יְלָה וְיָצָא֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה לֹ֥א יָבֹ֖א אֶל־תּ֥וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: If anyone among you has been rendered impure by a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp, and he must not reenter the camp.
Transliteration: khiy-yiheyeh vekha iysh asher lo-yiheyeh tahvor mikereh-layelah veyatsa el-michuts lamachaneh lo yavo el-tvokhe hamachaneh

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֥ה לִפְנֽוֹת־עֶ֖רֶב יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וּכְבֹ֣א הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ יָבֹ֖א אֶל־תּ֥וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Toward evening he shall bathe in water, and at sundown he may reenter the camp.
Transliteration: vehayah lifenvot-erev yirechats vamayiim ukhevo hashemesh yavo el-tvokhe hamachaneh

Hebrew: וְיָד֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לְךָ֔ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְיָצָ֥אתָ שָּׁ֖מָּה חֽוּץ׃
Translated: Further, there shall be an area for you outside the camp, where you may relieve yourself.
Transliteration: veyad tiheyeh lekha michuts lamachaneh veyatsata shamah chuts

Hebrew: וְיָתֵ֛ד תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ עַל־אֲזֵנֶ֑ךָ וְהָיָה֙ בְּשִׁבְתְּךָ֣ ח֔וּץ וְחָפַרְתָּ֣ה בָ֔הּ וְשַׁבְתָּ֖ וְכִסִּ֥יתָ אֶת־צֵאָתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: With your gear you shall have a spike, and when you have squatted you shall dig a hole with it and cover up your excrement.
Transliteration: veyated tiheyeh lekha al-azenekha vehayah veshivetekha chuts vechafaretah vah veshaveta vekhisiyta et-tseatekha

Hebrew: כִּי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ מִתְהַלֵּ֣ךְ ׀ בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֶ֗ךָ לְהַצִּֽילְךָ֙ וְלָתֵ֤ת אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ וְהָיָ֥ה מַחֲנֶ֖יךָ קָד֑וֹשׁ וְלֹֽא־יִרְאֶ֤ה בְךָ֙ עֶרְוַ֣ת דָּבָ֔ר וְשָׁ֖ב מֵאַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Since your God יהוה moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you, let your camp be holy; let [God] not find anything unseemly among you and turn away from you.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheykha mitehalekhe vekerev machanekha lehatsiylekha velatet oyeveykha lefaneykha vehayah machaneykha kadvosh velo-yireeh vekha erevat davar veshav meachareykha {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תַסְגִּ֥יר עֶ֖בֶד אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֑יו אֲשֶׁר־יִנָּצֵ֥ל אֵלֶ֖יךָ מֵעִ֥ם אֲדֹנָֽיו׃
Translated: You shall not turn over to the master a slave who seeks refuge with you from that master.
Transliteration: lo-tasegiyr eved el-adonayv asher-yinatsel eleykha meim adonayv

Hebrew: עִמְּךָ֞ יֵשֵׁ֣ב בְּקִרְבְּךָ֗ בַּמָּק֧וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֛ר בְּאַחַ֥ד שְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ בַּטּ֣וֹב ל֑וֹ לֹ֖א תּוֹנֶֽנּוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Such individuals shall live with you in any place they may choose among the settlements in your midst, wherever they please; you must not ill-treat them.
Transliteration: imekha eishev vekirevekha vamakvom asher-yivechar veachad sheareykha vatvov lvo lo tvonenu {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה קְדֵשָׁ֖ה מִבְּנ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה קָדֵ֖שׁ מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: No Israelite woman shall be a prostitute, nor shall any Israelite man be a prostitute.
Transliteration: lo-tiheyeh kedeshah mivenvot yisherael velo-yiheyeh kadesh miveney yisherael

Hebrew: לֹא־תָבִיא֩ אֶתְנַ֨ן זוֹנָ֜ה וּמְחִ֣יר כֶּ֗לֶב בֵּ֛ית יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְכׇל־נֶ֑דֶר כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ גַּם־שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not bring the fee of a whore or the pay of a dog into the house of your God יהוה in fulfillment of any vow, for both are abhorrent to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-taviy etenan zvonah umechiyr khelev veyt yehovah eloheykha lekhׇl-neder khiy tvoavat yehovah eloheykha gam-sheneyhem {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תַשִּׁ֣יךְ לְאָחִ֔יךָ נֶ֥שֶׁךְ כֶּ֖סֶף נֶ֣שֶׁךְ אֹ֑כֶל נֶ֕שֶׁךְ כׇּל־דָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשָּֽׁךְ׃
Translated: You shall not deduct interest from loans to your fellow Israelites, whether in money or food or anything else that can be deducted as interest;
Transliteration: lo-tashiykhe leachiykha neshekhe khesef neshekhe okhel neshekhe khׇl-davar asher yishakhe

Hebrew: לַנׇּכְרִ֣י תַשִּׁ֔יךְ וּלְאָחִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תַשִּׁ֑יךְ לְמַ֨עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ בְּכֹל֙ מִשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֔ךָ עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: but you may deduct interest from loans to foreigners. Do not deduct interest from loans to your fellow Israelites, so that your God יהוה may bless you in all your undertakings in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
Transliteration: lanׇkheriy tashiykhe uleachiykha lo tashiykhe lemaan yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol mishelach yadekha al-haarets asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תִדֹּ֥ר נֶ֙דֶר֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תְאַחֵ֖ר לְשַׁלְּמ֑וֹ כִּֽי־דָרֹ֨שׁ יִדְרְשֶׁ֜נּוּ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
Translated: When you make a vow to your God יהוה, do not put off fulfilling it, for your God יהוה will require it of you, and you will have incurred guilt;
Transliteration: khiy-tidor neder layhovah eloheykha lo teacher leshalemvo khiy-darosh yidereshenu yehovah eloheykha meimakhe vehayah vekha chete

Hebrew: וְכִ֥י תֶחְדַּ֖ל לִנְדֹּ֑ר לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃
Translated: whereas you incur no guilt if you refrain from vowing.
Transliteration: vekhiy techedal linedor lo-yiheyeh vekha chete

Hebrew: מוֹצָ֥א שְׂפָתֶ֖יךָ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר וְעָשִׂ֑יתָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר נָדַ֜רְתָּ לַיהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ נְדָבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ בְּפִֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: You must fulfill what has crossed your lips and perform what you have voluntarily vowed to your God יהוה, having made the promise with your own mouth.
Transliteration: mvotsa shefateykha tishemor veashiyta khaasher nadareta layhovah eloheykha nedavah asher divareta vefiykha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹא֙ בְּכֶ֣רֶם רֵעֶ֔ךָ וְאָכַלְתָּ֧ עֲנָבִ֛ים כְּנַפְשְׁךָ֖ שׇׂבְעֶ֑ךָ וְאֶֽל־כֶּלְיְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תִתֵּֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: When you enter a fellow [Israelite]’s vineyard, you may eat as many grapes as you want, until you are full, but you must not put any in your vessel.
Transliteration: khiy tavo vekherem reekha veakhaleta anaviym khenafeshekha shׇveekha veel-kheleyekha lo titen {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹא֙ בְּקָמַ֣ת רֵעֶ֔ךָ וְקָטַפְתָּ֥ מְלִילֹ֖ת בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְחֶרְמֵשׁ֙ לֹ֣א תָנִ֔יף עַ֖ל קָמַ֥ת רֵעֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: When you enter a fellow [Israelite]’s field of standing grain, you may pluck ears with your hand; but you must not put a sickle to your neighbor’s grain.
Transliteration: khiy tavo vekamat reekha vekatafeta meliylot veyadekha vecheremesh lo taniyf al kamat reekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִ֛ישׁ אִשָּׁ֖ה וּבְעָלָ֑הּ וְהָיָ֞ה אִם־לֹ֧א תִמְצָא־חֵ֣ן בְּעֵינָ֗יו כִּי־מָ֤צָא בָהּ֙ עֶרְוַ֣ת דָּבָ֔ר וְכָ֨תַב לָ֜הּ סֵ֤פֶר כְּרִיתֻת֙ וְנָתַ֣ן בְּיָדָ֔הּ וְשִׁלְּחָ֖הּ מִבֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: A man takes a woman [into his household as his wife] and becomes her husband. She fails to please him because he finds something obnoxious about her, and he writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house;
Transliteration: khiy-yikach iysh ishah uvealah vehayah im-lo timetsa-chen veeynayv khiy-matsa vah erevat davar vekhatav lah sefer kheriytut venatan veyadah veshilechah miveytvo

Hebrew: וְיָצְאָ֖ה מִבֵּית֑וֹ וְהָלְכָ֖ה וְהָיְתָ֥ה לְאִישׁ־אַחֵֽר׃
Translated: she leaves his household and becomes [the wife] of another man ;
Transliteration: veyatseah miveytvo vehalekhah vehayetah leiysh-acher

Hebrew: וּשְׂנֵאָהּ֮ הָאִ֣ישׁ הָאַחֲרוֹן֒ וְכָ֨תַב לָ֜הּ סֵ֤פֶר כְּרִיתֻת֙ וְנָתַ֣ן בְּיָדָ֔הּ וְשִׁלְּחָ֖הּ מִבֵּית֑וֹ א֣וֹ כִ֤י יָמוּת֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הָאַחֲר֔וֹן אֲשֶׁר־לְקָחָ֥הּ ל֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: then this latter man rejects her, writes her a bill of divorcement, hands it to her, and sends her away from his household; or the man dies who had last taken her as his wife.
Transliteration: usheneah haiysh haacharvon vekhatav lah sefer kheriytut venatan veyadah veshilechah miveytvo vo khiy yamut haiysh haacharvon asher-lekachah lvo leishah

Hebrew: לֹא־יוּכַ֣ל בַּעְלָ֣הּ הָרִאשׁ֣וֹן אֲשֶֽׁר־שִׁ֠לְּחָ֠הּ לָשׁ֨וּב לְקַחְתָּ֜הּ לִהְי֧וֹת ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֗ה אַחֲרֵי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֻטַּמָּ֔אָה כִּֽי־תוֹעֵבָ֥ה הִ֖וא לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֤א תַחֲטִיא֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the first husband who divorced her shall not take her [into his household] to become his wife again, since she has been defiled —for that would be abhorrent to יהוה. You must not bring sin upon the land that your God יהוה is giving you as a heritage.
Transliteration: lo-yukhal vaelah harishvon asher-shilechah lashuv lekachetah liheyvot lvo leishah acharey asher hutamaah khiy-tvoevah hiv lifeney yehovah velo tachatiy et-haarets asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִקַּ֥ח אִישׁ֙ אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲדָשָׁ֔ה לֹ֤א יֵצֵא֙ בַּצָּבָ֔א וְלֹא־יַעֲבֹ֥ר עָלָ֖יו לְכׇל־דָּבָ֑ר נָקִ֞י יִהְיֶ֤ה לְבֵיתוֹ֙ שָׁנָ֣ה אֶחָ֔ת וְשִׂמַּ֖ח אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֥וֹ אֲשֶׁר־לָקָֽח׃
Translated: When a man has newly taken a woman [into his household as his wife], he shall not go out with the army or be assigned to it for any purpose; he shall be exempt one year for the sake of his household, to give happiness to the woman he has taken.
Transliteration: khiy-yikach iysh ishah chadashah lo eitse vatsava velo-yaavor alayv lekhׇl-davar nakiy yiheyeh leveytvo shanah echat veshimach et-ishetvo asher-lakach

Hebrew: לֹא־יַחֲבֹ֥ל רֵחַ֖יִם וָרָ֑כֶב כִּי־נֶ֖פֶשׁ ה֥וּא חֹבֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: A handmill or an upper millstone shall not be taken in pawn, for that would be taking someone’s life in pawn.
Transliteration: lo-yachavol rechayiim varakhev khiy-nefesh hu chovel {s}

Hebrew: כִּי־יִמָּצֵ֣א אִ֗ישׁ גֹּנֵ֨ב נֶ֤פֶשׁ מֵאֶחָיו֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהִתְעַמֶּר־בּ֖וֹ וּמְכָר֑וֹ וּמֵת֙ הַגַּנָּ֣ב הַה֔וּא וּבִֽעַרְתָּ֥ הָרָ֖ע מִקִּרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: If a party is found to have kidnapped—and then enslaved or sold—a fellow Israelite, that kidnapper shall die; thus you will sweep out evil from your midst.
Transliteration: khiy-yimatse iysh gonev nefesh meechayv miveney yisherael vehiteamer-vvo umekharvo umet haganav hahu uviareta hara mikirevekha {s}

Hebrew: הִשָּׁ֧מֶר בְּנֶֽגַע־הַצָּרַ֛עַת לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְאֹ֖ד וְלַעֲשׂ֑וֹת כְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁר־יוֹר֨וּ אֶתְכֶ֜ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים הַלְוִיִּ֛ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתִ֖ם תִּשְׁמְר֥וּ לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: In cases of a skin affection be most careful to do exactly as the levitical priests instruct you. Take care to do as I have commanded them.
Transliteration: hishamer venega-hatsaraat lishemor meod velaashvot khekhol asher-yvoru etekhem hakhohaniym haleviyim khaasher tsiviytim tishemeru laashvot

Hebrew: זָכ֕וֹר אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֛ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לְמִרְיָ֑ם בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֥ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Remember what your God יהוה did to Miriam on the journey after you left Egypt.
Transliteration: zakhvor et asher-ashah yehovah eloheykha lemireyam vaderekhe vetsetekhem mimitserayiim {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תַשֶּׁ֥ה בְרֵֽעֲךָ֖ מַשַּׁ֣את מְא֑וּמָה לֹא־תָבֹ֥א אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ לַעֲבֹ֥ט עֲבֹטֽוֹ׃
Translated: When you make a loan of any sort to your compatriot, you must not enter the house to seize the pledge.
Transliteration: khiy-tasheh vereakha mashat meumah lo-tavo el-veytvo laavot avotvo

Hebrew: בַּח֖וּץ תַּעֲמֹ֑ד וְהָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ נֹשֶׁ֣ה ב֔וֹ יוֹצִ֥יא אֵלֶ֛יךָ אֶֽת־הַעֲב֖וֹט הַחֽוּצָה׃
Translated: You must remain outside, while the party to whom you made the loan brings the pledge out to you.
Transliteration: vachuts taamod vehaiysh asher atah nosheh vvo yvotsiy eleykha et-haavvot hachutsah

Hebrew: וְאִם־אִ֥ישׁ עָנִ֖י ה֑וּא לֹ֥א תִשְׁכַּ֖ב בַּעֲבֹטֽוֹ׃
Translated: If that party is needy, you shall not go to sleep in that pledge;
Transliteration: veim-iysh aniy hu lo tishekhav vaavotvo

Hebrew: הָשֵׁב֩ תָּשִׁ֨יב ל֤וֹ אֶֽת־הַעֲבוֹט֙ כְּב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ וְשָׁכַ֥ב בְּשַׂלְמָת֖וֹ וּבֵֽרְכֶ֑ךָּ וּלְךָ֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה צְדָקָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: you must return the pledge at sundown, that its owner may sleep in the cloth and bless you; and it will be to your merit before your God יהוה.
Transliteration: hashev tashiyv lvo et-haavvot khevvo hashemesh veshakhav veshalematvo uverekhekha ulekha tiheyeh tsedakah lifeney yehovah eloheykha {s}

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשֹׁ֥ק שָׂכִ֖יר עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן מֵאַחֶ֕יךָ א֧וֹ מִגֵּרְךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּאַרְצְךָ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall not abuse a needy and destitute laborer, whether a fellow Israelite or a stranger in one of the communities of your land.
Transliteration: lo-taashok shakhiyr aniy veeveyvon meacheykha vo migerekha asher vearetsekha visheareykha

Hebrew: בְּיוֹמוֹ֩ תִתֵּ֨ן שְׂכָר֜וֹ וְֽלֹא־תָב֧וֹא עָלָ֣יו הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ כִּ֤י עָנִי֙ ה֔וּא וְאֵלָ֕יו ה֥וּא נֹשֵׂ֖א אֶת־נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־יִקְרָ֤א עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה בְךָ֖ חֵֽטְא׃ {ס}
Translated: You must pay out the wages due on the same day, before the sun sets, for the worker is needy and urgently depends on it; else a cry to יהוה will be issued against you and you will incur guilt.
Transliteration: veyvomvo titen shekharvo velo-tavvo alayv hashemesh khiy aniy hu veelayv hu noshe et-nafeshvo velo-yikera aleykha el-yehovah vehayah vekha chete {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יוּמְת֤וּ אָבוֹת֙ עַל־בָּנִ֔ים וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־יוּמְת֣וּ עַל־אָב֑וֹת אִ֥ישׁ בְּחֶטְא֖וֹ יוּמָֽתוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Parents shall not be put to death for children, nor children be put to death for parents: they shall each be put to death only for their own crime.
Transliteration: lo-yumetu avvot al-vaniym uvaniym lo-yumetu al-avvot iysh vechetevo yumatu {s}

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תַטֶּ֔ה מִשְׁפַּ֖ט גֵּ֣ר יָת֑וֹם וְלֹ֣א תַחֲבֹ֔ל בֶּ֖גֶד אַלְמָנָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not subvert the rights of the stranger or the fatherless; you shall not take a widow’s garment in pawn.
Transliteration: lo tateh mishefat ger yatvom velo tachavol veged alemanah

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתָּ֗ כִּ֣י עֶ֤בֶד הָיִ֙יתָ֙ בְּמִצְרַ֔יִם וַֽיִּפְדְּךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ מִשָּׁ֑ם עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Remember that you were a slave in Egypt and that your God יהוה redeemed you from there; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.
Transliteration: vezakhareta khiy eved hayiyta vemitserayiim vayifedekha yehovah eloheykha misham al-khen anokhiy metsavekha laashvot et-hadavar hazeh {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִקְצֹר֩ קְצִֽירְךָ֨ בְשָׂדֶ֜ךָ וְשָֽׁכַחְתָּ֧ עֹ֣מֶר בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה לֹ֤א תָשׁוּב֙ לְקַחְתּ֔וֹ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֑ה לְמַ֤עַן יְבָרֶכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: When you reap the harvest in your field and overlook a sheaf in the field, do not turn back to get it; it shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow—in order that your God יהוה may bless you in all your undertakings.
Transliteration: khiy tiketsor ketsiyrekha veshadekha veshakhacheta omer vashadeh lo tashuv lekachetvo lager layatvom velaalemanah yiheyeh lemaan yevarekhekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol maasheh yadeykha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תַחְבֹּט֙ זֵֽיתְךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְפַאֵ֖ר אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: When you beat down the fruit of your olive trees, do not go over them again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
Transliteration: khiy tachevot zeytekha lo tefaer achareykha lager layatvom velaalemanah yiheyeh

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תִבְצֹר֙ כַּרְמְךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְעוֹלֵ֖ל אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ לַגֵּ֛ר לַיָּת֥וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֖ה יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, do not pick it over again; that shall go to the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.
Transliteration: khiy tivetsor kharemekha lo tevolel achareykha lager layatvom velaalemanah yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְזָ֣כַרְתָּ֔ כִּי־עֶ֥בֶד הָיִ֖יתָ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֞ן אָנֹכִ֤י מְצַוְּךָ֙ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Always remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore do I enjoin you to observe this commandment.
Transliteration: vezakhareta khiy-eved hayiyta veerets mitserayiim al-khen anokhiy metsavekha laashvot et-hadavar hazeh {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה רִיב֙ בֵּ֣ין אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְנִגְּשׁ֥וּ אֶל־הַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט וּשְׁפָט֑וּם וְהִצְדִּ֙יקוּ֙ אֶת־הַצַּדִּ֔יק וְהִרְשִׁ֖יעוּ אֶת־הָרָשָֽׁע׃
Translated: When there is a dispute between two parties and they go to law, and a decision is rendered declaring the one in the right and the other in the wrong—
Transliteration: khiy-yiheyeh riyv veyn anashiym venigeshu el-hamishefat ushefatum vehitsediyku et-hatsadiyk vehireshiyu et-harasha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֛ה אִם־בִּ֥ן הַכּ֖וֹת הָרָשָׁ֑ע וְהִפִּיל֤וֹ הַשֹּׁפֵט֙ וְהִכָּ֣הוּ לְפָנָ֔יו כְּדֵ֥י רִשְׁעָת֖וֹ בְּמִסְפָּֽר׃
Translated: if the guilty one is to be flogged, the magistrate shall have the person lie down and shall supervise the giving of lashes, by count, as warranted by the offense.
Transliteration: vehayah im-vin hakhvot harasha vehifiylvo hashofet vehikhahu lefanayv khedey risheatvo vemisefar

Hebrew: אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יַכֶּ֖נּוּ לֹ֣א יֹסִ֑יף פֶּן־יֹסִ֨יף לְהַכֹּת֤וֹ עַל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ מַכָּ֣ה רַבָּ֔ה וְנִקְלָ֥ה אָחִ֖יךָ לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The guilty one may be given up to forty lashes, but not more, lest being flogged further, to excess, your peer be degraded before your eyes.
Transliteration: arevaiym yakhenu lo yosiyf fen-yosiyf lehakhotvo al-eleh makhah ravah venikelah achiykha leeyneykha

Hebrew: לֹא־תַחְסֹ֥ם שׁ֖וֹר בְּדִישֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing.
Transliteration: lo-tachesom shvor vediyshvo {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יֵשְׁב֨וּ אַחִ֜ים יַחְדָּ֗ו וּמֵ֨ת אַחַ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ וּבֵ֣ן אֵֽין־ל֔וֹ לֹֽא־תִהְיֶ֧ה אֵֽשֶׁת־הַמֵּ֛ת הַח֖וּצָה לְאִ֣ישׁ זָ֑ר יְבָמָהּ֙ יָבֹ֣א עָלֶ֔יהָ וּלְקָחָ֥הּ ל֛וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֖ה וְיִבְּמָֽהּ׃
Translated: When brothers dwell together and one of them dies and leaves no offspring, the wife of the deceased shall not become that of another party, outside the family. Her husband’s brother shall unite with her: he shall take her as his wife and perform the levir’s duty.
Transliteration: khiy-eishevu achiym yachedav umet achad mehem uven eyn-lvo lo-tiheyeh eshet-hamet hachutsah leiysh zar yevamah yavo aleyha ulekachah lvo leishah veyivemah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הַבְּכוֹר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּלֵ֔ד יָק֕וּם עַל־שֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו הַמֵּ֑ת וְלֹֽא־יִמָּחֶ֥ה שְׁמ֖וֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The first child that she bears shall be accounted to the dead brother, that his name may not be blotted out in Israel.
Transliteration: vehayah havekhvor asher teled yakum al-shem achiyv hamet velo-yimacheh shemvo miyisherael

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א יַחְפֹּץ֙ הָאִ֔ישׁ לָקַ֖חַת אֶת־יְבִמְתּ֑וֹ וְעָלְתָה֩ יְבִמְתּ֨וֹ הַשַּׁ֜עְרָה אֶל־הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים וְאָֽמְרָה֙ מֵאֵ֨ן יְבָמִ֜י לְהָקִ֨ים לְאָחִ֥יו שֵׁם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה יַבְּמִֽי׃
Translated: But if that party does not want to take his brother’s widow [to wife], his brother’s widow shall appear before the elders in the gate and declare, “My husband’s brother refuses to establish a name in Israel for his brother; he will not perform the duty of a levir.”
Transliteration: veim-lo yachefots haiysh lakachat et-yevimetvo vealetah yevimetvo hashaerah el-hazekeniym veamerah meen yevamiy lehakiym leachiyv shem veyisherael lo avah yavemiy

Hebrew: וְקָֽרְאוּ־ל֥וֹ זִקְנֵי־עִיר֖וֹ וְדִבְּר֣וּ אֵלָ֑יו וְעָמַ֣ד וְאָמַ֔ר לֹ֥א חָפַ֖צְתִּי לְקַחְתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The elders of his town shall then summon him and talk to him. If he insists, saying, “I do not want to take her,”
Transliteration: vekareu-lvo zikeney-iyrvo vediveru elayv veamad veamar lo chafatsetiy lekachetah

Hebrew: וְנִגְּשָׁ֨ה יְבִמְתּ֣וֹ אֵלָיו֮ לְעֵינֵ֣י הַזְּקֵנִים֒ וְחָלְצָ֤ה נַעֲלוֹ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְל֔וֹ וְיָרְקָ֖ה בְּפָנָ֑יו וְעָֽנְתָה֙ וְאָ֣מְרָ֔ה כָּ֚כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֣ה לָאִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יִבְנֶ֖ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, pull the sandal off his foot, spit in his face, and make this declaration: Thus shall be done to the man who will not build up his brother’s house!
Transliteration: venigeshah yevimetvo elayv leeyney hazekeniym vechaletsah naalvo meal ragelvo veyarekah vefanayv veanetah veamerah khakhah eiasheh laiysh asher lo-yiveneh et-veyt achiyv

Hebrew: וְנִקְרָ֥א שְׁמ֖וֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בֵּ֖ית חֲל֥וּץ הַנָּֽעַל׃ {ס}
Translated: And he shall go in Israel by the name of “the family of the unsandaled one.”
Transliteration: venikera shemvo veyisherael veyt chaluts hanaal {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יִנָּצ֨וּ אֲנָשִׁ֤ים יַחְדָּו֙ אִ֣ישׁ וְאָחִ֔יו וְקָֽרְבָה֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת הָֽאֶחָ֔ד לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶת־אִישָׁ֖הּ מִיַּ֣ד מַכֵּ֑הוּ וְשָׁלְחָ֣ה יָדָ֔הּ וְהֶחֱזִ֖יקָה בִּמְבֻשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: If two parties are fighting—one man with another—and the wife of one comes up to save her husband from his antagonist and puts out her hand and seizes him by his genitals,
Transliteration: khiy-yinatsu anashiym yachedav iysh veachiyv vekarevah eshet haechad lehatsiyl et-iyshah miyad makhehu veshalechah yadah vehecheziykah vimevushayv

Hebrew: וְקַצֹּתָ֖ה אֶת־כַּפָּ֑הּ לֹ֥א תָח֖וֹס עֵינֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: you shall cut off her hand; show no pity.
Transliteration: vekatsotah et-khafah lo tachvos eynekha {s}

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ בְּכִֽיסְךָ֖ אֶ֣בֶן וָאָ֑בֶן גְּדוֹלָ֖ה וּקְטַנָּֽה׃
Translated: You shall not have in your pouch alternate weights, larger and smaller.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh lekha vekhiysekha even vaaven gedvolah uketanah

Hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ אֵיפָ֣ה וְאֵיפָ֑ה גְּדוֹלָ֖ה וּקְטַנָּֽה׃
Translated: You shall not have in your house alternate measures, a larger and a smaller.
Transliteration: lo-yiheyeh lekha veveytekha eyfah veeyfah gedvolah uketanah

Hebrew: אֶ֣בֶן שְׁלֵמָ֤ה וָצֶ֙דֶק֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֔ךְ אֵיפָ֧ה שְׁלֵמָ֛ה וָצֶ֖דֶק יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ לְמַ֙עַן֙ יַאֲרִ֣יכוּ יָמֶ֔יךָ עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
Translated: You must have completely honest weights and completely honest measures, if you are to endure long on the soil that your God יהוה is giving you.
Transliteration: even shelemah vatsedek yiheyeh-lakhe eyfah shelemah vatsedek yiheyeh-lakhe lemaan yaariykhu yameykha al haadamah asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe

Hebrew: כִּ֧י תוֹעֲבַ֛ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כׇּל־עֹ֣שֵׂה אֵ֑לֶּה כֹּ֖ל עֹ֥שֵׂה עָֽוֶל׃ {פ}
Translated: For everyone who does those things, everyone who deals dishonestly, is abhorrent to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: khiy tvoavat yehovah eloheykha khׇl-osheh eleh khol osheh avel {f}

Hebrew: זָכ֕וֹר אֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ עֲמָלֵ֑ק בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ בְּצֵאתְכֶ֥ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey, after you left Egypt—
Transliteration: zakhvor et asher-ashah lekha amalek vaderekhe vetsetekhem mimitserayiim

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָֽרְךָ֜ בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ וַיְזַנֵּ֤ב בְּךָ֙ כׇּל־הַנֶּחֱשָׁלִ֣ים אַֽחֲרֶ֔יךָ וְאַתָּ֖ה עָיֵ֣ף וְיָגֵ֑עַ וְלֹ֥א יָרֵ֖א אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: how, undeterred by fear of God, he surprised you on the march, when you were famished and weary, and cut down all the stragglers in your rear.
Transliteration: asher karekha vaderekhe vayezanev vekha khׇl-hanecheshaliym achareykha veatah aeif veyagea velo yare Elohim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה בְּהָנִ֣יחַ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ ׀ לְ֠ךָ֠ מִכׇּל־אֹ֨יְבֶ֜יךָ מִסָּבִ֗יב בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְהֹוָה־אֱ֠לֹהֶ֠יךָ נֹתֵ֨ן לְךָ֤ נַחֲלָה֙ לְרִשְׁתָּ֔הּ תִּמְחֶה֙ אֶת־זֵ֣כֶר עֲמָלֵ֔ק מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם לֹ֖א תִּשְׁכָּֽח׃ {פ}
Translated: Therefore, when your God יהוה grants you safety from all your enemies around you, in the land that your God יהוה is giving you as a hereditary portion, you shall blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!
Transliteration: vehayah vehaniycha yehovah eloheykha lekha mikhׇl-oyeveykha misaviyv vaarets asher yehovah-eloheykha noten lekha nachalah lerishetah timecheh et-zekher amalek mitachat hashamayiim lo tishekhach {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ כִּֽי־תָב֣וֹא אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לְךָ֖ נַחֲלָ֑ה וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֖הּ וְיָשַׁ֥בְתָּ בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: When you enter the land that your God יהוה is giving you as a heritage, and you possess it and settle in it,
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-tavvo el-haarets asher yehovah eloheykha noten lekha nachalah viyrishetah veyashaveta vah

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֞ מֵרֵאשִׁ֣ית ׀ כׇּל־פְּרִ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר תָּבִ֧יא מֵֽאַרְצְךָ֛ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָ֖ךְ וְשַׂמְתָּ֣ בַטֶּ֑נֶא וְהָֽלַכְתָּ֙ אֶל־הַמָּק֔וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִבְחַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן שְׁמ֖וֹ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: you shall take some of every first fruit of the soil, which you harvest from the land that your God יהוה is giving you, put it in a basket and go to the place where your God יהוה will choose to establish the divine name.
Transliteration: velakacheta mereshiyt khׇl-feriy haadamah asher taviy mearetsekha asher yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe veshameta vatene vehalakheta el-hamakvom asher yivechar yehovah eloheykha leshakhen shemvo sham

Hebrew: וּבָאתָ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֑ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֗יו הִגַּ֤דְתִּי הַיּוֹם֙ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כִּי־בָ֙אתִי֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֵ֖ינוּ לָ֥תֶת לָֽנוּ׃
Translated: You shall go to the priest in charge at that time and say to him, “I acknowledge this day before your God יהוה that I have entered the land that יהוה swore to our fathers to assign us.”
Transliteration: uvata el-hakhohen asher yiheyeh vayamiym hahem veamareta elayv higadetiy hayyvom layhovah eloheykha khiy-vatiy el-haarets asher nisheva yehovah laavoteynu latet lanu

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן הַטֶּ֖נֶא מִיָּדֶ֑ךָ וְהִ֨נִּיח֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֕י מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it down in front of the altar of your God יהוה.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen hatene miyadekha vehiniychvo lifeney mizevach yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְעָנִ֨יתָ וְאָמַרְתָּ֜ לִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֲרַמִּי֙ אֹבֵ֣ד אָבִ֔י וַיֵּ֣רֶד מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וַיָּ֥גׇר שָׁ֖ם בִּמְתֵ֣י מְעָ֑ט וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֕ם לְג֥וֹי גָּד֖וֹל עָצ֥וּם וָרָֽב׃
Translated: You shall then recite as follows before your God יהוה: “My father was a fugitive Aramean. He went down to Egypt with meager numbers and sojourned there; but there he became a great and very populous nation.
Transliteration: veaniyta veamareta lifeney yehovah eloheykha aramiy oved aviy vayered mitserayemah vayagׇr sham vimetey meat vayehiy-sham legvoy gadvol atsum varav

Hebrew: וַיָּרֵ֧עוּ אֹתָ֛נוּ הַמִּצְרִ֖ים וַיְעַנּ֑וּנוּ וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ עָלֵ֖ינוּ עֲבֹדָ֥ה קָשָֽׁה׃
Translated: The Egyptians dealt harshly with us and oppressed us; they imposed heavy labor upon us.
Transliteration: vayareu otanu hamitseriym vayeanunu vayitenu aleynu avodah kashah

Hebrew: וַנִּצְעַ֕ק אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־קֹלֵ֔נוּ וַיַּ֧רְא אֶת־עׇנְיֵ֛נוּ וְאֶת־עֲמָלֵ֖נוּ וְאֶֽת־לַחֲצֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: We cried to יהוה, the God of our ancestors, and יהוה heard our plea and saw our plight, our misery, and our oppression.
Transliteration: vanitseak el-yehovah elohey avoteynu vayishema yehovah et-kolenu vayare et-ׇneeinu veet-amalenu veet-lachatsenu

Hebrew: וַיּוֹצִאֵ֤נוּ יְהֹוָה֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם בְּיָ֤ד חֲזָקָה֙ וּבִזְרֹ֣עַ נְטוּיָ֔ה וּבְמֹרָ֖א גָּדֹ֑ל וּבְאֹת֖וֹת וּבְמֹפְתִֽים׃
Translated: יהוה freed us from Egypt by a mighty hand, by an outstretched arm and awesome power, and by signs and portents,
Transliteration: vayyvotsienu yehovah mimitserayiim veyad chazakah uvizeroa netuyah uvemora gadol uveotvot uvemofetiym

Hebrew: וַיְבִאֵ֖נוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: bringing us to this place and giving us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Transliteration: vayevienu el-hamakvom hazeh vayiten-lanu et-haarets hazot erets zavat chalav udevash

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּ֤ה הֵבֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־רֵאשִׁית֙ פְּרִ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תָּה לִּ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהִנַּחְתּ֗וֹ לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֔יתָ לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Wherefore I now bring the first fruits of the soil which You, יהוה, have given me.” You shall leave it before your God יהוה and bow low before your God יהוה.
Transliteration: veatah hineh hevetiy et-reshiyt feriy haadamah asher-natatah liy yehovah vehinachetvo lifeney yehovah eloheykha vehishetachaviyta lifeney yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְשָׂמַחְתָּ֣ בְכׇל־הַטּ֗וֹב אֲשֶׁ֧ר נָֽתַן־לְךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּלְבֵיתֶ֑ךָ אַתָּה֙ וְהַלֵּוִ֔י וְהַגֵּ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּקִרְבֶּֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: And you shall enjoy, together with the [family of the] Levite and the stranger in your midst, all the bounty that your God יהוה has bestowed upon you and your household.
Transliteration: veshamacheta vekhׇl-hatvov asher natan-lekha yehovah eloheykha uleveytekha atah vehaleviy vehager asher vekirevekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תְכַלֶּ֞ה לַ֠עְשֵׂ֠ר אֶת־כׇּל־מַעְשַׂ֧ר תְּבוּאָתְךָ֛ בַּשָּׁנָ֥ה הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖ת שְׁנַ֣ת הַֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֑ר וְנָתַתָּ֣ה לַלֵּוִ֗י לַגֵּר֙ לַיָּת֣וֹם וְלָֽאַלְמָנָ֔ה וְאָכְל֥וּ בִשְׁעָרֶ֖יךָ וְשָׂבֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: When you have set aside in full the tenth part of your yield—in the third year, the year of the tithe —and have given it to the [family of the] Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat their fill in your settlements,
Transliteration: khiy tekhaleh laesher et-khׇl-maeshar tevuatekha vashanah hasheliyshit shenat hamaasher venatatah laleviy lager layatvom velaalemanah veakhelu visheareykha veshaveu

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֡ לִפְנֵי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בִּעַ֧רְתִּי הַקֹּ֣דֶשׁ מִן־הַבַּ֗יִת וְגַ֨ם נְתַתִּ֤יו לַלֵּוִי֙ וְלַגֵּר֙ לַיָּת֣וֹם וְלָאַלְמָנָ֔ה כְּכׇל־מִצְוָתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּיתָ֑נִי לֹֽא־עָבַ֥רְתִּי מִמִּצְוֺתֶ֖יךָ וְלֹ֥א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
Translated: you shall declare before your God יהוה: “I have cleared out the consecrated portion from the house; and I have given it to the [family of the] Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, just as You commanded me; I have neither transgressed nor neglected any of Your commandments:
Transliteration: veamareta lifeney yehovah eloheykha viaretiy hakodesh min-havayiit vegam netatiyv laleviy velager layatvom velaalemanah khekhׇl-mitsevatekha asher tsiviytaniy lo-avaretiy mimitsevoteykha velo shakhachetiy

Hebrew: לֹא־אָכַ֨לְתִּי בְאֹנִ֜י מִמֶּ֗נּוּ וְלֹא־בִעַ֤רְתִּי מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ בְּטָמֵ֔א וְלֹא־נָתַ֥תִּי מִמֶּ֖נּוּ לְמֵ֑ת שָׁמַ֗עְתִּי בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י עָשִׂ֕יתִי כְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּיתָֽנִי׃
Translated: I have not eaten of it while in mourning, I have not cleared out any of it while I was impure, and I have not deposited any of it with the dead. I have obeyed my God יהוה; I have done just as You commanded me.
Transliteration: lo-akhaletiy veoniy mimenu velo-viaretiy mimenu vetame velo-natatiy mimenu lemet shamaetiy vekvol yehovah elohay ashiytiy khekhol asher tsiviytaniy

Hebrew: הַשְׁקִ֩יפָה֩ מִמְּע֨וֹן קׇדְשְׁךָ֜ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם וּבָרֵ֤ךְ אֶֽת־עַמְּךָ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֵת֙ הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תָּה לָ֑נוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּ֙עְתָּ֙ לַאֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Look down from Your holy abode, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the soil You have given us, a land flowing with milk and honey, as You swore to our fathers.”
Transliteration: hashekiyfah mimevon kׇdeshekha min-hashamayiim uvarekhe et-amekha et-yisherael veet haadamah asher natatah lanu khaasher nishevaeta laavoteynu erets zavat chalav udevash {s}

Hebrew: הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ מְצַוְּךָ֧ לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֑ים וְשָׁמַרְתָּ֤ וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אוֹתָ֔ם בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: Your God יהוה commands you this day to observe these laws and rules; observe them faithfully with all your heart and soul.
Transliteration: hayyvom hazeh yehovah eloheykha metsavekha laashvot et-hachukiym haeleh veet-hamishefatiym veshamareta veashiyta votam vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha

Hebrew: אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה הֶאֱמַ֖רְתָּ הַיּ֑וֹם לִהְיוֹת֩ לְךָ֨ לֵֽאלֹהִ֜ים וְלָלֶ֣כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֗יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֨ר חֻקָּ֧יו וּמִצְוֺתָ֛יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֥עַ בְּקֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated: You have affirmed this day that יהוה is your God, in whose ways you will walk, whose laws and commandments and rules you will observe, and whom you will obey.
Transliteration: et-yehovah heemareta hayyvom liheyvot lekha lelohiym velalekhet viderakhayv velishemor chukayv umitsevotayv umishefatayv velishemoa vekolvo

Hebrew: וַֽיהֹוָ֞ה הֶאֱמִֽירְךָ֣ הַיּ֗וֹם לִהְי֥וֹת לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם סְגֻלָּ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְלִשְׁמֹ֖ר כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָֽיו׃
Translated: And יהוה has affirmed this day that you are, as promised, God’s treasured people who shall observe all the divine commandments,
Transliteration: vayhovah heemiyrekha hayyvom liheyvot lvo leam segulah khaasher diver-lakhe velishemor khׇl-mitsevotayv

Hebrew: וּֽלְתִתְּךָ֣ עֶלְי֗וֹן עַ֤ל כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה לִתְהִלָּ֖ה וּלְשֵׁ֣ם וּלְתִפְאָ֑רֶת וְלִֽהְיֹתְךָ֧ עַם־קָדֹ֛שׁ לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֵּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: and that [God] will set you, in fame and renown and glory, high above all the nations that [God] has made; and that you shall be, as promised, a holy people to your God יהוה.
Transliteration: uletitekha eleyvon al khׇl-hagvoyim asher ashah litehilah uleshem uletifearet veliheyotekha am-kadosh layhovah eloheykha khaasher diver {f}

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ וְזִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר שָׁמֹר֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֖ם הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying: Observe all the Instruction that I enjoin upon you this day.
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh vezikeney yisherael et-haam lemor shamor et-khׇl-hamitsevah asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה בַּיּוֹם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעַבְר֣וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֣ן לָ֑ךְ וַהֲקֵמֹתָ֤ לְךָ֙ אֲבָנִ֣ים גְּדֹל֔וֹת וְשַׂדְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם בַּשִּֽׂיד׃
Translated: As soon as you have crossed the Jordan into the land that your God יהוה is giving you, you shall set up large stones. Coat them with plaster
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom asher taaveru et-hayareden el-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe vahakemota lekha avaniym gedolvot veshadeta otam vashiyd

Hebrew: וְכָתַבְתָּ֣ עֲלֵיהֶ֗ן אֶֽת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בְּעׇבְרֶ֑ךָ לְמַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁר֩ תָּבֹ֨א אֶל־הָאָ֜רֶץ אֲֽשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ ׀ נֹתֵ֣ן לְךָ֗ אֶ֣רֶץ זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: and inscribe upon them all the words of this Teaching. When you cross over to enter the land that your God יהוה is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as יהוה, the God of your ancestors, promised you—
Transliteration: vekhataveta aleyhen et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot veׇverekha lemaan asher tavo el-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lekha erets zavat chalav udevash khaasher diver yehovah elohey-avoteykha lakhe

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ בְּעׇבְרְכֶ֣ם אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ תָּקִ֜ימוּ אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם בְּהַ֣ר עֵיבָ֑ל וְשַׂדְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֖ם בַּשִּֽׂיד׃
Translated: upon crossing the Jordan, you shall set up these stones, about which I charge you this day, on Mount Ebal, and coat them with plaster.
Transliteration: vehayah veׇverekhem et-hayareden takiymu et-haavaniym haeleh asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom vehar eyval veshadeta votam vashiyd

Hebrew: וּבָנִ֤יתָ שָּׁם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ מִזְבַּ֣ח אֲבָנִ֔ים לֹא־תָנִ֥יף עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated: There, too, you shall build an altar to your God יהוה, an altar of stones. Do not wield an iron tool over them;
Transliteration: uvaniyta sham mizevecha layhovah eloheykha mizevach avaniym lo-taniyf aleyhem varezel

Hebrew: אֲבָנִ֤ים שְׁלֵמוֹת֙ תִּבְנֶ֔ה אֶת־מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְהַעֲלִ֤יתָ עָלָיו֙ עוֹלֹ֔ת לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: you must build the altar of your God יהוה of unhewn stones. You shall offer on it burnt offerings to your God יהוה,
Transliteration: avaniym shelemvot tiveneh et-mizevach yehovah eloheykha vehaaliyta alayv volot layhovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְזָבַחְתָּ֥ שְׁלָמִ֖ים וְאָכַ֣לְתָּ שָּׁ֑ם וְשָׂ֣מַחְתָּ֔ לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: and you shall sacrifice there offerings of well-being and eat them, rejoicing before your God יהוה.
Transliteration: vezavacheta shelamiym veakhaleta sham veshamacheta lifeney yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְכָתַבְתָּ֣ עַל־הָאֲבָנִ֗ים אֶֽת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֛י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּאֵ֥ר הֵיטֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: And on those stones you shall inscribe every word of this Teaching most distinctly.
Transliteration: vekhataveta al-haavaniym et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot vaer heytev {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶ֥ל כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הַסְכֵּ֤ת <small>׀</small> וּשְׁמַע֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ נִהְיֵ֣יתָֽ לְעָ֔ם לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Moses and the levitical priests spoke to all Israel, saying: Silence! Hear, O Israel! Today you have become the people of your God יהוה:
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh vehakhohaniym haleviyim el khׇl-yisherael lemor hasekhet <small></small> ushema yisherael hayyvom hazeh niheeiyta leam layhovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣מַעְתָּ֔ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְעָשִׂ֤יתָ אֶת־מִצְוֺתָו֙ וְאֶת־חֻקָּ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: Heed your God יהוה and observe the divine commandments and laws, which I enjoin upon you this day.
Transliteration: veshamaeta vekvol yehovah eloheykha veashiyta et-mitsevotav veet-chukayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thereupon Moses charged the people, saying:
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh et-haam vayyvom hahu lemor

Hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה יַֽעַמְד֞וּ לְבָרֵ֤ךְ אֶת־הָעָם֙ עַל־הַ֣ר גְּרִזִ֔ים בְּעׇבְרְכֶ֖ם אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן שִׁמְעוֹן֙ וְלֵוִ֣י וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר וְיוֹסֵ֥ף וּבִנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: After you have crossed the Jordan, the following shall stand on Mount Gerizim when the blessing for the people is spoken: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
Transliteration: eleh yaamedu levarekhe et-haam al-har geriziym veׇverekhem et-hayareden shimevon veleviy viyhudah veyishashkhar veyvosef uvineyamin

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה יַֽעַמְד֥וּ עַל־הַקְּלָלָ֖ה בְּהַ֣ר עֵיבָ֑ל רְאוּבֵן֙ גָּ֣ד וְאָשֵׁ֔ר וּזְבוּלֻ֖ן דָּ֥ן וְנַפְתָּלִֽי׃
Translated: And for the curse, the following shall stand on Mount Ebal: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
Transliteration: veeleh yaamedu al-hakelalah vehar eyval reuven gad veasher uzevulun dan venafetaliy

Hebrew: וְעָנ֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם וְאָ֥מְר֛וּ אֶל־כׇּל־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ק֥וֹל רָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The Levites shall then proclaim in a loud voice to all the people of Israel:
Transliteration: veanu haleviyim veameru el-khׇl-iysh yisherael kvol ram {s}

Hebrew: אָר֣וּר הָאִ֡ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשֶׂה֩ פֶ֨סֶל וּמַסֵּכָ֜ה תּוֹעֲבַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה מַעֲשֵׂ֛ה יְדֵ֥י חָרָ֖שׁ וְשָׂ֣ם בַּסָּ֑תֶר וְעָנ֧וּ כׇל־הָעָ֛ם וְאָמְר֖וּ אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be any party who makes a sculptured or molten image, abhorred by יהוה, a craftsman’s handiwork, and sets it up in secret.—And all the people shall respond, Amen.
Transliteration: arur haiysh asher yaasheh fesel umasekhah tvoavat yehovah maasheh yedey charash vesham vasater veanu khׇl-haam veameru amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַקְלֶ֥ה אָבִ֖יו וְאִמּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who insults father or mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur makeleh aviyv veimvo veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַסִּ֖יג גְּב֣וּל רֵעֵ֑הוּ וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who moves a neighbor’s landmark.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur masiyg gevul reehu veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַשְׁגֶּ֥ה עִוֵּ֖ר בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who misdirects a blind person who is underway.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur mashegeh iver vadarekhe veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֗וּר מַטֶּ֛ה מִשְׁפַּ֥ט גֵּר־יָת֖וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֑ה וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃
Translated: Cursed be the one who subverts the rights of the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur mateh mishefat ger-yatvom vealemanah veamar khׇl-haam amen

Hebrew: אָר֗וּר שֹׁכֵב֙ עִם־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֔יו כִּ֥י גִלָּ֖ה כְּנַ֣ף אָבִ֑יו וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the [man] who lies with his father’s wife, for he has removed his father’s garment. —And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur shokhev im-eshet aviyv khiy gilah khenaf aviyv veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־כׇּל־בְּהֵמָ֑ה וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who lies with any beast.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur shokhev im-khׇl-vehemah veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֗וּר שֹׁכֵב֙ עִם־אֲחֹת֔וֹ בַּת־אָבִ֖יו א֣וֹ בַת־אִמּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the [man] who lies with his sister, whether daughter of his father or of his mother.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur shokhev im-achotvo vat-aviyv vo vat-imvo veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־חֹֽתַנְתּ֑וֹ וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the [man] who lies with his mother-in-law.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur shokhev im-chotanetvo veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֕וּר מַכֵּ֥ה רֵעֵ֖הוּ בַּסָּ֑תֶר וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who strikes down a fellow [Israelite] in secret.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur makheh reehu vasater veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָרוּר֙ לֹקֵ֣חַ שֹׁ֔חַד לְהַכּ֥וֹת נֶ֖פֶשׁ דָּ֣ם נָקִ֑י וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Cursed be the one who accepts a bribe in the case of the murder of an innocent person.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur lokecha shochad lehakhvot nefesh dam nakiy veamar khׇl-haam amen {s}

Hebrew: אָר֗וּר אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָקִ֛ים אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת אוֹתָ֑ם וְאָמַ֥ר כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אָמֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: Cursed be whoever will not uphold the terms of this Teaching and observe them.—And all the people shall say, Amen.
Transliteration: arur asher lo-yakiym et-diverey hatvorah-hazot laashvot votam veamar khׇl-haam amen {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־שָׁמ֤וֹעַ תִּשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּנְתָ֨נְךָ֜ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עֶלְי֔וֹן עַ֖ל כׇּל־גּוֹיֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Now, if you obey your God יהוה, to observe faithfully all the divine commandments which I enjoin upon you this day, your God יהוה will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
Transliteration: vehayah im-shamvoa tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor laashvot et-khׇl-mitsevotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom unetanekha yehovah eloheykha eleyvon al khׇl-gvoeiy haarets

Hebrew: וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כׇּל־הַבְּרָכ֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֻ֑ךָ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֔ע בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: All these blessings shall come upon you and take effect, if you will but heed the word of your God יהוה:
Transliteration: uvau aleykha khׇl-haverakhvot haeleh vehishiygukha khiy tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Blessed shall you be in the city and blessed shall you be in the country.
Transliteration: varukhe atah vaiyr uvarukhe atah vashadeh

Hebrew: בָּר֧וּךְ פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֛ וּפְרִ֥י אַדְמָתְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י בְהֶמְתֶּ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּר֥וֹת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Blessed shall be your issue from the womb, your produce from the soil, and the offspring of your cattle, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.
Transliteration: varukhe feriy-vitenekha uferiy adematekha uferiy vehemetekha shegar alafeykha veashetervot tsonekha

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
Transliteration: varukhe taneakha umishearetekha

Hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וּבָר֥וּךְ אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Blessed shall you be in your comings and blessed shall you be in your goings.
Transliteration: varukhe atah vevoekha uvarukhe atah vetsetekha

Hebrew: יִתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ הַקָּמִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ נִגָּפִ֖ים לְפָנֶ֑יךָ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ יֵצְא֣וּ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים יָנ֥וּסוּ לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: יהוה will put to rout before [your army] the enemies who attack you; they will march out against you by a single road, but flee from you by many roads.
Transliteration: yiten yehovah et-oyeveykha hakamiym aleykha nigafiym lefaneykha vederekhe echad eitseu eleykha uveshiveah derakhiym yanusu lefaneykha

Hebrew: יְצַ֨ו יְהֹוָ֤ה אִתְּךָ֙ אֶת־הַבְּרָכָ֔ה בַּאֲסָמֶ֕יךָ וּבְכֹ֖ל מִשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וּבֵ֣רַכְךָ֔ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ נֹתֵ֥ן לָֽךְ׃
Translated: יהוה will ordain blessings for you upon your barns and upon all your undertakings: you will be blessed in the land that your God יהוה is giving you.
Transliteration: yetsav yehovah itekha et-haverakhah vaasameykha uvekhol mishelach yadekha uverakhekha vaarets asher-yehovah eloheykha noten lakhe

Hebrew: יְקִֽימְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה לוֹ֙ לְעַ֣ם קָד֔וֹשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר נִֽשְׁבַּֽע־לָ֑ךְ כִּ֣י תִשְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־מִצְוֺת֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וְהָלַכְתָּ֖ בִּדְרָכָֽיו׃
Translated: יהוה will establish you as God’s holy people, as was sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of your God יהוה and walk in God’s ways.
Transliteration: yekiymekha yehovah lvo leam kadvosh khaasher nisheva-lakhe khiy tishemor et-mitsevot yehovah eloheykha vehalakheta viderakhayv

Hebrew: וְרָאוּ֙ כׇּל־עַמֵּ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה נִקְרָ֣א עָלֶ֑יךָ וְיָֽרְא֖וּ מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated: And all the peoples of the earth shall see that יהוה’s name is proclaimed over you, and they shall stand in fear of you.
Transliteration: verau khׇl-amey haarets khiy shem yehovah nikera aleykha veyareu mimekha

Hebrew: וְהוֹתִרְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ לְטוֹבָ֔ה בִּפְרִ֧י בִטְנְךָ֛ וּבִפְרִ֥י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֖ וּבִפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ עַ֚ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ לָ֥תֶת לָֽךְ׃
Translated: יהוה will give you abounding prosperity in your issue from the womb, the offspring of your cattle, and the produce of your soil in the land that יהוה swore to your fathers to assign to you.
Transliteration: vehvotirekha yehovah letvovah viferiy vitenekha uviferiy vehemetekha uviferiy adematekha al haadamah asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykha latet lakhe

Hebrew: יִפְתַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> לְ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־אוֹצָר֨וֹ הַטּ֜וֹב אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם לָתֵ֤ת מְטַֽר־אַרְצְךָ֙ בְּעִתּ֔וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֕ךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֑ךָ וְהִלְוִ֙יתָ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֥א תִלְוֶֽה׃
Translated: יהוה will open for you that bounteous store, the heavens, to provide rain for your land in season and to bless all your undertakings. You will be creditor to many nations, but debtor to none.
Transliteration: yifetach yehovah <small></small> lekha et-votsarvo hatvov et-hashamayiim latet metar-aretsekha veitvo ulevarekhe et khׇl-maasheh yadekha vehileviyta gvoyim raviym veatah lo tileveh

Hebrew: וּנְתָֽנְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֤ה לְרֹאשׁ֙ וְלֹ֣א לְזָנָ֔ב וְהָיִ֙יתָ֙ רַ֣ק לְמַ֔עְלָה וְלֹ֥א תִהְיֶ֖ה לְמָ֑טָּה כִּֽי־תִשְׁמַ֞ע אֶל־מִצְוֺ֣ת ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֧י מְצַוְּךָ֛ הַיּ֖וֹם לִשְׁמֹ֥ר וְלַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated: יהוה will make you the head, not the tail; you will always be at the top and never at the bottom—if only you obey and faithfully observe the commandments of your God יהוה that I enjoin upon you this day,
Transliteration: unetanekha yehovah lerosh velo lezanav vehayiyta rak lemaelah velo tiheyeh lematah khiy-tishema el-mitsevot yehovah eloheykha asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom lishemor velaashvot

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א תָס֗וּר מִכׇּל־הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י מְצַוֶּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם הַיּ֖וֹם יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לָלֶ֗כֶת אַחֲרֵ֛י אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים לְעׇבְדָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: and do not deviate to the right or to the left from any of the commandments that I enjoin upon you this day and turn to the worship of other gods.
Transliteration: velo tasur mikhׇl-hadevariym asher anokhiy metsaveh etekhem hayyvom yamiyn ushemovl lalekhet acharey Elohim acheriym leׇvedam {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־לֹ֤א תִשְׁמַע֙ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֣יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם וּבָ֧אוּ עָלֶ֛יךָ כׇּל־הַקְּלָל֥וֹת הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְהִשִּׂיגֽוּךָ׃
Translated: But if you do not obey your God יהוה to observe faithfully all the commandments and laws which I enjoin upon you this day, all these curses shall come upon you and take effect:
Transliteration: vehayah im-lo tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor laashvot et-khׇl-mitsevotayv vechukotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom uvau aleykha khׇl-hakelalvot haeleh vehishiygukha

Hebrew: אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בָּעִ֑יר וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: Cursed shall you be in the city and cursed shall you be in the country.
Transliteration: arur atah vaiyr vearur atah vashadeh

Hebrew: אָר֥וּר טַנְאֲךָ֖ וּמִשְׁאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
Transliteration: arur taneakha umishearetekha

Hebrew: אָר֥וּר פְּרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֥ת צֹאנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Cursed shall be your issue from the womb and your produce from the soil, the calving of your herd and the lambing of your flock.
Transliteration: arur feriy-vitenekha uferiy adematekha shegar alafeykha veasheterot tsonekha

Hebrew: אָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּבֹאֶ֑ךָ וְאָר֥וּר אַתָּ֖ה בְּצֵאתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Cursed shall you be in your comings and cursed shall you be in your goings.
Transliteration: arur atah vevoekha vearur atah vetsetekha

Hebrew: יְשַׁלַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> בְּ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־הַמְּאֵרָ֤ה אֶת־הַמְּהוּמָה֙ וְאֶת־הַמִּגְעֶ֔רֶת בְּכׇל־מִשְׁלַ֥ח יָדְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשֶׂ֑ה עַ֣ד הִשָּׁמֶדְךָ֤ וְעַד־אֲבׇדְךָ֙ מַהֵ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֛י רֹ֥עַ מַֽעֲלָלֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲזַבְתָּֽנִי׃
Translated: יהוה will let loose against you calamity, panic, and frustration in all the enterprises you undertake, so that you shall soon be utterly wiped out because of your evildoing in forsaking Me.
Transliteration: yeshalach yehovah <small></small> vekha et-hameerah et-hamehumah veet-hamigeeret vekhׇl-mishelach yadekha asher taasheh ad hishamedekha vead-avׇdekha maher mifeney roa maalaleykha asher azavetaniy

Hebrew: יַדְבֵּ֧ק יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּךָ֖ אֶת־הַדָּ֑בֶר עַ֚ד כַּלֹּת֣וֹ אֹֽתְךָ֔ מֵעַל֙ הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: יהוה will make pestilence cling to you, until putting an end to you in the land that you are entering to possess.
Transliteration: yadevek yehovah vekha et-hadaver ad khalotvo otekha meal haadamah asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: יַכְּכָ֣ה יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה בַּשַּׁחֶ֨פֶת וּבַקַּדַּ֜חַת וּבַדַּלֶּ֗קֶת וּבַֽחַרְחֻר֙ וּבַחֶ֔רֶב וּבַשִּׁדָּפ֖וֹן וּבַיֵּרָק֑וֹן וּרְדָפ֖וּךָ עַ֥ד אׇבְדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: יהוה will strike you with consumption, fever, and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew; they shall hound you until you perish.
Transliteration: yakhekhah yehovah vashachefet uvakadachat uvadaleket uvacharechur uvacherev uvashidafvon uvayerakvon uredafukha ad ׇvedekha

Hebrew: וְהָי֥וּ שָׁמֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־רֹאשְׁךָ֖ נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וְהָאָ֥רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־תַּחְתֶּ֖יךָ בַּרְזֶֽל׃
Translated: The skies above your head shall be copper and the earth under you iron.
Transliteration: vehayu shameykha asher al-roshekha nechoshet vehaarets asher-tacheteykha varezel

Hebrew: יִתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מְטַ֥ר אַרְצְךָ֖ אָבָ֣ק וְעָפָ֑ר מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ יֵרֵ֣ד עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃
Translated: יהוה will make the rain of your land dust, and sand shall drop on you from the sky, until you are wiped out.
Transliteration: yiten yehovah et-metar aretsekha avak veafar min-hashamayiim eired aleykha ad hishamedakhe

Hebrew: יִתֶּנְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> נִגָּף֮ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֶ֒יךָ֒ בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ אֶחָד֙ תֵּצֵ֣א אֵלָ֔יו וּבְשִׁבְעָ֥ה דְרָכִ֖ים תָּנ֣וּס לְפָנָ֑יו וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְזַֽעֲוָ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: יהוה will put you to rout before your enemies; you shall march out against them by a single road, but flee from them by many roads; and you shall become a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
Transliteration: yitenekha yehovah <small></small> nigaf lifeney oyeveykha vederekhe echad tetse elayv uveshiveah derakhiym tanus lefanayv vehayiyta lezaavah lekhol mamelekhvot haarets

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֤ה נִבְלָֽתְךָ֙ לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל לְכׇל־ע֥וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּלְבֶהֱמַ֣ת הָאָ֑רֶץ וְאֵ֖ין מַחֲרִֽיד׃
Translated: Your carcasses shall become food for all the birds of the sky and all the beasts of the earth, with none to frighten them off.
Transliteration: vehayetah nivelatekha lemaakhal lekhׇl-vof hashamayiim ulevehemat haarets veeyn machariyd

Hebrew: יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֤ין מִצְרַ֙יִם֙ (ובעפלים) [וּבַטְּחֹרִ֔ים] וּבַגָּרָ֖ב וּבֶחָ֑רֶס אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵֽא׃
Translated: יהוה will strike you with the Egyptian inflammation, with hemorrhoids, boil-scars, and itch, from which you shall never recover.
