Transliteration: yakhekhah yehovah vishechiyn mitserayiim (vvflym) [uvatechoriym] uvagarav uvechares asher lo-tukhal leherafe

Hebrew: יַכְּכָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּשִׁגָּע֖וֹן וּבְעִוָּר֑וֹן וּבְתִמְה֖וֹן לֵבָֽב׃
Translated: יהוה will strike you with madness, blindness, and dismay.
Transliteration: yakhekhah yehovah veshigavon uveivarvon uvetimehvon levav

Hebrew: וְהָיִ֜יתָ מְמַשֵּׁ֣שׁ בַּֽצׇּהֳרַ֗יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יְמַשֵּׁ֤שׁ הַֽעִוֵּר֙ בָּאֲפֵלָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תַצְלִ֖יחַ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְהָיִ֜יתָ אַ֣ךְ עָשׁ֧וּק וְגָז֛וּל כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֖ים וְאֵ֥ין מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated: You shall grope at noon as the blind grope in the dark; you shall not prosper in your ventures, but shall be constantly abused and robbed, with none to give help.
Transliteration: vehayiyta memashesh vatsׇhorayiim khaasher yemashesh haiver vaafelah velo tatseliycha et-derakheykha vehayiyta akhe ashuk vegazul khׇl-hayamiym veeyn mvoshiya

Hebrew: אִשָּׁ֣ה תְאָרֵ֗שׂ וְאִ֤ישׁ אַחֵר֙ (ישגלנה) [יִשְׁכָּבֶ֔נָּה] בַּ֥יִת תִּבְנֶ֖ה וְלֹא־תֵשֵׁ֣ב בּ֑וֹ כֶּ֥רֶם תִּטַּ֖ע וְלֹ֥א תְחַלְּלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: If you [a man] pay the bride-price for a wife, another man shall enjoy her. If you build a house, you shall not live in it. If you plant a vineyard, you shall not harvest it.
Transliteration: ishah tearesh veiysh acher (yshglnh) [yishekhavenah] vayiit tiveneh velo-teshev vvo kherem tita velo techalelenu

Hebrew: שׁוֹרְךָ֞ טָב֣וּחַ לְעֵינֶ֗יךָ וְלֹ֣א תֹאכַל֮ מִמֶּ֒נּוּ֒ חֲמֹֽרְךָ֙ גָּז֣וּל מִלְּפָנֶ֔יךָ וְלֹ֥א יָשׁ֖וּב לָ֑ךְ צֹֽאנְךָ֙ נְתֻנ֣וֹת לְאֹיְבֶ֔יךָ וְאֵ֥ין לְךָ֖ מוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated: Your ox shall be slaughtered before your eyes, but you shall not eat of it; your ass shall be seized in front of you, and it shall not be returned to you; your flock shall be delivered to your enemies, with none to help you.
Transliteration: shvorekha tavucha leeyneykha velo tokhal mimenu chamorekha gazul milefaneykha velo yashuv lakhe tsonekha netunvot leoyeveykha veeyn lekha mvoshiya

Hebrew: בָּנֶ֨יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֜יךָ נְתֻנִ֨ים לְעַ֤ם אַחֵר֙ וְעֵינֶ֣יךָ רֹא֔וֹת וְכָל֥וֹת אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְאֵ֥ין לְאֵ֖ל יָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Your sons and daughters shall be delivered to another people, while you look on; and your eyes shall strain for them constantly, but you shall be helpless.
Transliteration: vaneykha uvenoteykha netuniym leam acher veeyneykha rovot vekhalvot aleyhem khׇl-hayyvom veeyn leel yadekha

Hebrew: פְּרִ֤י אַדְמָֽתְךָ֙ וְכׇל־יְגִ֣יעֲךָ֔ יֹאכַ֥ל עַ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדָ֑עְתָּ וְהָיִ֗יתָ רַ֛ק עָשׁ֥וּק וְרָצ֖וּץ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: A people you do not know shall eat up the produce of your soil and all your gains; you shall be abused and downtrodden continually,
Transliteration: feriy adematekha vekhׇl-yegiyakha yokhal am asher lo-yadaeta vehayiyta rak ashuk veratsuts khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְהָיִ֖יתָ מְשֻׁגָּ֑ע מִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: until you are driven mad by what your eyes behold.
Transliteration: vehayiyta meshuga mimareeh eyneykha asher tireeh

Hebrew: יַכְּכָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה בִּשְׁחִ֣ין רָ֗ע עַל־הַבִּרְכַּ֙יִם֙ וְעַל־הַשֹּׁקַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תוּכַ֖ל לְהֵרָפֵ֑א מִכַּ֥ף רַגְלְךָ֖ וְעַ֥ד קׇדְקֳדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: יהוה will afflict you at the knees and thighs with a severe inflammation, from which you shall never recover—from the sole of your foot to the crown of your head.
Transliteration: yakhekhah yehovah vishechiyn ra al-havirekhayiim veal-hashokayiim asher lo-tukhal leherafe mikhaf ragelekha vead kׇdekodekha

Hebrew: יוֹלֵ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֹתְךָ֗ וְאֶֽת־מַלְכְּךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּקִ֣ים עָלֶ֔יךָ אֶל־גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדַ֖עְתָּ אַתָּ֣ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְעָבַ֥דְתָּ שָּׁ֛ם אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃
Translated: יהוה will drive you, and the king you have set over you, to a nation unknown to you or your ancestors, where you shall serve other gods, of wood and stone.
Transliteration: yvolekhe yehovah otekha veet-malekhekha asher takiym aleykha el-gvoy asher lo-yadaeta atah vaavoteykha veavadeta sham Elohim acheriym ets vaaven

Hebrew: וְהָיִ֣יתָ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה לְמָשָׁ֖ל וְלִשְׁנִינָ֑ה בְּכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יְנַהֶגְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: You shall be a consternation, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to which יהוה will drive you.
Transliteration: vehayiyta leshamah lemashal velisheniynah vekhol haamiym asher-yenahegekha yehovah shamah

Hebrew: זֶ֥רַע רַ֖ב תּוֹצִ֣יא הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּמְעַ֣ט תֶּאֱסֹ֔ף כִּ֥י יַחְסְלֶ֖נּוּ הָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
Translated: Though you take much seed out to the field, you shall gather in little, for the locust shall consume it.
Transliteration: zera rav tvotsiy hashadeh umeat teesof khiy yacheselenu haareveh

Hebrew: כְּרָמִ֥ים תִּטַּ֖ע וְעָבָ֑דְתָּ וְיַ֤יִן לֹֽא־תִשְׁתֶּה֙ וְלֹ֣א תֶאֱגֹ֔ר כִּ֥י תֹאכְלֶ֖נּוּ הַתֹּלָֽעַת׃
Translated: Though you plant vineyards and till them, you shall have no wine to drink or store, for the worm shall devour them.
Transliteration: kheramiym tita veavadeta veyayiin lo-tisheteh velo teegor khiy tokhelenu hatolaat

Hebrew: זֵיתִ֛ים יִהְי֥וּ לְךָ֖ בְּכׇל־גְּבוּלֶ֑ךָ וְשֶׁ֙מֶן֙ לֹ֣א תָס֔וּךְ כִּ֥י יִשַּׁ֖ל זֵיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Though you have olive trees throughout your territory, you shall have no oil for anointment, for your olives shall drop off.
Transliteration: zeytiym yiheyu lekha vekhׇl-gevulekha veshemen lo tasukhe khiy yishal zeytekha

Hebrew: בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנ֖וֹת תּוֹלִ֑יד וְלֹא־יִהְי֣וּ לָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י יֵלְכ֖וּ בַּשֶּֽׁבִי׃
Translated: Though you beget sons and daughters, they shall not remain with you, for they shall go into captivity.
Transliteration: vaniym uvanvot tvoliyd velo-yiheyu lakhe khiy eilekhu vasheviy

Hebrew: כׇּל־עֵצְךָ֖ וּפְרִ֣י אַדְמָתֶ֑ךָ יְיָרֵ֖שׁ הַצְּלָצַֽל׃
Translated: The cricket shall take over all the trees and produce of your land.
Transliteration: khׇl-etsekha uferiy adematekha yeyaresh hatselatsal

Hebrew: הַגֵּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּךָ֔ יַעֲלֶ֥ה עָלֶ֖יךָ מַ֣עְלָה מָּ֑עְלָה וְאַתָּ֥ה תֵרֵ֖ד מַ֥טָּה מָּֽטָּה׃
Translated: The strangers in your midst shall rise above you higher and higher, while you sink lower and lower:
Transliteration: hager asher vekirevekha yaaleh aleykha maelah maelah veatah tered matah matah

Hebrew: ה֣וּא יַלְוְךָ֔ וְאַתָּ֖ה לֹ֣א תַלְוֶ֑נּוּ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה לְרֹ֔אשׁ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה לְזָנָֽב׃
Translated: they shall be your creditors, but you shall not be theirs; they shall be the head and you the tail.
Transliteration: hu yalevekha veatah lo talevenu hu yiheyeh lerosh veatah tiheyeh lezanav

Hebrew: וּבָ֨אוּ עָלֶ֜יךָ כׇּל־הַקְּלָל֣וֹת הָאֵ֗לֶּה וּרְדָפ֙וּךָ֙ וְהִשִּׂיג֔וּךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָ֑ךְ כִּי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֗עְתָּ בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֛ר מִצְוֺתָ֥יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּֽךְ׃
Translated: All these curses shall befall you; they shall pursue you and overtake you, until you are wiped out, because you did not heed your God יהוה and keep the commandments and laws that were enjoined upon you.
Transliteration: uvau aleykha khׇl-hakelalvot haeleh uredafukha vehishiygukha ad hishamedakhe khiy-lo shamaeta vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor mitsevotayv vechukotayv asher tsivakhe

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ בְךָ֔ לְא֖וֹת וּלְמוֹפֵ֑ת וּֽבְזַרְעֲךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: They shall serve as signs and proofs against you and your offspring for all time.
Transliteration: vehayu vekha levot ulemvofet uvezareakha ad-volam

Hebrew: תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־עָבַ֙דְתָּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּבְט֣וּב לֵבָ֑ב מֵרֹ֖ב כֹּֽל׃
Translated: Because you would not serve your God יהוה in joy and gladness over the abundance of everything,
Transliteration: tachat asher lo-avadeta et-yehovah eloheykha veshimechah uvetuv levav merov khol

Hebrew: וְעָבַדְתָּ֣ אֶת־אֹיְבֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְשַׁלְּחֶ֤נּוּ יְהֹוָה֙ בָּ֔ךְ בְּרָעָ֧ב וּבְצָמָ֛א וּבְעֵירֹ֖ם וּבְחֹ֣סֶר כֹּ֑ל וְנָתַ֞ן עֹ֤ל בַּרְזֶל֙ עַל־צַוָּארֶ֔ךָ עַ֥ד הִשְׁמִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: you shall have to serve—in hunger and thirst, naked and lacking everything—the enemies whom יהוה will let loose against you. [God] will put an iron yoke upon your neck until you are wiped out.
Transliteration: veavadeta et-oyeveykha asher yeshalechenu yehovah vakhe veraav uvetsama uveeyrom uvechoser khol venatan ol varezel al-tsavarekha ad hishemiydvo otakhe

Hebrew: יִשָּׂ֣א יְהֹוָה֩ עָלֶ֨יךָ גּ֤וֹי מֵֽרָחֹק֙ מִקְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִדְאֶ֖ה הַנָּ֑שֶׁר גּ֕וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־תִשְׁמַ֖ע לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה will bring a nation against you from afar, from the end of the earth, which will swoop down like the eagle—a nation whose language you do not understand,
Transliteration: yisha yehovah aleykha gvoy merachok miketseh haarets khaasher yideeh hanasher gvoy asher lo-tishema leshonvo

Hebrew: גּ֖וֹי עַ֣ז פָּנִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יִשָּׂ֤א פָנִים֙ לְזָקֵ֔ן וְנַ֖עַר לֹ֥א יָחֹֽן׃
Translated: a ruthless nation, that will show the influential no regard and the vulnerable no mercy.
Transliteration: gvoy az faniym asher lo-yisha faniym lezaken venaar lo yachon

Hebrew: וְ֠אָכַ֠ל פְּרִ֨י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֥ וּפְרִֽי־אַדְמָתְךָ֮ עַ֣ד הִשָּׁמְדָךְ֒ אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹא־יַשְׁאִ֜יר לְךָ֗ דָּגָן֙ תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָ֔ר שְׁגַ֥ר אֲלָפֶ֖יךָ וְעַשְׁתְּרֹ֣ת צֹאנֶ֑ךָ עַ֥ד הַאֲבִיד֖וֹ אֹתָֽךְ׃
Translated: It shall devour the offspring of your cattle and the produce of your soil, until you have been wiped out, leaving you nothing of new grain, wine, or oil, of the calving of your herds and the lambing of your flocks, until it has brought you to ruin.
Transliteration: veakhal feriy vehemetekha uferiy-adematekha ad hishamedakhe asher lo-yasheiyr lekha dagan tiyrvosh veyitsehar shegar alafeykha veasheterot tsonekha ad haaviydvo otakhe

Hebrew: וְהֵצַ֨ר לְךָ֜ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֗יךָ עַ֣ד רֶ֤דֶת חֹמֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ הַגְּבֹהֹ֣ת וְהַבְּצֻר֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּהֵ֖ן בְּכׇל־אַרְצֶ֑ךָ וְהֵצַ֤ר לְךָ֙ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇ֨ל־אַרְצְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: It shall shut you up in all your towns throughout your land until every mighty, towering wall in which you trust has come down. And when you are shut up in all your towns throughout your land that your God יהוה has assigned to you,
Transliteration: vehetsar lekha vekhׇl-sheareykha ad redet chomoteykha hagevohot vehavetsurvot asher atah votecha vahen vekhׇl-aretsekha vehetsar lekha vekhׇl-sheareykha vekhׇl-aretsekha asher natan yehovah eloheykha lakhe

Hebrew: וְאָכַלְתָּ֣ פְרִֽי־בִטְנְךָ֗ בְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַן־לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁר־יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֖ אֹיְבֶֽךָ׃
Translated: you shall eat your own issue, the flesh of your sons and daughters that your God יהוה has assigned to you, because of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you.
Transliteration: veakhaleta feriy-vitenekha veshar vaneykha uvenoteykha asher natan-lekha yehovah eloheykha vematsvor uvematsvok asher-yatsiyk lekha oyevekha

Hebrew: הָאִישׁ֙ הָרַ֣ךְ בְּךָ֔ וְהֶעָנֹ֖ג מְאֹ֑ד תֵּרַ֨ע עֵינ֤וֹ בְאָחִיו֙ וּבְאֵ֣שֶׁת חֵיק֔וֹ וּבְיֶ֥תֶר בָּנָ֖יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹתִֽיר׃
Translated: The householder who is most tender and fastidious among you shall be too mean to his brother and the wife of his bosom and the children he has spared
Transliteration: haiysh harakhe vekha veheanog meod tera eynvo veachiyv uveeshet cheykvo uveyeter vanayv asher yvotiyr

Hebrew: מִתֵּ֣ת ׀ לְאַחַ֣ד מֵהֶ֗ם מִבְּשַׂ֤ר בָּנָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹאכֵ֔ל מִבְּלִ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ כֹּ֑ל בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בְּכׇל־שְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: to share with any of them the flesh of the children that he eats, because he has nothing else left as a result of the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in all your towns.
Transliteration: mitet leachad mehem miveshar vanayv asher yokhel miveliy hisheiyr-lvo khol vematsvor uvematsvok asher yatsiyk lekha oyivekha vekhׇl-sheareykha

Hebrew: הָרַכָּ֨ה בְךָ֜ וְהָעֲנֻגָּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־נִסְּתָ֤ה כַף־רַגְלָהּ֙ הַצֵּ֣ג עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ מֵהִתְעַנֵּ֖ג וּמֵרֹ֑ךְ תֵּרַ֤ע עֵינָהּ֙ בְּאִ֣ישׁ חֵיקָ֔הּ וּבִבְנָ֖הּ וּבְבִתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And she who is most tender and dainty among you, so tender and dainty that she would never venture to set a foot on the ground, shall begrudge the husband of her bosom, and her son and her daughter,
Transliteration: harakhah vekha vehaanugah asher lo-nisetah khaf-ragelah hatseg al-haarets mehiteaneg umerokhe tera eynah veiysh cheykah uvivenah uvevitah

Hebrew: וּֽבְשִׁלְיָתָ֞הּ הַיּוֹצֵ֣ת ׀ מִבֵּ֣ין רַגְלֶ֗יהָ וּבְבָנֶ֙יהָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּלֵ֔ד כִּֽי־תֹאכְלֵ֥ם בְּחֹסֶר־כֹּ֖ל בַּסָּ֑תֶר בְּמָצוֹר֙ וּבְמָצ֔וֹק אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצִ֥יק לְךָ֛ אֹיִבְךָ֖ בִּשְׁעָרֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: the afterbirth that issues from between her legs and the babies she bears; she shall eat them secretly, because of utter want, in the desperate straits to which your enemy shall reduce you in your towns.
Transliteration: uveshileyatah hayyvotset miveyn rageleyha uvevaneyha asher teled khiy-tokhelem vechoser-khol vasater vematsvor uvematsvok asher yatsiyk lekha oyivekha visheareykha

Hebrew: אִם־לֹ֨א תִשְׁמֹ֜ר לַעֲשׂ֗וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את הַכְּתֻבִ֖ים בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה לְ֠יִרְאָ֠ה אֶת־הַשֵּׁ֞ם הַנִּכְבָּ֤ד וְהַנּוֹרָא֙ הַזֶּ֔ה אֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: If you fail to observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching that are written in this book, to reverence this honored and awesome Name, your God יהוה,
Transliteration: im-lo tishemor laashvot et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot hakhetuviym vasefer hazeh leyiireah et-hashem hanikhevad vehanvora hazeh et yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְהִפְלָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מַכֹּ֣תְךָ֔ וְאֵ֖ת מַכּ֣וֹת זַרְעֶ֑ךָ מַכּ֤וֹת גְּדֹלֹת֙ וְנֶ֣אֱמָנ֔וֹת וׇחֳלָיִ֖ם רָעִ֥ים וְנֶאֱמָנִֽים׃
Translated: יהוה will inflict extraordinary plagues upon you and your offspring, strange and lasting plagues, malignant and chronic diseases—
Transliteration: vehifela yehovah et-makhotekha veet makhvot zareekha makhvot gedolot veneemanvot vׇcholayim raiym veneemaniym

Hebrew: וְהֵשִׁ֣יב בְּךָ֗ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־מַדְוֵ֣ה מִצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָגֹ֖רְתָּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וְדָבְק֖וּ בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: bringing back upon you all the sicknesses of Egypt that you dreaded so, and they shall cling to you.
Transliteration: veheshiyv vekha et khׇl-madeveh mitserayiim asher yagoreta mifeneyhem vedaveku vakhe

Hebrew: גַּ֤ם כׇּל־חֳלִי֙ וְכׇל־מַכָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ לֹ֣א כָת֔וּב בְּסֵ֖פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את יַעְלֵ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ עָלֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד הִשָּׁמְדָֽךְ׃
Translated: Moreover, יהוה will bring upon you all the other diseases and plagues that are not mentioned in this book of Teaching, until you are wiped out.
Transliteration: gam khׇl-choliy vekhׇl-makhah asher lo khatuv vesefer hatvorah hazot yaelem yehovah aleykha ad hishamedakhe

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁאַרְתֶּם֙ בִּמְתֵ֣י מְעָ֔ט תַּ֚חַת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֱיִיתֶ֔ם כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם לָרֹ֑ב כִּֽי־לֹ֣א שָׁמַ֔עְתָּ בְּק֖וֹל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall be left a scant few, after having been as numerous as the stars in the skies, because you did not heed the command of your God יהוה.
Transliteration: venishearetem vimetey meat tachat asher heyiytem khekhvokhevey hashamayiim larov khiy-lo shamaeta vekvol yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֨שׂ יְהֹוָ֜ה עֲלֵיכֶ֗ם לְהֵיטִ֣יב אֶתְכֶם֮ וּלְהַרְבּ֣וֹת אֶתְכֶם֒ כֵּ֣ן יָשִׂ֤ישׂ יְהֹוָה֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לְהַאֲבִ֥יד אֶתְכֶ֖ם וּלְהַשְׁמִ֣יד אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְנִסַּחְתֶּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And as יהוה once delighted in making you prosperous and many, so will יהוה now delight in causing you to perish and in wiping you out; you shall be torn from the land that you are about to enter and possess.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher-shash yehovah aleykhem leheytiyv etekhem uleharevvot etekhem khen yashiysh yehovah aleykhem lehaaviyd etekhem ulehashemiyd etekhem venisachetem meal haadamah asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: וֶהֱפִֽיצְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ בְּכׇל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים מִקְצֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ וְעַד־קְצֵ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ וְעָבַ֨דְתָּ שָּׁ֜ם אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹא־יָדַ֛עְתָּ אַתָּ֥ה וַאֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ עֵ֥ץ וָאָֽבֶן׃
Translated: יהוה will scatter you among all the peoples from one end of the earth to the other, and there you shall serve other gods, wood and stone, whom neither you nor your ancestors have experienced.
Transliteration: vehefiytsekha yehovah vekhׇl-haamiym miketseh haarets vead-ketseh haarets veavadeta sham Elohim acheriym asher lo-yadaeta atah vaavoteykha ets vaaven

Hebrew: וּבַגּוֹיִ֤ם הָהֵם֙ לֹ֣א תַרְגִּ֔יעַ וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה מָנ֖וֹחַ לְכַף־רַגְלֶ֑ךָ וְנָתַן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לְךָ֥ שָׁם֙ לֵ֣ב רַגָּ֔ז וְכִלְי֥וֹן עֵינַ֖יִם וְדַאֲב֥וֹן נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: Yet even among those nations you shall find no peace, nor shall your foot find a place to rest. יהוה will give you there an anguished heart and eyes that pine and a despondent spirit.
Transliteration: uvagvoyim hahem lo taregiya velo-yiheyeh manvocha lekhaf-ragelekha venatan yehovah lekha sham lev ragaz vekhileyvon eynayiim vedaavvon nafesh

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ חַיֶּ֔יךָ תְּלֻאִ֥ים לְךָ֖ מִנֶּ֑גֶד וּפָֽחַדְתָּ֙ לַ֣יְלָה וְיוֹמָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תַאֲמִ֖ין בְּחַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: The life you face shall be precarious; you shall be in terror, night and day, with no assurance of survival.
Transliteration: vehayu chayeykha teluiym lekha mineged ufachadeta layelah veyvomam velo taamiyn vechayeykha

Hebrew: בַּבֹּ֤קֶר תֹּאמַר֙ מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן עֶ֔רֶב וּבָעֶ֥רֶב תֹּאמַ֖ר מִֽי־יִתֵּ֣ן בֹּ֑קֶר מִפַּ֤חַד לְבָֽבְךָ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּפְחָ֔ד וּמִמַּרְאֵ֥ה עֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: In the morning you shall say, “If only it were evening!” and in the evening you shall say, “If only it were morning!”—because of what your heart shall dread and your eyes shall see.
Transliteration: vavoker tomar miy-yiten erev uvaerev tomar miy-yiten voker mifachad levavekha asher tifechad umimareeh eyneykha asher tireeh

Hebrew: וֶהֱשִֽׁיבְךָ֨ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ מִצְרַ֘יִם֮ בׇּאֳנִיּוֹת֒ בַּדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣רְתִּֽי לְךָ֔ לֹא־תֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד לִרְאֹתָ֑הּ וְהִתְמַכַּרְתֶּ֨ם שָׁ֧ם לְאֹיְבֶ֛יךָ לַעֲבָדִ֥ים וְלִשְׁפָח֖וֹת וְאֵ֥ין קֹנֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה will send you back to Egypt in galleys, by a route which I told you you should not see again. There you shall offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but none will buy.
Transliteration: veheshiyvekha yehovah mitserayiim vׇoniyyvot vaderekhe asher amaretiy lekha lo-tosiyf vod lireotah vehitemakharetem sham leoyeveykha laavadiym velishefachvot veeyn koneh {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֩לֶּה֩ דִבְרֵ֨י הַבְּרִ֜ית אֲֽשֶׁר־צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֗ה לִכְרֹ֛ת אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֑ב מִלְּבַ֣ד הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲשֶׁר־כָּרַ֥ת אִתָּ֖ם בְּחֹרֵֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: These are the terms of the covenant which יהוה commanded Moses to conclude with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which was made with them at Horeb.
Transliteration: eleh diverey haveriyt asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh likherot et-veney yisherael veerets mvoav milevad haveriyt asher-kharat itam vechorev {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֗ם אֵ֣ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר֩ עָשָׂ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה לְעֵֽינֵיכֶם֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה וּלְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֖יו וּלְכׇל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: Moses summoned all Israel and said to them: You have seen all that יהוה did before your very eyes in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh and to all his courtiers and to his whole country:
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh el-khׇl-yisherael vayomer alehem atem reiytem et khׇl-asher ashah yehovah leeyneykhem veerets mitserayiim lefareoh ulekhׇl-avadayv ulekhׇl-aretsvo

Hebrew: הַמַּסּוֹת֙ הַגְּדֹלֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָא֖וּ עֵינֶ֑יךָ הָאֹתֹ֧ת וְהַמֹּפְתִ֛ים הַגְּדֹלִ֖ים הָהֵֽם׃
Translated: the wondrous feats that you saw with your own eyes, those prodigious signs and marvels.
Transliteration: hamasvot hagedolot asher rau eyneykha haotot vehamofetiym hagedoliym hahem

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נָתַן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם לֵב֙ לָדַ֔עַת וְעֵינַ֥יִם לִרְא֖וֹת וְאׇזְנַ֣יִם לִשְׁמֹ֑עַ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Yet to this day יהוה has not given you a mind to understand or eyes to see or ears to hear.
Transliteration: velo-natan yehovah lakhem lev ladaat veeynayiim lirevot veׇzenayiim lishemoa ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וָאוֹלֵ֥ךְ אֶתְכֶ֛ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר לֹֽא־בָל֤וּ שַׂלְמֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ מֵעֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְנַעַלְךָ֥ לֹֽא־בָלְתָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל רַגְלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: I led you through the wilderness forty years; the clothes on your back did not wear out, nor did the sandals on your feet;
Transliteration: vavolekhe etekhem arevaiym shanah vamidevar lo-valu shalemoteykhem mealeykhem venaalekha lo-valetah meal ragelekha

Hebrew: לֶ֚חֶם לֹ֣א אֲכַלְתֶּ֔ם וְיַ֥יִן וְשֵׁכָ֖ר לֹ֣א שְׁתִיתֶ֑ם לְמַ֙עַן֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: you had no bread to eat and no wine or other intoxicant to drink—that you might know that I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: lechem lo akhaletem veyayiin veshekhar lo shetiytem lemaan tedeu khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיֵּצֵ֣א סִיחֹ֣ן מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶ֠שְׁבּ֠וֹן וְע֨וֹג מֶלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֧ן לִקְרָאתֵ֛נוּ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה וַנַּכֵּֽם׃
Translated: When you reached this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan came out to engage us in battle, but we defeated them.
Transliteration: vatavou el-hamakvom hazeh vayetse siychon melekhe-cheshevvon vevog melekhe-havashan likeratenu lamilechamah vanakhem

Hebrew: וַנִּקַּח֙ אֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם וַנִּתְּנָ֣הּ לְנַחֲלָ֔ה לָראוּבֵנִ֖י וְלַגָּדִ֑י וְלַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֥בֶט הַֽמְנַשִּֽׁי׃
Translated: We took their land and gave it to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh as their heritage.
Transliteration: vanikach et-aretsam vanitenah lenachalah laruveniy velagadiy velachatsiy shevet hamenashiy

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֗ם אֶת־דִּבְרֵי֙ הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם לְמַ֣עַן תַּשְׂכִּ֔ילוּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשֽׂוּן׃ {פ}
Translated: Therefore observe faithfully all the terms of this covenant, that you may succeed in all that you undertake.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-diverey haveriyt hazot vaashiytem otam lemaan tashekhiylu et khׇl-asher taashun {f}

Hebrew: אַתֶּ֨ם נִצָּבִ֤ים הַיּוֹם֙ כֻּלְּכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם רָאשֵׁיכֶ֣ם שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֗ם זִקְנֵיכֶם֙ וְשֹׁ֣טְרֵיכֶ֔ם כֹּ֖ל אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: You stand this day, all of you, before your God יהוה —your tribal heads, your elders, and your officials, every householder in Israel,
Transliteration: atem nitsaviym hayyvom khulekhem lifeney yehovah eloheykhem rasheykhem shiveteykhem zikeneykhem veshotereykhem khol iysh yisherael

Hebrew: טַפְּכֶ֣ם נְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם וְגֵ֣רְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֶ֑יךָ מֵחֹטֵ֣ב עֵצֶ֔יךָ עַ֖ד שֹׁאֵ֥ב מֵימֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: your children, your wives, even the stranger within your camp, from woodchopper to waterdrawer—
Transliteration: tafekhem nesheykhem vegerekha asher vekerev machaneykha mechotev etseykha ad shoev meymeykha

Hebrew: לְעׇבְרְךָ֗ בִּבְרִ֛ית יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ וּבְאָלָת֑וֹ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כֹּרֵ֥ת עִמְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: to enter into the covenant of your God יהוה, which your God יהוה is concluding with you this day, with its sanctions;
Transliteration: leׇverekha viveriyt yehovah eloheykha uvealatvo asher yehovah eloheykha khoret imekha hayyvom

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן הָקִֽים־אֹתְךָ֩ הַיּ֨וֹם <small>׀</small> ל֜וֹ לְעָ֗ם וְה֤וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לְּךָ֙ לֵֽאלֹהִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לָ֑ךְ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נִשְׁבַּע֙ לַאֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated: in order to establish you this day as God’s people and in order to be your God, as promised you and as sworn to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
Transliteration: lemaan hakiym-otekha hayyvom <small></small> lvo leam vehu yiheyeh-lekha lelohiym khaasher diver-lakhe vekhaasher nisheva laavoteykha leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אִתְּכֶ֖ם לְבַדְּכֶ֑ם אָנֹכִ֗י כֹּרֵת֙ אֶת־הַבְּרִ֣ית הַזֹּ֔את וְאֶת־הָאָלָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: I make this covenant, with its sanctions, not with you alone,
Transliteration: velo itekhem levadekhem anokhiy khoret et-haveriyt hazot veet-haalah hazot

Hebrew: כִּי֩ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֶשְׁנ֜וֹ פֹּ֗ה עִמָּ֙נוּ֙ עֹמֵ֣ד הַיּ֔וֹם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְאֵ֨ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵינֶ֛נּוּ פֹּ֖ה עִמָּ֥נוּ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: but both with those who are standing here with us this day before our God יהוה and with those who are not with us here this day.
Transliteration: khiy et-asher yeshenvo foh imanu omed hayyvom lifeney yehovah eloheynu veet asher eynenu foh imanu hayyvom

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֣ם יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יָשַׁ֖בְנוּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְאֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָבַ֛רְנוּ בְּקֶ֥רֶב הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲבַרְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: Well you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we passed through the midst of various other nations;
Transliteration: khiy-atem yedaetem et asher-yashavenu veerets mitserayiim veet asher-avarenu vekerev hagvoyim asher avaretem

Hebrew: וַתִּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־שִׁקּ֣וּצֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת גִּלֻּלֵיהֶ֑ם עֵ֣ץ וָאֶ֔בֶן כֶּ֥סֶף וְזָהָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִמָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: and you have seen the detestable things and the fetishes of wood and stone, silver and gold, that they keep.
Transliteration: vatireu et-shikutseyhem veet giluleyhem ets vaeven khesef vezahav asher imahem

Hebrew: פֶּן־יֵ֣שׁ בָּ֠כֶ֠ם אִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֞ה א֧וֹ מִשְׁפָּחָ֣ה אוֹ־שֵׁ֗בֶט אֲשֶׁר֩ לְבָב֨וֹ פֹנֶ֤ה הַיּוֹם֙ מֵעִם֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ לָלֶ֣כֶת לַעֲבֹ֔ד אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֖י הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָהֵ֑ם פֶּן־יֵ֣שׁ בָּכֶ֗ם שֹׁ֛רֶשׁ פֹּרֶ֥ה רֹ֖אשׁ וְלַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated: Perchance there is among you some man or woman, or some clan or tribe, whose heart is even now turning away from our God יהוה to go and worship the gods of those nations—perchance there is among you a stock sprouting poison weed and wormwood.
Transliteration: fen-eish vakhem iysh vo-ishah vo mishefachah vo-shevet asher levavvo foneh hayyvom meim yehovah eloheynu lalekhet laavod et-elohey hagvoyim hahem fen-eish vakhem shoresh foreh rosh velaanah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה בְּשׇׁמְעוֹ֩ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֨י הָאָלָ֜ה הַזֹּ֗את וְהִתְבָּרֵ֨ךְ בִּלְבָב֤וֹ לֵאמֹר֙ שָׁל֣וֹם יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֔י כִּ֛י בִּשְׁרִר֥וּת לִבִּ֖י אֵלֵ֑ךְ לְמַ֛עַן סְפ֥וֹת הָרָוָ֖ה אֶת־הַצְּמֵאָֽה׃
Translated: When hearing the words of these sanctions, they may imagine a special immunity, thinking, “I shall be safe, though I follow my own willful heart”—to the utter ruin of moist and dry alike.
Transliteration: vehayah veshׇmevo et-diverey haalah hazot vehitevarekhe vilevavvo lemor shalvom yiheyeh-liy khiy visherirut liviy elekhe lemaan sefvot haravah et-hatsemeah

Hebrew: לֹא־יֹאבֶ֣ה יְהֹוָה֮ סְלֹ֣חַֽ לוֹ֒ כִּ֣י אָ֠ז יֶעְשַׁ֨ן אַף־יְהֹוָ֤ה וְקִנְאָתוֹ֙ בָּאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וְרָ֤בְצָה בּוֹ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣אָלָ֔ה הַכְּתוּבָ֖ה בַּסֵּ֣פֶר הַזֶּ֑ה וּמָחָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־שְׁמ֔וֹ מִתַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: יהוה will never forgive that party. Rather, יהוה’s anger and passion will rage against them, till every sanction recorded in this book comes down upon them, and יהוה blots out their name from under heaven.
Transliteration: lo-yoveh yehovah selocha lvo khiy az yeeshan af-yehovah vekineatvo vaiysh hahu veravetsah vvo khׇl-haalah hakhetuvah vasefer hazeh umachah yehovah et-shemvo mitachat hashamayiim

Hebrew: וְהִבְדִּיל֤וֹ יְהֹוָה֙ לְרָעָ֔ה מִכֹּ֖ל שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּכֹל֙ אָל֣וֹת הַבְּרִ֔ית הַכְּתוּבָ֕ה בְּסֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: [As for such a clan or tribe,] יהוה will single it out from all the tribes of Israel for misfortune, in accordance with all the sanctions of the covenant recorded in this book of Teaching.
Transliteration: vehivediylvo yehovah leraah mikhol shivetey yisherael khekhol alvot haveriyt hakhetuvah vesefer hatvorah hazeh

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֞ר הַדּ֣וֹר הָאַחֲר֗וֹן בְּנֵיכֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָק֙וּמוּ֙ מֵאַ֣חֲרֵיכֶ֔ם וְהַ֨נׇּכְרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָבֹ֖א מֵאֶ֣רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֑ה וְ֠רָא֠וּ אֶת־מַכּ֞וֹת הָאָ֤רֶץ הַהִוא֙ וְאֶת־תַּ֣חֲלֻאֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁר־חִלָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And later generations will ask—the children who succeed you, and foreigners who come from distant lands and see the plagues and diseases that יהוה has inflicted upon that land,
Transliteration: veamar hadvor haacharvon veneykhem asher yakumu meachareykhem vehanׇkheriy asher yavo meerets rechvokah verau et-makhvot haarets hahiv veet-tachalueyha asher-chilah yehovah vah

Hebrew: גׇּפְרִ֣ית וָמֶ֘לַח֮ שְׂרֵפָ֣ה כׇל־אַרְצָהּ֒ לֹ֤א תִזָּרַע֙ וְלֹ֣א תַצְמִ֔חַ וְלֹא־יַעֲלֶ֥ה בָ֖הּ כׇּל־עֵ֑שֶׂב כְּֽמַהְפֵּכַ֞ת סְדֹ֤ם וַעֲמֹרָה֙ אַדְמָ֣ה (וצביים) [וּצְבוֹיִ֔ם] אֲשֶׁר֙ הָפַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּאַפּ֖וֹ וּבַחֲמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: all its soil devastated by sulfur and salt, beyond sowing and producing, no grass growing in it, just like the upheaval of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which יהוה overthrew in fierce anger—
Transliteration: gׇferiyt vamelach sherefah khׇl-aretsah lo tizara velo tatsemicha velo-yaaleh vah khׇl-eshev khemahefekhat sedom vaamorah ademah (vtsvyym) [utsevvoyim] asher hafakhe yehovah veafvo uvachamatvo

Hebrew: וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם עַל־מֶ֨ה עָשָׂ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה כָּ֖כָה לָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֑את מֶ֥ה חֳרִ֛י הָאַ֥ף הַגָּד֖וֹל הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: all nations will ask, “Why did יהוה do thus to this land? Wherefore that awful wrath?”
Transliteration: veameru khׇl-hagvoyim al-meh ashah yehovah khakhah laarets hazot meh choriy haaf hagadvol hazeh

Hebrew: וְאָ֣מְר֔וּ עַ֚ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָזְב֔וּ אֶת־בְּרִ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֙ כָּרַ֣ת עִמָּ֔ם בְּהוֹצִיא֥וֹ אֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They will be told, “Because they forsook the covenant that יהוה, God of their ancestors, made with them upon freeing them from the land of Egypt;
Transliteration: veameru al asher azevu et-veriyt yehovah elohey avotam asher kharat imam vehvotsiyvo otam meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֗וּ וַיַּֽעַבְדוּ֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לָהֶ֑ם אֱלֹהִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יְדָע֔וּם וְלֹ֥א חָלַ֖ק לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: they turned to the service of other gods and worshiped them, gods whom they had not experienced and whom [God] had not allotted to them.
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayaavedu Elohim acheriym vayishetachavu lahem Elohim asher lo-yedaum velo chalak lahem

Hebrew: וַיִּחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּאָ֣רֶץ הַהִ֑וא לְהָבִ֤יא עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַקְּלָלָ֔ה הַכְּתוּבָ֖ה בַּסֵּ֥פֶר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: So יהוה was incensed at that land and brought upon it all the curses recorded in this book.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah vaarets hahiv lehaviy aleyha et-khׇl-hakelalah hakhetuvah vasefer hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּשֵׁ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ מֵעַ֣ל אַדְמָתָ֔ם בְּאַ֥ף וּבְחֵמָ֖ה וּבְקֶ֣צֶף גָּד֑וֹל וַיַּשְׁ<big>לִ</big>כֵ֛ם אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ אַחֶ֖רֶת כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: יהוה uprooted them from their soil in anger, fury, and great wrath, and cast them into another land, as is still the case.”
Transliteration: vayiteshem yehovah meal adematam veaf uvechemah uveketsef gadvol vayashe<big>li</big>khem el-erets acheret khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: הַנִּ֨סְתָּרֹ֔ת לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְהַנִּגְלֹ֞ת לָ֤ׄנׄוּׄ וּׄלְׄבָׄנֵ֙ׄיׄנׄוּ֙ׄ עַׄד־עוֹלָ֔ם לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃ {ס}
Translated: Concealed acts concern our God יהוה; but with overt acts, it is for us and our children ever to apply all the provisions of this Teaching.
Transliteration: hanisetarot layhovah eloheynu vehanigelot lanu ulevaneynu ad-volam laashvot et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot {s}

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ כִֽי־יָבֹ֨אוּ עָלֶ֜יךָ כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה הַבְּרָכָה֙ וְהַקְּלָלָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַהֲשֵׁבֹתָ֙ אֶל־לְבָבֶ֔ךָ בְּכׇ֨ל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר הִדִּיחֲךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: When all these things befall you—the blessing and the curse that I have set before you—and you take them to heart amidst the various nations to which your God יהוה has banished you,
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-yavou aleykha khׇl-hadevariym haeleh haverakhah vehakelalah asher natatiy lefaneykha vahashevota el-levavekha vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher hidiychakha yehovah eloheykha shamah

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתָּ֞ עַד־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֣ בְקֹל֔וֹ כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם אַתָּ֣ה וּבָנֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated: and you return to your God יהוה, and you and your children heed God’s command with all your heart and soul, just as I enjoin upon you this day,
Transliteration: veshaveta ad-yehovah eloheykha veshamaeta vekolvo khekhol asher-anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom atah uvaneykha vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ב יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֶת־שְׁבוּתְךָ֖ וְרִחֲמֶ֑ךָ וְשָׁ֗ב וְקִבֶּצְךָ֙ מִכׇּל־הָ֣עַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֱפִֽיצְךָ֛ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: then your God יהוה will restore your fortunes and take you back in love. [God] will bring you together again from all the peoples where your God יהוה has scattered you.
Transliteration: veshav yehovah eloheykha et-shevutekha verichamekha veshav vekivetsekha mikhׇl-haamiym asher hefiytsekha yehovah eloheykha shamah

Hebrew: אִם־יִהְיֶ֥ה נִֽדַּחֲךָ֖ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם מִשָּׁ֗ם יְקַבֶּצְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ וּמִשָּׁ֖ם יִקָּחֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Even if your outcasts are at the ends of the world, from there your God יהוה will gather you, from there [God] will fetch you.
Transliteration: im-yiheyeh nidachakha viketseh hashamayiim misham yekavetsekha yehovah eloheykha umisham yikachekha

Hebrew: וֶהֱבִיאֲךָ֞ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ אֶל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָרְשׁ֥וּ אֲבֹתֶ֖יךָ וִֽירִשְׁתָּ֑הּ וְהֵיטִֽבְךָ֥ וְהִרְבְּךָ֖ מֵאֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And your God יהוה will bring you to the land that your fathers possessed, and you shall possess it; and [God] will make you more prosperous and more numerous than your ancestors.
Transliteration: veheviyakha yehovah eloheykha el-haarets asher-yareshu avoteykha viyrishetah veheytivekha vehirevekha meavoteykha

Hebrew: וּמָ֨ל יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ אֶת־לְבָבְךָ֖ וְאֶת־לְבַ֣ב זַרְעֶ֑ךָ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֶ֛יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֥ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁךָ֖ לְמַ֥עַן חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Then your God יהוה will open up your heart and the hearts of your offspring—to love your God יהוה with all your heart and soul, in order that you may live.
Transliteration: umal yehovah eloheykha et-levavekha veet-levav zareekha leahavah et-yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha lemaan chayeykha

Hebrew: וְנָתַן֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הָאָל֖וֹת הָאֵ֑לֶּה עַל־אֹיְבֶ֥יךָ וְעַל־שֹׂנְאֶ֖יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר רְדָפֽוּךָ׃
Translated: Your God יהוה will inflict all those curses upon the enemies and foes who persecuted you.
Transliteration: venatan yehovah eloheykha et khׇl-haalvot haeleh al-oyeveykha veal-shoneeykha asher redafukha

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה תָשׁ֔וּב וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֖ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעָשִׂ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּֽוֹם׃
Translated: You, however, will again heed יהוה and obey all the divine commandments that I enjoin upon you this day.
Transliteration: veatah tashuv veshamaeta vekvol yehovah veashiyta et-khׇl-mitsevotayv asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom

Hebrew: וְהוֹתִֽירְךָ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ בְּכֹ֣ל ׀ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדֶ֗ךָ בִּפְרִ֨י בִטְנְךָ֜ וּבִפְרִ֧י בְהֶמְתְּךָ֛ וּבִפְרִ֥י אַדְמָתְךָ֖ לְטֹבָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ יָשׁ֣וּב יְהֹוָ֗ה לָשׂ֤וּשׂ עָלֶ֙יךָ֙ לְט֔וֹב כַּאֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖שׂ עַל־אֲבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And your God יהוה will grant you abounding prosperity in all your undertakings, in your issue from the womb, the offspring of your cattle, and your produce from the soil. For יהוה will again delight in your well-being as in that of your ancestors,
Transliteration: vehvotiyrekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol maasheh yadekha viferiy vitenekha uviferiy vehemetekha uviferiy adematekha letovah khiy yashuv yehovah lashush aleykha letvov khaasher-shash al-avoteykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י תִשְׁמַ֗ע בְּקוֹל֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֤ר מִצְוֺתָיו֙ וְחֻקֹּתָ֔יו הַכְּתוּבָ֕ה בְּסֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י תָשׁוּב֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכׇל־לְבָבְךָ֖ וּבְכׇל־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: since you will be heeding your God יהוה and keeping the divine commandments and laws that are recorded in this book of the Teaching—once you return to your God יהוה with all your heart and soul.
Transliteration: khiy tishema vekvol yehovah eloheykha lishemor mitsevotayv vechukotayv hakhetuvah vesefer hatvorah hazeh khiy tashuv el-yehovah eloheykha vekhׇl-levavekha uvekhׇl-nafeshekha {s}

Hebrew: כִּ֚י הַמִּצְוָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר אָנֹכִ֥י מְצַוְּךָ֖ הַיּ֑וֹם לֹא־נִפְלֵ֥את הִוא֙ מִמְּךָ֔ וְלֹ֥א רְחֹקָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: Surely, this Instruction which I enjoin upon you this day is not too baffling for you, nor is it beyond reach.
Transliteration: khiy hamitsevah hazot asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom lo-nifelet hiv mimekha velo rechokah hiv

Hebrew: לֹ֥א בַשָּׁמַ֖יִם הִ֑וא לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֣י יַעֲלֶה־לָּ֤נוּ הַשָּׁמַ֙יְמָה֙ וְיִקָּחֶ֣הָ לָּ֔נוּ וְיַשְׁמִעֵ֥נוּ אֹתָ֖הּ וְנַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
Translated: It is not in the heavens, that you should say, “Who among us can go up to the heavens and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”
Transliteration: lo vashamayiim hiv lemor miy yaaleh-lanu hashamayemah veyikacheha lanu veyashemienu otah venaashenah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיָּ֖ם הִ֑וא לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֣י יַעֲבׇר־לָ֜נוּ אֶל־עֵ֤בֶר הַיָּם֙ וְיִקָּחֶ֣הָ לָּ֔נוּ וְיַשְׁמִעֵ֥נוּ אֹתָ֖הּ וְנַעֲשֶֽׂנָּה׃
Translated: Neither is it beyond the sea, that you should say, “Who among us can cross to the other side of the sea and get it for us and impart it to us, that we may observe it?”
Transliteration: velo-meever layam hiv lemor miy yaavׇr-lanu el-ever hayam veyikacheha lanu veyashemienu otah venaashenah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־קָר֥וֹב אֵלֶ֛יךָ הַדָּבָ֖ר מְאֹ֑ד בְּפִ֥יךָ וּבִֽלְבָבְךָ֖ לַעֲשֹׂתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: No, the thing is very close to you, in your mouth and in your heart, to observe it.
Transliteration: khiy-karvov eleykha hadavar meod vefiykha uvilevavekha laashotvo {s}

Hebrew: רְאֵ֨ה נָתַ֤תִּי לְפָנֶ֙יךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם אֶת־הַֽחַיִּ֖ים וְאֶת־הַטּ֑וֹב וְאֶת־הַמָּ֖וֶת וְאֶת־הָרָֽע׃
Translated: See, I set before you this day life and prosperity, death and adversity.
Transliteration: reeh natatiy lefaneykha hayyvom et-hachayiym veet-hatvov veet-hamavet veet-hara

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֣י מְצַוְּךָ֮ הַיּוֹם֒ לְאַהֲבָ֞ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת בִּדְרָכָ֔יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֛ר מִצְוֺתָ֥יו וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֑יו וְחָיִ֣יתָ וְרָבִ֔יתָ וּבֵֽרַכְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אַתָּ֥ה בָא־שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: For I command you this day, to love your God יהוה, to walk in God’s ways, and to keep God’s commandments, God’s laws, and God’s rules, that you may thrive and increase, and that your God יהוה may bless you in the land that you are about to enter and possess.
Transliteration: asher anokhiy metsavekha hayyvom leahavah et-yehovah eloheykha lalekhet viderakhayv velishemor mitsevotayv vechukotayv umishefatayv vechayiyta veraviyta uverakhekha yehovah eloheykha vaarets asher-atah va-shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: וְאִם־יִפְנֶ֥ה לְבָבְךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א תִשְׁמָ֑ע וְנִדַּחְתָּ֗ וְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוִ֛יתָ לֵאלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִ֖ים וַעֲבַדְתָּֽם׃
Translated: But if your heart turns away and you give no heed, and are lured into the worship and service of other gods,
Transliteration: veim-yifeneh levavekha velo tishema venidacheta vehishetachaviyta lelohiym acheriym vaavadetam

Hebrew: הִגַּ֤דְתִּי לָכֶם֙ הַיּ֔וֹם כִּ֥י אָבֹ֖ד תֹּאבֵד֑וּן לֹא־תַאֲרִיכֻ֤ן יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתָּ֤ה עֹבֵר֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָב֥וֹא שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: I declare to you this day that you shall certainly perish; you shall not long endure on the soil that you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
Transliteration: higadetiy lakhem hayyvom khiy avod tovedun lo-taariykhun yamiym al-haadamah asher atah over et-hayareden lavvo shamah lerishetah

Hebrew: הַעִדֹ֨תִי בָכֶ֣ם הַיּוֹם֮ אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם וְאֶת־הָאָ֒רֶץ֒ הַחַיִּ֤ים וְהַמָּ֙וֶת֙ נָתַ֣תִּי לְפָנֶ֔יךָ הַבְּרָכָ֖ה וְהַקְּלָלָ֑ה וּבָֽחַרְתָּ֙ בַּחַיִּ֔ים לְמַ֥עַן תִּֽחְיֶ֖ה אַתָּ֥ה וְזַרְעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day: I have put before you life and death, blessing and curse. Choose life—if you and your offspring would live—
Transliteration: haidotiy vakhem hayyvom et-hashamayiim veet-haarets hachayiym vehamavet natatiy lefaneykha haverakhah vehakelalah uvachareta vachayiym lemaan ticheyeh atah vezareekha

Hebrew: לְאַֽהֲבָה֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ בְּקֹל֖וֹ וּלְדׇבְקָה־ב֑וֹ כִּ֣י ה֤וּא חַיֶּ֙יךָ֙ וְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמֶ֔יךָ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת עַל־הָאֲדָמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֧ה לַאֲבֹתֶ֛יךָ לְאַבְרָהָ֛ם לְיִצְחָ֥ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֖ב לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: by loving your God יהוה, heeding God’s commands, and holding fast to [God]. For thereby you shall have life and shall long endure upon the soil that יהוה swore to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give to them.
Transliteration: leahavah et-yehovah eloheykha lishemoa vekolvo uledׇvekah-vvo khiy hu chayeykha veorekhe yameykha lashevet al-haadamah asher nisheva yehovah laavoteykha leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov latet lahem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses went and spoke these things to all Israel.
Transliteration: vayelekhe mosheh vayedaver et-hadevariym haeleh el-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם בֶּן־מֵאָה֩ וְעֶשְׂרִ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ הַיּ֔וֹם לֹא־אוּכַ֥ל ע֖וֹד לָצֵ֣את וְלָב֑וֹא וַֽיהֹוָה֙ אָמַ֣ר אֵלַ֔י לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֥ן הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: He said to them: I am now one hundred and twenty years old, I can no longer be active. Moreover, יהוה has said to me, “You shall not go across yonder Jordan.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem ven-meah veesheriym shanah anokhiy hayyvom lo-ukhal vod latset velavvo vayhovah amar elay lo taavor et-hayareden hazeh

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ ה֣וּא ׀ עֹבֵ֣ר לְפָנֶ֗יךָ הֽוּא־יַשְׁמִ֞יד אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֛לֶּה מִלְּפָנֶ֖יךָ וִירִשְׁתָּ֑ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ ה֚וּא עֹבֵ֣ר לְפָנֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: It is indeed your God יהוה who will cross over before you, and who will wipe out those nations from your path; and you shall dispossess them.—Joshua is the one who shall cross before you, as יהוה has spoken.—
Transliteration: yehovah eloheykha hu over lefaneykha hu-yashemiyd et-hagvoyim haeleh milefaneykha viyrishetam yehvoshua hu over lefaneykha khaasher diver yehovah

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה לְסִיח֥וֹן וּלְע֛וֹג מַלְכֵ֥י הָאֱמֹרִ֖י וּלְאַרְצָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁמִ֖יד אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: יהוה will do to them as was done to Sihon and Og, kings of the Amorites, and to their countries, when [God] wiped them out.
Transliteration: veashah yehovah lahem khaasher ashah lesiychvon ulevog malekhey haemoriy ulearetsam asher hishemiyd otam

Hebrew: וּנְתָנָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם לָהֶ֔ם כְּכׇ֨ל־הַמִּצְוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: יהוה will deliver them up to you, and you shall deal with them in full accordance with the Instruction that I have enjoined upon you.
Transliteration: unetanam yehovah lifeneykhem vaashiytem lahem khekhׇl-hamitsevah asher tsiviytiy etekhem

Hebrew: חִזְק֣וּ וְאִמְצ֔וּ אַל־תִּֽירְא֥וּ וְאַל־תַּעַרְצ֖וּ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ ה֚וּא הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א יַעַזְבֶֽךָּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Be strong and resolute, be not in fear or in dread of them; for it is indeed your God יהוה who marches with you: [God] will not fail you or forsake you.
Transliteration: chizeku veimetsu al-tiyreu veal-taaretsu mifeneyhem khiy yehovah eloheykha hu haholekhe imakhe lo yarefekha velo yaazevekha {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה לִיהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו לְעֵינֵ֣י כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ חֲזַ֣ק וֶאֱמָץ֒ כִּ֣י אַתָּ֗ה תָּבוֹא֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֧ע יְהֹוָ֛ה לַאֲבֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֣ת לָהֶ֑ם וְאַתָּ֖ה תַּנְחִילֶ֥נָּה אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Then Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel: “Be strong and resolute, for it is you who shall go with this people into the land that יהוה swore to their fathers to give them, and it is you who shall apportion it to them.
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh liyhvoshua vayomer elayv leeyney khׇl-yisherael chazak veemats khiy atah tavvo et-haam hazeh el-haarets asher nisheva yehovah laavotam latet lahem veatah tanechiylenah votam

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֞ה ה֣וּא ׀ הַהֹלֵ֣ךְ לְפָנֶ֗יךָ ה֚וּא יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א יַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א יַעַזְבֶ֑ךָּ לֹ֥א תִירָ֖א וְלֹ֥א תֵחָֽת׃
Translated: And it is indeed יהוה who will go before you. [God] will be with you—and will not fail you or forsake you. Fear not and be not dismayed!”
Transliteration: vayhovah hu haholekhe lefaneykha hu yiheyeh imakhe lo yarefekha velo yaazevekha lo tiyra velo techat

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֣ב מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֣ה הַזֹּאת֒ וַֽיִּתְּנָ֗הּ אֶל־הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י הַנֹּ֣שְׂאִ֔ים אֶת־אֲר֖וֹן בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶל־כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses wrote down this Teaching and gave it to the priests, sons of Levi, who carried the Ark of יהוה’s Covenant, and to all the elders of Israel.
Transliteration: vayikhetov mosheh et-hatvorah hazot vayitenah el-hakhohaniym veney leviy hanosheiym et-arvon veriyt yehovah veel-khׇl-zikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו מֹשֶׁ֖ה אוֹתָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר מִקֵּ֣ץ ׀ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֗ים בְּמֹעֵ֛ד שְׁנַ֥ת הַשְּׁמִטָּ֖ה בְּחַ֥ג הַסֻּכּֽוֹת׃
Translated: And Moses instructed them as follows: Every seventh year, the year set for remission, at the Feast of Booths,
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh votam lemor mikets sheva shaniym vemoed shenat hashemitah vechag hasukhvot

Hebrew: בְּב֣וֹא כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֵֽרָאוֹת֙ אֶת־פְּנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בַּמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִבְחָ֑ר תִּקְרָ֞א אֶת־הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את נֶ֥גֶד כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאׇזְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: when all Israel comes to appear before your God יהוה in the place that [God] will choose, you shall read this Teaching aloud in the presence of all Israel.
Transliteration: vevvo khׇl-yisherael leravot et-feney yehovah eloheykha vamakvom asher yivechar tikera et-hatvorah hazot neged khׇl-yisherael veׇzeneyhem

Hebrew: הַקְהֵ֣ל אֶת־הָעָ֗ם הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֤ים וְהַנָּשִׁים֙ וְהַטַּ֔ף וְגֵרְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בִּשְׁעָרֶ֑יךָ לְמַ֨עַן יִשְׁמְע֜וּ וּלְמַ֣עַן יִלְמְד֗וּ וְיָֽרְאוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם וְשָׁמְר֣וּ לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Gather the people—men, women, children, and the strangers in your communities—that they may hear and so learn to revere your God יהוה and to observe faithfully every word of this Teaching.
Transliteration: hakehel et-haam haanashiym vehanashiym vehataf vegerekha asher visheareykha lemaan yishemeu ulemaan yilemedu veyareu et-yehovah eloheykhem veshameru laashvot et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot

Hebrew: וּבְנֵיהֶ֞ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹא־יָדְע֗וּ יִשְׁמְעוּ֙ וְלָ֣מְד֔וּ לְיִרְאָ֖ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֤ם חַיִּים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Their children, too, who have not had the experience, shall hear and learn to revere your God יהוה as long as they live in the land that you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.
Transliteration: uveneyhem asher lo-yadeu yishemeu velamedu leyireah et-yehovah eloheykhem khׇl-hayamiym asher atem chayiym al-haadamah asher atem overiym et-hayareden shamah lerishetah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הֵ֣ן קָרְב֣וּ יָמֶ֘יךָ֮ לָמוּת֒ קְרָ֣א אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וְהִֽתְיַצְּב֛וּ בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וַאֲצַוֶּ֑נּוּ וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ מֹשֶׁה֙ וִיהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: The time is drawing near for you to die. Call Joshua and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting, that I may instruct him. Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hen karevu yameykha lamut kera et-yehvoshua vehiteyatsevu veohel mvoed vaatsavenu vayelekhe mosheh viyhvoshua vayiteyatsevu veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיֵּרָ֧א יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּאֹ֖הֶל בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָנָ֑ן וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֛ד עַמּ֥וּד הֶעָנָ֖ן עַל־פֶּ֥תַח הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: יהוה appeared in the Tent, in a pillar of cloud, the pillar of cloud having come to rest at the entrance of the tent.
Transliteration: vayera yehovah vaohel veamud anan vayaamod amud heanan al-fetach haohel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הִנְּךָ֥ שֹׁכֵ֖ב עִם־אֲבֹתֶ֑יךָ וְקָם֩ הָעָ֨ם הַזֶּ֜ה וְזָנָ֣ה ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י נֵכַר־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֤וּא בָא־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ וַעֲזָבַ֕נִי וְהֵפֵר֙ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּרַ֖תִּי אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: You are soon to lie with your ancestors. This people will thereupon go astray after the alien gods in their midst, in the land that they are about to enter; they will forsake Me and break My covenant that I made with them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hinekha shokhev im-avoteykha vekam haam hazeh vezanah acharey elohey nekhar-haarets asher hu va-shamah vekirevvo vaazavaniy vehefer et-veriytiy asher kharatiy itvo

Hebrew: וְחָרָ֣ה אַפִּ֣י ב֣וֹ בַיּוֹם־הַ֠ה֠וּא וַעֲזַבְתִּ֞ים וְהִסְתַּרְתִּ֨י פָנַ֤י מֵהֶם֙ וְהָיָ֣ה לֶאֱכֹ֔ל וּמְצָאֻ֛הוּ רָע֥וֹת רַבּ֖וֹת וְצָר֑וֹת וְאָמַר֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא הֲלֹ֗א עַ֣ל כִּי־אֵ֤ין אֱלֹהַי֙ בְּקִרְבִּ֔י מְצָא֖וּנִי הָרָע֥וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Then My anger will flare up against them, and I will abandon them and hide My countenance from them. They shall be ready prey; and many evils and troubles shall befall them. And they shall say on that day, “Surely it is because our God is not in our midst that these evils have befallen us.”
Transliteration: vecharah afiy vvo vayyvom-hahu vaazavetiym vehisetaretiy fanay mehem vehayah leekhol umetsauhu ravot ravvot vetsarvot veamar vayyvom hahu halo al khiy-eyn elohay vekireviy metsauniy haravot haeleh

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֗י הַסְתֵּ֨ר אַסְתִּ֤יר פָּנַי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא עַ֥ל כׇּל־הָרָעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה כִּ֣י פָנָ֔ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: Yet I will keep My countenance hidden on that day, because of all the evil they have done in turning to other gods.
Transliteration: veanokhiy haseter asetiyr fanay vayyvom hahu al khׇl-haraah asher ashah khiy fanah el-Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה כִּתְב֤וּ לָכֶם֙ אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וְלַמְּדָ֥הּ אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שִׂימָ֣הּ בְּפִיהֶ֑ם לְמַ֨עַן תִּֽהְיֶה־לִּ֜י הַשִּׁירָ֥ה הַזֹּ֛את לְעֵ֖ד בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Therefore, write down this poem and teach it to the people of Israel; put it in their mouths, in order that this poem may be My witness against the people of Israel.
Transliteration: veatah khitevu lakhem et-hashiyrah hazot velamedah et-veney-yisherael shiymah vefiyhem lemaan tiheyeh-liy hashiyrah hazot leed viveney yisherael

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲבִיאֶ֜נּוּ אֶֽל־הָאֲדָמָ֣ה ׀ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֗יו זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ וְאָכַ֥ל וְשָׂבַ֖ע וְדָשֵׁ֑ן וּפָנָ֞ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֲחֵרִים֙ וַעֲבָד֔וּם וְנִ֣אֲצ֔וּנִי וְהֵפֵ֖ר אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
Translated: When I bring them into the land flowing with milk and honey that I promised on oath to their fathers, and they eat their fill and grow fat and turn to other gods and serve them, spurning Me and breaking My covenant,
Transliteration: khiy-aviyenu el-haadamah asher-nishevaetiy laavotayv zavat chalav udevash veakhal veshava vedashen ufanah el-Elohim acheriym vaavadum veniatsuniy vehefer et-veriytiy

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיָ֠ה כִּי־תִמְצֶ֨אןָ אֹת֜וֹ רָע֣וֹת רַבּוֹת֮ וְצָרוֹת֒ וְ֠עָנְתָ֠ה הַשִּׁירָ֨ה הַזֹּ֤את לְפָנָיו֙ לְעֵ֔ד כִּ֛י לֹ֥א תִשָּׁכַ֖ח מִפִּ֣י זַרְע֑וֹ כִּ֧י יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶת־יִצְר֗וֹ אֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֤וּא עֹשֶׂה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם בְּטֶ֣רֶם אֲבִיאֶ֔נּוּ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: and the many evils and troubles befall them—then this poem shall confront them as a witness, since it will never be lost from the mouth of their offspring. For I know what plans they are devising even now, before I bring them into the land that I promised on oath.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-timetsena otvo ravot ravvot vetsarvot veanetah hashiyrah hazot lefanayv leed khiy lo tishakhach mifiy zarevo khiy yadaetiy et-yitservo asher hu osheh hayyvom veterem aviyenu el-haarets asher nishevaetiy

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֥ב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֥ה הַזֹּ֖את בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַֽיְלַמְּדָ֖הּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: That day, Moses wrote down this poem and taught it to the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayikhetov mosheh et-hashiyrah hazot vayyvom hahu vayelamedah et-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֞ו אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ חֲזַ֣ק וֶאֱמָץ֒ כִּ֣י אַתָּ֗ה תָּבִיא֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי לָהֶ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֖י אֶהְיֶ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And [God] charged Joshua son of Nun: “Be strong and resolute: for you shall bring the Israelites into the land that I promised them on oath, and I will be with you.”
Transliteration: vayetsav et-yehvoshua vin-nun vayomer chazak veemats khiy atah taviy et-veney yisherael el-haarets asher-nishevaetiy lahem veanokhiy eheyeh imakhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלּ֣וֹת מֹשֶׁ֗ה לִכְתֹּ֛ב אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַתּוֹרָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את עַל־סֵ֑פֶר עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃
Translated: When Moses had put down in writing the words of this Teaching to the very end,
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot mosheh likhetov et-diverey hatvorah-hazot al-sefer ad tumam

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם נֹ֥שְׂאֵ֛י אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Moses charged the Levites who carried the Ark of the Covenant of יהוה, saying:
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh et-haleviyim nosheey arvon veriyt-yehovah lemor

Hebrew: לָקֹ֗חַ אֵ֣ת סֵ֤פֶר הַתּוֹרָה֙ הַזֶּ֔ה וְשַׂמְתֶּ֣ם אֹת֔וֹ מִצַּ֛ד אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָיָה־שָׁ֥ם בְּךָ֖ לְעֵֽד׃
Translated: Take this book of Teaching and place it beside the Ark of the Covenant of your God יהוה, and let it remain there as a witness against you.
Transliteration: lakocha et sefer hatvorah hazeh veshametem otvo mitsad arvon veriyt-yehovah eloheykhem vehayah-sham vekha leed

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָנֹכִ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ אֶֽת־מֶרְיְךָ֔ וְאֶֽת־עׇרְפְּךָ֖ הַקָּשֶׁ֑ה הֵ֣ן בְּעוֹדֶ֩נִּי֩ חַ֨י עִמָּכֶ֜ם הַיּ֗וֹם מַמְרִ֤ים הֱיִתֶם֙ עִם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאַ֖ף כִּי־אַחֲרֵ֥י מוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: Well I know how defiant and stiffnecked you are: even now, while I am still alive in your midst, you have been defiant toward יהוה; how much more, then, when I am dead!
Transliteration: khiy anokhiy yadaetiy et-mereyekha veet-ׇrefekha hakasheh hen vevodeniy chay imakhem hayyvom mameriym heyitem im-yehovah veaf khiy-acharey mvotiy

Hebrew: הַקְהִ֧ילוּ אֵלַ֛י אֶת־כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֥י שִׁבְטֵיכֶ֖ם וְשֹׁטְרֵיכֶ֑ם וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה בְאׇזְנֵיהֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֔ם אֶת־הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וְאֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, that I may speak all these words to them and that I may call heaven and earth to witness against them.
Transliteration: hakehiylu elay et-khׇl-zikeney shiveteykhem veshotereykhem vaadaverah veׇzeneyhem et hadevariym haeleh veaiydah vam et-hashamayiim veet-haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יָדַ֗עְתִּי אַחֲרֵ֤י מוֹתִי֙ כִּֽי־הַשְׁחֵ֣ת תַּשְׁחִת֔וּן וְסַרְתֶּ֣ם מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְקָרָ֨את אֶתְכֶ֤ם הָרָעָה֙ בְּאַחֲרִ֣ית הַיָּמִ֔ים כִּֽי־תַעֲשׂ֤וּ אֶת־הָרַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהַכְעִיס֖וֹ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יְדֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: For I know that, when I am dead, you will act wickedly and turn away from the path that I enjoined upon you, and that in time to come misfortune will befall you for having done evil in the sight of יהוה, whom you vexed by your deeds.
Transliteration: khiy yadaetiy acharey mvotiy khiy-hashechet tashechitun vesaretem min-haderekhe asher tsiviytiy etekhem vekarat etekhem haraah veachariyt hayamiym khiy-taashu et-hara veeyney yehovah lehakheiysvo vemaasheh yedeykhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּאׇזְנֵי֙ כׇּל־קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַשִּׁירָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את עַ֖ד תֻּמָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Moses recited the words of this poem to the very end, in the hearing of the whole congregation of Israel:
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh veׇzeney khׇl-kehal yisherael et-diverey hashiyrah hazot ad tumam {f}

Hebrew: הַאֲזִ֥ינוּ הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם וַאֲדַבֵּ֑רָה וְתִשְׁמַ֥ע הָאָ֖רֶץ אִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
Translated:
Give ear, O heavens, let me speak;
Let the earth hear the words I utter!
Transliteration: haaziynu hashamayiim vaadaverah vetishema haarets imerey-fiy

Hebrew: יַעֲרֹ֤ף כַּמָּטָר֙ לִקְחִ֔י תִּזַּ֥ל כַּטַּ֖ל אִמְרָתִ֑י כִּשְׂעִירִ֣ם עֲלֵי־דֶ֔שֶׁא וְכִרְבִיבִ֖ים עֲלֵי־עֵֽשֶׂב׃
Translated:
May my discourse come down as the rain,
My speech distill as the dew,
Like showers on young growth,
Like droplets on the grass.
Transliteration: yaarof khamatar likechiy tizal khatal imeratiy khisheiyrim aley-deshe vekhireviyviym aley-eshev

Hebrew: כִּ֛י שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶקְרָ֑א הָב֥וּ גֹ֖דֶל לֵאלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
For the name of יהוה I proclaim;
Give glory to our God!
Transliteration: khiy shem yehovah ekera havu godel leloheynu

Hebrew: הַצּוּר֙ תָּמִ֣ים פׇּֽעֳל֔וֹ כִּ֥י כׇל־דְּרָכָ֖יו מִשְׁפָּ֑ט אֵ֤ל אֱמוּנָה֙ וְאֵ֣ין עָ֔וֶל צַדִּ֥יק וְיָשָׁ֖ר הֽוּא׃
Translated:
The Rock!—whose deeds are perfect,
Yea, all God’s ways are just;
A faithful God, never false,
True and upright indeed.
Transliteration: hatsur tamiym fׇolvo khiy khׇl-derakhayv mishefat el emunah veeyn avel tsadiyk veyashar hu

Hebrew: שִׁחֵ֥ת ל֛וֹ לֹ֖א בָּנָ֣יו מוּמָ֑ם דּ֥וֹר עִקֵּ֖שׁ וּפְתַלְתֹּֽל׃
Translated:
Unworthy children—
That crooked, perverse generation—
Their baseness has played God false.
Transliteration: shichet lvo lo vanayv mumam dvor ikesh ufetaletol

Hebrew: <big>הַ</big> לְיְהֹוָה֙ תִּגְמְלוּ־זֹ֔את עַ֥ם נָבָ֖ל וְלֹ֣א חָכָ֑ם הֲלוֹא־הוּא֙ אָבִ֣יךָ קָּנֶ֔ךָ ה֥וּא עָשְׂךָ֖ וַֽיְכֹנְנֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Do you thus requite יהוה,
O dull and witless people?
Is not this the Father who created you—
Fashioned you and made you endure!
Transliteration: <big>ha</big> leyehovah tigemelu-zot am naval velo chakham halvo-hu aviykha kanekha hu ashekha vayekhonenekha

Hebrew: זְכֹר֙ יְמ֣וֹת עוֹלָ֔ם בִּ֖ינוּ שְׁנ֣וֹת דֹּר־וָדֹ֑ר שְׁאַ֤ל אָבִ֙יךָ֙ וְיַגֵּ֔דְךָ זְקֵנֶ֖יךָ וְיֹ֥אמְרוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Remember the days of old,
Consider the years of ages past;
Ask your parent, who will inform you,
Your elders, who will tell you:
Transliteration: zekhor yemvot volam viynu shenvot dor-vador sheal aviykha veyagedekha zekeneykha veyomeru lakhe

Hebrew: בְּהַנְחֵ֤ל עֶלְיוֹן֙ גּוֹיִ֔ם בְּהַפְרִיד֖וֹ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָ֑ם יַצֵּב֙ גְּבֻלֹ֣ת עַמִּ֔ים לְמִסְפַּ֖ר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
When the Most High gave nations their homes
And set the divisions of humanity,
[God] fixed the boundaries of peoples
In relation to Israel’s numbers.
Transliteration: vehanechel eleyvon gvoyim vehaferiydvo veney adam yatsev gevulot amiym lemisefar veney yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֛י חֵ֥לֶק יְהֹוָ֖ה עַמּ֑וֹ יַעֲקֹ֖ב חֶ֥בֶל נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For יהוה’s portion is this people;
Jacob, God’s own allotment.
Transliteration: khiy chelek yehovah amvo yaakov chevel nachalatvo

Hebrew: יִמְצָאֵ֙הוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִדְבָּ֔ר וּבְתֹ֖הוּ יְלֵ֣ל יְשִׁמֹ֑ן יְסֹבְבֶ֙נְהוּ֙ יְב֣וֹנְנֵ֔הוּ יִצְּרֶ֖נְהוּ כְּאִישׁ֥וֹן עֵינֽוֹ׃
Translated:
[God] found them in a desert region,
In an empty howling waste.
[God] engirded them, watched over them,
Guarded them as the pupil of God’s eye.
Transliteration: yimetsaehu veerets midevar uvetohu yelel yeshimon yesovevenehu yevvonenehu yitserenehu kheiyshvon eynvo

Hebrew: כְּנֶ֙שֶׁר֙ יָעִ֣יר קִנּ֔וֹ עַל־גּוֹזָלָ֖יו יְרַחֵ֑ף יִפְרֹ֤שׂ כְּנָפָיו֙ יִקָּחֵ֔הוּ יִשָּׂאֵ֖הוּ עַל־אֶבְרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Like an eagle who rouses its nestlings,
Gliding down to its young,
So did [God] spread wings and take them,
Bear them along on pinions;
Transliteration: khenesher yaiyr kinvo al-gvozalayv yerachef yiferosh khenafayv yikachehu yishaehu al-everatvo

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֖ה בָּדָ֣ד יַנְחֶ֑נּוּ וְאֵ֥ין עִמּ֖וֹ אֵ֥ל נֵכָֽר׃
Translated:
יהוה alone did guide them,
No alien god alongside.
Transliteration: yehovah vadad yanechenu veeyn imvo el nekhar

Hebrew: יַרְכִּבֵ֙הוּ֙ עַל־[בָּ֣מֳתֵי] (במותי) אָ֔רֶץ וַיֹּאכַ֖ל תְּנוּבֹ֣ת שָׂדָ֑י וַיֵּנִקֵ֤הֽוּ דְבַשׁ֙ מִסֶּ֔לַע וְשֶׁ֖מֶן מֵחַלְמִ֥ישׁ צֽוּר׃
Translated:
[God] set them atop the highlands,
To feast on the yield of the earth;
Nursing them with honey from the crag,
And oil from the flinty rock,
Transliteration: yarekhivehu al-[vamotey] (vmvty) arets vayokhal tenuvot shaday vayenikehu devash misela veshemen mechalemiysh tsur

Hebrew: חֶמְאַ֨ת בָּקָ֜ר וַחֲלֵ֣ב צֹ֗אן עִם־חֵ֨לֶב כָּרִ֜ים וְאֵילִ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־בָשָׁן֙ וְעַתּוּדִ֔ים עִם־חֵ֖לֶב כִּלְי֣וֹת חִטָּ֑ה וְדַם־עֵנָ֖ב תִּשְׁתֶּה־חָֽמֶר׃
Translated:
Curd of kine and milk of flocks;
With the best of lambs,
And rams of Bashan, and he-goats;
With the very finest wheat—
And foaming grape-blood was your drink.
Transliteration: chemeat vakar vachalev tson im-chelev khariym veeyliym veney-vashan veatudiym im-chelev khileyvot chitah vedam-enav tisheteh-chamer

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ן יְשֻׁרוּן֙ וַיִּבְעָ֔ט שָׁמַ֖נְתָּ עָבִ֣יתָ כָּשִׂ֑יתָ וַיִּטֹּשׁ֙ אֱל֣וֹהַּ עָשָׂ֔הוּ וַיְנַבֵּ֖ל צ֥וּר יְשֻׁעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
So Jeshurun grew fat and kicked—
You grew fat and gross and coarse —
They forsook the God who made them
And spurned the Rock of their support.
Transliteration: vayisheman yeshurun vayiveat shamaneta aviyta khashiyta vayitosh elvoha ashahu vayenavel tsur yeshuatvo

Hebrew: יַקְנִאֻ֖הוּ בְּזָרִ֑ים בְּתוֹעֵבֹ֖ת יַכְעִיסֻֽהוּ׃
Translated:
They incensed [God] with alien things,
Vexed [God] with abominations.
Transliteration: yakeniuhu vezariym vetvoevot yakheiysuhu

Hebrew: יִזְבְּח֗וּ לַשֵּׁדִים֙ לֹ֣א אֱלֹ֔הַּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לֹ֣א יְדָע֑וּם חֲדָשִׁים֙ מִקָּרֹ֣ב בָּ֔אוּ לֹ֥א שְׂעָר֖וּם אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
They sacrificed to demons, no-gods,
Gods they had never known,
New ones, who came but lately,
Who stirred not your forebears’ fears.
Transliteration: yizevechu lashediym lo eloha Elohim lo yedaum chadashiym mikarov vau lo shearum avoteykhem

Hebrew: צ֥וּר יְלָדְךָ֖ תֶּ֑שִׁ<small>י</small> וַתִּשְׁכַּ֖ח אֵ֥ל מְחֹלְלֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You neglected the Rock who begot you,
Forgot the God who labored to bring you forth.
Transliteration: tsur yeladekha teshi<small>y</small> vatishekhach el mecholelekha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיִּנְאָ֑ץ מִכַּ֥עַס בָּנָ֖יו וּבְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
יהוה saw and was vexed
And spurned these sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayare yehovah vayineats mikhaas vanayv uvenotayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַסְתִּ֤ירָה פָנַי֙ מֵהֶ֔ם אֶרְאֶ֖ה מָ֣ה אַחֲרִיתָ֑ם כִּ֣י ד֤וֹר תַּהְפֻּכֹת֙ הֵ֔מָּה בָּנִ֖ים לֹא־אֵמֻ֥ן בָּֽם׃
Translated:
[God] said: I will hide My countenance from them,
And see how they fare in the end.
For they are a treacherous breed,
Children with no loyalty in them.
Transliteration: vayomer asetiyrah fanay mehem ereeh mah achariytam khiy dvor tahefukhot hemah vaniym lo-emun vam

Hebrew: הֵ֚ם קִנְא֣וּנִי בְלֹא־אֵ֔ל כִּעֲס֖וּנִי בְּהַבְלֵיהֶ֑ם וַֽאֲנִי֙ אַקְנִיאֵ֣ם בְּלֹא־עָ֔ם בְּג֥וֹי נָבָ֖ל אַכְעִיסֵֽם׃
Translated:
They incensed Me with no-gods,
Vexed Me with their futilities;
I’ll incense them with a no-folk,
Vex them with a nation of fools.
Transliteration: hem kineuniy velo-el khiasuniy vehaveleyhem vaaniy akeniyem velo-am vegvoy naval akheiysem

Hebrew: כִּי־אֵשׁ֙ קָדְחָ֣ה בְאַפִּ֔י וַתִּיקַ֖ד עַד־שְׁא֣וֹל תַּחְתִּ֑ית וַתֹּ֤אכַל אֶ֙רֶץ֙ וִֽיבֻלָ֔הּ וַתְּלַהֵ֖ט מוֹסְדֵ֥י הָרִֽים׃
Translated:
For a fire has flared in My wrath
And burned to the bottom of Sheol,
Has consumed the earth and its increase,
Eaten down to the base of the hills.
Transliteration: khiy-esh kadechah veafiy vatiykad ad-shevol tachetiyt vatokhal erets viyvulah vatelahet mvosedey hariym

Hebrew: אַסְפֶּ֥ה עָלֵ֖ימוֹ רָע֑וֹת חִצַּ֖י אֲכַלֶּה־בָּֽם׃
Translated:
I will sweep misfortunes on them,
Use up My arrows on them:
Transliteration: asefeh aleymvo ravot chitsay akhaleh-vam

Hebrew: מְזֵ֥י רָעָ֛ב וּלְחֻ֥מֵי רֶ֖שֶׁף וְקֶ֣טֶב מְרִירִ֑י וְשֶׁן־בְּהֵמֹת֙ אֲשַׁלַּח־בָּ֔ם עִם־חֲמַ֖ת זֹחֲלֵ֥י עָפָֽר׃
Translated:
Wasting famine, ravaging plague,
Deadly pestilence, and fanged beasts
Will I let loose against them,
With venomous creepers in dust.
Transliteration: mezey raav ulechumey reshef veketev meriyriy veshen-vehemot ashalach-vam im-chamat zochaley afar

Hebrew: מִחוּץ֙ תְּשַׁכֶּל־חֶ֔רֶב וּמֵחֲדָרִ֖ים אֵימָ֑ה גַּם־בָּחוּר֙ גַּם־בְּתוּלָ֔ה יוֹנֵ֖ק עִם־אִ֥ישׁ שֵׂיבָֽה׃
Translated:
The sword shall deal death without,
As shall the terror within,
To youth and maiden alike,
The suckling as well as the aged.
Transliteration: michuts teshakhel-cherev umechadariym eymah gam-vachur gam-vetulah yvonek im-iysh sheyvah

Hebrew: אָמַ֖רְתִּי אַפְאֵיהֶ֑ם אַשְׁבִּ֥יתָה מֵאֱנ֖וֹשׁ זִכְרָֽם׃
Translated:
I might have reduced them to naught,
Made their memory cease among humankind,
Transliteration: amaretiy afeeyhem asheviytah meenvosh zikheram

Hebrew: לוּלֵ֗י כַּ֤עַס אוֹיֵב֙ אָג֔וּר פֶּֽן־יְנַכְּר֖וּ צָרֵ֑ימוֹ פֶּן־יֹֽאמְרוּ֙ יָדֵ֣נוּ רָ֔מָה וְלֹ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה פָּעַ֥ל כׇּל־זֹֽאת׃
Translated:
But for fear of the taunts of the foe,
Their enemies who might misjudge
And say, “Our own hand has prevailed;
None of this was wrought by יהוה !”
Transliteration: luley khaas voeiv agur fen-yenakheru tsareymvo fen-yomeru yadenu ramah velo yehovah faal khׇl-zot

Hebrew: כִּי־ג֛וֹי אֹבַ֥ד עֵצ֖וֹת הֵ֑מָּה וְאֵ֥ין בָּהֶ֖ם תְּבוּנָֽה׃
Translated:
For they are a folk void of sense,
Lacking in all discernment.
Transliteration: khiy-gvoy ovad etsvot hemah veeyn vahem tevunah

Hebrew: ל֥וּ חָכְמ֖וּ יַשְׂכִּ֣ילוּ זֹ֑את יָבִ֖ינוּ לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃
Translated:
Were they wise, they would think upon this,
Gain insight into their future:
Transliteration: lu chakhemu yashekhiylu zot yaviynu leachariytam

Hebrew: אֵיכָ֞ה יִרְדֹּ֤ף אֶחָד֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁנַ֖יִם יָנִ֣יסוּ רְבָבָ֑ה אִם־לֹא֙ כִּֽי־צוּרָ֣ם מְכָרָ֔ם וַֽיהֹוָ֖ה הִסְגִּירָֽם׃
Translated:
“How could one have routed a thousand,
Or two put ten thousand to flight,
Unless their Rock had sold them,
יהוה had given them up?”
Transliteration: eykhah yiredof echad elef ushenayiim yaniysu revavah im-lo khiy-tsuram mekharam vayhovah hisegiyram

Hebrew: כִּ֛י לֹ֥א כְצוּרֵ֖נוּ צוּרָ֑ם וְאֹיְבֵ֖ינוּ פְּלִילִֽים׃
Translated:
For their rock is not like our Rock,
In our enemies’ own estimation.
Transliteration: khiy lo khetsurenu tsuram veoyeveynu feliyliym

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִגֶּ֤פֶן סְדֹם֙ גַּפְנָ֔ם וּמִשַּׁדְמֹ֖ת עֲמֹרָ֑ה עֲנָבֵ֙מוֹ֙ עִנְּבֵי־ר֔וֹשׁ אַשְׁכְּלֹ֥ת מְרֹרֹ֖ת לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Ah! The vine for them is from Sodom,
From the vineyards of Gomorrah;
The grapes for them are poison,
A bitter growth their clusters.
Transliteration: khiy-migefen sedom gafenam umishademot amorah anavemvo inevey-rvosh ashekhelot merorot lamvo

Hebrew: חֲמַ֥ת תַּנִּינִ֖ם יֵינָ֑ם וְרֹ֥אשׁ פְּתָנִ֖ים אַכְזָֽר׃
Translated:
Their wine is the venom of asps,
The pitiless poison of vipers.
Transliteration: chamat taniynim eiynam verosh fetaniym akhezar

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־ה֖וּא כָּמֻ֣ס עִמָּדִ֑י חָת֖וּם בְּאוֹצְרֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Lo, I have it all put away,
Sealed up in My storehouses,
Transliteration: halo-hu khamus imadiy chatum vevotserotay

Hebrew: לִ֤י נָקָם֙ וְשִׁלֵּ֔ם לְעֵ֖ת תָּמ֣וּט רַגְלָ֑ם כִּ֤י קָרוֹב֙ י֣וֹם אֵידָ֔ם וְחָ֖שׁ עֲתִדֹ֥ת לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
To be My vengeance and recompense,
At the time that their foot falters.
Yea, their day of disaster is near,
And destiny rushes upon them.
Transliteration: liy nakam veshilem leet tamut ragelam khiy karvov yvom eydam vechash atidot lamvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָדִ֤ין יְהֹוָה֙ עַמּ֔וֹ וְעַל־עֲבָדָ֖יו יִתְנֶחָ֑ם כִּ֤י יִרְאֶה֙ כִּֽי־אָ֣זְלַת יָ֔ד וְאֶ֖פֶס עָצ֥וּר וְעָזֽוּב׃
Translated:
For יהוה will vindicate God’s people
And take revenge for God’s servants,
Upon seeing that their might is gone,
And neither bond nor free is left.
Transliteration: khiy-yadiyn yehovah amvo veal-avadayv yitenecham khiy yireeh khiy-azelat yad veefes atsur veazuv

Hebrew: וְאָמַ֖ר אֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֑ימוֹ צ֖וּר חָסָ֥יוּ בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
[God] will say: Where are their gods,
The rock in whom they sought refuge,
Transliteration: veamar ey eloheymvo tsur chasayu vvo

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֨ר חֵ֤לֶב זְבָחֵ֙ימוֹ֙ יֹאכֵ֔לוּ יִשְׁתּ֖וּ יֵ֣ין נְסִיכָ֑ם יָק֙וּמוּ֙ וְיַעְזְרֻכֶ֔ם יְהִ֥י עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם סִתְרָֽה׃
Translated:
Who ate the fat of their offerings
And drank their libation wine?
Let them rise up to your help,
And let them be a shield unto you!
Transliteration: asher chelev zevacheymvo yokhelu yishetu eiyn nesiykham yakumu veyaezerukhem yehiy aleykhem siterah

Hebrew: רְא֣וּ ׀ עַתָּ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲנִ֤י אֲנִי֙ ה֔וּא וְאֵ֥ין אֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּדִ֑י אֲנִ֧י אָמִ֣ית וַאֲחַיֶּ֗ה מָחַ֙צְתִּי֙ וַאֲנִ֣י אֶרְפָּ֔א וְאֵ֥ין מִיָּדִ֖י מַצִּֽיל׃
Translated:
See, then, that I, I am the One;
There is no god beside Me.
I deal death and give life;
I wounded and I will heal:
None can deliver from My hand.
Transliteration: reu atah khiy aniy aniy hu veeyn Elohim imadiy aniy amiyt vaachayeh machatsetiy vaaniy erefa veeyn miyadiy matsiyl

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶשָּׂ֥א אֶל־שָׁמַ֖יִם יָדִ֑י וְאָמַ֕רְתִּי חַ֥י אָנֹכִ֖י לְעֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
Lo, I raise My hand to heaven
And say: As I live forever,
Transliteration: khiy-esha el-shamayiim yadiy veamaretiy chay anokhiy leolam

Hebrew: אִם־שַׁנּוֹתִי֙ בְּרַ֣ק חַרְבִּ֔י וְתֹאחֵ֥ז בְּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט יָדִ֑י אָשִׁ֤יב נָקָם֙ לְצָרָ֔י וְלִמְשַׂנְאַ֖י אֲשַׁלֵּֽם׃
Translated:
When I whet My flashing blade
And My hand lays hold on judgment,
Vengeance will I wreak on My foes,
Will I deal to those who reject Me.
Transliteration: im-shanvotiy verak chareviy vetochez vemishefat yadiy ashiyv nakam letsaray velimeshaneay ashalem

Hebrew: אַשְׁכִּ֤יר חִצַּי֙ מִדָּ֔ם וְחַרְבִּ֖י תֹּאכַ֣ל בָּשָׂ֑ר מִדַּ֤ם חָלָל֙ וְשִׁבְיָ֔ה מֵרֹ֖אשׁ פַּרְע֥וֹת אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated:
I will make My arrows drunk with blood—
As My sword devours flesh—
Blood of the slain and the captive
From the long-haired enemy chiefs.
Transliteration: ashekhiyr chitsay midam vechareviy tokhal vashar midam chalal veshiveyah merosh farevot voeiv

Hebrew: הַרְנִ֤ינוּ גוֹיִם֙ עַמּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י דַם־עֲבָדָ֖יו יִקּ֑וֹם וְנָקָם֙ יָשִׁ֣יב לְצָרָ֔יו וְכִפֶּ֥ר אַדְמָת֖וֹ עַמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
O nations, acclaim God’s people!
For He’ll avenge the blood of His servants,
Wreak vengeance on His foes,
And cleanse His people’s land.
Transliteration: hareniynu gvoyim amvo khiy dam-avadayv yikvom venakam yashiyv letsarayv vekhifer adematvo amvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַשִּׁירָֽה־הַזֹּ֖את בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם ה֖וּא וְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
Translated: Moses came, together with Hosea son of Nun, and recited all the words of this poem in the hearing of the people.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh vayedaver et-khׇl-diverey hashiyrah-hazot veׇzeney haam hu vehvoshea vin-nun

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל מֹשֶׁ֗ה לְדַבֵּ֛ר אֶת־כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And when Moses finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
Transliteration: vayekhal mosheh ledaver et-khׇl-hadevariym haeleh el-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵהֶם֙ שִׂ֣ימוּ לְבַבְכֶ֔ם לְכׇ֨ל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י מֵעִ֥יד בָּכֶ֖ם הַיּ֑וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר תְּצַוֻּם֙ אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֔ם לִשְׁמֹ֣ר לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַתּוֹרָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: he said to them: Take to heart all the words with which I have warned you this day. Enjoin them upon your children, that they may observe faithfully all the terms of this Teaching.
Transliteration: vayomer alehem shiymu levavekhem lekhׇl-hadevariym asher anokhiy meiyd vakhem hayyvom asher tetsavum et-veneykhem lishemor laashvot et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah hazot

Hebrew: כִּ֠י לֹא־דָבָ֨ר רֵ֥ק הוּא֙ מִכֶּ֔ם כִּי־ה֖וּא חַיֵּיכֶ֑ם וּבַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה תַּאֲרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ עַל־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אַתֶּ֜ם עֹבְרִ֧ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן שָׁ֖מָּה לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: For this is not a trifling thing for you: it is your very life; through it you shall long endure on the land that you are to possess upon crossing the Jordan.
Transliteration: khiy lo-davar rek hu mikhem khiy-hu chayeykhem uvadavar hazeh taariykhu yamiym al-haadamah asher atem overiym et-hayareden shamah lerishetah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּעֶ֛צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: That very day יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veetsem hayyvom hazeh lemor

Hebrew: עֲלֵ֡ה אֶל־הַר֩ הָעֲבָרִ֨ים הַזֶּ֜ה הַר־נְב֗וֹ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֑וֹ וּרְאֵה֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֛ן לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
Translated: Ascend these heights of Abarim to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab facing Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving the Israelites as their holding.
Transliteration: aleh el-har haavariym hazeh har-nevvo asher veerets mvoav asher al-feney yerechvo ureeh et-erets khenaan asher aniy noten liveney yisherael laachuzah

Hebrew: וּמֻ֗ת בָּהָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתָּה֙ עֹלֶ֣ה שָׁ֔מָּה וְהֵאָסֵ֖ף אֶל־עַמֶּ֑יךָ כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־מֵ֞ת אַהֲרֹ֤ן אָחִ֙יךָ֙ בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר וַיֵּאָ֖סֶף אֶל־עַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: You shall die on the mountain that you are about to ascend, and shall be gathered to your kin, as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his kin;
Transliteration: umut vahar asher atah oleh shamah veheasef el-ameykha khaasher-met aharon achiykha vehor hahar vayeasef el-amayv

Hebrew: עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר מְעַלְתֶּ֜ם בִּ֗י בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּמֵֽי־מְרִיבַ֥ת קָדֵ֖שׁ מִדְבַּר־צִ֑ן עַ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־קִדַּשְׁתֶּם֙ אוֹתִ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: for you both broke faith with Me among the Israelite people, at the waters of Meribath-kadesh in the wilderness of Zin, by failing to uphold My sanctity among the Israelite people.
Transliteration: al asher mealetem viy vetvokhe veney yisherael vemey-meriyvat kadesh midevar-tsin al asher lo-kidashetem votiy vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֥י מִנֶּ֖גֶד תִּרְאֶ֣ה אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשָׁ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א תָב֔וֹא אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֖ן לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: You may view the land from a distance, but you shall not enter it—the land that I am giving to the Israelite people.
Transliteration: khiy mineged tireeh et-haarets veshamah lo tavvo el-haarets asher-aniy noten liveney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְזֹ֣את הַבְּרָכָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בֵּרַ֥ךְ מֹשֶׁ֛ה אִ֥ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לִפְנֵ֖י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: This is the blessing with which Moses, God’s agent, bade the Israelites farewell before he died.
Transliteration: vezot haverakhah asher verakhe mosheh iysh haElohim et-veney yisherael lifeney mvotvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֗ר יְהֹוָ֞ה מִסִּינַ֥י בָּא֙ וְזָרַ֤ח מִשֵּׂעִיר֙ לָ֔מוֹ הוֹפִ֙יעַ֙ מֵהַ֣ר פָּארָ֔ן וְאָתָ֖ה מֵרִבְבֹ֣ת קֹ֑דֶשׁ מִימִינ֕וֹ (אשדת) [אֵ֥שׁ דָּ֖ת] לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
He said:
יהוה came from Sinai,
And shone upon them from Seir;
[God] appeared from Mount Paran,
And approached from Ribeboth-kodesh,
Lightning flashing at them from [God’s] right.
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah misiynay va vezarach misheiyr lamvo hvofiya mehar faran veatah merivevot kodesh miymiynvo (shdt) [esh dat] lamvo

Hebrew: אַ֚ף חֹבֵ֣ב עַמִּ֔ים כׇּל־קְדֹשָׁ֖יו בְּיָדֶ֑ךָ וְהֵם֙ תֻּכּ֣וּ לְרַגְלֶ֔ךָ יִשָּׂ֖א מִדַּבְּרֹתֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
Lover, indeed, of the people,
Their hallowed are all in Your hand.
They followed in Your steps,
Accepting Your pronouncements,
Transliteration: af chovev amiym khׇl-kedoshayv veyadekha vehem tukhu leragelekha yisha midaveroteykha

Hebrew: תּוֹרָ֥ה צִוָּה־לָ֖נוּ מֹשֶׁ֑ה מוֹרָשָׁ֖ה קְהִלַּ֥ת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
Translated:
When Moses charged us with the Teaching
As the heritage of the congregation of Jacob.
Transliteration: tvorah tsivah-lanu mosheh mvorashah kehilat yaakov

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י בִישֻׁר֖וּן מֶ֑לֶךְ בְּהִתְאַסֵּף֙ רָ֣אשֵׁי עָ֔ם יַ֖חַד שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Then [God] became King in Jeshurun,
When the heads of the people assembled,
The tribes of Israel together.
Transliteration: vayehiy viyshurun melekhe vehiteasef rashey am yachad shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: יְחִ֥י רְאוּבֵ֖ן וְאַל־יָמֹ֑ת וִיהִ֥י מְתָ֖יו מִסְפָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
May Reuben live and not die,
Though few be his numbers.
Transliteration: yechiy reuven veal-yamot viyhiy metayv misefar {s}

Hebrew: וְזֹ֣את לִיהוּדָה֮ וַיֹּאמַר֒ שְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ ק֣וֹל יְהוּדָ֔ה וְאֶל־עַמּ֖וֹ תְּבִיאֶ֑נּוּ יָדָיו֙ רָ֣ב ל֔וֹ וְעֵ֥זֶר מִצָּרָ֖יו תִּהְיֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
And this he said of Judah:
Hear, יהוה, the voice of Judah
And restore him to his people.
Though his own hands strive for him,
Help him against his foes.
Transliteration: vezot liyhudah vayomar shema yehovah kvol yehudah veel-amvo teviyenu yadayv rav lvo veezer mitsarayv tiheyeh {f}

Hebrew: וּלְלֵוִ֣י אָמַ֔ר תֻּמֶּ֥יךָ וְאוּרֶ֖יךָ לְאִ֣ישׁ חֲסִידֶ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִסִּיתוֹ֙ בְּמַסָּ֔ה תְּרִיבֵ֖הוּ עַל־מֵ֥י מְרִיבָֽה׃
Translated:
And of Levi he said:
Let Your Thummim and Urim
Be with Your faithful one,
Whom You tested at Massah,
Challenged at the waters of Meribah;
Transliteration: uleleviy amar tumeykha veureykha leiysh chasiydekha asher nisiytvo vemasah teriyvehu al-mey meriyvah

Hebrew: הָאֹמֵ֞ר לְאָבִ֤יו וּלְאִמּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א רְאִיתִ֔יו וְאֶת־אֶחָיו֙ לֹ֣א הִכִּ֔יר וְאֶת־בָּנָ֖ו לֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע כִּ֤י שָֽׁמְרוּ֙ אִמְרָתֶ֔ךָ וּבְרִיתְךָ֖ יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Who said of his father and mother,
“I consider them not.”
His brothers he disregarded,
Ignored his own children.
Your precepts alone they observed,
And kept Your covenant.
Transliteration: haomer leaviyv uleimvo lo reiytiyv veet-echayv lo hikhiyr veet-vanav lo yada khiy shameru imeratekha uveriytekha yinetsoru

Hebrew: יוֹר֤וּ מִשְׁפָּטֶ֙יךָ֙ לְיַֽעֲקֹ֔ב וְתוֹרָתְךָ֖ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יָשִׂ֤ימוּ קְטוֹרָה֙ בְּאַפֶּ֔ךָ וְכָלִ֖יל עַֽל־מִזְבְּחֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
They shall teach Your laws to Jacob
And Your instructions to Israel.
They shall offer You incense to savor
And whole-offerings on Your altar.
Transliteration: yvoru mishefateykha leyaakov vetvoratekha leyisherael yashiymu ketvorah veafekha vekhaliyl al-mizevechekha

Hebrew: בָּרֵ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ חֵיל֔וֹ וּפֹ֥עַל יָדָ֖יו תִּרְצֶ֑ה מְחַ֨ץ מׇתְנַ֧יִם קָמָ֛יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֖יו מִן־יְקוּמֽוּן׃ {ס}
Translated:
Bless, יהוה, his substance,
And favor his undertakings.
Smite the loins of his foes;
Let his enemies rise no more.
Transliteration: varekhe yehovah cheylvo ufoal yadayv tiretseh mechats mׇtenayiim kamayv umeshaneayv min-yekumun {s}

Hebrew: לְבִנְיָמִ֣ן אָמַ֔ר יְדִ֣יד יְהֹוָ֔ה יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָבֶ֖טַח עָלָ֑יו חֹפֵ֤ף עָלָיו֙ כׇּל־הַיּ֔וֹם וּבֵ֥ין כְּתֵפָ֖יו שָׁכֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated:
Of Benjamin he said:
Beloved of יהוה,
He rests securely beside [God],
Who protects him always,
As he rests between God’s shoulders.
Transliteration: levineyamin amar yediyd yehovah yishekhon lavetach alayv chofef alayv khׇl-hayyvom uveyn khetefayv shakhen {s}

Hebrew: וּלְיוֹסֵ֣ף אָמַ֔ר מְבֹרֶ֥כֶת יְהֹוָ֖ה אַרְצ֑וֹ מִמֶּ֤גֶד שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ מִטָּ֔ל וּמִתְּה֖וֹם רֹבֶ֥צֶת תָּֽחַת׃
Translated:
And of Joseph he said:
Blessed of יהוה be his land
With the bounty of dew from heaven,
And of the deep that couches below;
Transliteration: uleyvosef amar mevorekhet yehovah aretsvo mimeged shamayiim mital umitehvom rovetset tachat

Hebrew: וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד תְּבוּאֹ֣ת שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד גֶּ֥רֶשׁ יְרָחִֽים׃
Translated:
With the bounteous yield of the sun,
And the bounteous crop of the moons;
Transliteration: umimeged tevuot shamesh umimeged geresh yerachiym

Hebrew: וּמֵרֹ֖אשׁ הַרְרֵי־קֶ֑דֶם וּמִמֶּ֖גֶד גִּבְע֥וֹת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
With the best from the ancient mountains,
And the bounty of hills immemorial;
Transliteration: umerosh harerey-kedem umimeged givevot volam

Hebrew: וּמִמֶּ֗גֶד אֶ֚רֶץ וּמְלֹאָ֔הּ וּרְצ֥וֹן שֹׁכְנִ֖י סְנֶ֑ה תָּב֙וֹאתָה֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ יוֹסֵ֔ף וּלְקׇדְקֹ֖ד נְזִ֥יר אֶחָֽיו׃
Translated:
With the bounty of earth and its fullness,
And the favor of the Presence in the Bush.
May these rest on the head of Joseph,
On the crown of the elect of his brothers.
Transliteration: umimeged erets umeloah uretsvon shokheniy seneh tavvotah lerosh yvosef ulekׇdekod neziyr echayv

Hebrew: בְּכ֨וֹר שׁוֹר֜וֹ הָדָ֣ר ל֗וֹ וְקַרְנֵ֤י רְאֵם֙ קַרְנָ֔יו בָּהֶ֗ם עַמִּ֛ים יְנַגַּ֥ח יַחְדָּ֖ו אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְהֵם֙ רִבְב֣וֹת אֶפְרַ֔יִם וְהֵ֖ם אַלְפֵ֥י מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Like a firstling bull in his majesty,
He has horns like the horns of the wild-ox;
With them he gores the peoples,
The ends of the earth one and all.
These are the myriads of Ephraim,
Those are the thousands of Manasseh.
Transliteration: vekhvor shvorvo hadar lvo vekareney reem karenayv vahem amiym yenagach yachedav afesey-arets vehem rivevvot eferayiim vehem alefey menasheh {s}

Hebrew: וְלִזְבוּלֻ֣ן אָמַ֔ר שְׂמַ֥ח זְבוּלֻ֖ן בְּצֵאתֶ֑ךָ וְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר בְּאֹהָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And of Zebulun he said:
Rejoice, O Zebulun, on your journeys,
And Issachar, in your tents.
Transliteration: velizevulun amar shemach zevulun vetsetekha veyishashkhar veohaleykha
