Hebrew: עַמִּים֙ הַר־יִקְרָ֔אוּ שָׁ֖ם יִזְבְּח֣וּ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֑דֶק כִּ֣י שֶׁ֤פַע יַמִּים֙ יִינָ֔קוּ וּשְׂפֻנֵ֖י טְמ֥וּנֵי חֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated:
They invite their kin to the mountain,
Where they offer sacrifices of success.
For they draw from the riches of the sea
And the hidden hoards of the sand.
Transliteration: amiym har-yikerau sham yizevechu zivechey-tsedek khiy shefa yamiym yiynaku ushefuney temuney chvol {s}

Hebrew: וּלְגָ֣ד אָמַ֔ר בָּר֖וּךְ מַרְחִ֣יב גָּ֑ד כְּלָבִ֣יא שָׁכֵ֔ן וְטָרַ֥ף זְר֖וֹעַ אַף־קׇדְקֹֽד׃
Translated:
And of Gad he said:
Blessed be the One who enlarges Gad!
Poised is he like a lion
To tear off arm and scalp.
Transliteration: ulegad amar varukhe marechiyv gad khelaviy shakhen vetaraf zervoa af-kׇdekod

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא רֵאשִׁית֙ ל֔וֹ כִּי־שָׁ֛ם חֶלְקַ֥ת מְחֹקֵ֖ק סָפ֑וּן וַיֵּתֵא֙ רָ֣אשֵׁי עָ֔ם צִדְקַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ עָשָׂ֔ה וּמִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated:
He chose for himself the best,
For there is the portion of the revered chieftain,
Where the heads of the people come.
He executed יהוה’s judgments
And God’s decisions for Israel.
Transliteration: vayare reshiyt lvo khiy-sham chelekat mechokek safun vayete rashey am tsidekat yehovah ashah umishefatayv im-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וּלְדָ֣ן אָמַ֔ר דָּ֖ן גּ֣וּר אַרְיֵ֑ה יְזַנֵּ֖ק מִן־הַבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated:
And of Dan he said:
Dan is a lion’s whelp
That leaps forth from Bashan.
Transliteration: uledan amar dan gur areeih yezanek min-havashan

Hebrew: וּלְנַפְתָּלִ֣י אָמַ֔ר נַפְתָּלִי֙ שְׂבַ֣ע רָצ֔וֹן וּמָלֵ֖א בִּרְכַּ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה יָ֥ם וְדָר֖וֹם יְרָֽשָׁה׃ {ס}
Translated:
And of Naphtali he said:
O Naphtali, sated with favor
And full of יהוה’s blessing,
Take possession on the west and south.
Transliteration: ulenafetaliy amar nafetaliy sheva ratsvon umale virekhat yehovah yam vedarvom yerashah {s}

Hebrew: וּלְאָשֵׁ֣ר אָמַ֔ר בָּר֥וּךְ מִבָּנִ֖ים אָשֵׁ֑ר יְהִ֤י רְצוּי֙ אֶחָ֔יו וְטֹבֵ֥ל בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן רַגְלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
And of Asher he said:
Most blessed of sons be Asher;
May he be the favorite of his brothers,
May he dip his foot in oil.
Transliteration: uleasher amar varukhe mivaniym asher yehiy retsuy echayv vetovel vashemen ragelvo

Hebrew: בַּרְזֶ֥ל וּנְחֹ֖שֶׁת מִנְעָלֶ֑ךָ וּכְיָמֶ֖יךָ דׇּבְאֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
May your doorbolts be iron and copper,
And your security last all your days.
Transliteration: varezel unechoshet minealekha ukheyameykha dׇveekha

Hebrew: אֵ֥ין כָּאֵ֖ל יְשֻׁר֑וּן רֹכֵ֤ב שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ בְּעֶזְרֶ֔ךָ וּבְגַאֲוָת֖וֹ שְׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
O Jeshurun, there is none like God,
Riding through the heavens to help you,
Through the skies in His majesty.
Transliteration: eyn khael yeshurun rokhev shamayiim veezerekha uvegaavatvo shechakiym

Hebrew: מְעֹנָהֿ֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵי קֶ֔דֶם וּמִתַּ֖חַת זְרֹעֹ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וַיְגָ֧רֶשׁ מִפָּנֶ֛יךָ אוֹיֵ֖ב וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַשְׁמֵֽד׃
Translated:
The ancient God is a refuge,
A support are the arms everlasting.
He drove out the enemy before you
By His command: Destroy!
Transliteration: meonahֿ elohey kedem umitachat zeroot volam vayegaresh mifaneykha voeiv vayomer hashemed

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכֹּן֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל בֶּ֤טַח בָּדָד֙ עֵ֣ין יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ דָּגָ֣ן וְתִיר֑וֹשׁ אַף־שָׁמָ֖יו יַ֥עַרְפוּ טָֽל׃
Translated:
Thus Israel dwells in safety,
Untroubled is Jacob’s abode,
In a land of grain and wine,
Under heavens dripping dew.
Transliteration: vayishekhon yisherael vetach vadad eyn yaakov el-erets dagan vetiyrvosh af-shamayv yaarefu tal

Hebrew: אַשְׁרֶ֨יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל מִ֣י כָמ֗וֹךָ עַ֚ם נוֹשַׁ֣ע בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה מָגֵ֣ן עֶזְרֶ֔ךָ וַאֲשֶׁר־חֶ֖רֶב גַּאֲוָתֶ֑ךָ וְיִכָּחֲשׁ֤וּ אֹיְבֶ֙יךָ֙ לָ֔ךְ וְאַתָּ֖ה עַל־בָּמוֹתֵ֥ימוֹ תִדְרֹֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated:
O happy Israel! Who is like you,
A people delivered by יהוה,
Your protecting Shield, your Sword triumphant!
Your enemies shall come cringing before you,
And you shall tread on their backs.
Transliteration: ashereykha yisherael miy khamvokha am nvosha vayhovah magen ezerekha vaasher-cherev gaavatekha veyikhachashu oyeveykha lakhe veatah al-vamvoteymvo tiderokhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל מֹשֶׁ֜ה מֵעַרְבֹ֤ת מוֹאָב֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר נְב֔וֹ רֹ֚אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י יְרֵח֑וֹ וַיַּרְאֵ֨הוּ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֛רֶץ אֶת־הַגִּלְעָ֖ד עַד־דָּֽן׃
Translated: Moses went up from the steppes of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the summit of Pisgah, opposite Jericho, and יהוה showed him the whole land: Gilead as far as Dan;
Transliteration: vayaal mosheh mearevot mvoav el-har nevvo rosh hafisegah asher al-feney yerechvo vayareehu yehovah et-khׇl-haarets et-hagilead ad-dan

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־נַפְתָּלִ֔י וְאֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ אֶפְרַ֖יִם וּמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיָּ֥ם הָאַחֲרֽוֹן׃
Translated: all Naphtali; the land of Ephraim and Manasseh; the whole land of Judah as far as the Western Sea;
Transliteration: veet khׇl-nafetaliy veet-erets eferayiim umenasheh veet khׇl-erets yehudah ad hayam haacharvon

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֗גֶב וְֽאֶת־הַכִּכָּ֞ר בִּקְעַ֧ת יְרֵח֛וֹ עִ֥יר הַתְּמָרִ֖ים עַד־צֹֽעַר׃
Translated: the Negeb; and the Plain—the Valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees—as far as Zoar.
Transliteration: veet-hanegev veet-hakhikhar vikeat yerechvo iyr hatemariym ad-tsoar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו זֹ֤את הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֠שְׁבַּ֠עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֨ם לְיִצְחָ֤ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְזַרְעֲךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה הֶרְאִיתִ֣יךָ בְעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְשָׁ֖מָּה לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה said to him, “This is the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, ‘I will assign it to your offspring.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you shall not cross there.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elayv zot haarets asher nishevaetiy leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov lemor lezareakha etenenah hereiytiykha veeyneykha veshamah lo taavor

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨מׇת שָׁ֜ם מֹשֶׁ֧ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּאֶ֥רֶץ מוֹאָ֖ב עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So Moses the servant of יהוה died there, in the land of Moab, at the command of יהוה.
Transliteration: vayamׇt sham mosheh eved-yehovah veerets mvoav al-fiy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבֹּ֨ר אֹת֤וֹ בַגַּי֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מוֹאָ֔ב מ֖וּל בֵּ֣ית פְּע֑וֹר וְלֹא־יָדַ֥ע אִישׁ֙ אֶת־קְבֻ֣רָת֔וֹ עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: [God] buried him in the valley in the land of Moab, near Beth-peor; and no one knows his burial place to this day.
Transliteration: vayikevor otvo vagay veerets mvoav mul veyt fevor velo-yada iysh et-kevuratvo ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֗ה בֶּן־מֵאָ֧ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים שָׁנָ֖ה בְּמֹת֑וֹ לֹא־כָהֲתָ֥ה עֵינ֖וֹ וְלֹא־נָ֥ס לֵחֹֽה׃
Translated: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eyes were undimmed and his vigor unabated.
Transliteration: umosheh ven-meah veesheriym shanah vemotvo lo-khahatah eynvo velo-nas lechoh

Hebrew: וַיִּבְכּוּ֩ בְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֥ת מוֹאָ֖ב שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים י֑וֹם וַֽיִּתְּמ֔וּ יְמֵ֥י בְכִ֖י אֵ֥בֶל מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: And the Israelites bewailed Moses in the steppes of Moab for thirty days. The period of wailing and mourning for Moses came to an end.
Transliteration: vayivekhu veney yisherael et-mosheh vearevot mvoav sheloshiym yvom vayitemu yemey vekhiy evel mosheh

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן מָלֵא֙ ר֣וּחַ חׇכְמָ֔ה כִּֽי־סָמַ֥ךְ מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־יָדָ֖יו עָלָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁמְע֨וּ אֵלָ֤יו בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands upon him; and the Israelites heeded him, doing as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: viyhvoshua vin-nun male rucha chׇkhemah khiy-samakhe mosheh et-yadayv alayv vayishemeu elayv veney-yisherael vayaashu khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וְלֹא־קָ֨ם נָבִ֥יא ע֛וֹד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כְּמֹשֶׁ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֙ יְדָע֣וֹ יְהֹוָ֔ה פָּנִ֖ים אֶל־פָּנִֽים׃
Translated: Never again did there arise in Israel a prophet like Moses—whom יהוה singled out, face to face,
Transliteration: velo-kam naviy vod veyisherael khemosheh asher yedavo yehovah faniym el-faniym

Hebrew: לְכׇל־הָ֨אֹתֹ֜ת וְהַמּוֹפְתִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר שְׁלָחוֹ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לְפַרְעֹ֥ה וּלְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֖יו וּלְכׇל־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: for the various signs and portents that יהוה sent him to display in the land of Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his courtiers and his whole country,
Transliteration: lekhׇl-haotot vehamvofetiym asher shelachvo yehovah laashvot veerets mitserayiim lefareoh ulekhׇl-avadayv ulekhׇl-aretsvo

Hebrew: וּלְכֹל֙ הַיָּ֣ד הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וּלְכֹ֖ל הַמּוֹרָ֣א הַגָּד֑וֹל אֲשֶׁר֙ עָשָׂ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and for all the great might and awesome power that Moses displayed before all Israel.
Transliteration: ulekhol hayad hachazakah ulekhol hamvora hagadvol asher ashah mosheh leeyney khׇl-yisherael
